Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: StudioFit63
Reviews.Content: Yes! The stairs are steep! Yes! The rooms are small. But get over it because this hotel is a genuine find. If you book with the expectation of getting a 5* hotel for 2* prices you will be disappointed but we were delighted with our stay there in April 2012. This is a quirky, individual hotel with friendly staff. Everywhere is clean and comfortable. Our bathroom was tiny but the shower was lovely. The breakfast was simple but tasty and plentiful. The location was brilliant. Easy to get to everywhere we wanted to go. All in all the Nadia contributed to a brilliant stay in a beautiful city. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “:) We would go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSteve657
Reviews.Content: First of all, ignore the negative comments, for the prices the Nadia charges you would be stupid to expect luxury, it is a basic, comfortable, friendly hotel. We stayed in April 2012. Me and my friend stayed in what I think was the cheapest room with the worst view but we loved it, who needs a view really when you can actually go outside!? The staff are very friendly, very helpful and make you feel welcome instantly! The hotel has a lot of stairs, but you can't complain because so does nearly every building in Amsterdam. The rooms are very small, not ideal if you want to spend a weekend in your hotel room, but if you plan on leaving the hotel (which I'm sure everyone does) the size of the rooms doesn't matter. The beds were very comfortable, rooms were warm and we didn't have any issues with any noise at all. The only slight criticism I have for this hotel is that our bathroom was very small. This wouldn't stop me going back, I don't suppose anybody really needs mountains of room in a bathroom!? I'm horrendously lazy but the hotel was close enough to bars, shops, coffee shops, tram stations, red light district, canals, the train station and museums, we only went to one bar that we needed to get a taxi. Basically, the hotel is as random and as quirky as the rest of Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, maybe not families (just because of the space). For a hotel in such a good location, with very good prices, I see no reason to complain!!!! (And I am a bit snobby)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChris2012
Reviews.Content: No one is joking about the steep stairs! But the staff are great at getting luggage and attending to guest needs. The location is perfect! While the single rooms are small they have everything that you need and are well kept. My only, and very big issue for me, was the smell of cigarette smoke in the building. The staff do smoke in the reception area and the smoke makes its way under the doors into rooms. If this doesn't bother you then there is no problem, but if it does you may not be happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lloydser
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights here in March. We picked this hotel based on all of the good reviews, and they are all spot on. Great service, great location, rooms are small but just add to the overall quirkiness of the hotel and Amsterdam in general! Just minutes away from the Anne Frank House, Canal Cruise, Dam Square, Laundromat and bars/restaurants. Would recommend this hotel to everyone and we would definitely stay here again if we returned to Amsterdam for another visit. One piece of advice, be wary if catching a taxi from Centraal Station to the hotel. It is a 3 minute drive and the taxi driver ripped us of by charging us 15 euro and by not showing us the meter running (our fault).

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcoming stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara Z
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small and the stairs steep :-) I felt very welcomed as a guest and welll cared for. I loved the flowers in my room, the cleanliness and the supportive attitude of the staff. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “First night in Amsterdam :)”
Reviews.Author: Satu T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere in Nadia was excellent! This was our first night in Amsterdam and we didn't know about these steep stairs, and we were a bit amazed at first. :) Rooms and public areas were cozy and decorated with nice stuff and plants. View from our window was pointed to church and canal and we were very much pleased with that. Breakfast was average, but sufficient. Eggs would have been nice extra. We would definitely come Nadia again! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Nadia from 31Mar to 6Apr. This was a very good hotel with convenient location. Dam square was hereby (just a few minutes walk). A tram station was just right outside the hotel. Though the room was very small (mine was a single room), it had all you need with a shower and toilet. It had free WIFI (which is very important). Most importantly, the staff was very nice and helpful. The manager also provided me with weather forecast everyday.......I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “welcome back home...”
Reviews.Author: indija_nadia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful typical Dutch building - and its steep stairs - located in a great position... the canals, the church, the centre seem to be there to encircle us in a hug. Comfort and a perfect cleanliness... fresh flowers... everywhere... welcome us back home. A really lovely friendliness, jointly with a great professionalism, take care of us during our stay. Lovely the music from the Westerkerk. I am deeply thankful to Osama to make everything so refined and enjoyable. P.S. The steep stairs are a really good cardio fitness training... Enjoy them!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinaIbrahim
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam during April 3rd till April 8th, 2012 and stayed with my family in Hotel Nadia. The hotel has an excellent location that is very close (4 - 5 min walking) to the Dam square, the western Kerk and Anna Frank house. A hypermarket is in the walking distance to the dam square. A tram station is in front of the hotel. The hotel staff are friendly and highly co-operative. My room was small. However, it contains the basic requirements in addition to coffee/tea facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, brilliant location and brilliant staff. Spent a week exploring the city and the Nadia was a fantastic base to do this from. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough, even if the stairs are a tad steep. The staff couldn't have done any more for us and the quirky design just added to a superb week.

Reviews.Title: “NADIA HOTEL ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: 81AZRIN
Reviews.Content: Dear all travellers! I and my wife have a good experience in Nadia Hotel (NH) and Amsterdam. NH is beautiful hotel, good services, friendly, clean, great location and have a good public transport in this area. This hotel is near with Amsterdam Station and others interesting places. I and my wife will stay in NH again! p/s: hope NH can provide a lift... :) AZRIN KUALA LUMPUR, MALAYSIA 81azrin@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Our return to the Hotel Nadia ...”
Reviews.Author: threadsofawen
Reviews.Content: I have already stayed at this hotel and recommended it to friends and family but this is the first time I have written them a review. I have stayed here with my husband and with my brother in law and his wife and a few weeks ago I chose it to stay at when I took my daughter to Amsterdam. I am in my 50's and although the stairs are very steep ... and a lot of them ! .. I find them ok to to get up and down as have my previous companions. There is usually someone who rushes to greet you when you arrive and takes your bags off you so you don't need to haul the cases up and down the stairs yourself. They are very friendly and helpful and I feel very comfortable in this hotel which is why I chose it again when I took my daughter to Amsterdam. The rooms are adequate for our needs ( we only intend to sleep in them , not spend large chunks of the day in there) They are smaller than large 5 star hotels but then they are not a large 5 star hotel !!!.... It has 'ambience', is clean and the price for staying there is within our budget and I feel we get value for our money. The continental breakfast is fresh and filling (meat free ) and the time slot for breakfast is quite long ... they have an early arrival policy of minding your luggage and if you arrive in the breakfast time slot then you can have a free breakfast as well :) which was a lovely welcome for us having been up since 4am. The flowers in the room saying 'welcome home' was a lovely touch ... Thank you Nadia Hotel, I really appreciated that. ... We had a twin room at the back, except for the church bells we didn't hear much noise at night and I sleep with the window partly open .... for those of you who like extra wide spaces I will mention that the beds were each against a wall and the gap between the beds was narrow, possibly less than 2ft, and the shower room was 'compact' which didn't bother us but if you wanted a bedroom to swing anything bigger than an average cat in, then you may want to check with reception before you book. !! It had a safe, a fridge and a tea/coffee tray. It is well located for the canals, Anne Franks house, Dam Square, The shops, Restaurants and cafes. It is about a 15 minute walk from Central station for me ( a 53 yr old) and within a half hour walk for many attractions, markets, Zoo, Museums etc... I LOVE this hotel and will deffinately return. My daughter and in laws have also recommended it to friends. If I mention that we stayed in the Victoria Hotel about 9 years ago and prefer to rebook this one does that tell you anything ? It's only downside is the stairs if you have a problem with a lot of steep stairs . Check out their website ... they have all their info and pictures on there for you to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: m0r0
Reviews.Content: Selected for it's location, moments from the Anne Frank house and minutes from Dam Square and on the edge of the Jordaan, one of the trendiest and safest areas of town. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the help yourself, meatless breakfast plentiful. However, the rooms are tiny, the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in! Anyone with mobility problems would find this hotel difficult. Our double bed was pushed up against the wall on one side, the bathroom door was unable to open fully as it hit the bed and my husband had to sit sideways on the loo as otherwise his knees hit the door! Corridors are narrow, the stairs,which greet you as soon as you enter from the street are almost vertical (but prepare you for all the other vertical staircases in Amsterdam!).This hotel is basic, but value for money and if I wasn't going away for a 'treat' I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem!”
Reviews.Author: loruhlin
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms here based ONLY on the reviews of TripAdvisor, and we were thrilled with our choice. It was friendly, a little bit eclectic and fun and a nice atmosphere. We were greeted well at the door, 2 gentlemen came down to get out bags up the stairs (luckily we only had a single backpack, I'm SO glad that we had a place to leave our BIG bags!) The check in was great, and our rooms were clean, cute, very small, but nice balcony. We had a fridge, safe, hot water pot for coffee (didn't use it) and a double bed, shower, sink and toilet. There was a shelf/desk and mirror. We were two women travelling with our 12 year old daughters, and they thought the place was REALLY cool with the stairs and little areas, and best of all, the cats, Hello and Goodbye! We lost them for an hour as they played with the cats(luckily they had a perch right across from our rooms on the 2nd floor.) Breakfast was really nice, croissants, bread, cheese, nutella, jam, honey, apples, juice, coffee etc and the breakfast room was wonderful. The only drawback to the place was the noise at night, we were on the street side on the second floor, so the street, cars, motorcycles, trams and people were quite noisy, but I had my ear plugs, so I slept fine. The location is great. I would stay here again, and so would my companion and I KNOW the girls would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “feedback”
Reviews.Author: Rosie C
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay everyone very friendly with great customer service,great location with nice view, yes the hotel had a certain quikkiness about it fresh flowers a lovely touch the rooms including breakfast room very small, nice continental breakfast stairs very steep so need to watch your step ovelall had a very nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Aspinav
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with an amazing location. We stayed at Nadia for 3 nights for my birthday and our 6 year anniversary and the service was fantastic. We arrived early on the first day hoping to drop off our bags so we could explore Amsterdam, they gave us each a cold drink while they prepared our room so we could just check in early. They also left a beautiful bunch of flowers in my room on my birthday. We had a room with a canal view which was lovely but the noise from the trams was very loud and the church bells woke us up repeatedly through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shanf99
Reviews.Content: I would give this place a 5 star rating but I can't do it based on how small the rooms are. Think galley kitchen in a NYC apartment. While I definitely would have preferred larger accommodations, it didn't really spoil the trip since we stayed out of the room most of the day. The decor and linens are a little worn too but they did at least seem clean. The bathroom is really a shower with a sink and toilet in it separated only by a curtain. However, whatever this hotel is lacking in size they make up in hospitality. Hands down this was the best customer service I ever received at a hotel. I guess you can't have everything (the better hotels we stayed at this trip had the worst customer service)! We had football tickets delivered to the hotel without an issue. They printed out vouchers for us that we had forgotten. They made great restaurant recommendations and even made reservations for us. If you have time try Thai Bird and/or Kantjil for dinner - they were awesome. Basically anything we needed, they provided with a smile. If I were to return to Amsterdam I would consider staying here again especially if I could get one of their larger rooms. If you are a young, easy going traveler then this hotel will work great for you. If you are out of shape (seriously steep steps and multiple floors) and an inflexible traveler, then you should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Katewap
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel is wonderfully quirky and the staff are so friendly and helpful. It is centrally located, with great views overlooking the canal (views that can be enjoyed whilst eating breakfast) and many back streets to wander aimlessly down. Despite the the steep stairs (which add to the hotels charm), I can't fault the hotel. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cosy, clean & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracey F
Reviews.Content: 4 of us arrived for a 2 night stay already aware of the steep steps, but were still shocked at how steep they were, however this was not a problem at all and shouldn't be for anyone without mobility problems. The rooms were small, cosy and most importantly clean, our room had a floor to ceiling window overlooking the canal it was lovely, the only thing I would change is to add some extra lighting, it's a bit dark for us ladies trying to apply make-up. The breakfast was ample, plenty of croissants, bread/toast, jam, cake, cheese, yoghurt etc and the croissant must be the best I've had. We were made really welcome from our arrival to our departure and would definitely stay here again, it is only a 2 star hotel but so much friendlier and welcoming than the 4 star hotel we stayed in on our last visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CeeLow01
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam for 3 days which incorparated my birthday, we stayed at The Hotel Nadia. The first thing to hit you is the stairs which are very steep and narrow and NOT advisable for the people not in good health.The lady on the reception was very jolly and friendly and a man took our bags up to reception for us, were we given a can of cold soft drink. Our was not ready but they looked after our bags till our return later in the day. The hotel is situation about 5 mins walk to Dam Sq (heart of the city) and Anne Frank House is just across the road. A beautiful city with a lot of history. The rooms was clean with fresh flowers, even though we booked a double roomwe got a family room, but it done the job that it was intended, would have been nice if there was a bath what with all the walking, but the shower was great. Would go back to the Nadia, ideal to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully quirky!”
Reviews.Author: wynos25
Reviews.Content: 4 of us traveled to Amsterdam, 3 for the first time, and had no preconceived expectations of accommodations. We booked Hotel Nadia based on reviews and not much more research. We arrived a was treated by a series of steps that didn't seem humanly possible to climb. After the laughs had settled. We were greeted by someone and told to leave our bags at the bottom of the stairs. Once reaching the upper level, we were greeted by a very friendly staff and taken to our rooms. The laughs began again by the size of the rooms. Small is an understatement, but well appointed. Probably to well appointed for the amount of space. The bathrooms (wet rooms) were functionally and also a great laugh. Breakfast was great and our rooms offered an exceptional view of the adjacent canal and church in the back room. Excellent shopping and restaurant within easy walking distance. Just minutes from the main attractions of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel; good location”
Reviews.Author: dabullar
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel during an Amsterdam visit. It is in a very convenient location, walking distance to almost anywhere in central Amsterdam. Our room (207) looked out directly onto the Westmarkt church and canal. This also put us directly on a busy street, but noise did not bother us. We also were immediately adjacent to the breakfast room, but did not notice much racket. The room was beautiful and clean, small as is usual for Amsterdam. The front desk staff were helpful, friendly, spoke excellent English. The bathroom in the room had a shelf for putting your things on which is a feature not to be taken for granted!! Plenty of hot water, decent pressure. The drain in the shower did not work well. From the street there is a big sign for the hotel, and you can tell it is quite large. However, the doorway is small and when you open it up, it leads only to a LONG, steep stairway. This took me by surprise. You have to climb to the top to check in at reception. Could be difficult for some older people carrying bags but the staff are more than willing to assist. The breakfast was not as good as some of the other hotels we stayed at in Amsterdam, but certainly decent. They did not offer as many options as we found elsewhere. The breakfast room was a little cramped when busy, but nothing objectionable. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for its location and pleasant, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: billy i
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed in Nadia hotel for 4 nights and I have been left with only positive things to mention. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly stuff who immediately took care of our bags for us. The staircase leading up to the reception from the main entrance is quite steep but that didnt bother us much. We were more than happy with our room as it had more than enough space for us to spread all of our luggage. It also had all of the important facilities such as shower, toilet, fridge, safe to put ur valuables in, and a kettle. Other useful features were small tv and free wi-fi access. Reception also provided hairdryer upon request. Breakfast was good with variety of choice available, items were regularly replenished. Staff were very helpful, friendly, warm and chatty which made everything so much better. Needless to say that the hotel's location is pretty much in the heart of old city where everything is within walking distance (10minutes walk from the Amsterdam Centraal station). Upon checking out you can also leave your luggage in the storage room and pick it up later during the day; the storage room is well secured which is a positive change in comparisson to the other hotels. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: honeybee313
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Nadia for 3 nights. Upon arrival we were quite surprised when we saw the huge narrow staircase up to the reception at the entrance. Thankfully the staff immediately told us to leave our bags at the bottom and they brought them up for us. They aren't kidding when they say that there is no lift and that this hotel is not for anyone not in good shape, as you will have to climb a lot of stairs every time you enter the building. The rooms are very small, but have some nice features given the price range including a refrigerator, safe, and free wi-fi. The rooms do not have hair dryers, but they can be checked out from the front desk. They also don't have bars of soap or shampoo, but instead have a dispenser of hair/body wash near the bathroom sink and in the shower. We did frequently have the smell of cigarette smoke under our door at night which we did not like. Breakfast was good with toast, cheese, very small yogurt, marble bread, and pastries. The items were replenished regularly. The room did sometimes get crowded, but there was always room for everyone when we were there. The location is excellent and it is right near a tram stop (which means it can be noisy at night) and is within walking distance of many of the attractions in Amsterdam. Overall I feel it was a good value for 100 euros a night, though the room was very small. It is a reasonable place to stay if you don't expect to spend a lot of time in your room and are able to climb stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A secure superb home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Professor568
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia people are all warm and helpful. My wife and I have stayed many times over the last fifteen years at Nadia (in the heart of the old city centre). Your room and your possessions are safe and secure. You are within walking distance to everything that is Amsterdam. They do not allow single male groups in their hotel. It is quiet and you are left alone to be free and enjoy. I feel the manager is a personal friend. Hospitality and reciprocal respect are Nadia trademarks. Umm, as to room sizes and steps--hello Americans this is Europe! You never have to handle any luggage anywhere, they move it all. Fresh continental breakfast every day with a lounge overlooking the canals. Refrigerators in every room. Modern bath facilities. Honest, fair pricing and a locked security camera controlled single front door entrance makes Nadia very special. Thank you Osam, and your family, for all you have done for us over the years. Personal taxi and shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 Average Hotel spiced with disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Goldilocks7_12
Reviews.Content: Not quite what I expected from the photos on the website, quite deceiving in fact. The hotel is above a row of shops, with a single door entrance leading to a very steep staircase that is almost a 160 gradient. Ok if you are young, fit and agile. Not so great if you're elderly and have walking difficulties. The staff are very helpful and carry your luggage up the stairs and to your room. The room was very small and did not contain all the facilities it details on the website. I had to ask for a hairdyer at reception. The view of the canal was scenic though the chime of the Westerkerk clock opposite which strikes at every hour and does a tune as well is ok if you don't mind being woken up during the small hours. Breakfast was a continental buffet help yourself which consisted of coffee, bread, cheese, croissants, cake, and condiments of jam. The breakfast room is quite small so you want to get there at the earliest opportunity to get a table. Not the cheapest hotel either. For a centrally located hotel, just outside the Jordaan, it was Â£100 a night. This could be justifed if the room were bigger, and there were the add ons of shower gel in the bathroom and the little finishing touches that make it more special. Saying that, they left a vase of fresh flowers in the room which was nice however I would prefer to have a hairdryer and the toiletries! No bath, just a shower which was a bit disappointing as after a long day out walking I fancied a soak in a bath. The beds were very narrow as well though the mattress was ok. The cleanliness wasn't great. There was loads of dust on the shelfing above the beds and the carpet didn't look like it had been vaccumed. The one thing that did get up my nose was the amount of cigarette smoke in the hotel. The staff were smoking behind the reception area or within the vicinity. The website is misleading in saying it is a non-smoking hotel. Also the other kind of smoke was prevalent as well from hotel rooms adjacent to ours. The corridor was full of smoke and it streamed through under our door which wasn't pleasant. I know we were in Amsterdam and it's expected though the hotel shouldn't be the place to smoke their drugs, can they not keep it to the coffee shops? I found the hotel quirky, the staff were helpful, however, the hotel was tired and in need of refurbishment and for the cost of the room, for three nights, it was a disappointment. I have stayed at other hotels in Europe for better quality and value and found that this hotel was not living up to what it says on their tin. Honest opinion; I won't be staying there again but then I won't be going back to Amsterdam again. I have been in the past, seen and done everything I want to see there and don't feel the need to go back again. For people with an interest in the Anne Frank House, the hotel is located opposite. I found that a moving experience and certainly I would recommend it a worthwhile visit. Amsterdam is a lovely City with interesting architecture. Though I find the drug culture a losers game, and it is a shame as it ruins what can be a really great City.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: artdiva26
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this very quirky and charming hotel. The staff was so nice and most helpful. Have never been treated with such beautiful hospitality. Centrally located, so easy to find my way around the city; small but very clean rooms; a nice safe place to lay one's head down at night. Lovely continental breakfast with great coffee and croissants. I would return to stay at the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with fantastic friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: CullenLaoisIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights from the 16 of March 2012. The steep stairs would not be suitable for people with walking difficulties however, most of the older hotels seem to have these stairs. The staff were extremely friendly & helpful, we were welcomed with a soft drink & flowers in our room. The rooms were very small but fully equipped, comfortable & cleaned daily. The balcony was an added bonus.The continental breakfast was fresh & plentifull, a good start to the day. The location was very central a five minute walk to Dam Square. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mccrud
Reviews.Content: The receptionist on checking in was extremely helpful and friendly, we even got a free tin of soft drink as a welcome drink. There are alot of steep stairs but from what we seen most hotels in Amsterdam are like this. The room is basic but clean with an ensuite toilet and shower. The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast but very nice. I would definitely return to this hotel. The location was great. It is a few minutes walk to Ann Franks house and about a 5 minute walk to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Stay At Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Hudson96
Reviews.Content: We returned toThe Nadia to celebrate our birthdays. We were amazed to find the staff remembered us from four years ago. We will never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. The location is outstanding-on the tram line and an easy walk to Dam Square, the Flower Market, and The Anne Frank House. From our balcony, we could see the Westerkerk and hear the same bells Anne Frank heard. The hotel is filled with exotic charm. The staff is warm, friendly, helpful and made us feel The Nadia is our Amsterdam home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevinorf
Reviews.Content: The stuff of the hotel was very friendly and helpfull. We had booked a room with balcony for six nights but one night we had to change to a room without balcony 'cause the hotel was crowded (I guess), but they had told us in the e-mail from the day we had booked. The room with balcony is big enough for two people and very cozy and comfortable! The beds were OK although a little small if you are a tall guy like me! But even where you were tired you could have a nice relaxing sleep! Nice breakfast in the morning, good enough to start the day satisfied! The rooms were cleaned daily although we found some... "leftovers" from the people stayed before us! The location is perfect, in 10 minutes by feet you reach the Dam Square and on the other side Anna Frank's house is a 5 minutes walk! The neighborhood is crowed in the day and has all kind of stores if you want to buy something. At night it's quiet and safe. As a conclusion the hotel is very good relating to the money we gave, so anyone looking for a nice hotel around the centre I would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “very much a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: AllyODB
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple for 2 nights at this hotel on our last couple of days in Amsterdam. Out of all of the other hotels we stayed in Europe, this was the worst. The first part is the stairs, very narrow and very steep, mind you the staff come to bring it up the stairs, it's a good thing they did! Once we arrived we were bombarded with smoke. The reception was full of it. They would not take credit card payments, only cash, which was a pain. We were asked to wait in the breakfast area until our room was prepared and our luggage was placed. 10 minutes later we were handed our key, remote and off to our room.Have no idea as to why we had to wait when the hotel was not busy. Booking a double suite you would think nice a roomy, knowing how small a regular room is in europe. Room was very tiny with a double bed against a wall, had a balcony, which was the best part of the whole place. The bed sheets were filthy, dusty and heaps of hair. No room to put your suitcase.The bathroom was as all other comments state, you hardly have enough room to turn around. The shower didn't work properly and also flooded the toilet and rest of bathroom. The towels are old, and bleach spots all over. On the second day our room still hadn't been cleaned by 5pm. When asked for them, we had to wait 45 mins, and did not collect our old ones. The breakfast area. Do not be fooled by the photos. You get cold coffee, some bread, croissants, and some marble cake. If you could find a seat you were lucky. Maybe 25 seats. Very tight. Staff were friendly enough. Would not recommend hotel to anyone unless you are a backpacker, not looking for much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 4evrnblujns
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a cute little property located in what seemed to be the heart of the city. It was about a 20 minute walk from the central train station. When we arrived, we were met at the door by a friendly staff member, who carried all our luggage up the steep entryway stairs and up to our room. Check in was easy. We arrived about an hour before check-in, but were allowed to check in early. They even gave us a welcome drink (choice of soda, juice, water) and had a bouquet of fresh flowers waiting in the room for us. The room was cozy, cute, and clean, and had a wonderful view of the canal. The hotel is within walking distance to most major attractions, including Anne Frank House, Red Light District, Dam Square, and the flower market. We did have to take a tram to the museum area and Vondelpark. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Nadia Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CdnSophia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia hotel with my sister for 3 nights last summer. The hotel was easy to find as it is right across the street from the Wester Markt/Church tram station. The stairs to get up from street to reception are the steepest and most narrow i have ever seen! But have no fear as the hotel staff will gladly lug ALL your luggage up for you. I will admit that the rooms are small, but the property is cozy and everyone working is SO SO nice. We got welcome drinks while checking in as well as fresh flowers and a personalize welcome message in our room. The hotel even gave my sister a big bouquet of flowers and free pop on her birthday and let us use their cutlerly for her cake. Other Pros; - Walking distance to Dam square, Anne Frank House, food and shopping - Tram station is across the street - 90 euros for a double room with a balcony (although it rained cats and dogs during our stay so we didn't even open a window..) - 6% discount if you pay in cash I would most definitely recommend the Nadia Hotel and hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SE5555
Reviews.Content: Stayed in The Nadia for 3 nights last week. The hotel is quite small with steep narrow stairs! However, it is extremely clean and the beds are really comfortable. The staff go out of their way to make you welcome. It is very well located for local sight seeing particularly the canal tours and the Anne Frank museum, as well as boutique and mainstream shopping

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 970clairo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Nadia twice and both times have been excellent. The service is excellent and they go out of their way to help you. The hotel is right around the corner from the Anne Frank house and other attractions are easily in walking distance. It is a great location with friendly service. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but cosy”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Grete F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia hotel for three nights, and appreciated it. The stairs are very steep and long, not recommended for people who have problems with walking, but otherwise the hotel was very nice. The staff was friendly and serviceminded, breaksfast was OK (it would have been nice with something -in addition to cheese- that was not so sweet, difficult for a diabetic). A variety of bread types was a plus, thanks for the dark bread besides the white fluffy stuff! Our room was on the street side, and it was very noisy. That made it difficult to sleep, even though the bed was very comfortable. When I go back (because I will!) I will ask for a room in a different area. Very, very small room and bathroom, but big enough when the aim is to sleep and relax there. The hotel is situated in a very central place, with only a short walk to canal boats, trams, trains and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is a great place to stay during a short trip to Amsterdam. The manager was extremely friendly and upgraded us to a room with a balcony and gave us a much needed complimentary drink whilst we waited in the breakfast room for our room to be made ready. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay - overall the service was excellent. The room was compact but very clean and had everything we needed. Nadia hotel is only a ten minute walk from Centraal Station and very near Dam Square, Anne Frank's House and other attractions. The only slight downside - the trams are pretty noisy and they did keep us awake a little the first night of our stay! Overall thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and well located”
Reviews.Author: Rui Meola C
Reviews.Content: Nice people and excelent service. The location is perfect (near Dam square and Anne Frank Museum), the atmosphere is great and at the same time, you can take your time to relax without city noises. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mdejong
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location. The hotel has a great admosphere and offers a fantastic service. When we arrived we could wait in the relax room before going to our rooms where our suitcase was already delivered. The room was small, but the space was optimally used. It looked well taken care of, nicely painted, comfortable beds and pillows and a clean bathroom. Free welcome drink, coffee and tea facilities in our room and also a free room upgrade. After we checked out it was no problem to leave our luggage in their storage room so we could walk around Amsterdam without suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be seeing you!”
Reviews.Author: katie T
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of great reviews of hotel nadia, and I was not disappointed. The hotel is centrally located, about a 2 minute walk from dam square, 3 tram stops from central station and a stones throw from Anne Frank house. We were greeted with a drink, and the staff were really welcoming. We had fresh flowers in the bedroom upon arrival which was a lovely touch! We requested a room with a balcony which are hard to come by in Amsterdam, and there were no problems at all. It was great with a lovely two seater bench which we enjoyed sitting on and watching the bikes and the people go by. Yes the rooms are small but many Amsterdam buildings are much the same, and again for the steep stairs. The staff were more than helpful, we asked for extras pillows (duck down by the way!) and they brought them to our room for us, gave us tips and directions etc and also not forgetting they were so friendly and chatty! the hotel owner is always about, he's very funny! The roads are very noisy (especially the trams) but this didn't bother us since it was easy to sleep what with the beds being so comfy! All in all a fantastic hotel, probably one of the best I've been to, staff go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable, excellent central location right in the heart of the city (that never sleeps!) We'll be back again and again and again, thanks to you all for a lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but incredibly tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in Amsterdam before and only needed two nights. Hotel Nadia was recently renovated and my room was very clean but tiny. I could touch the walls on both sides at the same time. The shower stall was suitable for only an average sized person at 58cm x 100cm. The bed for one was just wide and long enough for one. There was a chair and a desk, but I couldn't pull the chair back far enough to sit at the desk. This room was everything you needed and absolutely nothing you didn't need. The stairs up to the rooms was the steepest I have ever seen, but the porter took my suitcase and wouldn't let me take it myself. I was only paying 60 euro a night and the experience was quirky and fun. The staff was helpful and friendly, breakfast was good and the internet solid and speedy. If you have more people, the rooms are more spacious. If you are an American, you have now been warned that every bit of space is used to it's maximum. Do take advantage of their contacts for parking your car if you drive in...street side parking is 5 euro an hour. Like other reviewers, I was greeted warmly with offer of a cold beverage and flowers were in the room. It was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: With the great location near Anne Frank's House, the Hotel Nadia was a great experience and surprise for me and my friends. For its price, we didn't expect so much but we were received with a soda welcome drink and with flowers in our room. The breakfast is ok and the employers are very thoughtful and pleasants. On my next trip to Amsterdam, I'll certainly come back to Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “007 pringle”
Reviews.Author: DJA89
Reviews.Content: This low cost hotel comes with a 1st class service! Upon arrival me and my friend were greeted very warmly, not only by the hotel receptionist but also by the hotel Owner with a drink of our choice. The Owner is extremly friendly, has lots of witty repartee and you instantly build a rapport and a love for the hotel. To the eye the hotel looks very charming, quaint and traditonal, and whilst the size of the room may come as a bit of a shock at first, it really really does add to the enjoyment of the holiday. The room had fresh flowers, a television, safety deposit box and fridge, with hair dryers and irons available upon request with no charge. All of this is included in the price of your booking! What i was more concerned about was the cleanliness of the room, please rest assured this hotel is clean!!! maid service daily, not a spec of dust, clean bedding and mattress protectors too! Breakfast is included and also there is a luggae room for the end of your stay if you have a late return flight!!! location - excellent!!!! public transport is convieniently located just outside the front door and it is exceptionally easy to use, even for me!!! things to see and do around this amazingly interesting and stunning city are in abundance, personal recommendations to the heiniken museum, ann franks house (literally across the road too) and the amsterdam dungeons. Whilst coming in and out of the hotel i always found a friendly greeting with receptionists constantly checking if there is anything more they can do! They are also local experert with maps and journey planning hints and tips at their disposal to help you get yourself about! throughout. Checking out - the best checkout experience of any hotel i've been to. Your bags are carried out to the luggage room for you so you don't have to tackle the stairs yourself, but what i found more impressive was the receptionist who dialled the owner for each guest that left to let him know we were leaving, the owner coming to take us for one last farewell drink and a personal good bye! What a touch! i wasn't expecting much from this hotel, not only did they meet our needs and expectations, they exceeded them. OO7 PRINGLE - IF YOUR READING THIS, THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING CHEEKY WEEKEND, I WILL BE BACK FOR MORE OF YOUR BEAUTIFUL CITY SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaEurope2012
Reviews.Content: I canÂ´t recommend this hotel more! When we arrived to check in for six nights, we were offered a drink and comfortably accomodated, there were fresh flowers with a card reading "Have a nice stay" . Public transport is right outside and employees are extremely kind and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellytime
Reviews.Content: Had read reviews on this hotel so kind of had an idea of what to expect. The steps are steep when you arrive but reception came to collect our bags and checked us in and gave us a welcome drink. The hotel has a lot of character and i like that. It was clean and warm but at times it was too warm, we had the window open in our room to get ready etc. Had flowers in the room once we got there, a nice touch and puts a smile on your face after travelling. The room reminded me of being on a ship. It is small but i found it cosy if not romantic... The room has everything you need, bed, cupboard, shelves, fridge, telephone, en suite shower n toilet, tv etc/ It was just what we needed. It is basic but its not the Hilton! It had the added bonus of being near Dam square and the majority of the attractions. Anne Franks house is a 5 min walk around the corner. The breakfast was very basic and we were not impressed with this. It was literally coffee, tea, orange juice, croissants, cheese, some spreads and crackerbreads and bread oh and some apples! I asked if they had cereal and they didnt. There was a small kitchen in the breakfast room. Surely they could whip up some eggs or something?? We didnt bother with breakfast the rest of the time we were there. On our last day we were leaving early and breakfast was only 7.30-10.30am. When checking in i did ask if we could have breakfast early. The receptionist told me they could arrange it for 7am. He told us to let him know the day before we leave. This seemed reasonable but after seeing the options on day 1 we decided not to bother arranging an early breakfast. However, on our last day whilst getting ready to check out, reception rang us to say that our breakfast was ready. I felt bad having to say we did not want it but we did not confirm to them that we wanted it. The man at reception told us when checking out that he remembered our request and made a note. We apologised and explained we had to leave for the airport. He tried to make us stay but we wanted to get going and we eventually had breakfast at the airport. Ok, we paid for it and should have made the most of it but there really was nothing that could have satisfied us or sustained us throughout the day. Im not talking a full english but something a bit healthier than a croissant or Nutella spread! I dont really have any negatives on this hotel apart from how hot the room was, nothing that an open window couldnt solve but wouldnt fancy this hotel in the middle of summer! At times you could smell cigarette smoke wafting up the stairs and into your room. Im not a smoker so i instantly smell smoke and it wasnt pleasant. There was a thick layer of dust on one of the shelves in the room which hadnt just accumulated during our stay. My boyfriend also complained of how noisy the road was which our room was overlooking, but i really didnt notice this and i slept well. I think the steep steps and no lift would make this the wrong choice for people who are less mobile. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. All in all a good hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Whilst surprised...................”
Reviews.Author: SamManchester
Reviews.Content: by the size of the room (small) it soon became amusement. Other reviews have described the hotel as 'quirky' and that is totally accurate. Staff wonderful, location superb, price excellent. BUT, once the trams stopped running no noise, no creaking floorboards, no rumbling plumbing. Would I stay here again? - YES, but the stair warning on the hotel website is not to be ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpock101
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hotel Nadia and we will be back. Location The hotel is away from the central areas but is still within easy walking distance with Dam Square being about a 5 minute walk away and itâ€™s either an easy 15/20 minute stroll from Central Station or a short tram ride. Because itâ€™s slightly off the main areas, we have not experienced any drunken groups wandering loudly past in the early hours. Its worth remembering that it is a city location and the trams run right outside so yes, there is some noise from the traffic and the nearby church bells but this certainly did not detract from the experience. Hotel Be warned, on entering the hotel you will be greeted by the steepest steps known to mankind. As the website indicates, it is not suitable for the elderly, disabled and possibly young children who are just starting to negotiate stairs. However, the stairs are part of what makes the hotel that extra bit special, and you donâ€™t have to lug your luggage up and down them as the very friendly and enthusiastic staff are genuinely happy to do this for you. Plus you are given a choice of soft drink on your arrival in reception (at the top of the first flight) to help you recover. The whole hotel is quirky and small and full of character. Itâ€™s a family run affair and everyone is genuinely helpful and welcoming. You are given a handful of useful maps and information on arrival and the reception which is staffed 24 hours can help from posting your postcards to giving you directions. Bedrooms As youâ€™d expect from a period building, rooms are small but clean and comfortable. They come equipped with en suites, kettle, TV, fridge and safe. They are cleaned everyday. Plus you are greeted by a bunch of lovely flowers which is a nice touch. Breakfast Room This is also a fairly small room so can get quite busy. However, breakfast runs for a decent time slot (about 2 Â½ hours) so there is plenty of time to chill and wait your turn. The views are lovely overlooking the canal and church. Itâ€™s self service and a basic continental breakfast but itâ€™s an all you can eat one. Cats Meet â€˜Helloâ€™ and â€˜Goodbyeâ€™ the two hotel cats who can usually be found snoozing behind the glass window opposite the breakfast room. They are kept in the private quarters so do not roam the hotel but if youâ€™re lucky you will be allowed in to meet them. Top tips Visit Saraâ€™s Pancakes a couple of doors down from the hotel for every kind of pancake imaginable. If you are looking for a quieter coffee shop try Paradox which about a 5 minute walk away. Great music, relaxed atmosphere and great hot chocolate. There are a few lovely places to eat right near the hotel but we highly recommend San Jovanys next to the Albert Heijn Supermarket where youâ€™ll get the most delicious steaks. Summary The perfect hotel to use as a base for exploring and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: This is a well located, cosy, quirky hotel near the centre which is relatively inexpensive by Amsterdam standards. It is located within walking distance to most major attractions and is near to tram lines. The staff were friendly and excellent, I had arrived at 7:30am after a 24 hour flight and hadn't slept too much. They provided me with a room as soon as one was available, after 12 but still before check in time. The breakfast was average with a lack of protein such as eggs or bacon. The rooms are exceedingly small but this is typical for Amsterdam, where there isn't much floor space considering they restrict the height of the skyline to a low level to protect the character of the historic part of the city. There is a nearby, fairly inconsiderate church that keeps ringing it's bells throughout the night - does it have planning permission for bell noise? I doubt it. The stairs were steep but who cares? I feared for my safety about the stairs having read some reviews on here in advance but it was no big deal. Overall, i'd easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very well located hotel for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Guaip
Reviews.Content: We got a double and a family room. The familly room (for four people) is particullary amazing, with a front view to the canals, a lot of space, free coffee/tea, fridge, electric keetle and a large dining table. The breakfast was also a pleasant surprise. The only problem was a strong paint smell on the room. Some people may complain about the stairs, but there's no way a hotel in that area won't have them. The staff was very friendly with information and helping with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jacksparr0w
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here for 4 days and the service and staff were brilliant.Its in a good location for the red light district and easy to get to and from the airport. We were given an upgrade on arrival to a canal view room and flowers in the room as it was my girlfriends birthday which was a lovely surprise.We had a great stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel Central Location Fantastic Staff clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: dharris2203
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is amazing wow the stairs not for the infirm but worth the effort. The welcome was really warm and friendly the room was small side but very clean and cosy with TV ,Fridge and safe the shower was great . For value location and freindly and warm welcome would be hard to beat Would return with pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nicky-Plymouth
Reviews.Content: We couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough - all the staff were so friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble! Extras we asked for were provided immediately - decaff coffee for our room, mugs instead of cups, a adapter socket to plug things in... there were loads of electrical sockets too! The rooms are 'compact', ok they are small... but we lacked for nothing - to even have a fridge and a safe at no extra charge was brilliant! Things that may niggle others amused us - for example if we opened the wardrobe the door switched the light off! But hey, compared to the overall experience that was nothing! The bed was comfortable, the shower had excellent water pressure and was lovely and hot, there were even 2 chairs for us to sit to the desk / table if we wanted to... most hotel rooms of this size (or bigger) would probably have placed a single chair there. The location could not have been bettered - everything was in easy walking distance. Breakfast was basic; croissants, bread, cheese, yoghurts, fruit etc, but there was plenty of everything and we wouldn't have wanted anything different. The coffee was good and there was a wide range of different teas to try.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, quirky, clean, friendly...a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Caroline C
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely warm welcome, and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We arrived in Amsterdam early and they checked us in straight away, offering us all complementary soft drinks. There were fresh flowers in our two rooms, both were spotlessly clean and beautiful - wooden panelled walls, very unusual shapes, well laid out for the size, and a wonderful setting overlooking the canal and Westerkerk. A really great place to stay, and would happily return here both for the location and the staff. Many thanks Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel, Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must for visitors to Amsterdam. Set in an arcade of shops and restaurants, its staff are welcoming polite and helpful, with a good knowledge of local attractions. 2 minutes from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “The STAIRS!”
Reviews.Author: BrokenLaces
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fantastic from the accommodations, location and extremely friend & helpful staff. The stairs to get to the hotel are awesome its a complete blast and if you're tired from travelling the staff will bring your baggage up. The breakfast room was great, wonderful view, great food, delicious coffee and all around great people.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Vindaloobaby
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 of stayed in varying rooms from singles to triples and no one was disappointed. We were met by Osam and his wonderful staff who helped us in with our bags. We were offered a free cold drink on arrival with brochures and maps of the area. The rooms are more than adequate in size although cosy. Very clean, fresh flowers in the rooms. Free safe in the room. The views are wonderful and for the price this hotel cannot be criticised its brilliant. Location is about a 5 minute walk from Dam Square. Breakfast is lovely with loads of hot coffee and tea, bread, jams etc. You simply cannot go wrong with this hotel, honestly. There is a room where you can store your luggage after check out and even then you are welcome back into the hotel for tea and coffee whilst you await taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Clare D
Reviews.Content: Cannot rate this hotel more highly. The staff were fantastic and could not be more helpful. The rooms were on the small side and it did get a littel cold at times but it was -12 at one point outside but they were clean and tidy and had everything you needed. Great location and amazing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, very nice staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Dan K
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel, we knew there were a lot of stairs but we didn't realise how many. The staircase is really high and steep, which wasn't a problem for us with our small luggage, but may be a problem for others. We got to reception, which my girlfriend thought was lovely, decorated nice and quirky and very welcoming. The receptionist was friendly and offered us each a choice of one of the drinks from the fridge behind reception as a welcome drink. She was very helpful offering us maps of the city, and although we arrived earlier than check-in, they prepared our room quickly for us. Upon entering our room, we were pleasantly surprised to see a vase of fresh flowers on the side unit, which is unique as you don't see this very often in hotels like this. The room itself was small, as was the bathroom, but it was also nice, and clean. There was a tv in the room, as well as a fridge and free wi-fi which were nice bonuses. We booked a balcony room, so we were keen to check the balcony out. It was quite small but had a nice little bench to sit on, and a chair. The balcony overlooks the street, but to the left is a nice view of the church and homomonument. As we were staying in November and it was very cold, we were happy to find a fleecey blanket in the wardrobe which was handy to use on the balcony. The bed was comfortable, there was a bit of noise from the street from trams, traffic and the chruch bells, but it went quiet at night and the noise didn't bother us at all during our stay. As we headed out the next day, we were asked if we required our room to be cleaned, which we declined but appreciated getting the choice. When checking out the following day, the receptionist was very friendly once again and actively encouraged us to review the hotel as they like the customer feedback, which we liked as we've never been asked to do this before in other hotels we've stayed in. We had no problems in this hotel during our stay, and I was surprised to find a greeting card email from the hotel at christmas. We were very impressed with this hotel and are planning on staying there again when we go back to Amsterdam soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Svetz
Reviews.Content: A nice location (about 5 minute walk from dam square or 1 stop on the tram), and very friendly staff make this a nice hotel to stay. There are a lot of nice restaurants within walking distance and some of the rooms have a nice view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Small and clean”
Reviews.Author: Woimble
Reviews.Content: Located near Anne Frank's house this hotel is well positioned and OK for a couple of tourist nights as long as you don't plan to spend time in the room. The room I had was tiny and on the front (noisy), en suite toilet and shower room also very small, free wi-fi. Reception is located on the second floor and accessed by steep stairs (could see no lift), hotel staff carry bags to room but this is definitely not a good hotel for disabled or infirm people. Breakfast is very simple, bread, rolls, cheese, jams, tea coffee, orange juice. The place is clean and the staff are welcoming and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, but I won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Norman_Luxury_Yacht
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, well run, and sincerely hospitable. As looking at a map will tell you, itâ€™s also very conveniently located â€“ about 5 minutes by tram or bus from Central Station, a five-minute walk to Dam Plaza and the Royal Palace â€“ without being in the midst of the tourist traffic that teams along and near Damrak (with requisite noise and trash). At the price I paid, about $110 per night (including everything, pre-paid on hotels.com about 3 months ahead), itâ€™s a very good value, especially with the continental bâ€™fast. The free wi-fi performed flawlessly. There are a couple of well fed cats, so I assume any rodent problem in under constant control. That said, there were enough things that I didnâ€™t like about the hotel that would preclude my returning. There was a slight but persistent odor in my hallway reminiscent of cooking cabbage. It wasnâ€™t strong but I found it unpleasant. Fortunately, it was not present in my room. Traveling alone, I was accorded what was almost certainly the smallest room Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. The floor space was in the shape of a right triangle, with the room tapering most acutely at the end furthest from the door. The total square footage, not including bathroom, was under 70 ft. It had a small refrigeratorâ€¦ on a shelf literally five feet off the floor at the narrow end of the room, over the desk (more like a narrow counter). The bathroom door opened about 22â€� before hitting the bed. A little too claustrophobic considering that the only other public/sitting area of the hotel is the breakfast room, which is open 24 hrs. (chairs & tables, no couches or lounge area). The wallsâ€™ cherry-tone old wood paneling and dark blue carpet gave the room a gloomy feel. The one window, which was large, opened onto a small interior patio allowing some indirect light in daytime (but why would you stay there in the daytime). The bed clearly sagged in the one spot where almost assuredly anyone who had ever used the bed would have sat on it to get in or out; the room geometry and bedâ€™s position (in the only 90-degree corner) assured that. The mattress was softer than I like and except for the sag, comfortable. I was there five nights and slept well every one. There were ample blankets and pillows. The bathroom was typically euro-small but adequate. However, the vent in the room did more to let outdoor air in than to let indoor air out. It being winter, I had to keep the bathroom door closed to prevent cool air from entering the hotel room. The room was very adequately heated and allowed me to adjust the radiator for heat. It was winter and very cold while I was there, and I was able to keep the room (but not the bathroom) very comfortable. As others have commented, the lobby is two steep, narrow flights up from the street. This didnâ€™t bother me but will some. (A hotel porter will happily take your luggage up and down.) My room was one flight down from the lobby, on a locked hallway; the security of the place was good. My room was reasonably quiet, but I could hear conversations clearly of anyone in the hall near my door. Because I had an interior room, there was no street noise. My problem with the hotel is that it wasnâ€™t a place to spend any time comfortably when not sightseeing or working (my primary reason for visiting was business). My room had two equally uncomfortable chairs, a bed used too often as a chair or couch, and the place didnâ€™t offer enough other comfort or atmospheric charm to bring me back. The management is unquestionably concerned that you feel welcome and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Julie F
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Nadia.The staff were friendly and very helpful.The hotel is clean.cosy and full of character.Situated far enough from the centre but close enough to get to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experince”
Reviews.Author: Jessica T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought our three boys to Amsterdam. We picked Nadia because of its location, which was perfect! We could easily walk anywhere from the hotel. Our view from our room was amazing! But the best part of our stay was the staff. They were so helpful and kind. They paid extra attention to our 7 year, which made him feel really important. The boys loved the welcome drinks and the candies and cookies that were always available. They loved the breakfast options, too. My husband and I loved that they brought an extra bed into our room so no one had to sleep on the floor. It did make the room cramped, but not too bad. The room was clean, had plenty of towels and hot water. There is a market on Dam square, where we bought bread, cheese and fruit. There was a table in our room where we had picnics and felt right at home. The kids also enjoyed the TV, which had American shows in English and commericals in Dutch. This is a wonderful hotel for families! I had to rate it an average for sleep quality because of the church bells, which bothered one of our family of five.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a fan”
Reviews.Author: BusyBusy82
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely has its positives: 1) Extremely friendly staff - So nice and welcoming! A lot of them are Arab, and I felt like I was back in Jordan or Egypt with that super-warm Arab hospitality, if you've ever experienced it. 2) Terrific location 3) Generous breakfast for the price paid 4) Spotlessly clean (though somewhat worn) rooms However, there are some big downsides that make this not really a terrific place to stay given that Amsterdam is a city full of old heritage hotels: 1) Paper-thin walls - I heard every word neighbors on both sides of me said. I couldn't sleep all night with their talking 2) Utter lack of design or charm - Someone else described this as a sort of "indoor motel" or something like that, and I have to agree. Amsterdam is a city full of charming B&B's, heritage hotels, etc., and this hotel really has no charm. If it was bigger, the room could fit in well in any motel on the side of the road in the US. You can spend 15 or 20 Euros more and have a really charming experience in one of the small house-hotels. 3) Tiny, tiny, tiny rooms - Even for Amsterdam! I could not close the bathroom door without curling my feet given the size of the room and that the toilet was in front of the door. I've lived in Japan and Hong Kong and never seen a bathroom this size!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning from an overnight flight (7 am) and asked if they could hold my baggage until check-in at 2. They said wait 20 minutes and we will have a room for you with a balcony. I then needed to checkout 45 minutes before breakfast was served; again, they accommodated me by having breakfast waiting for me an hour early. The service overall was outstanding. The hotel is also very nice, with an amazing old staircase leading up to the reception. My room was on the lower level facing the street, so it was a bit noisy with traffic, but they also have rooms on the quiet side of the building. The rooms are small by North American standards, but all European rooms are, and this one had everything I needed, including shower and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about :) very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey_Zammit
Reviews.Content: As I arrived in this Hotel, with my wife, we were welcomed with a welcome drink, and found a man that took up our luggage in our room. We had a small, warm room with a balcony and a nice view of the river and a lovely church. I suggest all of you that are going to Amsterdam to stay in this Hotel, that is 5minutes walk from Dam Square. A supermarket just opposite the Hotel, and restaurants on the same side of it. I am very happy that i chose this hotel, and when i go, i definetly book here again. The stuff are just amazingggggg. Thanks alot guys. You made our holiday complete :)

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: jack n
Reviews.Content: i had good time in Nadia hotel , very friendly staff , clean , in the center of Amsterdam 5 mins walk from the Dam , 10 mins train station ( central ) wonderfull breakfast room , they have a nice touch by flower in the room even during stay fresh flower ,small room but have all you need ,, fast internet wfi and free !!!! so nice ,, i like hotel; nadia and i will be back soon .. thanks for all staff

Reviews.Title: “Quality for a nice price!”
Reviews.Author: hestia69
Reviews.Content: It was my third stay t this hotel and again it felt really good. It was like coming home! In this hotel youâ€™re not a â€˜numberâ€™. Youâ€™re a human being and the manager and his personnel really want you to have a nice stay. The place is very clean; the atmosphere is cosy and happy. As an elderly person, the first time I was impressed by the huge steep staircase, but help with your luggage is there at once, and walking stairs is good exercise. The location is central, near the Dam, with several trams close by. If youâ€™re not used to the noises of the city, you can ask for a room on the quiet site. Breakfast buffet is not â€˜hugeâ€™, but gives all you need with several kinds of fresh bread, rolls and croissants. And fresh flowers on the tables and from the breakfast room a fascinating view on the â€˜â€˜Westertorenâ€™! Anyway, for my next stay in Amsterdam, this is my address! Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “We will only stay here from now on”
Reviews.Author: pondtraveler
Reviews.Content: I took my two daughters to Amsterdam as a New Year's treat. I found the Nadia Hotel online and chose it as it was reasonable for a triple room. I knew the area it was located in because it is only blocks from the Anne Frank House. The door leading into the hotel is very misleading as it looks like a door into a flat. When you enter, you are greeted by the owners who take your bags up the stairs to the reception. I have bad knees but these stairs did not bother me although they are typical canal house stairs - straight up. The room and bathroom were VERY clean and the beds comfortable. Breakfast consisted of bread, cheese, yoghurt, croissants and delicious coffee. We left our luggage there as we wandered the city. When we returned to get it, we were treated to coffee and ginger cookies in the breakfast room (at no charge). Oh - there were fresh flowers in all rooms we went in. Nice touch! I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a no frills, clean comfortable, well priced hotel. My husband and I visit Amsterdam once or twice a year (more now that Easy Jet has such good fares - Â£25 each way) and we will stay here from now on. Well done Nadia Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is an indoor motel & not a hotel... boutique or otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife decided to stay at Nadia over the holiday to explore the city. Two positive things about the hotel: it's location and friendliness of the staff. Otherwise, I was very disappointed in the decor, space (I knew it was small but I didn't expect it to be THAT SMALL), cigarette smoke in the hallway (you're allowed to smoke in the hallway and they supply ashtrays), and general cleanliness of the hotel. If you're looking to party and just need a bed to lay your head, then Nadia may be for you. But if you want to have a place to return to after a long day of seeing the sights and want to relax with some basic amenities then you may want to select a different hotel. And even though the location is ideal it is on a major through-way/and tourist part of the city and you may want something a little more quiet. Don't be mislead into thinking that Nadia is more like a B&B or eclectic boutique hotel. It's more like a indoor motel. If that's what you're into then go for it. Otherwise I'm sure you can find better elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but cramped”
Reviews.Author: ths907
Reviews.Content: The people who work here are very friendly and helpful, the location is excellent, and the other guests all seemed quite happy and nice, but the rooms are so small that you can barely turn around in them w/out knocking your elbows, so cramped that you just want to leave the room as soon as you put your things down. In part because of the very steep narrow entry stairs (you don't have to carry your own bags up and down the stairs) this hotel is probably not advisable for people over 50 unless you are very sporty. The bedspreads are a bit stained and have a few cigarette burns, and the carpet is okay but you'd probably rather not step on it in your bare feet. Next time in Amsterdam, I will spend maybe 20 euros more a night and hope to find a place with a bit more room in it. But the staff is very positive and the place has a friendly, relaxed and pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Ioana Hojda,”
Reviews.Author: ioanahmara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nadia in Amsterdam, and I was impressed by the hotel staff, the conditions very well located with access everywhere. Very good price and quality buna.Recomand with pleasure. Thank you Hotel Nadia, we'll see with pleasure when we return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lia C
Reviews.Content: i had a terrible experience in amsterdam in the clemens hotel in the same street. after going to a last minute booking on the 30th of january we finally got a bedroom for 3 persons with bathroom included for a really good price. Mr Osam was one of the nicest persons ive met in my life, and overall the service was excellet. i would highly recommend this hotel to people that are looking for a quite stay in amsterdam near the dam. we were three girls around 24 years old and we really had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: This was our very first trip to Amsterdam, so we booked this hotel as part of an internet holiday packageThis is a very nice hotel but beware the stairs at the entrance are very sleep and the rooms are very small. This I believe is common in Amsterdam. The majority of the staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and the facilities excellent, but the point that let's this hotel down is the size of the breakfast area. For a hotel of this size it's far too small. You feel cramped whilst trying to enjoy your breakfast. Also, despite it's claims, this hotel is not centrally located for most of the attractions, although access to trams and canal boats is quite easy. On the whole we had an enjoyable stay here, but compared to some, this hotel is quite expensive for what's on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel and staff are the Best,we stayed in many Hotels throughout Europe and none compare with the friendly atmosphere we encountered here.Location excellent we walked to all major attractions however Tram is right at front door if needed.Rooms are small but that is Amsterdam,stairs might test elderly.We will certainly stay here again and highly recommend to all this great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia- very good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Dileksi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Amsterdam for the last Christmas and we preferred Hotel Nadia. I would highly recommend this hotel. Firstly, the owner of the hotel and all stuff were very kind people. Each of them showed us sincere hospitality. Accordingly, we felt very comfortable and cosy environment. Secondly, the location of the hotel is perfect. Our window had wonderful panaromic view of the city. We also could reach Dam square in five minutes by walking. Thirdly, the hotel has its own style; for example, there were many hidden small decorations in the breakfast room such as small statues under the leaves of flower pots. Even you can discover beautiful garden if you intend to look from the windows of the reception room. If you're lucky, you can see the big parrot which visits routinely this garden for feeding. The dominant colors for me were yellow, green and red. All of them can give you an impression to discover interesting things during your stay at this hotel.Fourthly, eventhough rooms are small, but well-designed for easy functionality. Only one thing I could emphasize is that the stairs are highly deep like the historical buildings in Amsterdam, thus if you have not mobility problems as physical condition, you have no problem to reach reception desk after stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A few days in 'Room 212'”
Reviews.Author: irene212212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a welcoming place due to the caring attitude of the staff. I was on my own and made to feel quite at home. My room was small but had everything I needed. It was very clean and had a great shower. Also the artistic use of mirrors helped to make the room appear bigger. And I liked the colours and the shapes - no straight lines. On my arrival I was even given a lovely vase of flowers. The owner should be rightly proud of his hotel. A big thankyou, both to Osam and to all the others who made my stay so relaxed and warm. Every time I came back I was offered a nice non-alcoholic drink, hot or cold. And they were genuinely interested in how things were going. It would have been pretty difficult to get lost as I was given so much information as well as maps. I wish I could have stayed longer. In fact I wish I could spend a while on each floor - just to try out the stairs - and compare the views!! One day maybe. Before leaving they even made sure that I had my return flight 'online check in' sorted and printed out on their computer. My bag was carried up and down the stairs. And it also makes such a difference to just leave luggage on the last day - I had a late flight, and was able to stroll about Amsterdam knowing that I had plenty of time to return for my bag. Nadia Hotel has character and such a good atmosphere. I hope you'll like it too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and hotel, will be returning soon!”
Reviews.Author: steffi42
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Nadia, we were welcomed with fresh flowers and a note saying welcome home....the staff and the owner really cant do enough for you and if there is anything you need they will go out of thier way to help. Room was spotless as was shower and toilet. It is in a perfect location about 6 or 8 mins from dam square almost opposite to the anne frank house.There also some lovely places to eat nearby Koh-I-Noor just a few steps away and a lovely little brown cafe on the next corner. Thank you again for a lovely stay. Hope to see you all very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: wd_wade71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around a 15 min walk from the station but once you get there beaware of the hunderds of steep steps inside the hotel 49 just to reception then 3 more floors up each flight 30 steps the rooms and they are tiny and we were on the inside so all we could see oitsde was other windows.and our room was next door to their laundry room so an early wake up call with teh washers and dryers 6am. the breakfast was quite poor bread, chees, yogurt, not much more to say really apart from reception staff lovely and helpful

Reviews.Title: “One more reason that made me love Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Stella M
Reviews.Content: In general it is a very nice place to stay but the personnel is fabulous, the attention is great, they speak great English and are very nice and are very available to help in anything you need.
