At first you might get scared because of the stairs but you have nothing to worry about because the staff takes the best care of your luggage. Very close of the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurie T
Reviews.Content: The staff is helpful and very friendly. The rooms are charming. The location is terrific. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. If I ever get so lucky to get to make it back to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay here. I had the 4th Fl room with balcony.... fantastic view. I've had 5 star hotels that fail in comparison to this hotel. Good job Hotel Nadia! Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: TommyStanners
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for a couple of nights at the beginning of December and it was lovely. The rooms are not huge but this is in the centre of the city so u cannot really expect much more. Dam centre is only a couple minutes walk away and as a tourist from there you can go pretty much anywhere. We booked a room with a balcony which I would also advise to anyone thinking about staying here it really added to the room to be able to sit out at night time and relax and if it got too cold your room was only a foot away :) Great hotel, friendly staff, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LMdNiC
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples staying for 4 nights. The staff is extremely helpful, welcoming and accomodating. Flowers in the bedroom, teas and coffees etc... Note: don't take your luggage up the stairs, someone will bring them to your room. You'll understand when you see the stairs. Double beds are 2 singles brought together but me and my partner didn't feel any gap or anything. The room with the best views on the canal and westerkerk are also the noisiest so I wouldn't say there are better rooms although some bathrooms may be on the squeezy side. Breakfast is ok to keep you going but that's not one of their core strength. Overall we had a great time, the location was simply ideal and the staff was great... and considering the price, we're convinced we couldn't have find better.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dafni_g
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and accomodating staff, eager to answer all questions! Clean hotel, good service and very convenient location. However, lots of steps (but that is something that a visitor is warned about) and not a very rich breakfast variety. Overall, good value for money. Just a remark: perhaps something could be done with windows letting too much cold air in?? The heating is satisfactory, but it would work much better combined with firmly shut windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sms50
Reviews.Content: My family and I were on our way out of Europe after a 4 month stay in Holland and, since we were flying out of Amsterdam, were looking for someplace reasonable to stay for those last few days. With needing accomodation for 4 this was no easy task. Everytime I would find something close to Amsterdam Centraal Station that was in our price range I would be scared away by the negative reviews. When I began to look for good reviews I would be scared away by the price. I then found this hotel and it seemed to fit the bill - reasonable rates, a room for 4, excellent reviews, free wi-fi, and free breakfast. We were not disappointed. First, it is true that the steps leading to the lobby are daunting. But before we even had a chance to start taking our suitcases up there was someone there to do this for us. Since we had 4 suitcases, this was very welcome. We arrived early so our room wasn't ready yet. But we were given a complimentary soda, asked to wait in the breakfast room while our room was prepared and in about 15 minutes were shown to our room and our suitcases were already there. The hospitality shown by the staff throughout our stay was wonderful and comparable to what you would expect out of a 4 or 5 star hotel. As for the room, it was small but in Amsterdam all rooms are small. Nevertheless, it was big enough for our purposes. It had a nice canal view and of Raadhuisstraat. Had it been in the summer I would imagine that it could be a little noisier if the windows needed to be opened but in early December, this was fine. As for the breafast buffet, he only thing missing was some type of meat but it was still nice. The location was perfect as it was a short walk from the train station and within easy walking distance to most of the sites you would want to see in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Simone S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! very good position near Dam. Good ospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ronpauline
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The Nadia was a great "quirky" hotel with many steps to the reception area. Anyone with breathing problems beware. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Nothing was a problem,Rooms and reception/breakfast rooms were very clean ,bedding changed twice, serviced every day and if very small was very compact. we had a four foot bed and found it difficult to get comfortable. It was rather narrow and we both had to stand back to let the other pass in the room. Lighting was a great problem for us as no light except in the bathroom was adequate to read by. The hotel was a great short stay place, a longer stay in our room would have been very difficult. The entrance was lovely,loads of greenery and very welcoming.and the Arabic style lampshades were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 311 between the 9th to 11th December. Hotel room was a deluxe double and whilst not massive in size was easily suitable for a couple of nights. Staff couldn't be more helpful with any query, (e.g. directions, lent us an adaptor, reset the safe in our room, free drink on arrival/departure etc.). Breakfast is very good and the location is superb being a stones throw from the Anne Frank House on one side and Dam square on the other. Prices are very reasonable and I would be keen to stay here again next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca H
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff friendly, welcoming and helpful. Room cosy and comfortable. Location of hotel close to everything of interest - Dam Square 5 minutes walk, Anne Frank's house 5 minutes walk. Centraal Station 10-15 minutes walk or hop a tram which stops 1 minute walk from hotel. Will be back again to stay here and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: Ralph H
Reviews.Content: Genuinely friendly and helpful receptionists Comfortable room, double bed, fridge, more shelves than we've ever seen Toilet and shower cunningly squeezed into tiny space Balcony upgrade doubtful benefit, accompanied by noise of trams Good breakfast Central location, near Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to central station and attractions”
Reviews.Author: TisPete
Reviews.Content: Short walk from Central station. Friendly welcome. Steep stairs to reception on 2nd floor. I only had hand luggage but they will carry your luggage if you have difficulty. Very small room(306) on third floor facing street. However, it did have shower/WC a desk and tea making facilities. You will need to fetch a glass cup from the breakfast room if you are a tea drinker as small expresso cups are what is put in the bedroom. Quiet at night. Fine for a few days if you are mostly out seeing the sights. Breakfast saves you trying to find food outside the hotel. Yoghourt, orange juice, bread, rolls and cheese. Tea, coffee and cake. No meat. Filling, but a bit boring. No need to bother with trams you can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLIEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jean c
Reviews.Content: the owner and all the staff at this hotel were so friendly and could not do enough for us. Although only B&B, coffee, tea and cold drinks were available 24/7 free of charge. Flower in our room. Always a smile waiting for you. Not for the faint hearted though! There were 36 steps to reception and another 36 to our room and they were very steep. Got used to them by the third day though! Rooms very small. Hazem was very helpful, always ready for any info you required and waited on us when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: criserim
Reviews.Content: My experience at Nadia Hotel was great. Service is amazing, they offer you a drink when you arrive, there are flowers in your room, and they also help you with your luggage, as the entrance stairs are veeeery steep (not suitable for old people, or physically impaired). The room was warm and comfortable, although the mattress was quite old. Breakfast very complete, included in the price. I would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bercisa
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, 4 minutes walk from Dam square, you may also walk from central station easily but because of the luggages if you wish to use tram, the tram station is just across the hotel! We stayed at the end of november but the room was so warm that we slept with tshirts. The stuff was so friendly and kind, they offer us drinks everytime we go to the reception. If you bored of the big hotel chains and looking for warm and nice hotel that you feel the city best we highly recommend Hotel Nadia to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday and brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: Brett E
Reviews.Content: Came to Amsterdam early morning from Australia within 15 minutes room was ready, clean and the staff brought up our giant suitcases no questions asked. Super friendly and would go out of their way to make the stay pleasant. Superb breakfast every morning and quick walking distance to all of amsterdams main attractions, shops, cafes, restaurants, coffeeshops etc.. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone... Not a bad word to say about anything.. Felt safe and even if the bathroom was slightly small it's part of the experience. Great great start to my European adventure.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: crazygerman08
Reviews.Content: we got a room last minute and we paid very little. The location is just perfect because everything is so close by. The service was great very polite and helpful. The room was kind of small but we have noticed that everything in the Netherlands is small. If I happen to go back to Amsterdam I WILL stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pedro C
Reviews.Content: We were 3 nigths in Amsterdam the last October. Before to arrive there, we were searching lots of hotels by surfing the net. We had listened that some of them had a lack of hygiene in the rooms, so, we focused our search on three things. The first one, obviously was the hygiene. For this, we were reading a lot of comments based on people experienceÂ´s in each hotel we were interested. The second one was the location. It was very important for us that we were able to go walking everywhere we wanted to visit. And last but not least the price. We are a young couple (25 years old), so we canÂ´t pay so much money in an hotel. All of these three things in which we focused our search, we find them on NADIA HOTEL. There you will find a very nice staff. They are very friendly and they help you in everything you need.Its a pretty hotel, in a perfect localitation, only a 4 minuts from Dam Place. The rooms were very clean. We slept 2 nights in a little bit small room, although it was ok, but the third night they changed us to a new room that was fantastic! You can sleep relaxed without any noise to disturb you. The breakfast was good. The price was very good and like I said before, the people who work there is lovely people. So, I would really recommend everybody this hotel to stay in Amsterdam. It was all we can expect from a hotel. Price, location, hygiene, staff... Nadia Hotel is a perfect election.

Reviews.Title: “"Almost afraid to share the secret ...!"”
Reviews.Author: NoFixedPlans
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel!!! It is cute, clean, central, includes a decent breakfast, and staff are amazingly friendly! 10-15 minute walk from the Central Station if you don't have big bags. We arrived early Friday morning for a weekend getaway, jetlagged ... we were checked in quickly and had a little snooze .. when we woke up staff told us they'd had a cancellation for a balcony room and asked if we'd like to upgrade. Um, yes. Our first room on the 4th floor was fine but the second room on the 2nd floor with a balcony facing the church and canal was a bit larger and recently renovated (210). Can't recommend this place enough if you are not fussy (yes, there are steep stairs and the rooms are European-size) and like to be close to everything. We rented bikes at the shop the next block over and got around the entire city zip-zip all weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Really basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Damien121
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend with my wife in Amsterdam and stayed here. We had read other trip advisor reviews but were still a bit surprised at just how tiny and basic our room was - If you opened the bathroom door it hit the wardrobe, and had to leave toilet door open to sit on it! The walls were thin and on both the Fri and Sat night I had to complain at reception about the noise coming from the TV and the people in the next room. Staff were excellent and got the noise stopped immediately. Having said all that the room was spotless, bed comfortable and continental breakfast tastey. Its also in a great location - 10 mins from station and 5 mins from Dam square. Ann Frank House was across the road. Would I use it again - yes

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: emiushi
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with some amazingly helpful and friendly staff. They genuinly went out of your way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. For a resonably priced hotel, the little touches, like having fresh flowers in the room to welcome you, the free welcome drink and complementary breakfast made the stay feel that little bit more special. The location is fantastic, very central and a stone's throw away from the Anne Frank House. My only 2 points of complaint was that our room faced the main road and it was very noisy at night (although they do mention this on their website). I live in a town centre so I am used to noise but it was almost unbearable. So my advise is to take one of the rooms at the back! My other point is that the shower was really not great. The bathroom and rooms were super clean however. I would still recommend this hotel as the wonderful service and location totally made up for any negative points during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Bugzee27
Reviews.Content: Excellent location...only a few minutes by tram from Central Station....Staff were very helpful...room was spotless...great view overlooking the canal...Hire bikes...the only way to get around the city...all you do is foolow the canal routes on the map

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: aeabbot
Reviews.Content: I believe this is an excellent choice for housing in Amsterdam. It is centrally located and within easy walking and public transportation distance of all points of interest in Amsterdam. Westerkerk and the Anne Frank house are just across the adjacent canal. The tram to and from Centraal Station stops right in front of the hotel and the hop on hop off canal boat stops close by. The staff is exceptional and went above and beyond to assist me with all my needs and to make me feel at home. Steep stairs and small but cosy, warm rooms with fresh flowers, free WiFi and a fridge. I would recommed this highly!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated about 15minute walk from central station and 5-10 minute walk to the main town. There is a very step staircase leading up to the reception area but think this is very common in buildings in Amsterdam. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Got the room, which I booked a twin room. Room was clean and tidy, so was toilet and shower. There was also Free Wifi with plenty off different wifi connections so all you have to do is pick the strongest signal and type in the password which the reception staff give you. Will use again when I return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LB00
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at 14 different places throughout our backpacking trip and this hotel was by far our favourite. The staff are so warm, friendly and helpful we felt like we were at home. The rooms were very clean and offered coffee/tea and had mini-fridges. There is a breakfast room that you can use during the day so that you don't need to hang out in your room. The location was perfect for us - right on the canal and close enough to walk to anywhere we wanted to be. We had a great stay here and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “good value very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Eugene C
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was a bit of a steep stair climb but the exceptionally friendly staff made the effort worthwhile. Our bags were well handled to our room and the reception was great. We appreciated the extras that were offered (eg. detailed map and beverages) when we checked in. Throughout our four night stay the staff were fantastic and always willing to help. Wonderful location to the sights we wished to see. We would definitely return to the Nadia for good value and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “A traditional hotel- Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Maali
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel experience that goes beyond just a comfortable place to stay the the Hotel Nadia is highly recommended. We had a delux room that over looked the canal. The room was not large but it was very clean and comfortable. There may not be double galzing but we were not disturbed by the gentle buzz of evening life in the town. The hotel is only a short walk from the main station and postitioned well for a walk into the more touristy centre or the more cultural areas to the south west. You arrive to a very steep set of stairs- but this is the Amsterdam way! the staff were delightful- very keen to please and very cheerful. Breakfast was simple but adequate- coffee/tea, croissants, bread and cheese, a slice of local cake and orange juice. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and well located”
Reviews.Author: sc00ter11
Reviews.Content: My room was tiny, but all I wanted was a place to sleep. It was just fine for that. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is great. My room in the back was quiet, but I was told by others that the church clock tower across the street kept them awake. I overslept, but was able to get coffee in the charming breakfast room with lovely views of the church and canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fantastic location, but hard bed”
Reviews.Author: CarotteSauvage
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed the service at this hotel - the staff was so accommodating and helpful and also very kind! The location cannot be been beat as it was less a five minute walk to the Anne Frank House and Westerkerk (our room had a great view of Westerkerk, actually) and close to the stop for the tram that takes you wherever you need to go. It's right around the corner from Dam square and the red light district, and the Jordaan with all it's wonderful restaurants is also right there. The location made up for the fact that the room was pretty tiny (however, with lots of shelves and places to store your belongings, the room felt larger than it was). The bathroom was pretty tiny and an odd shape - it was difficult to maneuver around such a tight space, but this may be unique to the room we stayed in. We had a room in the curved cupola-type part of the building next to the canal so bathrooms in the other rooms might be set up better. My biggest complaints were that the bed was rock hard and there was a constant odor of cigarette smoke coming in from another room and into the bathroom - it may have been coming from the owner's apartment which was right next door to our room. I also recommend if you stay here to skip the canal view or street side rooms and get one of the quiet rooms unless you don't plan to open your windows. It was pretty warm when we stayed there so we slept with the windows open and there was a quite a bit of noise coming off the street. Overall, I liked this hotel and if they would just get softer/newer beds, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people”
Reviews.Author: narelleJ
Reviews.Content: We were first timers in Amsterdam and we read the reviews for Hotel Nadia on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The stairs are steep as in most places in Amsterdam, but staff were there to carry our luggage upstairs for us. My sister has vertigo and management arranged a beautiful canal room for us, which was on the first floor. The views from the room and the breakfast room were beautiful, even in the rain that we experienced. Management and staff are welcoming, caring and helpful. A very comfortable environment. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Qwerky character filled, perfectly placed hotel with fab customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Raeray103
Reviews.Content: Great qwerky hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms are small and stairs are steep but they take your luggage to the room for you at no charge and you get a free breakfast. Customer service was fantastic. Not spotlessly clean but beds are clean and comfy. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Nadai......but will certainly return!!”
Reviews.Author: louisecullum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam and with the amount of hotels in the city, we were unsure which to use. We read 100's of reports on Trip advisor and following excellent feedback on the Nadia, we booked up. We were not dissapointed!! From the moment we arrived, the very helpful and professional reception staff looked after all our needs. Even though we arrived very early, we were given refreshments and our cases were taken to our room. The position of the hotel was perfect. Walking distance from all the sites etc. Breakfast was continental but plentyful......and the rooms were clean and tidy. You will reda about the rooms and if you can get a room on the outer side of the hotel, you have a great view of the city. We had a quaint inner room first but were then asked if we would like another room.....which was at the top, with a balcony and a view of the main church....FANTASTIC!! Overall, if you are looking for a friendly place to stay with a great location, look no further that Hotel Nadia.....yu will not be dissapointed!! We will cedrtainly return.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sue H
Reviews.Content: 1st time to amsterdam and the nadia hotel...great location short walk to shops and dam square,had a room with a balcony very clean and comfortable,staff very friendly and helpful,even had a extra bunch of flowers for my birthday from the staff which was a lovely surpise.stairs very steep but after a couple of times of going up and down you get used to them.BIG THANK YOU to all the staff for making my 40th birthday a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel providing service with a Smile.”
Reviews.Author: qawraStPaulsBay
Reviews.Content: One of the main attractions that bring me back to Amsterdam at least twice a year is Nadia Hotel. I always stay at this hotel because the service offered and the friendliness of the staff is second to none. A complimentary drink and fresh flowers in your room will make you feel at home the moment you arrive. Watching the busy life of central Amsterdam while relaxing in the balcony of the clean and cosy rooms is an experience in itself. Nadia Hotel is very centralized and is within walking distance of the main attractions. The manager Mr. Osam and all the staff go beyond their call of duty to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A room at the top!”
Reviews.Author: jane107
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. Handy for the centre but in a calm area with some interesting shops and bars and eating places. We had a lovely room with a balcony, right at the top of the building and it was very comfortable and very clean. There was a great view over canal and church tower and clock (handy! ) The staff were excellent and friendly without being pushy and I liked the fresh flowers in the room when we arrived. Breakfast was good and the staff were happy to top up the tea and coffee in the room, as well as offering us complimentary drinks. They made us feel very welcome and at home. I love the stairs. It is all part of the charm! However anyone with mobility problems or small children would probably find it too much. Will certainly go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - great location, welcoming and good value”
Reviews.Author: Peanut66Kent
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year, great location, short walk to Central Station and Dam Square. Friendly staff, rooms clean, nice breakfast, not hot food but nice choice of brekkie! We always get fresh flowers in the room which is a nice touch. Room cleaned daily. Yes the stairs are steep and quite a few, but this is the style of buildings here and it's good exercise. The staff could not be more helpful and are very welcoming. We love staying here and always recommend and come back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krian
Reviews.Content: we loved how they welcomed us. they have VERY good stuff who helped us in every possible way. I didn't expect to have such a high level of service but i was wrong. the stairs were steep and we never carried our bulky bagages but they were kind enough to do that for us. they also offered a complimentary drink several times during our stay. the room was perfect although i sugest not to book on the street side due to the trams working late at night. VERY VERY tidy and organised room. they never go into your room before asking you and i loved that as it showed a proffessional way. beds were comfortable and you can also control the room's temperature. bathroom was perfectly cleaned everyday leaving everything in place. breakfast was also very good and they used to toast some bread for us aswell. we loved their crossaints with nutella ... aaahh i wish i was still there eating them hahah. another thing i like in this hotel is the saftey. we used to ring the bell and then get inside and therefore they minimise the noise that can make other people who are not guests there. they are able to offer you a taxi whenever you like and it takes about 10 mins or less to arrive which was great. it is very central and we managed to get around the city quite easily. i have nothing else to say expect it was worth it a lot and i do not regret anything. i would def. go back to nadia hotel if visiting again Amsterdam. The Maltese Delegation ;p

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great atmosphere, great value!”
Reviews.Author: LJ_Delta9
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Nadia Hotel twice now, and have had a great stay each time. From the hotel door, there's a large supermarket and the Royal Palace (5 min), then Dam Square and Centraal station (10 min). The proximity to the city center is perfect-- close enough that you never have to walk far, but distant enough that you can escape the noisy crowds. The rooms are clean and cozy, the staff are very helpful and friendly, and there's a warm and homely atmosphere that a big hotel chain undoubtedly lacks. For transport from the airport, there's a Connexxxion shuttle (15.50 euro) that takes you straight there. Depending on the time of your departing flight, you can take the same shuttle back or the Nadia front desk will help you arrange a taxi pickup. Whether you're a partying solo traveler, a tourist, a family or a couple, Nadia is a great place to stay and enjoy Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A home while away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen S
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the wonderful things everyone else has said and I can't say enough good things about Nadia Hotel and its staff! The owner, Mr. Osam and his team are amazing hosts. I truly have never received such great service. The service provided is better than any 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff is wonderful, curteous, very generous and polite. As a single traveler I feel like staying as a guest in my friends' house. The staff went out of its way to make me feel welcome and to assist me with all kinds of issues, like recommending sites, restaurants, stores, making cab & shuttle reservations, printing flight and hotel reservations. Nadia Hotel is very clean and safe. Stairs original for Amsterdam, I love it! I was happy to experience staying in a historic & traditional Amsterdam building with steep narrow stairs, and interesting rooms' architecture. Great location close to Dam Square. I loved being in a neighbourhood where you feel real life is being lived, and so convenient to everything. Thanks for everything Mr Osam and your hardworking team! I hope I can come back, soon!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: William W
Reviews.Content: GREAT value hotel in decent location in central Amsterdam, good tram links.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: plan_ahead_traveler
Reviews.Content: We were traveling thru Amsterdam for two days, and the Nadia Hotel was the perfect place for us. The price was very reasonable and the location was great. There's a tram stop almost right outside the hotel. The room and bathroom was very tiny...just enough room for a bed and a chair. For cleanliness, the room just felt a little dirty. We didnâ€™t notice anything in particular, but it just felt like we were staying in a cheap motel in the US. Our room was on the street side, and it was pretty noisy at night...but that's probably the same all over Amsterdam. Breakfast was normal European breakfast with plenty of bread. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Overall, great place to stay if you're looking for a cheap room with a great location. But if you spend a lot of time in your hotel room, this might not be the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGriffs999
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome at the Nadia Hotel. We were greeted by the famous stairs!!! But kindly a gentleman was sent down to collect our baggage. We were given a complimentary drink upon arrival to drink in the lounge whilst our room was sorted out. We were actually upgraded to a nicer room which was very kind. We had researched the hotel before booking so we knew that it was a very compact hotel so we did not expect anything different. The room we had overlooked the canal and clock tower and quite a busy road. The room itself was as we had expected very compact but it was clean and had all the facilities needed for a couple of nights stay, tv, tea/coffee facilities, bathroom, shower etc. The bathroom could have done with having a fan installed in it as there was no window and a faint chemical smell was always present but other than that the shower was adequate although it would have been helpful if the showerhead could have been moved around as the floor got very wet when showering. The bed was very comfortable and the room's temperature could be controlled as you had two windows and a radiator if necessary. We were right next to the breakfast room so we expected early noise but I am pleased to say the noise level was fine. The only downside was that as we overlooked the road it was quite noisy until late at night as the trams went past very regularly. Also the clock tower chimed throughout the night but we both didn't find that a particular problem. My advice if possible is to get a room at the opposite side of the hotel as you would be away from the road slightly. The noise didn't particulary bother either me or my husband though. Breakfast was served from 7.30 until 10am which was good if you didn't want to get up too early. It was a continental breakfast which was lovely and toast was made for you if required. There is a great pancake shop right next door to the hotel too if you fancy something different, Saras Pancakes. The location of the hotel was brilliant, it was 5 minutes walk from the Dam Square and all the shopping roads. It was only a 10 minute walk from the Central Station so despite getting a tram on the way here we decided to walk on our departure which was fine. The service we received here was lovely and great for the budget price. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Thank you Nadia Hotel, we hope to be back at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: sazzerhughes
Reviews.Content: First class service, they really go out of they way to help you. Steep stairs but they carry your luggage for you and take to your room. They also store your luggage if your arrive early and leave late. They have a welcome drink on arrival (non alcohol). Rooms are compact but have everything you need. We were on the top floor so had a few more steep steps than the others but the room and view was great. Breakfast is simple with crossiants, rolls, cheese jams etc with juice, tea and coffee. Enough to start your day and as this is incuded in price I think is fab, as loads of other hotels charge extra for breakfast. There were 11 of us and the hotel did everything they could to accomodate us, letting us use the breakfast room as an evening meeting point and a few early drinks (our own drinks), extended our check out time. This is a simple hotel but with outstanding staff and service and great location, only 10min walk to Dam Square and 2 mins to Anne Franks. For those of you who have not been to Amsterdam before just to warn you it is very expensive, your looking around Â£6-Â£8 pint of large, Â£3 glass of coke, Â£9 baileys coffee, Â£8.50 bottle Magners. I think as long as your prepared for it, then its not too much of a shock! Having said that we had a fantastic time celebrating my husbands 40th with a fantastic group of friends and had an amazing time. Would definately come back and certainly to Hotel Nadia. Would definately recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam in the fall”
Reviews.Author: hakanengstrom
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Amsterdam. A friend recommended this hotel, and we found it terrific for our purposes. Most importantly, the location is great: close to the western canals and Jordaan, which are the most pleasant in central Amsterdam (if you prefer small shops to chains, and if you prefer nice restaurants and great beer cafÃ©s to noisy bars filled with pot smokers). The rooms are smallish, but large enough if you don't plan to spend your vacation in your hotel. And who does? Service was amazing (yes, really). Breakfast wasn't that great. Our room (first floor, with windows by Raadhuis Straat) was a bit noisy because of the traffic, but ... nothing really to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it was rated to be!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyMeg
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, lovely staff - spotlessly clean. Good breakfast, and the room had a fridge, , tea and coffee making in the room, a safe, iron available and the best view. I would go nowhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Rachelmay1969
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay , from the friendly staff to the breakfast bar , it was all thoroughly excellent . It is situated in a lovely place where people watching and city life just flys by ....

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to returning!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra c
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Nadia Hotel...sure the stairs are steep but not having to carry the bags up and down made it very manageable. The room was very cozy and compact but most importantly very clean, It also had everything that you could possibly need including a safe, coffee maker and fridge!! What a bonus also to have breakfast consisting of pastries, cheese, yogurt, fruit ,coffee and juice included to start your day. The rooms are small but the beds are comfortable!! Good Value for a great location!! Sandra C

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia: a great place for those who enjoy Amsterdam and exercise!”
Reviews.Author: DuValois
Reviews.Content: Thank you Osam and Staff for another in a long series of happy visits to Nadia Hotel! Nadia is the only place I ever stay in Amsterdam. I love the friendly staff, the quirky little rooms, the safe and happy atmosphere, the fine central location. As for the stairs, well, one doesn't need to work out at a gym when staying at Nadia Hotel. As long as the boys are willing and cheerfully able to carry my suitcase upstairs for me, I shall continue to enjoy my stays at Nadia Hotel. The breakfast room is lovely, and the continental breakfast makes you ready for a busy day in beautiful Amsterdam. or, you can sit in the breakfast room with a cup of tea and a book, and watch the canal in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Anne frank probably had more room than us !”
Reviews.Author: Vinyladdict
Reviews.Content: We were on the top floor,73 steps to climb and the room if you can call it that was tiny ! The breakfast was really really poor !if you could get in there anyway ! Hotel has about 50 rooms,dining room seats 15 at a squash,if u dont like croissants for breakfast then its a piece of cake and the smallest cup of coffee you ever seen.also came home with loads of bites all over our bodies.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel is just what we wanted in Amsterdam as it was central and held a warm welcome. The staff were very obliging, and we were able to make full use of the breakfast room (with super views) in the evening as well as morning - with fresh coffeee available too. I would heartily recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen T
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff. Twenty four hour reception. Cosy, clean room with shower/W.C. overlooking canal/road- great view of Westerkerk. Good basic continental breakfast. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Ange12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Nadia for 3 nights and had a lovely stay. We found the staff to be accommodating, friendly and always willing to help. We can not fault their service. The room was compact, clean and had all that we needed for our stay and we had the room that we had requested. The Breakfast was perfect to start our day.. Fresh croissants, fresh coffee and filled us up until the evening. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a value for money hotel in the heart of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Worth going for the staff alone!”
Reviews.Author: buts
Reviews.Content: Yes the rroms are small and the stairs are steep but the welcome and help you get from all of the staff make up for them. The staff here are the best I have ever come across in any hotel.They went out of their way to be friendly, helpful and amusing. We had a room at the front of the hotel and we didn't find it too noisy. We liked having a balcony and being able to sit out there in the evening. In the summer it would be nice to sit out there. The Nadia is in a very good location. We never used the trams or buses whilst we were in the city. We particularly liked walking past the Westerkirk into the Jordaan area in the evening and finishing up at a place called T'Small bar. Indeed it was small but we were made very welcome Lovely stay in a very friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in strategic position”
Reviews.Author: Lorena B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and we are very happy with Nadia Hotel: staff is very friendly, rooms are small but comfortable, with wide windows and a nice view. We also had very nice balconies. The hotel is located near the Joordan district, at 5 minutes from Dam square. Breakfast is good, with a wide choice of food and you can eat as much as you want. If we ever come back we'll choose Nadia hotel for sure. Quality/price combination is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sparr0w81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nadia for 6 nights and had a great experience. As previous reviews have noted the rooms are quite "pokey" but this was no problem for us. We were looking for hotel in a great location, within walking distance to the major attractions and reasonably priced. Hotel Nadia ticked all these boxes. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel to people who have a heart condition, knee issues etc due to the high stairs that you need to climb to get to your room. The breakfast, although simple is perfect, and was a fantastic start to each day, the service in the hotel was also first rate and everything was taken care of, from taking bags up the steep stairs, to providing a welcome and farewell drink. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to see the sights of Amsterdam and is looking for a well priced well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LJSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Everyone very friendly and helpful and extremely welcoming. Hotel is ideally situated in centre of Amsterdam - not far from any of the attractions. Our room (4) had great view of Westerkirk church and canal. Very clean. Especially liked the flowers in the room. Stairs are very steep but we were prepared - all part of staying in a canal house in Amsterdam. Thank you to everyone for making our stay so memorable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Four Wonderful Days in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are compact, but remember you are in Amsterdam. The staff at the Hotel was wonderful, friendly and always helpful. I am still laughing, thinking about opening the door at the hotel, hearing Tess voice welcoming us at the top of the 36 steps stillwell. We enjoy our breakfast, we luv Amsterdam, the hotel and if we have another visit, we would again stay at the Nadia Hotel. Thank you for my flowers celebrating my 60 birthday. They were beautiful!! Barbara & Robert Texas Friends for Life

Reviews.Title: “Small room but a BIG welcome”
Reviews.Author: DamLoverHalifax
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Nadia and we loved it just as much as the first time. Here are few short comments that may help you decide if the hotel is for you:- BIG welcome - the staff are very hospitable and helpful - the best I have experienced anywhere. Welcome drink offered on arrival - the receptionist even invited us to go for breakfast when we arrived at 9:00, even though we weren't really entitled to this - lovely touch I thought. Flowers in our room with a note saying "welcome back home" - another nice welcoming touch. Excellent location for everything - approximately 200 metres from the back of the Royal Palace on Dam Square. Very steep stairs but the staff will carry and store your luggage for you. Small rooms and bathrooms but nice and clean. Comfortable bed - requested an extra pillow and this was brought to our room whilst we were out. Some rooms at the front have balconies which provide more space. The rooms at the back are probably quieter. The front of the hotel is on a fairly busy road with a tram line. Lovely views of the Westerkerk church. Nice plentiful continental style breakfast to get you going for the day. Coffee/tea facilities in rooms but also available all day in breakfast room. TV, fan and fridge in room. Hairdrier available from reception on request. To summarise a lovely, welcoming and great value hotel in a great location and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Compact very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulbellis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Rooms are small but some would add perfectly formed. The staff and owner are very helpful and friendly. They speak all European languages. It can be a bit daunting for some as when you arrive you are presented with a steep flight of stairs but there is always a member of staff available to help you with your bags. I must be satisfied as I have been back more than 5 times

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: DickC540
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is perfectly located in the centre of Amsterdan, right next to the the Westernkirk and Anne Frank's House. The rooms are small and quirky, but comfortable with many facilities provided that are often overlooked by larger hotels. But what makes the hotel special is the the staff, everybody goes out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay. The passing trams can be noisy at times but they cease operating around 11pm so do not disturb sleep. I would strongly recommend the Hotel Nadia and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Trudie W
Reviews.Content: This is een cosy hotel with the most friendly owner you can imagine. They changed our family room because they could offer a better one during our stay. Futher they helped us find a bag with new clothes we left somewhere in the hotel and an other guest had taken it not on purpose. The place in the centre with a view on the Westertoren is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Suksun C
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed of your excellent services and good service minded. I will visit you in future for next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hellsradish3
Reviews.Content: Hotel nadia is in an amazing location right in the heart of Amsterdam. The rooms even though are on the small side are clean and very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and will help you with anything you may need. In short a great hotel for a weekend break in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Connie S
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the hotel and loved it. The service was great, people were friendly, and everyone was helpful. The breakfasts provided each day were very tasty and generous. This was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Abrind
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing value for the money! First and foremost the staff was so kind and friendly constantly going above and beyond in customer service. Our room, while small even by European standards, was very clean and functional. The neighborhood was awesome and very close to all of the major sites, most of which were within walking distance. Centraal Station was only a 10' tram ride away. The traditional Amsterdam steps into the hotel are not for the weak of heart and gave us a good daily workout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Rooms with balcony recommendedâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Walfaro83
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location very clean and nice! Rooms are a small but then again every room I small in Europe unless you pay top dollar. Close to everything in the heart of Amsterdam! Breakfast can be a little better then just toast and croissants. Other then that great hotel

Reviews.Title: “10/10 location”
Reviews.Author: Bernie P
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a few days around town,located a few mins from dam square the staff were the most helpful and friendly people you could meet. totally recommend staying here they had everything we needed hairdryers , irons etc had a most enjoyable week end and would definitley stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but very nice”
Reviews.Author: hodnak
Reviews.Content: good location, great neighbourhood very helpful staff clean rooms would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: sid101711
Reviews.Content: After two wonderful stays I would recommend Hotel Nadia to friends and family. The location is superb. Although the rooms are not expansive the staff hospitalaity far exceeds any anticipations; very helpful with all needs from neogtiating the ladder like stairs with luggage to suggestions on airport traonsport. Definitley a hotel I will use again when in Amsterdam. Mahalo, sid

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: murra142
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Nadia, for two nights. What a great experience. The staff was super helpful and welcoming. They went out of their way to make accommodations for me and my two friends. The hotel is also in a great location right on a canal, just outside of the city center. Anything you could possibly want to go do and see is within a 10-15 minute walk of the hotel. The room was perfect just what we needed at the end of of a full day of walking and biking around the city. It was warm with a comfy bed and most importantly a television. I would highly recommend staying at the Hotel Nadia and if I am in Amsterdam again I will make sure to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsK24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located so it was very easy to walk to all the attractions we wanted to see. Beware of the stairs though, no-one is exaggerating when they say how steep they are but the staff carried our bags to our room without hesitation. The rooms are also quite small, ours was one of the bigger ones but was still only about 11 ft sq including the space allocated for the bathroom. However, it was very clean and there was a daily maid service. We also found a very welcoming vase of flowers in our room upon arrival. The room also had a very spacious wall mounted fridge which was very handy for our milk as we like a lot of tea. The hotel provided tea and coffee facilities which they were quite happy to refresh for us as often as we wanted. The continental breakfast was very bland and comprised mainly croissants, bread and cheese with sachets of jams and honey available but as previous reviewers have said there was a lot of it available and it was continually stocked up by the very friendly and helpful staff. The room was noisy as the windows were not double glazed and we overlooked the road but the noise was mainly from the trams which run right past the hotel which are very handy for getting around. Ear plugs are available from the staff. If you want a centrally located very clean hotel room with very friendly and helpful staff and don't mind climbing stairs then this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fazak
Reviews.Content: We were 2 friends who had no booking in Amsterdam, So when we found Nadia hotel we were pretty stoked!! The hotel is centrally located, and one can easily hop on and off the tram to wherever location you want to go. Walking distance to Red light district. The staff are so friendly , helpful & went out of their way to make us feel at home. We left Amsterdam and when we came back from Paris we sent the hotel an email and they immediately had a room available for us and welcomed us with open arms and smiles. We were so touched by that. The breakfast is basic, your usual toast, cheese, croissant , tea, coffee & cake. If you are a bacon and eggs person there are cafes nearby for this. Bathrooms were clean. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “"lovely hotel"”
Reviews.Author: lindsey d
Reviews.Content: good central location,fantastic helpful staff,compact but clean room with amazing views and good value for money.would stay there again and highly recommend. many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Carla_Chris
Reviews.Content: We've been back here several times and every time has been great. Service is above normal with a nice cold (free!) beverage on arrival and a great continental breakfasts (croissants always so fresh). If you can get a room with a balcony. Some rooms can be a bit small but you're not here to spend time in your room. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodging Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jerry W
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was a great location for several friends and family to meet for a stay in Amsterdam. The location is great to be able to walk to museums and general points of interest. The rooms are small, but clean and the beds are comfortable. The breakfast was a good beginning for the day and the breakfast room was a nice place to gather to chat later in the day. The web site is accurate in its description of the hotel. The stairs are many and steep. We would not recommend this place to someone who is very overweight (as some doors and bathrooms are very narrow and negotiating the stairs may be difficult). The staff is exceptional! They were very freindly and responsive to any requests...everything from room requests to airport transporation was capably handled by the staff. We have stayed in larger rooms in Amsterdam before, but those rooms were twice the cost of Hotel Nadia. We look forward to staying at Hotel Nadia on our next Amsterdam visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staying”
Reviews.Author: MariaSalazarPadilla
Reviews.Content: We were 4 friends and we didn't book in any hotel or hostel before getting Amsterdam. So when we found Nadia Hotel we just couldn't believe it. It was next to downtown, a pretty good location. We shared a private room with 3 beds and the possibility of an extra one, and a super clean bathroom. We enjoyed a great comfort and the best treatment from all of the personal. We were VERY lucky and obviously we'll repeat the experience at this wonderful hotel next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieLB2011
Reviews.Content: central location. staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast very enjoyable. Loved the character of the building. Stairs very steep but staff insisted on carrying our baggage up and down them without our asking. Only downside, clock outside quite noisy throughout the night. So saying that, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oren Z
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and kind (fantastic hospitality). The room is nice, clean and includes all required equipment. Bed was good. Had a shower and toilet with a small vent. Breakfest was nice but egs were not included.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at Hotel Nadia in August 2011 for four nights. Room was good value for the location, just 5 mins walk to the main square. Staff at the hotel would go out of their way to assist you with anything you would ask. Room was small, but quiet and very clean. Free Wifi is a bonus. Would definitely reccommend

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently located and the staff were friendly. I wouldnt recommend it for people who dont like stairs because the staircase was VERY steep - almost like a carpeted ladder & I felt sorry for the old lady who was really struggling to get up to her floor. The breakfast area was far too crowded & I couldnt actually find a space to sit so I had to share with a nice old German couple. The food was also very bland & basic. Like I said, it was convenient to the city centre but I wouldnt stay there again & moved to another hotel after only 1 night

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La RouxiÃ¨re, Pays de la Loire, France
Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Emma G
Reviews.Content: very good hotel staff very friendly. good breakfast and nice rooms with welcome flowers and handful tea and coffee facilities.very nice view and big balcony. would recommand this hotel. the luggage is collected at arrival and taken up and down by the staff, would return for sure for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Dutch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElaineG262
Reviews.Content: A quaint hotel set on a main road and canal. Very central for exploring. The rooms are on the small side but adequate with a lovely touch of flowers and tea/coffee facilities, all rooms are en-suite, (shower, toilet, basin) if you like something a little different, a good hotel, very clean, good continental breakfast which was plentiful and staff very friendly and helpful. Not for visitors who cannot manage stairs, it is a bit of a shock at first to see the stairs which are extremely steep, almost like climbing a ladder, but we found it good fun! Your luggage is collected by the staff and taken up and down, the steep stairs to your room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, would return.

Reviews.Title: “Another 10 out of 10 stay!”
Reviews.Author: lathdruigan
Reviews.Content: This is the third stay we have had in the Nadia and once again we have no complaints. The room and sevices were well worth the money and the staff as always were very friendly and helpful, we got a great room with a terrific view this time, and as always a vase of flowers with "welcome home" on the card..... which is very much how the Nadia makes us feel, we look forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “no chance ... last room !!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas G
Reviews.Content: it was very bad . no chance for me maybe but it was the last room ( 209) i think the most little room of this hotel.. beutifull view on one wall.. the bathroom ..horrible ,( maybe few more than 2 m2 for the shawer and toilette , all this with the same floor). for 120 euro by night it's really expenssive. just the position of the hotel and the breackfast was correct .. for sure never they they will see us again ..

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TwitchyTheWonderBuny
Reviews.Content: Twitchy Thewonderbunny, a globetrotting pink and blue bunny, gives the Hotel Nadia in Amsterdam a four out of five carrot rating. The rooms are tiny but there is an excellent use of space. The proprietors and staff are very friendly and extremely responsive to guest needs. The only drawback is the steep staircase and lack of elevator. Given the style of architecture in this city, that seems to be a common occurrence. www.nadia.nl

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jenny B
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a couple of nights, it has a great location - about a minutes walk from Anne Frank's house and five minutes from Dam square. Our room was small (I believe this is true of a lot of rooms in Amsterdam) but cosy, comfortable and very clean with fresh flowers, a TV, fridge and a safe; the bathroom was tiny but again very clean and the shower was better than my shower at home! The breakfast room overlooks the canal and the Western Church. You have a choice of white/brown bread which you can ask to have toasted, various jams and marmalades, croissants, rolls, cake, apples, yoghurts, orange juice, tea and coffee. However the best thing about the hotel was the staff who were the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come across. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: francescalibero
Reviews.Content: Staied at hotel Nadia with my boyfriend for 5 nights and we had a great time there: location is awesome behinde the royal palace and in front of the Wester Kerk;our room wos clean and spacious for Amsterdam standards with balcony on Raduistraat,making it a perfect spot to watch the world go by(it's a trafficated street but windows are thick and from the first floor we heard no noise);breakfast was good(fresh croissant,cheese,bread,spreads,fresh fruit,milk,coffee,orange juice). Last but not least the staff are IMO the best you can find in Amsterdam(one of the girls speaks perfect italian so this was a bonus for us) and will do anything they can to make your stay the best possible. In the end I'd recomend Nadia hotel to anyone looking for a great fairly priced accomodation in the wanderful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: An0therMike
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week in Amsterdam after a week in London in early April 2011 over her birthday. I can't say enough about how well the staff of Hotel Nadia treated us the whole time. A birthday bouquet for the lady waiting in the room and our new friend Hazem is the hardest working, most generous and polite person we came into contact with our entire trip. Don't let the staircase intimidate you - you'll get used to it in no time, and you will not have to carry your luggage up them yourself (thanks to Hazem!). The hotel is in the perfect location - steps from some fantastic restaurants, including a wonderful pancake shop right below the hotel we ate at four times! Damrak is only a few blocks away and the light rail stop is right across the canal next to the hotel, which is the way to go to get to the Heineken Museum or Oosterpark. I woud highly recommend taking the day-trip to Ghent and Brugge, Belgium. See the tour stop on Damrak, close to central station. With two nights left in our stay, the hotel manager requested a few minutes of our time and asked us to gather our things in our room. Hazem escorted us, luggage in tow, to a beautiful, canal-side suite for the last two nights of our stay. I will never stay anywhere but Hotel Nadia in future visits, thanks to a great facility, outstanding staff, and rates that would be a bargain at twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: fbas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is at an excellent location, it's just a few minutes to places like Westerkerk, Madame Toussaud's, Anne Frank's house, Kalverstraat and Dam Square. Staff is very kind and helpfull. Our room was clean, we had cable tv, wifi, hair dryer, our own safe, and a refrigerator. Overall I can recommend Hotel Nadia to anyone visiting the marvellous city Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wookieman
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for a few days and were impressed. Great location, very close to a lot of nice restaurants, and the Anne Frank house. The steps up to the hotel are a daunting experience, and the room was cosy if a little small, but I think a lot of hotels in Amsterdam are like this. The people who work there are very polite and we were even given a free drink each upon our arrival. The breakfast was decent as well. I would recommend this place for people staying a few days in the city

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says!”
Reviews.Author: aefb
Reviews.Content: Great location, very very friendly staff, rooms are definitely small but how long do you want to stay in your Room in Amsterdam? We also had a Balcony which was great to use late at night. Breakfast is a very good Continental fare, toast, croissants etc All in all, a very good value Hotel in which, one has to admit, is an expensive city. Will certainly recommend and would have no hesitation in staying again

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, maybe a bit more....”
Reviews.Author: Kat_NYC888
Reviews.Content: Based on the many very positive reviews, I think my expectations were a bit off. I'm not sure why people would say this is 'one of the nicest hotels in Amsterdam,' which is clearly not true. And 'lovely' is not a word I would pick, either. But the comments about the friendly and helpful staff and convenient location are all absolutely true. -My room was REALLY small. There were only a couple of feet between the bed and the wall all around, you couldn't even open the front door the whole way. No place to properly hang longer clothing - there was a rod on a book-shelf-type of fixture, though I would say it was good enough. I'm only 5'3" and live in a small NY apartment and am used to small. But maybe since the decor is not exactly fancy, the overall effect was not very cheerful. -Only one small window for ventilation. Not sure if they have AC in the summer - would be good to check. -The water kettle was partially filled and looked pretty gross inside, though the rest of the room cleaning seemed OK. But that glimpse inside just gave me an 'off' feeling. -The location is on a busy street, which feels safer. But it's not a picturesque stretch, like some nearby boutique hotels. -Staff is very warm and friendly. And they do carry your bags up the incredibly steep stairs with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great value and VERY clean!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my sister and me for our stay in Amsterdam. It was exceptional value. It is located in the more artsy, Dutch part of the city. The rooms are small as are most in Europe but it was very clean, cozy and safe. The staff was amazing, everyone was so helpful. I will be staying here again my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Small but workable”
Reviews.Author: cosmicevil
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is in a good location. Walking distance to everything. Very close to the best Indian restaurant and a very good pancake restaurant. The rooms are very small. You couldn't open the door all the way because it hit a closet. When you sat on the toilet, your feet hung into the shower. The bed was tiny, full size for two people. The only issue was one person had to crawl out of bed because one side was pushed against the window. The staircase when you enter is amazing. Very steep with very small steps. The hotel staff brought up all luggage to your room. Good thing because I don't think I'd make it:) Architecture aside, the hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and breakfast was included (even though we never got up in time to go to it). I would stay here again. After all, you don't spend much time in the hotel room when you are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed a property before now. After staying at Nadia hotel I simply had to. The room was awesome, with a private balcony over looking the streets and canals. The only one in Amsterdam I believe. The staff were always polite, helpful and most of all very friendly. The room was small, but safe and comfortable. There is a few stairs (like every hotel in Amsterdam) but they will help you with your bags. The location was excellent, and facilities were outstanding. The good out weighed any bad tenfold. I cant understand how anyone would not enjoy their experience at this hotel. I have stayed in Amsterdam numerous times at many hotels, guesthouses and usually stay somewhere different each time. It will be Nadia Hotel every time from now on. Thank you Hotel Nadia. See you soon! A very happy customer!!! Michael C

Reviews.Title: “fantastic 1st time visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: eek71
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked in March 2011.The trip was for my husband's 50th birthday,when we arrived our bags were carried up to reception and we were given a welcome drink. As we were early we went out for a walk and some lunch and upon arriving back at the Nadia we were given our room.The room was next to the breakfast room and had a balcony which over looked the street and the canal, also had a beautiful view of the Westerkerk.There was also a gorgeous bunch of flowers for my husband with a happy birthday card attached. Room was small but clean, bed was comfortable and noise from road was not bad at all. I was given a hairdryer to use during my stay and offered use of an iron if required. Breakfast was lovely ...croissants,bread and cheese,orange juice, coffee,tea,cake,yoghurt and small choice of fruit. The staff are wonderful they are all very polite,speak very good english and can't do enough to help you during your stay. It is an ideal location to stay in as it is not far from many of the well known tourist attractions. We will definately be returning there in the future. Thankyou to Osam and all his staff for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 20adams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Nadia for three nights in early September. Thankfully the reviews here are mostly correct. We had a lovely stay. European hotels are generally are small but quaint. Don't expect anything fancy - you'll be disappointed. We were given a room for three even though it was only me and my partner but it gave us extra room. The room comes with a safe, tea and coffee making facilities, a mini fridge and a fan. The fridge was loud at night so we had to unplug it. Our room came with an en suite with a shower. This was clean and shampoo/body gel was supplied. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable enough. We slept well. It did get quite hot in the room so we did leave a window slightly open. On arrival the manager offered us a free drink which was a lovely touch. Our suitcases were carried upstairs by a staff member and we were met in our room by flowers welcoming us to the hotel. The hotel comes with free wi-fi which in this day and age most people see as a must. Other reviewers here are not exaggerating, the stairs are very steep and there is no lift. If you are elderly or have trouble getting up stairs this is not the hotel for you. Breakfast wasn't huge but it was a decent quality. Tea, coffee, croissants, fruit and some other bits and pieces. In near enough five whole days we saw nearly all of Amsterdam so we won't be going back anytime soon. But we would have no hesitation in booking Nadia again. The staff are very friendly and speak good english and we had a really enjoyable, easy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Near the centre, but out of the noise”
Reviews.Author: Ritmocor
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, 5-15 minutes walking from everywhere in Amsterdam. Near the centre, but out of the noise. Our triple room at first floor was very small, but clean and confortable. Friendly staff. Really suitable for a short stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: geo2901
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed @ Hotel Nadia for couple of nts in Amsterdam, staff were very friendly, beds clean and comfortable, the breakfast was very good too, I'd definitely come back to Hotel Nadia, give it a try, You won't be disappointed????

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Sinsi S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, walking distance from everywhere. Very clean rooms and a great hospitality from the moment you get in the hotel until you leave. Very friendly personnel. Lovely stay... The personnel is always trying to help you. Whatever you ask, they always try to find an easy way for you. It's been a pleasure to stay in this hotel and definitely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, safe, centrally located, breakfast & internet”
Reviews.Author: TimothyFlorida
Reviews.Content: The title says it all except the Nadia was also reasonably priced and location, location, location.. Expect a small clean hotel - rooms are very small and the bathrooms the smallest I have experienced in a hotel. Its up a flight of steps but the friendly staff there will help with your luggage if requested. If you are expecting a large luxurious American style hotel with all the trimmings- this is not what the Nadia is. When we travel to Amsterdam again we intend to stay at the Nadia and look forward to all it does offer - and the great local style breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: boneman7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights at this hotel. The location is wonderful-three blocks from the Dam Square and about eight blocks from Central Station. Tram stops are within two to three blocks depending on which ones you take (suggest getting a free tram, bus map from a conductor and you will have all the info you need regarding public transportation routes). The rooms are small and the stairs are formidable but those may be characteristics of many properties in this city. The room was clean and the staff was maybe the most accomodating of any we have ever encountered. Every person seemed to genuinely care about our experience and the hotel did everything it could possibly do to enhance our stay. I bought a map at the Visitors Bureau at Central Station for 2.5 Euro upon arrival to the city and was given materials at the hotel that included a map that was just as good as the one I had purchased-2.5 Euro wasted. They helped with luggage, asisted with directions, placed flowers in the room, had wonderful candy out every day. They changed our room to a lower location when we arrived and saw that my wife was having walking problems because of an injury to her leg-and we didn't even ask. The lower room location was a big help and our view of the canal was just a good. If city noise at night/early a.m. is a problem you may want a secluded property without traffic noise or church bells but that may be due to our room location (with a view of the canal-which we would do again). The cost was very reasonable for a city that is somewhat expensive. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: electrade
Reviews.Content: Our first Amsterdam stay and we could not be happier with this Hotel.Wecoming staff who continually go out of their way to assist in everything.Location perfect,we walked to all central attractions,however trams and bus,s at the door if needed.Rooms small and stairs steep but this is authentic Amsterdam,my family recommended this hotel to me and I recommend as well.Thankyou Osam and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Value”
Reviews.Author: shipster
Reviews.Content: Old Hotel building (as most are in Amsterdam central) with interesting shaped rooms and steep stairs. No air conditioning (not really needed) or elevator . Note that the street they are on changes name after the first canal. When you get off of tram at the recommended stop go back toward the center of town Absolutely wonderful owner and staff, Went out of way to help - Bought tickets online for and had trouble printing. Owner went way out of his way to help. Offered to change our room without us asking - we didn't - we were nested already. Breakfast was very nice Been to amsterdam a couple of time before and only had one must do - the National Museum (Rijksmuseum). What they had there was great - but it was a very limited selection. Train to and from airport was no sweat. Watch out for new tram tickets. You buy by the hour (unless you want a day pass - which I would reccomend a serious look). We spent about 12$ for a 10 minute ride. We did not know it expired after an hour. A local said they just changed the system and they weren't happy with it either

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: younglass11
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for three nights. The staff were great! Really welcoming. The location is amazing couldn't get any closer to central unless you were init. Only down point was the room was tiny!! I mean couldn't swing a cat tiny! Would stay again though!

Reviews.Title: “clean, good located but too much small”
Reviews.Author: alexsanro
Reviews.Content: We were 5 people in 3 rooms, 2 double and 1 individual. I must say hotel is very clean and staffed help a lot with luggage (stairs are very tired and hard to keep with u any luggage). Its really very good situated, to 5 minutes by foot to the Dam Platz. The worst thing is room are too much small, u dont have space to move iniside, and bathroom is the same, too much little.... at least, i repit, is very clean, and we think that the rest of hotels of amsterdam are similar.... first day we were dissapointed but the last day we realized that it wasnt so bad. breakfast is tasted, not very variated, but enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good location and Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: CHEGreenVillage
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This is a very clean, quiet hotel in a convenient neighborhood with a courteous and attentive staff. It is a good value by Amsterdam standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attitude and location!”
Reviews.Author: Olga K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very much! Were in Amsterdam for the first time from 27/08/11 till 09/02/11, us was four, reserved 2 double rooms. We not so well speak English, but the staff is very understandable and accessible to us all told, quickly settled, were given maps of Amsterdam. Always smiling, always ready to help! The rooms are cozy, clean, were cleaned every day. Places it is certainly small, but I think that in Amsterdam, in all hotels so. In addition, we did not stop it completely, we are perfectly fit in the evenings in a room of four. Very nice breakfast room, visible channel and watch. The very abundant breakfast: bread, cheese, butter, croissants, muffins, jams and spreads, we load up perfectly! Location is also excellent - about 7 minutes walk to Dam Square, but the other side of the red-light district, so the night is quiet enough. From the train station with suitcases arrived well within 15 minutes. It was very pleasant to wake up from the melodious ringing of hours outside the window! So, if even in Amsterdam, only to Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Josiany
Reviews.Content: It's a very good place to stay at Amsterdam. Walk distance to every sigthseen and also to the Centraal Station. The staff is very nice and friendly, and makes you feel home. The breakfast is great (with Nutella). You are wellcome with free drinks and there is flowers in your room (that makes it seems not so small as it really are). All rooms have either a balcony or a view to the canal. Furthermore, there is wifi free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: KierstenYY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Had a difficult time looking for an affordable hotel in Amsterdam as there was the IBC conference and everywhere else required a minimum stay of three nights. But Hotel Nadia gladly welcomed me. Hotel is in a central location, close to Dam Square. Room is small, but has everything (including bathroom, WiFi, TV, fridge, and safe). I had a sound sleep on the clean, comfy bed. And a delicious breakfast in a room overlooking the pretty canals. But most of all, you have to love Hotel Nadia for her friendly, accommodating staff. On arrival, the porter helped to bring our luggage up the stairs. The room was not ready, as we were too early. But we could leave our luggage in the store. When we returned that evening, our luggage were already brought into our rooms! :) You can count on attentive service with a smile 24 hours a day. On the day of check-out, the manager (who was not at the reception) specially called to ask about my stay and also say goodbye. Made me really sad to leave Hotel Nadia and Amsterdam. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A really neat experience a great welcome to Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: rubytuesday16
Reviews.Content: I searched obsessively for a hotel in Amsterdam. I was looking for me and my boyfriend but as my boyfriend has never travelled to Eurpope, let alone Amsterdam, it was mainly for him. This was the perfect place since it has that feel of the typical Amsterdam experience, lots and lots of stairs, tiny cramped rooms, beautiful architecture, funky character and a great location. It was a total experience to stay here, not a generic hotel at all. It was like the hostels I've stayed at before in Amsterdam but clean, lovely and way way nicer than a cheap hostel. You can access most places by foot if you're energetic and the canals around the hotel are beautiful. We walked to the hotel from the train station but on the way back we caught a shuttle.
