Rolling suitcases along behind you on cobblestone streets is not as fun as it sounds. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to feel more culture than at a generic hotel. Why stay somewhere where you feel like you could be anywhere in the world when you can stay at the Hotel Nadia and look out from your tiny, totally neat, funky room and really feel somewhere different. The staff are really lovely and it felt very safe. I'd definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Enigma1985
Reviews.Content: When we got to the outside of the Nadia hotel, I thought.....where are we staying??!!! However, the service that we were provided with were absolutely amazing! The staff were extremely accomodating, made you feel welcome and really created an experience. Downsides were the size of the room, although more than adequate for what we wanted and those stairs (Though I did get a good work out)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: Pecos28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Nadia for 2 nights in July 2011. Overall, the hotel was ok. Our room was on the top floor and included a small balcony overlooking a canal. The location of the hotel is good (< 1 minute walk to Ann Frank's house). The staff was courteous and helpful. The room is itself was a little outdated. My main complaint would be the stairs. The entrance to the hotel is a small door on the street level that you have to buzzed into. Once you enter, you are faced with 2 stories of (very steep, narrow) steps up to reception. From there, we had to climb another 2 flights to our room. While we are younger and didn't mind too much, I would definately not recommend this for anyone who is not in decent shape, as it can be a challenge. It also made quick runs back to the hotel a pain. Overall, we enjoyed our time here, but I think we would look for another hotel next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “perfekt 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaby E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just behind the town square. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was exactly what we expected. It was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Good location, small and cosy hotel, cool breakfast with fresh croissants. We were in a twin beds room with a balcony. Very happy of the whole stay, kind people, good atmosphere. A bit of noise coming from the street but nothing really bothering.

Reviews.Title: “Small but central and great service”
Reviews.Author: Idewards
Reviews.Content: All the rooms in this hotel are in minuture - from reception to the rooms themselves. We had one of the biggest bedrooms and it was still tiny. Definately more of a base than a leisure experience but if that's what you want then its perfect. It's in a great location, about 20 mins walk from the station and right on the central canal network and the road isn't that noisy. The staff are very friendly and helpful and there's always free coffee on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kwboi70
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel. It's centrally located and meant for people who are looking for location and a place to crash at night. Bad: 1. small hotel, w/ small rooms in an old building.; 2. long and narrow set of stairs to get to the reception and rooms; Good: 1. rooms are small but are clean and have all you'll need such as a fridge, TV, free wi-fi and, of course, a bed. 2. small but private bathroom and shower; 3. there's always someone to carry your luggage upstairs; 4. location is excellent. There are tram stations nearby and it's a walking distance from the Dam, Red Light District, etc. The neighborhood seemed very safe too. 5. Customer service was excellent. Everyone I met was very courteuos. They offered me a bottle of water, maps, etc. as soon as I checked it; 6. Breakfast wasn't fancy but it was pretty good; 7. After I checked out, they let me leave my luggage at the hotel while I explored some more of the city;

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: ew00060
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is easy to get to from the airport and is ideally situated in the city... not the touristy centre but a pleasant 10 minute walk and near the pretty Jordaan. The staff were all helpful and friendly but the rooms was so dated. The covers were old and the room wasn't very clean. There was nothing WRONG with the hotel, it was just very expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Carol839
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in canal-view room on upper floor. The staff were helpful carrying luggage up many flights of steep stairs, as no elevator can be installed in this historic building. Our room was comfortable, the views lovely and the proximity to Anna Frank's house and the North Church were real attractions. In every way, the staff were helpful and kind. Breakfast was tasty and attractive. We will use this hotel again until we are too old to mount all those stairs.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: bearman69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Nadia for 2 nights. Great location had a corner room with canal views and a balcony . Walking distance to Anne Frank , 5 mins, and Dam Square, 10 mins, Red Light ,15 mins. Staff were wonderful and friendly. Met us at the bottom of the stairs and carried our luggage up and down. Breakfast was OK. Stairs are very narrow and steep, but knew that from other reviews. Didn't think they would be that steep.Room was 1 of the smallest we have ever stayed in. Bed also was small and it should really be replaced. If your looking for an economical hotel with great location and a wonderful staff this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Memories”
Reviews.Author: mark s
Reviews.Content: We have visited 3 Times, and it is always a great pleasure staying at the Nadia, Super Friendly staff, Always going the extra mile.... Amazing Views, and central location. We will be back!! Mark and Kim......

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: rosidom1991
Reviews.Content: The location was beautiful and the double room (with a balcony) was so homely. There was a range of things for breakfast in a beautifully furnished breakfast room. We experienced no problems and every service was functional. The best aspect of this hotel is the warm reception and consistent helpfulness and welcoming attitude of the staff. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only downside was the stairs up to the hotel which were many and incredibly steep. Not a fantastic idea for children or those who can't manage stairs that well anymore but its definitely worth the climb!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the most friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NicNac22
Reviews.Content: The location was great! Centrally located and just a block from Anne Frank House (note it opens at 8.30am so get there from 8.15am to beat the lines). The room we had was on the canal and had a beautiful view - no lies about the view! The breakfast was varied and tasty (make sure you time it right to get a seat though). The staff were sooooooooo friendly. They carried our bags up the VERY STEEP stairs, recommended a great restaurant (which we went back to twice), organised washing / drying of our clothes and booked a taxi. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkybuddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Amsterdam for 2 nights in August and found this hotel on-line. It is a wonderful place to stay. The location is excellent, very close to Dam Square (5 minute walk), near many restaurants and across from the Westerkerk, a beautiful old church. It is located on a canal so the views are very pretty. The price was excellent considering how expensive Amsterdam is. The staff was uniformly friendly and exceptionally helpful with all of our requests. The owner is very attentive and concerned that his guest's experiences are optimal. Our first room was not as high-up as we'd wanted so they moved us to a wonderful room at the top of the hotel, taking care of moving our luggage and all for us. They have a number of different wireless hubs, so all of the rooms in the hotel (we stayed on two different floors) appear to get great (free!) wireless service. This was a nice exception to our usual experience at hotels where frequently one can only get internet down near (or in) the lobby). There were only a few modest negatives: the breakfast is very rudimentary so don't count on a fancy spread (e.g. no cereal, no eggs, etc.). The hotel is small, but that is what one expects in Europe generally. The street is noisy so earplugs will help you sleep. But if you're going to stay in a bustling part of Amsterdam that will be true regardless of your hotel. Finally, if you have trouble with stairs this may not be the place for you. There are 34 stairs in a very steep staircase that lead up to reception and the first floor of rooms, with another 37 stairs to the top floor. We found this charming and atmospheric and did not think of it as a negative, per se. However, if you have trouble with stairs due to age or infirmity you might want to think twice about staying here. That said, the staff was extremely attentive to swooping down to carry everyone's bags and also emphasize that they consider it routine to carry your bags down too. So they've done all they can to be sure that the stairs don't present a problem to people. Their attention to this was very welcoming. We stayed in room 413 and highly recommend asking for it. It is at the top of the hotel with views (and a balcony) out towards two sides (including the canal and the Westerkerk). In summary, a wonderful and charming hotel at a great price with fantastic service by a staff that seems genuinely interested in making sure your stay is great. If we are ever back in Amsterdam we will stay at Hotel Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cheap central hotel, would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, 10 mins walk from Damm Square, 2 mins from Anne Frank Huis, ~30 mins from Museum quarter. There are some very good bars on the canal nearby that makes a nice change from the Red Light district etc. Rooms are basic but reasonably priced compared to other hotels in Amsterdam (80 euro per night with breakfast included). We were given a canal view room which was lovely. Hotel staff very helpful and accomodating, very steep staircases up to the rooms + recpetion but the staff will be more than happy to help you with your luggage. Only real negative is that it is quite noisy being so close to the Westerwerk church (chiming rather randomly all through the night), but after staying in 3 different hotels in Amsterdam I can honestly say this was no louder than anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we'd hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianBirks
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in August. Great location; staff couldn't be more helpful; room was small but perfectly adequate! Great value for money! The best thing to say is that if we go to Amsterdam again we will certainly be planning on hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location..friendly staff..great stay!”
Reviews.Author: EmmyLouB81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location & the staff are really friendly & helpful! The rooms are small however we had a balcony & really only needed the room for a place to sleep. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Edgardmx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Nadia Hotel with my 15 year old sister and i can say that when i booked this hotel i wasn't sure cause i received some bad comments about it but as soon as i got to Amsterdam i realized that it was the best option, a couple minutes walking from the train station, few blocks away from Dam Square (our tours started there) and close to many Museums and other attractions. The first image you get is of a long stair that takes you to the Recepcion, of course the Stairs are Narrow, but its the same in any hotel you stay in Amsterdam. Already up the staff is very Friendly and as our room wasn't ready (we arrived at 11 am) they asked us to go to the Breakfast room where we got a coffee and cookies that was nice because the breakfast was already closed. It only took 10 mins till we got our room, and when we got there our bags where aklready in the room. It was a small but clean 2 beds room, facing the street, with a great view, we loved it and what i liked the most is that we found flowers with a welcome card from the management, it was an amazing detail! About the room i can say that it was small, but not too small, there was space for the baggage, coffe maker and well the beds, the bathroom was ok, maybe if we were fat ppl we wouldn't fit in it, but we are not. I will go back to this hotel whenever I go to amsterdam again. and of course i can recomend it to everyone visiting this wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!! READ THIS FIRST!!!”
Reviews.Author: jagdheart
Reviews.Content: Thought this might be a nice place to stay after reading reviews on TA and seeing many excellent comments. Boy was I wrong!!!! THIS PLACE MUST BE BUYING REVIEWS!!!!!! The place has a seedy entrance, don't be fooled by the nice picture on it's website! I am relatively fit, and we were on the 4th floor.... the triple deluxe suite...WHAT A JOKE but we'll get to that later. The steps are ridiculously narrow, steep and there are tons!!!! I wanted to climb back to my room as few times as possible during the day. The decor is terribly cheesy with cheap plastic figurines that you would find in cheap souvenir stores...I think they think that this makes the place look...uhhh...quaint???? The room was the biggest joke. "The deluxe Triple Suite!.... Mind you it costs more than the regular triple . It has a balcony! With 3 plastic chairs...wow. The three single beds were jammed in so tight there was not even room to squeeze between them. The sheets are ROUGH, the blankets are cheap. The bathroom measures 4.5' by2.5 '!!!!!! The shower is barely big enough to stand in and the moldy curtains are fluttering in on your body while the water floods the bathroom and toilet seat. The towels are small and thin and when I asked for an extra towel, because it got all wet from this ridiculous shower, I was told that each person is only allowed one small one and one large one. Very loud street noise. Flies all over. Breakfast terrible and they asked for us to go back to our room and they would call us when a table opened...like I'm going to wait in line for a piece of bread..... I can go on and on, but I think you get my drift. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY MANY COMMENTS ON TA!!!!! I HAVE TO BELIEVE THIS PLACE CHEATS THE SYSTEM. "WHAT A DUMP!!!!!!!" Update: both my son and I just got diagnosed with mite infestation 48 hours after leaving. This place needs to be inspected by the health department!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Aleksander_x
Reviews.Content: A family with three children, we were staying there for e week and we would certainly come again. First of all, a very friendly and obliging staff - we travel quite a lot but we haven't met such helpfulness yet. Perfect location with wonderful view from family room. Although our room was faced the street with tram and bus lines, the noise from the street was not a problem. The stairs are steep but there are only three floors and we used them only once or twice per day. The only complain would be rather small breakfast room (during rush hour). And the children missed some corn-flakes or crispies for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine stay at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: FOONK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Nadia on numerous trips to Amsterdam and will continue to do so. It a clean, hospitable, and wonderfully located family-run 2 star hotel. The rooms are small, the staircase is steep, and the street is noisy, but the welcome, service, and ambience are all 5 star. Three cheers for the Nadia from me!

Reviews.Title: “Such pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: NikManchester
Reviews.Content: This is an Excellent Hotel in an ideal place too, on arrival staff took our cases up the steep staircase which we knew about from other reviews but if you dont mind stairs its no problem, at the the reception we was checked in and offered a soft drink as a welcome, we were shown to our room which had a balcony and a nice view of the street below, our room was small but just enough for us as we was out all day anyway and the balcony was an added bonus, rooms have fridge, big double beds, dresser, good showers, safe, tv and are nice and quiet at night, the staff were so nice especially the guy who carries peoples luggage up and down them stairs did an excellent job and made us feel like it was our second home, Nice breakfast in the breakfast room I didnt realise it was only a 2 star hotel, should be 3 stars. Thanks to all staff we will be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Greg F
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the states from my trip to Amsterdam and my stay at the Nadia. It's still lingering in my mind like a nice dream. I can't think of one unpleasant thing about the hotel. The rooms are cosy and the stairs, well they're good exercise for ya. I needed to stay three extra days at the last minute and the manager told me, 'no problem'. I would definitely stay here again. Nice staff, always helping out when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - would use again or get friends to do so!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael C
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, tidy and well managered. All staff were very friendly. Though there were a lot of stairs - the staff would help us with our luggage! Room was quite small but perfect for what we wanted as we would not spend a lot of time in there. Great location - only a 5 minute walk from Dam Square, Anne Franks and other attractions!! Would reccommed to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sokano
Reviews.Content: The staff was warm and helpful. The hotel was charming and had everything you would need. My room was a single and very small but it had everything I needed: bed, closet, desk, TV, safe, bathroom, and plenty of shelves. The location was excellent. Everything was in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and they helped me navigate around the city. There is wifi in the hotel. Caution to anyone that does not handle stairs well. I would definitely stay here again when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_2011_Trip_Ad
Reviews.Content: Food is great if you like traditional Dutch breakfasts. Room was comfortable and clean with 30 channel TV and good shower, but highlight was private balcony with view towards canal. Also mini-fridge and safe extremely useful. Staircase is just as steep as indicated on website. Staff very friendly and especially helpful with baggage storage. Anne Frank Huis very close, as are Koh-I-Noor Indian restaurant, and OPART museum.

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: chitz09
Reviews.Content: very nice people, very good location, clean rooms, nice breakfast, but very small rooms and a very old bed

Reviews.Title: “i'll come back !”
Reviews.Author: liesbeth l
Reviews.Content: very good service, correct reception the room was small but very clean the quiet room was really quiet so I slept well !

Reviews.Title: “Had a bad experience of booking!”
Reviews.Author: AlyonkaRudenko
Reviews.Content: I know that this hotel is very popular among tourists and they all praise it! But I the stuff don't cherish their clients! I was dissapointed with the booking process. I work at the travel agency. Yesterday around the end of my working day. I confirmed the reservation with a credit card. Today I read a letter in my outlook from Nadia telling me that my credit card didn't go through. The answer was "Dear Ms. Alena Rudenko, We are sorry to inform you that during the verification process of the creditcard details provided by you, the verification failed and was not accepted by the creditcard company. Therefore, we are obliged to cancel your request. We thank you very much for the interest shown in our Hotel and we really hope we can accommodate you in the future." The answer is totally unfriendly! I would even say that the last settence is rude! When I called the hotel, they said they gave the room to someone else... Unbelievable! That's the second time I'm booking for my clients. The first time it was OK. I was so happy I found a hotel that I can recommend to my friends and clients, but now I am very dissapointed.:((( There are always problems with credit card! And I don't think it's a way to treat clients...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, quite noisy”
Reviews.Author: ashleyrwood
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, a 5 minute walk to the central area and 10 minutes to central station. Rooms are small but equipped with the necessary incl safe, fridge and tea and coffee. Only drawback is the noise at night - noise from the street travels straight into your room.

Reviews.Title: “Best two star hotel on the planet?”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPoloBristol
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a five star spa experience this place isn't for you. However if you are looking for a well run individual establishment which more than makes up for it's lack of free bath robes and Molton Brown toiletries this place is for you. The first striking thing about the place is it's location in a beautiful old building opposite Westermarkt and round the corner from Dam Square. As soon as we were arrived we were greeted by the hotel management and helped up the steepest sltaircase ever with our baggage. We were given a complimentary soft drink and the password for the very reliable free wifi. We were then shown to our room which had a good sized fridge, a free safe big enough to fit a laptop in and complimentary fresh flowers. Our view of the Pride celebrations opposite in Westermarkt were amazing and there were times we didn't want to leave our hotel room. The free breakfast was limited, croissants, rolls, cheese, fromage frais, apples and coffee most days. However the quality of food was excellent and for Â£50 a night b&b for two I wasn't complaining. All in all the best two star hotel I have ever stayed in. Beats the pants off many four star establishments too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Johanna02
Reviews.Content: The staff was really friendly and helpful, and my room was cosy and clean. Nothing to complain about. The mad-steep stairs just added character!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: v11rah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. We had a triple room even though there were only two of us. We also changed rooms during our stay, Osam, the manager said there was a better room available after the weekend, so we moved to a room with a balcony . The rooms here as in most traditional Amsterdam hotels are small. The service at this hotel is excellent and cannot be faulted. Breakfast is a little basic but it does the job just. The location is great near Anne Frank house and near the tram stop. I would stay at this hotel again because of the staff and location. If you want luxury, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilovestcroix
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was dirty, with bloodstains on the curtains and the matress. The bathroom was full of mold. I will say that we had never been in a 2 star hotel before. But my God this should be in the minus star category. BTW, we paid extra to have a room with a private balcony.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, simphatic. original people, great hotel. we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sami1511
Reviews.Content: When you open the door...uff ....you will not believe it!!! then you meet the people and you find yourself like at home!!! the breakfast room is great, it's like living there since always... the location is absolutely perfect: you can just walk into the city center... if we are so lucky to be back to amsterdam, no doubt about which hotel to choose. thanks!!::))

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: igs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia for one night on a stopover in Amsterdam. The hotel was well situated, comfortable and good value. It's true that the rooms weren't large, but we didn't spend much time hanging around the room. Be warned: there are lots of stairs. The staff was great about carrying our luggage up and down (heroic, might be a better word), but this is not the place to stay if you have trouble with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 186340Robert
Reviews.Content: Funny that all the good reviews seem to comment on what great value this hotel is...................maybe these review are written by the many backpacking students we encountered. I am a 26 year old teacher and in my younger days slummed it in hostels backpacking around Europe to save money and had the best holiday of my life. However, now I am slightly older, married and more mature (arguably) I decided not to book a hostel whilst staying in Amsterdam. Instead I booked what seemed to be a decent hotel for GOOD MONEY with a respectable travel company-Thompson. To summarise:- Room tiny, too small for us both to stand up together! (really) Toilet located in 8cm from shower (good for a sit down shower..........?!!) Service poor. Breakfast bad. Expensive (at least it is through Thompson) If your backpacking and getting this place really cheap then fine. Its clean, well located and basic. However if your paying decent money like we did, think again!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and stayed 3 nights on our way to the UK....”
Reviews.Author: Burns1911
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so cute and very clean with staff that couldn't have been more helpful and went that extra mile to assist you. The Breakfast Room was lovely - they had the best coffee. We are both middle 60's and did read there were lots of stairs which was true plus also very steep but the staff took our luggage up to the room and brought it down on our departure. It is so central for everything and I would certainly recommend this hotel. Doreen & John Burns, Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: KFCDorset_UK
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel too highly. We were made welcome from the moment we stepped inside the door. Our bags were taken to our rooms and we were offered a complimentary drink from the chiller cabinet. Later in my stay when I wanted to print some tickets, this was done free of charge. The room itself was small but had everything we needed including a safe, lots of shelves and hanging space, tea and coffee facilities, shower room with shower gel, television... exceptional for such a budget hotel. Breakfast was better than expected - juice, coffee, cake, croissants, bread, jams etc, fruit, yoghurt. Basic but all you need. In addition, the hotel is centrally-located just a few minutes' walk from Dam Square in one direction and Ann Frank's house in the other on the picturesque Grachtengordel. Will happily stay at Hotel Nadia again when I next stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghNeilW
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Nadia and had a great time. The staff were brilliant and very helpful - even remembering my name ! My room was comfortable, clean and well appointed and the hotel is in a great location. I really recommend it and I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than Expected for the $”
Reviews.Author: galapagoer
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing price for this friendly hotel. Many I talked to got less for much more $$ in Amsterdam. Yes, the stairs are initially daunting, but we were greeted at the door with someone ready to carry our bags to our room, so it was not a problem. We were offered a cold drink as we checked in and again when we waited for transportation upon check out. We were traveling with another couple and booked two rooms with lovely large windows overlooking the canals. One was small, but we had all that was needed and the location was great. The decor is quaint and rather dark. There was a beautiful fresh bouquet of flowers in our room which was changed twice in out 4 night stay. If you like sleek and modern or travel with a lot of luggage, this is not for you. Closet space is limited, though bags not needed during your stay may be stowed in a roomy, locked baggage room. The included breakfast was a better than expected selection of fruit, yogurt, cereals, breads, meat cheeses, juice, tea and very good coffee. The location of the hotel was excellent, in close walking distance to much of the activity in the center, but much quieter and not too close to the action. The chimes of the church nearby rang throughout the night. I found it charming, but others might want a quieter location. The tram was a block and a half away from the hotel. Internet service was free as is the room safe. We were worried, having read some other reviews, that the rooms might have a smell of cigarette smoke, but that was not the case. Staff was very friendly and helpful, giving us helpful information about transportation and attractions and booking a convenient shuttle for us to the cruise center when we left. I would rate this excellent for the $, but recognize that its age and datedness do not really qualify it as a top rated hotel, so I give it a very good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Is This The Best Hotel In Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: Martintravels9
Reviews.Content: To answer to the above question, for us the answer is a resounding YES! Sure there may be cheaper hotels and more luxurious hotels, but when it comes to warm welcome and a comfortable haven, which s good value for money it takes some beating. Our Room I have to say it was small, but it did not feel too cramped and it had all you could need, a TV, Safe, storage space and en suite. The bed was clean and very comfortable. We overlooked the owners beautiful roof top Garden, so the room was quite. Compact and cosy would be my description. Oh and the Egyptian, middle eastern, touches were lovely. The Reception And Staff. Always manned and you will always be created with a warm smile and friendly word. The staff are a mine of information and are a great source of local knowledge. They even rang the local pharmacy for me to see if they were open. Check out all the little nick-nacks and miniature houses. You will have read about the stairs, but the staff are always on hand to assist and you will need to buzz to enter the hotel at street level, a nice reassurance that your security is important to them. On the last night my wife slipped in the rain and hurt her foot. The next morning, our last, the staff looked after us very well, ringing us a taxi to the airport, helping my wife down the stairs. They got her a chair while we waited and gave us some water. We could not ask for better treatment. The Breakfast Room, All I can say is delightful. The Zen TV is very relaxing and the middle eastern touches add to the ambience. If you are lucky you can eat breakfast overlooking the canal and Wester Kerk, perfect way to start the day, as you watch the city come to life. The food is plentiful, consisting of bread, cheese, croissants, jam, biscuits, coffee, tea, all you could want really. If you ask, the ever friendly staff will toast some bread for you. Our stay was short but we loved it. Amsterdam is a great city with loads to do and the Dutch or a very welcoming and friendly race. The Hotel Nadia is a great base to explore. Dam Square is a couple of minutes walk and you can get Trams to all the main sites from there. Anne Francs House is literally across the road and the Jordan area starts just across the canal. All I can say is book a stay and enjoy, I know you will. Mr and Mrs Hynes 15th to 18th July 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, friendly, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Andy503904
Reviews.Content: Lovely, characterful hotel in an architecturally interesting building. It's in an excellent position for exploring the heart of Amsterdam on foot or by hired bicycle and an easy walk from Centraal station. We got talking with the hotel manager and the staff, and got to see some unusual views of the city! Everyone was very welcoming and friendly. Our particular room didn't have much of a view but was clean, comfortable and well equipped, with welcoming flowers and drinks. The breakfast room had an excellent outlook towards the Westerkerk and the Anne Frank Huis (if you can see the queue from there it's too long! Try going an hour before closing time), and proved a good place to meet other travellers. You do need to be mobile enough to cope with some steep stairs, but it's well worth it and we would happily return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: jjr75
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and very friendly and helpful staff. This building had very steep stairs but our luggage was carried to our room by the staff. I don't recommend this hotel fo rpeople with bad feet or health issues. But for a helthy adult there's no problem if you're not too picky. Our room was in the third floor and had a balcony and also a canal view window. Nice view! However while we stayed in Hotel Nadia, it was +30C outside and it was also very warm insde the hotel. No airconditioning. But we were aware of this when we booked. The hotel is situated between Anne Frank's home museum and Dam square so the location is good for a few day holiday in Amsteradam. Overall we had a pretty pleasent stay in Hotel Nadia and will definitely come back on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good locations”
Reviews.Author: AiramV
Reviews.Content: Great location, could walk everywhere from the Hotel. Nice basic dutch breakfast, you have to ask the staff to toast your bread if you want it toasted. It is on a busy street so a little noisy if you want the windows open, but it was nice to hear the church bells ringing. It's a non smoking hotel, but people do smoke, but our room didn't smell of smoke at all, the halls did sometimes. (use the 10-20% off coupons on the wall in the lobby, great meals at Sara's Pancakes just next door)

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: supihonbun
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from train; great location; THEY CARRY YOUR LUGGAGE UP & DOWN THE STEEP DUTCH STAIRWAY!!!!!! I had left my purse at a restaurant & they personally called the owner of the restaurant & helped me retrieve my purse.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome=Good; Location=Good; Price=Good; Facilities=Good; Space=Compact”
Reviews.Author: tkw2210
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend Hotel Nadia to any visitors after my wife and I stayed there for 2 nights from Fri 22nd July 2011. Having researched this expensive city I was delighted to find other reports were accurate - and we enjoyed our stay in Hotel Nadia. "Welcome". While there are plenty of steps up to reception (a typical Dutch feature) the staff will take your bags from ground level to whatever room you're in and are genuinely welcoming and helpful, not just on arrival. "Location". We walked from Centraal Station with luggage and didn't find it too far away (the hotel will email you a "3D" walking map) but next time would take the easy 5 minute tram/bus ride. Nadia is very handy for the Jordaan and Anne Frank House particularly. Buses and trams stop near to the entrance so connections are a piece of cake. "Price". Anyone who's compared Amsterdam hotel prices knows nowhere is cheap. We found Hotel Nadia to be reasonable by UK city standards and a good deal by Amsterdam standards. "Facilities". Rooms had everything in them that we wanted and we slept well. No space is wasted! Liked the balconies that you could actually get a table and two chairs onto. Minor noise from the trams outside but we found it atmospheric. Breakfast room busy and food generous. "Space". The rooms all have high ceilings and are big enough, just. Use the broad shelves for your luggage and you'll be fine. Happy to answer any enquiries but there's nothing to be wary of. Hotel Nadia is a safe budget bet in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Debii-Lou
Reviews.Content: Ok so rooms were quaint, stairs are a bit daunting, but as me and me bloke are in our 20's it wasnt horrific... They carried our luggage up to our rooms mine weighed loads lol quite suprising how he carried both together :)... In a perfect location near Dam Square... Hotel staff absolutely fantastic, they were willing to bend over backwards for us... Breakfast small but did fill us up till about lunch... Next some some divine restraunts :)... Kept our baggage till we left and didnt mind us going back to find stufff we packed...Overall amazinggg :) definately be back again

Reviews.Title: “I Get More than what Ido expect”
Reviews.Author: alinotes
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly and helpful in anything and simply Fast and accurate I do appreciate and highly recommend a great Location , accessible to anywhere in europe a friendly staff that are keen to satify all guests u feel home here Thanks a lot to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Back Home”
Reviews.Author: creade5
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had stayed at the Nadia a couple of times before, finding it very welcoming and a perfect location for the centre of Amsterdam. It's always nice when you are remembered! Therefore I had no hesitation in staying at the Nadia when travelling on my own recently. The staff could not do enough for me and the manager Osam deserves a mention for his courtesy and hospitality. 'Welcome Back Home' is a phrase you will hear often on a return visit and that's how it feels. I cannot recommend the Nadia highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: ozveildancer
Reviews.Content: Firstly, giving this a four star rating primarly ONLY because of the stairs and small ensuite. Otherwise 5 star service. Breakfast good. juice, pastries, toast, yoghurt, coffee etc;. Room was small but functional. Ensuite was extremely small, but made us laugh every time we went to use it. We eneded up flooding the floor each time and yes you could not swing a cat in it, but i was there to shower etc only not to spend all day there. Don't complain about the sizing of these facilities in these old buildings which have been renovated to give travellers ENSUITE facilities of your own. Expect small but did the job. Plenty of shelf space in our room. Helpful reception staff. Would stay here again. Also the price was good for us. Help with bags available up the stairs. Keep your luggage light. You won't use everything you take.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_Vanc0uver
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Nadia and we had a number of other family who we recommended it to for a trip we were taking together. We had the family suite which was very good. The most endearing part of the Nadia is its friendly and accommodating staff. The seemingly unending staircase at the entrance was intimidating, but staff were right there to bring up (and down) all our luggage. They worked hard at meeting our needs. Compared to the price of hotels in Amsterdam, I think you can't beat the value for money. Location is very convenient. I would definitely stay here again. Regular rooms are small and the staircase is long, but that is not unusual in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: boartsy
Reviews.Content: When we first entered our room, we were met with a fresh bouquet of flowers on our dresser. We had the corner "tower" room which overlooked the Church and the canals. Loved sitting on the balcony. The folks at the Nadia are so pleasant. Even when we left, they hugged us saying they would miss us and to return some day. True, the stairs are steep, but that's part of the charm. But we were never asked to carry a thing up the stairs --- as soon as we got there, they met us to take our luggage. It's centrally located so you can walk to everything. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie17
Reviews.Content: We warmly recommend the Nadia Hotel. The location is central and within a walking distance to many attractions, the rooms are small but comfortable and spotlessly clean, the breakfast is great and so are the fresh cut flowers in the rooms and the free wi-fi access everywhere. The hotel stuff is friendly, welcoming and helpful and make you feel at home away from home. In our next trip to Amsterdam we would certainly go back to the Nadia Hotel The only drawback is that sometimes we could smell cigarettes smoke in the hallways and in our room. It would be nice if smoking is prohibited throughout the building. .

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Nadia hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tasha_f
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Nadia and we were very pleased with almost every aspect of our stay. After getting past the initial slight disadvantages- the very steep steps up to the hotel, and the narrow, cabin-like room- we found everything to be of a good standard, and excellent value for money. Good facilities in the room- an ice-cold fridge, facilities to make tea and coffee; very friendly staff who often gave us drinks on the house; bright, cheerful rooms filled with fresh flowers; and lots of choice for breakfast. Of course, the centrality of the location is another great plus. And not once did other visitors to the hotel disturb us at night, coming back late. I am pretty certain you will not find a better hotel in this price range, so don't hesitate to book your stay with Hotel Nadia!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qawraStPaulsBay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is one of the friendliest hotels I have come across in my travels. This is not our first visit to Hotel Nadia and we will be staying again in October.

Reviews.Title: “I will always come back at Nadia Hotel, was the best place!”
Reviews.Author: Raquel M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! It was a great view and everyone treat me very well! People were really nice to me! The breakfast was excellent and i felt like i was at home! I want to thank to Osama for the kidness and the hospitilaty! (He is a great friend!) And i also want to thank you to Chedia , Najet and Jamila for their sympathy! And the rest of employers! Big hug from Portugal, Raquel IglÃ©sias

Reviews.Title: “staff and owner friend and always help”
Reviews.Author: city52
Reviews.Content: Bedroom 5 stars, wonderful place, staff and owner friend and always help. Perfect cleaning. I go back to Nadia hotel and recommend it to everyone. Jorge Iglesias Porto - Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, great view of canal and Westerkierke”
Reviews.Author: DagdaIreland
Reviews.Content: We found the Nadia great - they were very helpful (soft drink on arrival is a nice touch) and friendly. More than happy to carry your bags up and down the long stairs! The location is very good - only two minutes to a tram stop, the WesterKirke (great views of the church from the breakfast room, great views from the church tower of the rest of Amsterdam!) and Anne Frank house (long queues - try and book online maybe?). Long stairs up to bedrooms could be an issue for some people but seem to be a common feature of these older buildings, and the basic rooms are very small (not much storage either) but have everything you need. We enjoyed our stay and I'd have no hesistation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location & fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Emma140
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we were greeted by very helpful and friendly staff who carried our bags up lots of stares! We were then offered welcome drinks by the reception staff. The staff were so friendly and immediately made us feel welcome and comfortable. The rooms aren't 5 star rooms but the staff make up for this. The hotel had character and that's what made it so great! The location is excellent. Lots of great boutique shops around along with heaps of cafes and restaurants. We felt completely safe the whole time and loved not staying in a hotel around the centraal station area. We walked everywhere: to central station, the red light district, anne franks house etc Thank you hotel Nadia for a great stay! We will definitely be back :). Amsterdam is such an amazing city! Emma & Evan

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant place!”
Reviews.Author: sylviacortezzi
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is a well-localization, very close to Anne FrankÂ´s house and less then 10 minutes walk to Dam Square. The crew is very good, and I felt secure and happy there. The only thing that is not so good is that the rooms are very small, but very clean. Anyway, is a good choice when in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm - a mixed bag! An honest review.”
Reviews.Author: AmberCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago with a group of friends, after reading superb reviews from here, i have to say .. i was expecting more!! Dont get me wrong, the staff are absolutely lovely! They were all very friendly, offering help at every opportunity. However, the hotel itself was a little disappointing. The rooms are so tiny .. you could probably sit on the toilet, brush your teeth over the sink and shower all at the same time! The beds are really comfy though, so this kind of makes up for it! The stairs are ridiculous .. especially if you are on the top floor. They have to be seen to be believed, trust me! Breakfast, well .. isnt really breakfast! Coffee, Croissants (which were lovely, to be fair!) Bread (you have to ask the kitchen staff to toast it) and some cheese slices. The location is very good, a 5minute walk to Dam Square and about 15 to the red light District. If it hadnt have been for the staff .. i'd dread to think what this hotel would be! Had an ok, pleasant stay overall .. but certainly wouldnt stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Large Room, and Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jimpame2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a friend. The staff was very nice to deal with right off the bat. The room was a decent size and the bathroom was large for any type of hotel in Europe. The beds were comfortable, but small and narrow. I could lay on my stomach on it and touch the floor on each side at the same time. I felt like I was a bear wrestling a tree. The view of the canal and church were beautiful day or night. There was even a little refrigerator, iron, safe, and fresh flowers. Yes the rooms are a little bit dated, but I enjoyed the not too overly polished posh look sometimes. It felt homey. We had an canal facing room without a balcony. The included breakfast was satisfying for the start of a long day of tourist activities. Typically Dutch breakfast. The location can not be beat. Just a few minutes from everything either on foot or trolley. We had a fun time on our trip, and Hotel Nadia was a great place to stay. I recommend it to families or couples. BUT! The stairs are crazy steep and I believe 37 to just register. If you have a room higher, it will be even more. If you are in any type of decent shape it shouldn't be a problem. I only wish they had a camera to catch everyone's first look at the stairs. That would be a hilarious photo wall.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all positive Tripadvisor Recommendations”
Reviews.Author: sc0ttietraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 5 looking for a few days near central Amsterdam. We chose "Nadia" after detailed research on Tripadvisor (guilty not having given feedback before) looking for a reasonable priced hotel with good reviews. We found that previous reviews had been correct in that the stairs up to, and within, the hotel are very steep but this is consistent with many non corporate hotels in Amsterdam The rooms were spotlessly clean and daily service was faultless. We were asked if it was ok to do room service each day as we handed our keys in. The rooms we had were perfectly adequate in size (103 double and 105 triple). There is outside noise from the surrounding area but nothing out of the ordinary for a city location. Breakfast was plentiful, if basic, and in keeping with the good value offered. The breakfast room did get busy after 9:00 am. The staff and management were extremely helpful, arranging a collection and park service for our car although we had not booked anything prior to arrival (local parking â‚¬5 an hour from 09:00 to 24:00) handling all of our luggage and storing our luggage on the last day to give us a full day in Amsterdam until our car was delivered back to the Hotel late afternoon. We even managed to borrow umbrellas on the days it rained. We recommend the Nadia to anyone looking for excellent quality budget acommodation in Amsterdam. One point to note is that the Hotel is B&B only with limited snacks from a vending machine outside breakfast hours (although tea/coffee available free all day in the breakfast room) We found some good restautants near by including the Panorama, at the end of the block (undercover all the way which was good as it rained heavily during our visit) , which was reasonable for Amsterdam (â‚¬100 two courses for 5 inc drinks) , helpful (meals split between two children with no quibble) with some of the best ribs I have tasted for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: elspier
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very centrally located. The stairs were straight up and there was no elevator, but the staff were quick to bring all your luggage to your room immediately. My only complaint would be that the staff smoke and you can smell that in the hallways and sometimes through the vents into the room. Overall staff was helpful and very friendly and the morning breakfast was more than adequate. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: Boppojr
Reviews.Content: At first this place seems a bit of a dive, it's dated and the rooms are just ok. But then after a day you realize It's actually not that bad. The staff are VERY helpful ( they will arrange anything if you know what I mean) no doubt because they are getting kickbacks from the services they recommend, but that's business and every place/service they recommend is great. Its location is probably the best, literally a walk to everything you want to see in Amsterdam, Anne Franks museum is a few 100 meters away as is both cheap and exclusive restaurants. A bike shop next door and this is the best way to see Amsterdam, next to a canal.. Cheap, cheerful and clean would be my description. One thing, if you don't like steps or heights then watch it, getting to the reception is like climbing a fire mans ladder to the 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Topsy277
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first weekend in July, and would thoroughly recommend it. Easy walk to the centre, but also close to lovely peaceful canal walks, great restaurants and individual shops. Staff very welcoming (cold drink on arrival a lovely touch) and although the rooms are on the smaller side, it felt snug rather than cramped. Some beds also on smaller side, but were offered to swap on 2nd night (without requesting it) when they realised our bed might not be so comfortable for my husband, me and a baby bump!! Clean, welcoming and very good value, would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average room.”
Reviews.Author: AngV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located very close Anne Frank's House and Dam Square and canals. The stairs are as others have written - like climbing a mountain! But the staff are very helpful and are always on hand to carry the bags up or down. We (like another previous traveller) were generously "upgraded", which we think meant we got a canal view room - this was nice to have but did not make the room any bigger! Room fittings are pretty dated, but overall clean and convenient. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special at all. It will suit travellers on a budget. Next time we will probably spend a bit more on accommdation but try to be in the same area as it was easy to navigate from the Raadhuis Straat area.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: angel4eva
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasant addition to our trip. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, clean, cute and charming. I would 100% recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: davejackSheffield
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time we have used this hotel and the service from its staf continues to be of the very highest standard. They are both polite and helpful. The hotel is located close to Dam Square and is situated at the side of the Kaiser's canal above a small shopping aracde. The breakfast room offers excellent views of the canal and nearby church . The room we stayed in was clean, small but well equipped with en suite facilities , TV, fridge , safe , fan tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast is typical continental style with options such as toast, differnt breads and croissants. Although the staircase at the hotel entrance is steep staff help you with the luggage.It would not be suitable for someone with mobility difficulties. We will defintiely use this hotel again the next time visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandego
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent , helpful and very friendly. The stairs from the entrance to the reception on the 2nd floor are very steep, but the staff is eager to carry the luggage up to your room. The rooms are small but clean and secure. I highly recommend this hotel to people who are healthy and able to climb a set of steep chairs. Not recommended for anyone with moblity and or breathing problems. Great location, close to public transit and the Jordaan.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service at the Nadia Hotel and strongly recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: ge0rgev
Reviews.Content: We selected the Nadia Hotel based on feedback we received from others who had stayed there. It also met our criteria of location and cost. We were certainly more than pleased with Nadia and their friendly staff. When it was my wife's birthday, they had overheard this and left a beautiful bouquet of flowers in our room after we came back from dinner. Their included breakfast was good with sufficient variety to please everyone. We certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a prime location in Amsterdam at a reasonable price. G&G

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, scary stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Fearless17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night on july 3rd to 4th 2011. It is a 15 min walk to the train station but there is a tram that goes directly there from outside the hotel. Its a bit daunting when after a long train ride from Copenhagen and then a long hot walk from the station to find an incredibly long steep flight of stairs (with reception on the 3rd floor) awaiting you. Before you can even close your mouth, there is somebody speeding down to personally carry all out luggage to your room. The stairs look much worse than they are and the reception was absolutely wonderful and gave us each a free cold drink ( sprite, coke, dutch sports drink, sparkling water etc.) and the 8 year old with us, a free can of Pringles from the vending machineWhen we checked in they happily gave us two double rooms next to each other instead of the family room we requested. It did work for our family so we didn't insist on the room we had booked. The rooms were rather small and cramped and furnished like a medieval castle. However they had an amazing view of the canal and you could even see Anne Frank's attic from the room! It was a 2 min walk to the Anne Frank House, 4 min walk to the dam square and it was even walkable (15-20 min) to the Vincent van Gogh museum . The breakfast had really good croissants and a lot of little yogurts. Even though the room was small, it was a pleasant experience. The service was almost overly helpful and Hazem, an employee who almost seemed to live at the hotel (he was always there) always carried our ridiculously heavy luggage every where and was very helpful. All the staff were immediately friendlier the minute I mentioned finding the hotel on trip advisor and kept bring up me writing a review when I got home to the US. So Hotel Nadia, here is your review!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: riseandshine22
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 Friends stayed in Hotel Nadia during the weekend when Queens day is celebrated (April 30th). We stayed for 2 nights in Hotel Nadia. The location of the hotel is excellent, right round the corner from Anne Franks house. We had the family room which was right on the corner of the hotel which looked out on the canals! It was excellent. The hospitality and friendliness of the staff was excellent, they couldn't do enough for you. One morning we went down to breakfast and there wasn't enough room for us in the breakfast room to sit down, so we had a look and went back up to the room - 5 minutes later there was a phone call to our room saying that there is now a table free and would we like to come down - now thatâ€™s service, we didn't even have to ask!! The hotel is quirky, it has really steep stairs to get up to the rooms, but this adds to its charm. If you're looking for luxury then this isn't for you. If you're looking for a weekend break away and want a hotel with a good location, friendly staff and a comfortable room then I recommend this 100%! I would also recommend going during Queens day as there are people partying in the street all day & night - great atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Normal High Standards”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Halford
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed again at the Nadia. Why do we always stay there a) Location b) cleanliness c) friendly staff d) cost If money is no issue and you are looking for a luxury hotel then look elsewhere. If you are on a budget then in my opinion the Nadia cannot be beaten. Yes its a basic hotel but its very clean, is in a great location (5 min walk to dam square) and is comfortable and provides everything you need. The staff are all very friendly and will help you carry bags up the stairs and offer you drinks on arriving etc. You will notice that the Nadia has a lot of repeat guests - this is not by accident. People go back there because its value for money. I've stayed in expensive hotels in Amsterdam and they are not as clean as the Nadia. If you like to spend a lot of time in the hotel then again look elsewhere , if like us its just somewhere safe to sleep and rest the fit fits the bill perfectly. Its very secure - door is kept locked and desk is manned 24 hours - there is no risk of outsiders coming into your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cherie65_16
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located for getting around the main tourist spots in Amsterdam. It is very close to the Hop on Hop off Canal Boat. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very small. Free wi fi. Free Breakfast Daily. This is not the ideal hotel for people with mobility problems because there is no elevator. There are instead very steep, narrow staircases. However, if you are happy to climb stairs this might be a great place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We totally loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: cfmmalta
Reviews.Content: I recommend Hotel Nadia for anyone staying in Amsterdam. The hotel is very central. Rooms are very clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. Moreover, the hotel's staff were very welcoming. Breakfast is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Value for $”
Reviews.Author: SP_ORD
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Nadia on Tripadvisor. We booked a 3 night stay for early June this year. The receptionist (Michelle) was very pleasant and helpful. She offered us bottled water, coke upon arrival. The rooms are tiny but if you are on budget, you can't ask for anything better. Very clean, neat. Location is great. Just a block away from Anne Frank Huis. You can hop on the tram at Westermarkt (in front of the church) to go to Centraal Station. Breakfast is fantastic. Fresh bread, croissants, juice, coffee, dutch cheese etc. Wi-fi is free. Not recommended if you have knee problems or you are old. The stairs are extremely steep. Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint Hotel in the heart of Amsterdam with exceptionally professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Dean-Matt
Reviews.Content: Had the best stay at Hotel Nadia... Any questions or problems were answered and rectified straight away... The staff all deserve medals they were so polite, professional and efficient. Nothing was a problem.. I'd recommend Hotel Nadia to any discerning traveller... Special praise & thanks to the guys carting our bags up & down the stairs, we didn't need to lift a finger! Thankyou very much Dean Myers

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to come back”
Reviews.Author: MarisiyPruden
Reviews.Content: When you get in you will feel the way to heaven (steep stairs), dont worry the angels come to help you. Nice recepcionists. Very good service and really well located.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: marilyn064
Reviews.Content: The outstanding aspect of this hotel is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. On arrival I was made to feel welcome and comfortable. I was given a free soft drink which was much needed; flowers and fruit were put in my room and I was shown around and everything explained clearly. My room was relatively inexpensive and was small but immaculately clean. The shower worked very well and I had everything I needed. I would have liked a front room with a better view but they were taken. The stairs to the hotel are very steep but there is always someone to help you and to take any luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VancouveriteTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing canal-view room which blew my mind. My view was the historic Westerkerk and the Keizergracht. Very clean, safe with impeccible service. Thier breakfast room was beautiful too and breakfast good though it was a traditional European hotel breeakfast (juice, coffee, croissants and cake).

Reviews.Title: “Flowers and great service”
Reviews.Author: LaVidaBuono
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nadia during a 5 week trip through Germany, Luxembourg, Belgium and the Nederlands. Hotel Nadia made us feel right at home, from the cozy and very functional room (with patio overlooking Westkirche and the canal, ask for room 206) to the flowers and water waiting for us, to offering us a hand with my wife's (carry on size) bag up the stairs. They even did a load of laundry for us (for a reasonable fee). Thank you so much for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Karla021
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days in Nadia hotel. The staff is very friendly, we got a welcome drink. There's a steep stairs, but no problem because they carry our luggage. The room was very small, but there were flowers everyday, the cleaning was good, and the best: the amazing view for the canal and Westerkerk. I loved just laying on the bed and looking through the window admiring the view. The breakfast was nice, and the location is very central. I would definitily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, simple characteristic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JMU_K54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Nadia for a weekend break in Amsterdam. In characteristic Amsterdam style, the hotel is negotiated via three fairly long, narrow, steep and twisting stairways. Do not stay here if you find negotiating such stairways difficult as there is no lift. Hotel staff were very welcoming and kindly portered our luggage up the stairs for us. The hotel is clean with slightly quirky decor that added to its charm. Our room was located on the top floor with small balcony overlooking Raadhuisstraat and neighbouring Keizergsgracht canal. The room itself was very small, though had all required amenities, ensuite shower-room with sink and toilet, small fridge, tv, phone, fan, kettle with complimentary tea and coffee sachets. The noise from the trams running on the Raadhuisstraat and from the neighbouring Westerkerk clock could be a touch loud for some, but didn't really bother us. Breakfast is a simple continental buffet of croissants, fruit loaf, bread, toast, cake, jams, yoghurt, orange juice, tea and coffee, etc. All in all a good hotel which is very conveniently located for arrival by train, exploring the centre of Amsterdam, its canals, shops and restaurants. Museums are a 25-30 minute walk from the hotel, though trams could be used to get there much quicker if desired.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great service”
Reviews.Author: Lizet60
Reviews.Content: The management did everything to ensure a comfortable stay. Breakfast can include fruit as well. Room was very small, but clean linen and towels were provided every day. Overall, good budget hotel. Will definitely stay here again. Cape Town June 2011

Reviews.Title: “First time in Amsterdam - Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Foxiboy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fab location and magnificent staff - couldn't do enough for you.Thoroughly recommended especially the rooms with their own balcony with views over the canal.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the place and the people”
Reviews.Author: AggyM
Reviews.Content: Very nice and good located place in Amsterdam to stay. The staff nice and friendly. Place with very nice atmosphere. The breakfast poor :(

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel would def recommend”
Reviews.Author: susan186332
Reviews.Content: had a lovely stay , a really friendly hotel , they made us so welcome the rooms are spotless and very clean. would def recommend a great base near all the attractions and centre .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LAJEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a huge room, and bring earplugs - the downside of being on a tram-route is noise. Bedding and bathroom all really clean, but the carpet could have done with replacement or thorough shampooing.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and will go back”
Reviews.Author: tdcar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. The staff cannot do enough for you and are very friendly. Yes we agree the stairs are steep, but they are much the same as on other hotels unless you go to a more modern one. The breakfast was very good and as much tea or coffee as you can drink. The room was very clean and well aspected, we had a view of the canal, which we enjoyed watching all the boats going back and forth. The hotel is well placed for all the sights and for shopping and getting around on the trams or canal boats made the stay easy for us to get around. May i send our thanks to Osam and his staff for a great stay. WE WILL SEE YOU AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Again a fabulous welcome and stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gentlegiant69
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this hotel. Centrally located and a few minutes walk from Dam square. But the location is not the 'key' it is the warmth of the owners and employees, they treat you like family, nothing is too much! I travel around the world on business and stay in small and large hotels, Hotel Nadia is high on my list! Quite honestly I love it there and would stay nowhere else! Well Done Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Nadia for three nights and couldn't be happier!!! For a start the hotel staff were above and beyond with their service answering any questions or queries we had!!! The stairs were daunting but the hotel staff carry them up to your room for you!! The rooms were small as all Amsterdam rooms are but the bed was so comfortable and the room cosy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eklimya
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is only 2 min to Dam Square. Fresh flowers welcomes you at your room. My room was a little small ( standard single room) but it was pretty. Maybe breakfast can be more reach other all things were great. For my next trip i will defintly choose Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay when traveling solo in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PiscesV
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great and staff was so accomodating. There are steep steps to get up when you arrive (normal for canal houses), and upon reaching the top, I was given a free welcome drink. I was actually given one each time I arrived, water or soda, each time I came back. Staff was very kind and helpful. Breakfast was simple but good. Room was perfect - larger then I expected for a single, and I even had a balcony. Location was perfect - close to Anne Frank house on the Prince's canal.

Reviews.Title: “Very wonderful. We loved it and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Oliveira_Jose
Reviews.Content: I already stayed before in this Hotel (2002). I came back because I'm feeling very well. All the people that works on it, they are very hospitable. Always with a smile and a disponibility to help and advise us. The room is clean, and comfortable. The room service it's ok. Maybe, the coat hanger can have more racks (there was only two).

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: sightseer07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly as we expected from reading other reviews.The location is excellent-tho noisy if you are on a room overlooking the road. This honestly wasn't a problem for us as we were so tired after walking round the city all day. The room was very small but had everything we needed and was most importantly very clean. The breakfast is simple- but that was fine for us and there's plenty of it. The service really is excellent and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. We were given free drinks on arrival, when we popped back to get our bags before leaving for airport and also one evening when we returned. The stairs are VERY steep but the staff carry any bags up and down. If you're looking for a good value good location simple hotel with lovely staff -this will suit you.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: stephtrips62
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the hotel Nadia for position, cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff. From the moment you arrive you are on your holidays and they make sure your every need is catered for. Don't be put off by the rating, much larger hotels cannot match this service. Yes the stairs are steep but thats the nature of the building and again the staff step in to help. Being provided with a welcome soft drink after your journey to the free maps and info you are well catered for. We had the corner room featured in the literature and even with 4 of us it was fine for space. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “What a warm, friednly, and fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: arthurdill
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Nadia. This time it was for my honeymoon and it was great. It is in a great location, right near the Dam and Centraal station, 5 minute walk if that. Also it is right next to Anne Frank's house. The staff is very welcoming and friendly, they always greet you with, "welcome home". The breakfast isn't lavish but it is always fresh and with nice breads, jams, meat and cheese. The rooms are comfortable and cozy. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Would Certainly Come Back”
Reviews.Author: GGPerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this cool hotel for a couple of days and were so happy we did. It was at a great part of town (near the Anne Frank House & Palace, Dam, National Monument etc) which for us was perfect as we walked everywhere. The hotel was very clean and we got a nice warm welcome + a free soft drink. Our bags were taken to our deluxe canal view room and we also got fresh flowers placed in there. The room was quirky, with a balcony and a toilet that was on the small side, but it wasn't a big deal as we wasn't going to be there a lot anyway, although the shower was fantastic. It had a small tv, tea & coffee etc, the usual standard stuff, although I brought my own tea as there's isn't great and tastes weak. It was quiet for us despite being on a main road as the windows closed 90% of road noise out. Breakfast was ok, just usual European fare, tea, coffee, orange juice, bread, cheese, cake, yogurt, apples etc which was enough to just get us going in the morning. We thought the staff were fantastic and always there to help and always had a smile and wished us a good day. This alone made it worth it for us. Ok, so now the dreaded stairs which most people seem to have complained about. They're right in that they are steep and narrow with no lift. We loved the Dutch quirky staircase which is very normal there but admit we just had a couple of shoulder bags but if you have several suitcases to drag up then this hotel isn't for you. If we did have suitcases (we were on the top floor) this review may have been a bit different. It's a great hotel and very near to attractions run by great and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Guestess
Reviews.Content: I agree with a previous reviewer; get a balcony if you can. We did and loved it! The staff were tremendous and the location was fantastic. Take the canal taxi which the green line is only 2 blocks away. The Anne Frank museum was only steps away too. If you can climb the stairs, you're in for one of the best deals in the city!

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MagdalenJ
Reviews.Content: The service was very polite and helpful, there was no problem with the early arrival and leaving our luggage till late afternoon. The room was very cosy, very clean bathroom, tv, coffee and tea facilities, a little bit noisy as it was the street side room. Breakfast was tasty. A very good place to visit Amsterdam for the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TemaMagicFlute
Reviews.Content: Granted, the stairs from the street up to the hotel are daunting, but will soon transform themselves into magnificence, natural and homey Dutch. Heavy luggage? Don't worry, the staff will take care of that, anytime, as they did with any other issue during our five days stay. Top notch service, beautiful view of the Kelzersgracht canal from our room. The room was small, but highly functional, and they even find ways to place a mini-fridge. Going to the sights is also easy. Tram 14 goes to Rembrandtplein, the Zoo and on; trams 13 and 17 goes to the Central Station and will, the other way, take you one stop to tram 10 which goes to Leidseplein. Hotel Nadia is a great small hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: CJKStPaul
Reviews.Content: Booked the Nadia because of other reviews and think it was great. Steps are an issue but they carried up bags and staff was extremely helpful. Can't beat the location.! Rooms very small but clean and modern bathroom. Great value but keep in mind it is a 2* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very cramped room"”
Reviews.Author: theflyingfish
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel is in a good location for visiting Amsterdam. It is on a busy road by two canals very close to the quieter "7 Streets" area, the Ann Frank house and to tram stops. Damm Square is about 5 minutes walk away. It's an easy walk to the Wallen district and Railway station (or you can take a tram if you're tired, lazy or heavy-laden). As has been noted by other guests, the steps are very steep and it's a big climb up to the reception. It was an even bigger climb to the top floor, where we were staying. Our room was classed as a double but it really was only big enough to be a single room - and a small one at that (that's even for Europe, for American readers!). The bed was pushed up against the wall at one side, which gave a rather claustrophobic feel, and we had to climb over each other to get in or out of it. There was very little space at the other side of the bed. The small room was crammed with unnecessary shelving units and furniture - including a fridge, slightly worryingly overhanging the foot of the bed - and this reduced the scarce available space further. The bathroom was equally tiny and had to be used with the door open. There was always a good supply of hot water, however. A roof window let us see the street below, but we did not notice any street noise. We found the beds to be surprisingly comfortable. The electrics were a bit unconventional but seemed safe. The breakfast room was very small, too, and we had to wait for a place in the morning. Once we were in, it was very crowded. The buffet breakfast itself was nothing special. The staff were polite and friendly. We were offered a free drink when we arrived, as promised. The guy on reception carried our bags up and down the stairs when we arrived and departed, and stored them for us because we arrived before the room was ready. A bonus that more luxurious hotels often do not provide was _free_ wifi in the room with good signal strength. (Ask at reception for the password.) To the hotel management, I'd suggest stripping out all unnecessary fittings and furniture from the room to maximise space, and decorating it in a crisp style in a light plain colour to reduce feelings of claustrophobia. And if there is not at least 40cm on both sides of the bed, then market it as a single room. Overall, the cramped room, the many steep stairs and the wait for a place at the average breakfast did not spoil our stay in Amsterdam. The location of the hotel meant we were close to almost everything we wanted to see and could use public transport to get to everything else, and the polite staff and comfortable beds made it a more pleasant stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone slim, fit and healthy who would not actually spend much time in it! For someone who just wants a base for exploring the city and a place to sleep, it's a reasonable option, though I suspect there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “All you need and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: oschli12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June for a short business trip. The location is excellent. Short walking distance to the train station, as well as to center city. You can also use the Schiphol hotel shuttle for more convenience - takes about 20 minutes to get from and to the airport. Cost is about 25 EUR for a roundtrip. The shuttle picks guests up right in front of the hotel. The room was very clean. They have everything that you would require from a hotel. What i found excellent is the service and security of the hotel. The breakfast was continental style, but absolutely enough food of everything - good coffee. The hotel has a very family style atmosphere - the staff is very friendly and supports wherever they can. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Character! small rooms, great stay :)”
Reviews.Author: mfuhr
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right, the steps are steep and the rooms are small, but this hotel is awesome. ton's of character, very clean and a great staff.
