The rooms are tiny but comfortable and clean, the bathrooms are small but excellent. the location is a long walk from Central station, but easily doable in about 20 minutes. Close to Dam square and far enough from the red light district to make it nice and quiet at night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, friendly, very warming staff, I am back in 2 weeks.”
Reviews.Author: Elmes8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia for 3 nights, it is very safe with an intercom system to enter the building. The staff are very polite, helpful and friendly, the room I had was clean and had everything I needed, it was very peaceful, which was lovely. The location of the hotel was perfect for me, a few minutes walk to Dame Square and shops. I have already booked to return, this in itself tells you what a good hotel this is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: TurboDani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful, service is excellent. The welcome drink at check-in really hit the spot, and the flowers in the room were lovely. Breakfast was typical Dutch breakfast fare, delicious and plentiful. The decor throughout the hotel is beautiful, the rooms well-kept. Especially nice was the option to leave our bags at the hotel so we could explore the city before check-in. And they kept them the day of check-out even after we were done with our stay, until we were ready to pick them up after a day of site-seeing. The location can't be beat, and the prices are very reasonable. We had a twin room with canal view, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We stay very well and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SerryMilano
Reviews.Content: Everything is liked of the hotel Nadia there! The position is strategic: in center, to few footsteps from the house of Ann Frank and from the station (in fact not abbiam ever taken a mean, of it not even a taxi). The staff immediately is thoughtful and pleasant from, from when it comes you meeting to directly bring you the baggages in room. The rooms are well take care of and clean, nothing don't miss indeed! The breakfast is very good, it is not very various, but the dishes are excellent. Are found well there indeed and when will return to Amsterdam - because will return there - surely will return to the hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, helpful and friendly. Would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: JennaLD
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helping and friendly. Upon arrival our bags were taken to our rooms and we were offered a free welcome drink and visitor book for the city with a map (even members of our group who weren't staying at this hotel were offered the same). There were flowers in our rooms to greet us too. The rooms were small but for a 3 day stay was fine for us and we had our own bathroom. The room was kept very tidy though during our stay and the breakfast was basic. The location of the hotel is perfect - just near to everything yet away from it (the Anne Frank house is a 2 min walk and Dam Square is about 10 mins away if that). The hotel was very peaceful at night so no problem sleeping at all - although our room was at the back of the hotel away from road. I wouldn't recommend elderly people or anyone with knee/leg problems etc due to the steep stairs in the hotel and no lift! If I was to go back to Amsterdam (which I most likely will as its a brilliant city) I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff exceptional”
Reviews.Author: lorraineFalkirk
Reviews.Content: We received a warm and professional welcome including bags carried, a welcome drink and even flowers in the room for my husband's birthday. The room itself, although compact, was most welcoming and comfortable including a safe, a fridge, tv, fan and coffee/tea facilities. The view takes in the fabulous Westerkerk and the canal below, the location could not be better, 5 mins from Anne Frank house, canal trip, 10 mins from Dam square, shopping and flower market. Farmers market, Vintage markets and lovely restaurants also within 10 mins walk. Overall an excellent choice for a stay in Amsterdam and a friendly and courteous service assured.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidSparkle
Reviews.Content: As this is my first time in Amsterdam,i got lost trying to find the hotel...but it's actually situated in a convinient area.the room i got was very small but very cosy & clean though.but the thing that impressed me most was the staffs!very friendly & accomodating especially when i was not feeling too well & had difficulty to climb the very steep stairs...yes,VERY steep stairs...i'm writing this review as i'm having my b'fast in the hotel's b'fast room& i hope all the other hotels that i will be going too after this will be as wonderful as Hotel Nadia! 2 thumbs & toes up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JuliePS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia in mid-May and found it to be quite charming and quaint. We had a room overlooking the canal. What a lovely sight. The management team was incredible. They were friendly and very helpful. The rooms while not huge but were manageable and added to the ambiance. The free wirelss worked perfectly. The location was perfect with a wide variety of restaurants within a short walk from the hotel. Amsterdam is very walkable and the Hotel Nadia is very centrally located. i would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, most friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Corinsky
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights in a twin room. From begin on this placed suprised us with the most firendliest and considerate, mindful staff. We even got welcome flowers in our room and because we arrived very early we were offered to have breakfast before we start our walk through Amsterdam. The hotel has a very conviniend location next to Western Kerk, Anne Frank House and a Paddling Boat station. Almost everything is in walking distance. To thhe train station it is only a 10 min walk but there is also a tram station in front of the hotel. Yes the hotel rooms are tiny and yes the stairs are very steep, but that is typical in Amsterdam. The staff in the hotel carries your luggage to the room. No reason to worrie about that. The rooms are clean and have safe, regrigerator and water boiler. We did not miss anything and enjoyed our time at Hotel Nadia. We would always come back to this place. Thanks a lot!

Reviews.Title: “what a treat, quirky, friendly, always smiling and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Jan_T50
Reviews.Content: The team at The Nadia were so welcoming and friendly. The rooms are quaint and comfortable, cosy and very clean. Everything you would need is available and I would most definitely recommend this place for a stay in Amsterdam. But dont book it if you cant climb stairs, the guys will carry your bags no worries and take good care of you always. I will be back if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: lathdruigan
Reviews.Content: We love the nadia hotel, great value for money and in a nice cental part of Amsterdam. The staff are always friendly and can't seem to do enough to help you. Actualy, i'm scared to praise this hotel too much, just incase the hotel is fully booked for our next visit!! C. Cameron Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GFQLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia in Amsterdam for 2 nights in early May 2011. You cant get a better spot in Amsterdam to stay its in such a good location in the old district the building is beautiful and its right across the road from the Westerkerk church and clock tower. We walked everywhere from the hotel, dam square is right around the corner. We had a double room with a beautiful canal view and also looking right out at the westerkerk. Rooms were lovely and clean and they even gave us a bunch of welcome flowers on the first day. The staircase to get up to the hotel is impressive! Very steep but they take your bags up for you! Breakfast was great and served in their breakfast room which looks out to the canals. Best part of the hotel is definitely the staff they are all so helpful and friendly . Would definitely stay here again and really reccomend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: 190732Jim
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff; cases carried, welcome drink; smallish rooms but with all mod.cons. Clean. Tip Keep windows closed to keep out city noi9se; frugal breakfast but loads of it

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Family12345_11
Reviews.Content: PROS Family-friendly environment; Exceptional staff who accommodated our needs for a quite room, even though one wasn't readily available; Clean rooms with a great canal view; Beautiful roof garden with real (!) parrots CONS Steep stairways, but we have been warned about it in a guidebook; and we got plenty of help from staff with our luggage. Overall, a great experience we are likely to repeat in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect room, perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: laviok
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anybody. It's not luxury but it's perfect. The room was the right size for a single person and the balcony was great. Nice breakfast. Nice attention from the staff throughout the stay. I will definitely come back. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very quirky but clean and pleasant in a great location”
Reviews.Author: horacethefrog
Reviews.Content: We've never stayed anywhere quite this small before! Having said that, I understand some of the rooms are larger than ours. But it did have everything we needed and was spotlessly clean. The bathroom facilities were ingenious - one could sit on the toilet and take a shower at the same time. The shower was the weak point - more of a dribble than a shower. Our room had a balcony which faced the morning sun and was perfect for morning coffee or evening drinks (if you've visited the nearby supermarket opposite Magna Plaza - no minibar!). Breakfast is continental but as much as you want, very fresh and a wide range to cater for all tastes. There are a few seats at breakfast that give you a great view of the canal below. As others have commented, the stairs are incredibly steep, like you've never seen before but the staff will deal with your bags so it's not really an issue (so long as you're moderately sober). The staff are all very helpful, nothing is too much trouble and they are always around. Note the discount the hotel offers for cash - it's very generous so it may be worth taking a little extra with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel, and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: justbabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel last week for our honeymoon. The hotel's location is great, since it's near the train station and the center of Amsterdam. It's very charming, with a lovely breakfast room, clean bedrooms, and great views from the windows. When we first arrived, the room I had requested was being occupied by a business convention, but to compromise, they let us stay in one of the deluxe double rooms until they checked out of that room, which was extremely nice of them. (The deluxe room had a very nice view of the canal.) A yummy continental breakfast was included, which consisted of croissants, bread & different spreads, cheese, fruit, juice & coffee. They run a 24 hour front desk, which meant that there were various people to greet us when we came and went, but each one of them were very nice and helpful. The hotel does have a lot of stairs to climb, but they'll gladly carry your bags for you upstairs. We had a great time staying here, and would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money"”
Reviews.Author: exflorida
Reviews.Content: You need to be able to climb steep stairs - no elevator/lift.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING YOU NEED IN A TINY SIZE”
Reviews.Author: stefanos-penny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpfull staff, location near to everything.The room was tiny but was equipped with all necessary for a comfortable stay.Fridge,coffee making facilities, WC+shower, cupboard and a great balcony where I enjoyed having my morning coffee.Besides the hotel is very close to Dam, Jordaan, Princengracht etc. Don't miss the area above the hotel and WesterKirk to Central Station.Small canals with caffes by the canalside, nice shops.Generally it was one of the nicest trips that we ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3442vanzanten
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights in France and Holland and stayed at small hotels. The Nadia was by far the best for service. I agree with all the comments above. We had a canal view room so after a day of sightseeing it was great to sit and watch the boat traffic with a beer in hand. The Jordaan area is steps away and a world away from the Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and hospitality. But watch your step if you are a bit tipsy!”
Reviews.Author: mtrolio
Reviews.Content: Pros - Many rooms have large balconies overlooking Raadhuisstraat with a partial view of the Keizersgracht. The staff is amazingly gracious and helpful in every possible way. The breakfast room is nice and the reception room (checking in/checking out) has some wonderful ornamentation. Cons - The corner of Ruidhuisstraat and Keizergracht can be very noisy even with doors and windows shut due to heavy traffic and trams. The trams can literally shake the foundations when they pass by. Also, the rooms are extremely compact, even by Dutch standards. Watch Your Step - Neither a Pro nor a Con. But it should be mentioned there is no elevator and many steep steps just to get to the reception (2nd floor). More of the same to go to the higher floors. The staff is wonderfully efficient about taking your luggage to and from the room. But use caution when negotiating these steps especially if you have had some alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel but great staff”
Reviews.Author: congal123
Reviews.Content: Great location, 10 minutes from station, excellent staff very helpful. However its a very basic hotel will small rooms and en-suites,stairs are very very steep and not for anyone with any disabilities. Saying all that the staff made up for all its faults. Rooms were very clean, they help carry your bags up and down stairs, check out at 11am but they hold your bags no charge if checked out. We thought we'd be stuck in Amsterdam because of ash cloud, owner offered us a room in his own house if the hotel was booked out so we wouldn't be stuck. Don't know of any other hotel in the world that would offer that. Definitely stay there if ever in Amsterdam again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieSam11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Nadia for a 2 night stay in Amsterdam. Thanks to all the great reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to stay here and I'm very happy we did. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As expected from other reviews, the rooms were small but very clean and that is the main thing. Loved the fresh flowers in the room and thought breakfast, even though it was a limited selection was very good. I also suggest like someone else did in their review to check out Sara's Pancake place downstairs!! Yum! The location was amazing. Right in the middle for everything! Will not miss the stairs though lol, but they give the place its dutch charm. Thanks Hotel Nadia for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: keefyc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very friendly helpful staff. Comfortable clean room. Easy to find, only 10 minutes from Central Station. Not a hotel for people with mobility problems because of the very steep staircases. This was my first visit to Amsterdam. I will return asap, and will have no hesitation in booking a room at the Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Bizzzy44
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent, right opposite Anne Frank's house and only a few minutes walk to Dam Square. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and had a great sense of humour. The drinks on the house were appreciated after the walk up the stairs! We soon got used to these and our luggage was carried up and down for us, so they were not really an issue for us. Our triple room had a balcony with fantastic views over the canal but the street outside was quite busy and, even though we were on the 4th floor, the noise did take some getting used to, though it was bearable and to be expected when in the city centre. Having read the other reviews, the room was bigger than I expected and clean, though the carpet was showing some wear and the duvet covers looked fairly old (but were clean). The buffet breakfast was lovely - croissants, toast, yoghurt, cake, fruit, coffee, juices, etc, all fresh and constantly refreshed. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel for it's location, value for money and friendly staff for those wanting a short city break with friends/ family.

Reviews.Title: “Another 5 star stay”
Reviews.Author: Riverside1971
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my 5th stay at Hotel Nadia and as per usual it was another 5 star stay. Hotel as welcoming as ever, staff always polite and efficient. Room spotless, compact but everything you could possibly need. Location perfect, just a short walk to the station and even shorter walk to Dam Square. If you are looking for place to stay in Amsterdam then there is no need to look any further as Hotel Nadia is simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: dejablue17
Reviews.Content: From reading other reviews I knew that the rooms were small but this is the way in Amsterdam unless you are willing to shell out big bucks. Like many of the other reviews I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful and I really enjoyed the breakfast here as well (thought it was good quality). I didn't find the steps that difficult and I'm past 50 plus the staff was great about helping with my big luggage. I had requested a quiet room and they came through for me, I slept great. I can't remember the room number but it was the first room on the left as you leave the reception desk. My only complaint was the shower. It sprayed water everywhere except on me and the drain was very slow. I think just a new shower head would fix the spray problem but in the end I managed to get clean. As far as location it was fairly easy to get to. It was about 5 tram stops (10 to 15 minutes) from Central Station. One other nice touch was that they put fresh flowers in my room along with a welcome card.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel who couldn't do more to help!”
Reviews.Author: NaomiNo
Reviews.Content: We felt 'right at home' from the moment we arrived at Hotel Nadia. We arrived a couple of hours before check in, but were met halfway down the (long) stairs by someone who carry our bags, and were offered a drink and a sit in the breakfast room, whilst they saw if a room was ready, which one was, about 20 minutes later. The room (206) was charming, absolutely tiny but with everything we needed, and the added space provided by the balcony was welcome. All of the balcony rooms overlook the main street (think trams, cars and cyclists) but I live in a city anyway and loved being able to watch the world go by. Sights we saw from the balcony include a fridge appearing in the middle of the road, 100's of Dutch Football Fans singing and being very good natured and loads of cyclists whizzing by either using no hands or perhaps one hand to guide the bike and the other to eat/phone/text/hold an umbrella/etc! The location was great, 10 mins from the central station (mind your wheelie case on the cobbles) and it was easy to walk anywhere in the city. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The breakfast room was small but very lovely with a small selection (bread, pastries, cheese, jam, juice, fruit, yoghurts, tea and coffee etc)

Reviews.Title: “I love Hotel Nadia!”
Reviews.Author: Melcifer
Reviews.Content: Once again I find myself at Hotel Nadia watching the sun set behind the beautiful Westerkirk. I have been visiting Amsterdam a few times a year for many years now and I always stay at Hotel Nadia. You cannot beat the location. It is really convenient for shopping and many tourist attractions are within easy walking distance. Also it's really easy to get to on the trams. The staff is super friendly and helpful. They will carry your bags up the stairs and give you directions or suggestions on places to go and things to see. And the rooms are always very clean. Some rooms have amazing views of the canals and the church with lovely balconies. Other rooms are quiet and overlook one of the most amazing gardens I have ever seen. I feel like a queen whenever I am here and always look forward to coming back. Hotel Nadia is a very good value for the money with awesome free Internet and breakfast. I won't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jarforr
Reviews.Content: Great and friendly service. Room had everything that a traveler should need. The location is great. It's in the city center but not right on Damrak so you don't have to deal with the noise. As far as liked best, I would have to say the friendly staff. Liked least? There was nothing that I didn't like.

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendly and helpful, rooms small but very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: lu_civi
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, comfortable bed, bathroom in the room, courteous and helpful staff, always looking after us at all. Many stairs, but hotel staff were always pleased to transport our luggage to our room on arrival and departure. Cost-effective. Ask for rooms facing the opposite side of the church. Some friends were in rooms with windows for the church, and the bell rang every half hour, causing disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 4 times in 8 years and we'll return again ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: fraserbb
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to the Nadia and enjoy it a bit more each time! The handy location (4 blocks to Dam Square), views over a canal & tram tracks, sound of the WesterKirk Church bells, charming bldg, lovely + well stocked breakfast room and extremely welcoming owner and staff all make this a hotel we will continue to stay at every time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PEOPLE, NICE HOTEL, NICE STAY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: nickb59
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay at Nadia and I would not have returned had it not been good. The people are friendly and helpful, which is important when you are in an unfamiliar city. The location is nice and central for all the local attractions. As with all Amsterdam hotels there are many stairs, so I suggest asking for a lower level room facing the canal. I can heartily recommend Nadia for your stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Small, steep, not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Andreea011
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with this hotel given the reviews it has here. In my opinion it is highly overrated, it is a 2 star hotel with very small rooms, actually everywhere you turn there isn't enough place to feel comfortable, the reception is small, the breakfast room is small not to mention the stairs very steep and abrupt. I suppose this applies to many 2 star hotels in amsterdam and perhaps I had bigger expectations, so don't expect too much or you'll be disappointed as I was. And to refer to my personal experience there, when we arrived at the hotel we were given a single room (which by the way was the smallest rooms I have ever been into, I think it was no bigger than 5sqm) although reserved a double and when I returned to the reception and complaint about it they gave us another room, a double this time which was also ready so they could have given this room in the first place. I didn't feel ok about this, as if they wanted to check whether we accepted the bad room first. The breakfast is quite fine for a 2 star hotel, so this is a plus and also the welcome drink was appreciated. To conclude it is ok for 1 night, maximum 2 but don't book this hotel if you intend to spend more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Does What It Says On The Tin”
Reviews.Author: SteveJuliet
Reviews.Content: Will not repeat what has always been said apart from great location, very friendly staff and clean. Room was small although expecting this so fine. Can add a few restaurants etc instead:- 1 - De Struisvogel (Keizersgraxht - 3 minutes) - traditional Dutch at a set price, excellent. 2 - Los Pilones (Kerkstratte - 10 minutes) - Mexican and very lively although really good atmosphere on Friday night. 3 - Billi Thai (Prinsengracht - 6 minutes) - as it says Thai although good menu but small, perhaps book in advance. Also walking back from any of the above is a fantastic but slightly pricey wine bar called Vyne (Prinsengracht). Great wines and nice way to finish off your evening. Watch out for early closing of bars/restaurants on Sundays! In my mind best side of town away from the 'red light district' if indeed you are away for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wil never disappoint you...”
Reviews.Author: puthurr
Reviews.Content: Third time we are staying in Nadia Hotel and it is always a pleasure, staff is friendly and super helpful, location is excellent, price are reasonable and it is always nice to come back to your room after a whole day out. Morning breakfast are super cool in a vintage environment with exquisite croissants, and wonderful sight of a pretty church... all these with the sweet sound of the bells at the background. We enjoy it as usual ! Nicolas/Alexandra

Reviews.Title: “warm staff”
Reviews.Author: filho21
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is a small hotel, but the remarkable fact is the friendly of the staff. The Hotel offers free fast internet, breakfast, an empty refrigerator in each room, coffee/tea maker and a toilet with shower. The hotel is clean and the furniture is new. The rooms are too small; it seems a cruiseâ€™s room. The price, the warm people, the cleanness, the breakfast and the toilet in the room compensate the roomÂ´s size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value for money and friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rach2304
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a 3-5 minute walk from Dam Square, so an ideal location. We were on the top floor of the hotel, and with there being no lift the stairs could get very exhausting (they're quite narrow & steep). However, our room did have a balcony, and the view from being so high up was good. The staff are very friendly and helpful, ensuring a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ADR1990
Reviews.Content: Being a travel agent I always try to look for a really good hotel and spend a long time researching to make sure I get the best and in all honesty this hotel was bloody brilliant. The staff were friendly, fantastic location and just the overall experience was exactly what my partner and I wanted. I would definitely go back if visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: luapina
Reviews.Content: a very good experience! Amsterdam are beautiful also Nadia Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gavola
Reviews.Content: I have just returned to this hotel with a group of friends after spending a few nights here before with my partner. Again, the service was excellent, from the welcome drink on arrival, the fresh flowers in the room to the fresh and plentiful breakfast provided in the morning. The hotel is traditionally dutch, small but charming, clean and comfortable and i would highly recommed that you upgrade to a balcony room. The location could not be better for exploring amsterdam with everything within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again when i return. Thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel with exellent service.”
Reviews.Author: sujk
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Amsterdam for a long weekend, and we found the Hotel Nadia at Hotels.com. We had a wonderful stay, the staff are extremely service minded and extremely helpful. We had made â€‹â€‹a mistake by booking so we had booked a night less than we needed, but they just swapped around a bit and we got a room in an otherwise a lot busy weekend. The hotel is small and cozy, the rooms are small but well used, there are many narrow and steep stairs which is good for general fitness, but not good if you have a disability. Hotel is located in the heart of town, which we enjoyed very much as we love to shop. We highly recommend the Hotel Nadia, and we love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: mcc144
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was always available and helpful. We also found the room to be comfortable, even though it was small, especially the bathroom. When booking a room ask for a room away from the street, because it was very noisy until 2 or 3 in the morning. Do not stay in Amsterdam on the night before The Queens Birthday. A street party was so loud we could not sleep.

Reviews.Title: “EVERTHING WE NEEDED FROM A CITY BREAK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: keels107
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the most perfect location, practically across from one of the main tourist attractions in Amsterdam - Anne Frank's house. Dam Square & other main attractions, plenty of shops, resturants, bars & cafes less than a 5 minute walk away. Central train station in approx 10-15 min walk, but it is a very pleasant walk. Breakfast in the hotel was simple but just enough to set you up for the day. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and reception was always manned 24 hour. The hotel does have fairly steep steps, but the staff were always there to help you with luggage etc. Room decor was what I would call quirky, but I liked it, maybe it was typical decor for a old Dutch building?? Room was perfectly clean, with fresh flowers on arrival & we received maid service, which I didnt expect on a 2 night stay. One major plus point for us was the view from our bedroom window, we had a full length window with a view that overlooked the canal, with The Central Catherdral as a back drop, it was lovely to wake up to!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: C_P06
Reviews.Content: The staff at Nadia's were wonderful, extremely helpful and so welcoming. We stayed on 2 separate occasions on our trip around the Netherlands and both stays were very memorable. The rooms were very clean, cute and comfortable and the value for money was excellent. I would recommend Nadia's to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay central, with a friendly and great service.”
Reviews.Author: ulifux
Reviews.Content: A friendly crew welcomed us with a free cold drink. They are helpful and attentive. The breakfast (included) was rich and the crew wait untill last guest finished, bevore closing the buffet, even if he is a little "over the time". Porters will carry your luggage up and downstays and they are stand by all over the day. The desk is in service 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vagrant1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nadia made visiting Amsterdam all that more pleasant. Its location allowed us to walk to most of the sites or hop on the tram for those not in walking distance. If you are looking for luxury this is not for you but if you are looking for a good deal with a great breakfast and clean but small rooms in a well located hotel this is for you. The steps are not that bad, I am sixty five, and the staff carries your luggage up for you. Ask to see the roof garden.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s a great hotel, near to the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: russinha
Reviews.Content: is a great hotel in the center of town. attendance by employees of the hotel is ideal both as to advise us of the best places to go. The rooms and common areas are always clean, and has a great breakfast (those croissants). The relation quality price is excellent, so that is the second time I go there a few days. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Anon2121
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is extremely well located in a beautiful historic building, close to the Dam, the canals, Anne Frank House, and on bus and tram lines. The manager and staff are absolutely wonderful. They ran down the steep stairs as soon as we arrived to help carry our luggage up. From the yummy sweets they have at the desk, to the welcome drink they offer, you are made to feel very welcome and at home from the minute you arrive. The room is smallish, but comfortable with all the amenities and a great view from the windows. I sat on the sill and watched the world go by whenever I was in the room. I am a light sleeper but had no trouble at all even though we had a streetside room. The beds are comfortable and the wireless internet was fast with the strongest signal we've had in a hotel in ages. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Aljojo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very friendly and kind atmosphere. Rooms r small, but cleen and cosy, bed is very comfortable. The fresh flowers in the room is a very nice surprise) We had a room with balkony, it is perfect for smokers. Next time we come to Amsterdam, we won't waste time looking for hotel - we will stay in Nadia, because for us atmosphere of this place is more important than big bathrooms)) Mr. Osam, and the girls at the reception, thanks alot for ur nice hotel! Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ckweeks
Reviews.Content: I arrived early, the hotel stored my luggage so I could go out and about for the day. I returned late evening and my luggage was in my room as well as welcome flowers. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station (Amsterdam Central), a little too far to walk with luggage, but take the #2 or #5 tram and it will let you off in front of the church, backtrack about a half block and the hotel is on the right. Don't take a taxi - it will cost around 12.00 euro for a 5 minute trip. Best option is to arrange for the shuttle - especially when returning to the airport. The room was clean and typical by European standards, not large but had everything needed. The room had a refrigerator, coffee service, safe, and fan. I reserved a room with a balcony, which was nice to sit outside and have coffee in the morning and relax in the evening. The bed and pillows were comfortable. My room faced the main street, I did not think it was noisy - the area is much quiter than closer to Dam Square. But remember, the hotel is located in the city, so expect a little traffic noise. I was there for Queens day - there was very little if any noise the night before the celebration. As they state, there are a lot of stairs, but unless you have a medical issue or just an averision with walking up stairs, you should be fine. Of course I only walked up/down once a day, when I left in the morning and returned in the evening. The staff carried my luggage up/down the stairs, so not having the use of an elevator was a non-issue. The staff is friendly and helpful, always willing to provide assistance, directions, wake up calls, etc. The front desk is available 24/7. The hotel entrance is locked 24/7 and the front door has a camera and speaker to verify who is entering...Big Plus!!!! The hotel is located about 10 minutes from the train station, 5 minutes from Dam Square and 10 minutes from the Red light district. The Anne Frank house is about 1.5 blocks from the hotel - 3 minute walk. Trams and busses are about a half block from the hotel, to the left when you exit the hotel. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The breakfast was typical European and the food was always good and fresh. Breads, cheese, fruit, coffee, juices, etc. Don't expect any American type breakfast - as you're not in the United States. Try Sara's Pancake restaurant a few doors down from the hotel for any meal - she has wonderful options for dinner. Stay here if you are looking for a clean and comfortable room with friendly helpful staff and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: philips
Reviews.Content: Location was wonderful, right on a canal across from the boat dock, a short walk to the Anne Frank house, grocery store and Dam Square. We walked from the train station but there is a bus and tram stop in fromt of Nadia. The staff was very helpful and always smiling and willing to chat. The stairs are as narrow and steep as we were warned. The lobby is up two flights up and our room was yet another flight up. The room was the smallest we have ever been in but had all we needed including a mini refrigator. We would definitely recommend this to the budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kabo_5
Reviews.Content: Though the room was somewhat small, the staff made up for it with heart. The staff are willing to carry your bags up the stairs and help you with anything you need. While I was traveling, it was my favourite hotel as the staff were approachable and cracking jokes. The location is fantastic as well - a quick walk to many sights! Overall I would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and enough for solotraveler.”
Reviews.Author: takota
Reviews.Content: hotel ie old structure,but cleaned every day. we can go to centraal station by walk,of corse can go to dam ,koninklijk paleis,can see wester kerk from winndow of breakfast room, can go to many nice shop. staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: dannmichele
Reviews.Content: This hotel proves that finding a hotel in a great location, with great service, and clean rooms is absolutely possible. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. They provided insight on getting around, gave us maps, and helped us with many other things that helped make our trip wonderful. They even held our bags for us for over 8 hours on the day we checked out before we had to leave for the train station. The breakfast room is quaint and cozy and a great way to meet other travelers. This hotel is exactly what we were hoping for with our Amsterdam experience. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel very close to Anne Frank house”
Reviews.Author: Heather503913
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for a short break. The service and welcome by the owner and his staff was excellent. The room we had was small but compact. It had everything we needed for a short stay - fridge, tea and coffee, shower, TV, phone, etc. It is an old narrow house coverted into a hotel. The stairs could have been a problem but our luggage was brought up by the staff. The owner was always very hospitable, giving us maps etc. on our first evening so that we found our way round the city very easily. It was our first time to Amsterdam and we enjoyed our stay very much. Iwould thoroughly recommend the hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam for a short break, as long as they were fit and could manage the steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, cosy and cute.”
Reviews.Author: jtelcs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was a nice place to stay during our trip to Amsterdam. The room was not the biggest, but spacious enough for the two of us. The balcony was particular nice in the morning where the sun was on it. Breakfast is good and there is always enough food. Great apples, and good Orange Juice. The staff is kind and helpful - all the time. Rooms are clean and tidy. Sometimes the traffic could wake you up during the evening. I will hopefully come back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dave2566
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Nadia for three nights and loved it. Our room was a single with a balcony and was perfect for us. The hotel is obviously older but very clean. Breakfast was included in the room rate and consisted of croissants and other simple breakfast items. As far as the location goes it is approximately a block from the Anne Frank House and the Westermarkt Tram/Bus stop is just across the canal. On foot we were able to reach the red light district in about 15-20 minutes but the walk consisted of taking in all that Amsterdam has to offer so it could be shortened. There is a grocery store less than a block away if needed and the area seemed to be semi-quiet at night (we were there on the weekend and didn't hear a thing). One thing to keep in mind about Nadia is that it is not the Four Seasons. However the staff was extremely helpful and nice, the room was just what we needed, and we have no complaints. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Robertlesage
Reviews.Content: We've stay 4 nights at this hotel and we were not unhappy!! Yes, the room is small (it's Europe, DUHH!) but for the price in Amsterdam, it was enough place for us :) And it's near the square, wich is a plus, obviously. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Good value for what you get! Good service, nice room. Maybe the breakfast could be upgraded, but it's still ok! Go there if you visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel I would strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: chiya_serena
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and I will recommend it to any friend. More than everything else all the staff there has one single goal: to make you feel at home. And they manage it. Rooms are tiny, but clean and with private bathroom. In every room a bunch of flowers will welcome you. The area, right behind Dam square, is pretty safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: nelcast
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. Staff were very friendly and helped us during our short stay (we traveled with a 2-year old). The hotel is located approx. 10-15 minutes from the train station, we think that the location is good. The only negative aspect of our room was that we could hear the noise from the adjacent roadway.

Reviews.Title: “they treated us like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: stylerchick
Reviews.Content: at first, i was a bit reluctant to book a '2 star' hotel, but, after reading all the positive comments here, i booked 2-2 nite stays. VERY conveniently located, we took tram 13( or 17) from amsterdam centraal, and the stop was a block away. we were 'buzzed in" (great security!!) and saw THE STEPS! yes, they are long and narrow, but sturdy rails on each side helped! the staff expects to carry your luggage up and down, and they do it very gladly. hazem was amazing, as were the rest of the staff. our canal room was small, but very cozy and efficient ( safe, fridge). a welcoming bouquet of flowers greeted us both times we arrived; the second had a card that said "welcome BACK home!" very nice! the corner/canal view breakfast room was a nice way to start the day; breads, yogurts, juice and great coffee in a nicely appointed room. if they are full, don't wait til 9:30 AM to get all you'd like, though ( breakfast is over @ 10). we've honestly never had such attentive service, and we will be back. you can not beat the location or the wonderful staff. smiles galore!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect launch pad for our outerspace Amsterdam Adventure!!!”
Reviews.Author: americanmonkeys
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Amsterdam. We loved everything about our stay from the gorgious views from the balcony to the warm and welcoming staff. The Nadia is full of hidden treasures, if you look hard enough you'll find yourself in Wonderland. We will be back, and hope to interduce our friends to Amsterdam through the eyes of The Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little Dutch hotel with great service in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: piper243
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit late at writing this review seeing as we were there in January but better late than never, right? My husband and I recently took an amazing two week trip around Europe and it was both of our first time visiting Amsterdam. We found Hotel Nadia on tripadvisor and are so glad we did! It was the perfect little Dutch hotel! The staff is amazing and completely takes care of you from start to finish...we arrived early and they had us wait in the cozy little breakfast room where we were given sandwiches and coffee even though breakfast was over. Didn't have to wait long before our room was ready...there were flowers on the desk and the most beautiful view of the canal and the old church (we found out very quickly that the bells of this particular church ring every 15 mins...we loved it!). Yes, the rooms are on the small side but it's Europe! They all are! We called it cozy - small but still fairly roomy - it was by far NOT the smallest we've encountered and everything was very comfortable. Very clean and organized as well. The wi-fi worked great and the breakfast was good. I would say the thing that made Nadia stand out was the staff...they were great and took care of everything for us! Your bags are up the stairs and in your room before you even know what's going on...they were always there for directions, suggestions, anything we needed. We were only there for two days and very much wished we could have stayed longer! Next time we're in Amsterdam, there's no question we'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind2211
Reviews.Content: A Fantastic hidden Gem in a terrific location. Old rustic charm, and ambiance galore .. The Nadia Hotel is a safe haven and spot you'll be happy to come back to ... even with all the stairs! It just adds to the charm! Highly recommended and guaranteed to make your trip to Amsterdam that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: TmeyerTRD
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was so nice and helpfull. Your luggage is in your room before you are, which is good because there is quite a few stairs to climb. Rooms are nice and comfy. If room is facing street you may want ear plugs because the trams run fairly late and can hear them roll by. Overall a very good place to stay. I can't wait to go back there .

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Dutch hotel with lovely canal views”
Reviews.Author: Chococat71
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast was good. The rooms may be a bit smaller than a big chain hotel, but they have lovely character and are in an old building that it typically Dutch with character rather than a mass produced chain hotel. It makes it all part of the Amsterdam experience. Very close to Anne Franks house and a short walk to Dam Square. It is an ideal base to explore Amsterdam from. I would happily stay here again, and wish that all hotels were run this way. Many thanks for a lovely stay. 5*

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benji023
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam and stayed for 6 nights at The Nadia Hotel. This hotel is full of character and charm. Our room was excellent with side canal view and large balcony - great to watch the world go by. Stairs are not for the feint-hearted but once you've mastered them they're no problem - just take your time going up and down on them. Staff great - couldn't do more for you. Room fine - everything you needed - especially the safe (no extra charge), fridge and tea & coffee facilities. Great to pop back during the day to have a cup of tea and refresh before setting out again. Super Indian restaurant just up the road - Koh in Noor and the Hotel Di Ann restaurant in same block as Nadia Hotel. Loved the breakfasts at the Nadia Hotel - Croissants, Bread Rolls with Strawberry Jam and plenty of Orange Juice. No problem finding a seat in the Breakfast Room. Breakfast is available from 7.30 - 10.30 daily. Great location - very handy for hopping on and off the Canal Bus as there are stops nearby. Looking forward to returning to Amsterdam and The Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lossie2
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried when I saw visitors photo's of the staircase I would have to climb, but in all honesty they were not as bad as I expected, seriously so don't let the thought of them put you off. We were 5 female friends and had been booked into a family room, yes beds dorm style..... and one small wet room with toilet and small sink..... But what a laugh we had. The Hotel provides friendly efficient service, we never made breakfast, but did sit in the breakfast room prior to depature where we were able to help ourselves to tea and coffee. The owner was very accomodating and I was able to use his computer to check into my flight. Will deffinately use the Nadia again if I am ever fortunate enough to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Karimaam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the room spaces are optimized to provide the comfort you need including a fridge, a safe and a kettle . Excellent service and a very friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: aly006
Reviews.Content: Really it was amazing vacation ,hotel is very clean with good location ,the staff is very freindly and helpful ,i hope to visit again. General farouk salama from Cairo.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & hospitable”
Reviews.Author: reigate4
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely welcoming family run hotel. There is a very friendly, relaxed atmosphere. The staff are helpful and considerate. The location is excellent for exploring all the sights in central Amsterdam. Breakfast is fine and gets the day off to a good start. The breakfast room seems to be open all day for coffee and a break and the staff encourage you to make use of the facilities. We had a family room for 4 which was well equipped and spacious with a view over the canal. The stairs are a challenge to all but in particular for the less able and elderly. Again the staff are very helpful with luggage, taking bags up and down and in our case keeping our bags in storage until we collected them at 7 in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: redharvestmpls
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for several nights while visiting Amsterdam in March. In my opinion, the hotel has pros and cons. On the plus side, it is centrally located in downtown Amsterdam and also easily accessible via public transportation. The signage is good at the hotel itself and the website had good directions, so it was easy to find for someone unfamiliar with the city. In addition, the staff could not have been more helpful, and their attitudes were very customer-service oriented. When I arrived a staff member offered to carry my suitcase to my room and offered me a welcome drink while they got the room ready. There were flowers in the room when I got there as well, which was a nice touch. The room included a mini-refrigerator and a safe, which was handy. Breakfast was included with my stay, and the breakfast room was nice and the hours convenient. Breakfast included beverages, bread and croissants, yogurt, etc. I experienced several cons, though. The reception area smelled strongly of smoke much of the time I was there, and it did filter up into my nonsmoking room. Also, the single room I stayed in was TINY. The bed was wedged between two walls, and because of that I don't know how a person taller than 5'5'' would be able to sleep in it comfortably. The room itself could have used some redecoration--the sheets and room chair were stained, the curtains were ripped and the bathroom towels were worn. Though I stayed on the back (i.e., quieter) side of the hotel, this hotel is centrally located and thus not in a quiet area. The Westerkerk is nearby, and the bells toll frequently, even throughout the night. In addition, there were birds nesting outside/above my window, and at night their cooing and moving about was pretty loud. Sleeping was difficult. The hotel also mentions on its website that a potential con for those with arthritis or knee problems is that there is a steep and fairly long staircase to the reception area from the street, and then additional stairs up to many of the rooms. For me, the cons unfortunately outweighed the pros, and I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladame5
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and comfortable room, hospitable staff - all in all a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “its all you need”
Reviews.Author: xohxbabyx
Reviews.Content: i stayued here in february with my boyfriend. we were just looking for a cheap couple of days away so picked this as was the best price with a good location. The rooms were very small but very clean and all you needed as we found out we were not in our room alot. The only thing i can say is that the room looked onto the road and you could constantly hear bikes and trams. But what do you expect - you are in amsterdam!!! The staff cannot do enough to help you. They were brilliant!!! The complimentary breakfast was ok but not alot on offer and get down early as we went down later and ther was nothing left. All in all this hotel is all you need and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, lovely room and had a great time !!!”
Reviews.Author: Leah098
Reviews.Content: Great views very clean and friendly welcoming people, very relaxing and calm loved every minute of it beautiful place highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest hotel we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: daiporth
Reviews.Content: If you have trouble with stairs this hotel might not suit you.as it is a typical old amsterdam building.For the same reason the rooms are naturally small. Having said that,the whole hotel is immaculately maintained and spotlessly clean.The staff are the most obliging we've met in our extensive travels,and really make you feel welcome. Another plus is the location of the hotel,very conveniently located and with a tram stop almost outside the door.,all in all we found this hotel suited us admirably.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, central, very friendly, steep stairs, breakfast improvable”
Reviews.Author: Guest110401
Reviews.Content: Good located nice Hotel for the best price. Complete inner city in walking distance. Room very small but clean. Really friendly people, fast free internet. You get a welcome drink, a free map and some useful info about AÂ´dam. Troublefree quick online booking. Had a quiet room to the backyard but troubles with very loud neigbours. Good mattress. You should not have problems with climbing real steep stairs. The breakfast was a bit poor: cold toast, slices of cheese, prepacked jam, apples.

Reviews.Title: “I would defanetly stay again if i go to amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: potter15
Reviews.Content: The service was very good the staf were frendly we stayed with all different ages some young children and some teenagers and adults the rooms were very good i had a large balcany with a big window and the rooms had a tv and a persnal toilet and a good desk. The location was good you could she every thing and you could see the boats going down the canals and there were a few shops round it and all the big shops were just a walk away. The best thing was the relaxation you could have round the staf and in the hotel i dont think i found anything that was bad but i loved the stay there and will deffenetly stay there again if i go to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location, very good room with good value!!”
Reviews.Author: RafaelRGB
Reviews.Content: I made my online reservation in Nadia Hotel in february without any problem. I have been in this hotel in march 2011. So when I arrived I was treated very well by receptionist. The single room is small, but clean and with all facilities. I got me a room facing the street (I recommend) and had no problems with noise.The breakfast was very good. Considering the good value and the excellent location, this hotel would be perfect if they exchanged the sprinkler of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back to hotel Nadia.”
Reviews.Author: abreeden
Reviews.Content: Just right, love the location... Staff very friendly.room was clean.. But if your a big person you may find it cramped ... And the flight of stairs ...well you better be fit!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tink0376
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our stay at the nadia hotel,from the moment we arrived we were greeted by the very friendly and helpful staff and were offered a welcome drink.The rooms are a little on the small side but for the amount of time we were in the room this did not bother us.At night there is alittle noise from the street below because the hotel is on a main road but the location is excellent so again did not mind.The rooms and the hotel is very clean and the sevice wonderful,it was my birthday whilst we were there and even though we had welcome flowers in the room when we arrived which i thouhgt was a nice touch the manager gave me some beautiful flowers for my birthday and it is these little touches that i would recommend anyone to stay at the hotel nadia i will certainly stay there again.Thank you hotel nadia for a great stay and making my birthday special.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, fantastic breakfast...little room”
Reviews.Author: Dexterino
Reviews.Content: Very good location, breakfast, cleanliness, staff! The room was a 1 - 2 people room and was small... Amsterdam is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia was good as you could walk to most places to visit”
Reviews.Author: karonmoore
Reviews.Content: The Nadia was ideal for us as we could walk to all the sights we wanted to visit. Trams were very frequent but it was nice to walk around and view Amsterdan by foot. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Would go back again .

Reviews.Title: “...you only think of fun because all the rest will think Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balzino
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel is fantastic! There had already been preceded the year in several times and we always return with pleasure. The staff are always polite, courteous and helpful ... they are all still smiling! The rooms are not very big but they are done very well, in particular, are very comfortable and equipped with all necessary amenities (refrigerator, TV, hair dryer, coffee maker, bathroom and shower room even though they are a little small in some rooms ) to spend a nice holiday, and the rooms are always neat and clean also because the cleaning is done every day and the staff will think to put your things in order even as well as everything else. Excellent value for money! is conveniently located (in practice, behind Dam square, 50 meters from the house of Anne Frank), then the center of all attractions. Overall my opinion to the Hotel Nadia is excellent. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Great simple hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelLover2003
Reviews.Content: Overall a wonderful small hotel with the friendliest staff in all of Amstedam. Also located in an excellent location. Can't wait to go back to Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: cutedog24
Reviews.Content: thank you nadia hotel for a brilliant stay in amsterdam, the staff cannot do enough for you.the location is exellent, special thanks to hasim for all his help.

Reviews.Title: “What the size of the rooms lacked, the outstanding hospitality made up for !”
Reviews.Author: lolaWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Myself and seven friends went to stay at the Hotel Nadia in Amsterdam last weekend. It was easy to book and when we arrived (apart from the daunting 37 steep steps to reception) we had the most fabulous welcome. All weekend the staff at the hotel could not do enough to make sure we were looked after, with one kind young man offering to carry our drunken bodies (should this be the case later on in the evening) up the stairs! Luckily, not being those sort of tourists, we never called upon this service, but it was good to know it was there. The rooms were very compact and bijou (sorry if spelt wrong) but once settled in, we found them adequate for our needs, with cleaning, fresh towels and shower and hand soaps available as well as tea and coffee facilities. We were offered tea and coffee in the breakfast room all day, which was lovely, at no extra cost. All in all, I would highly recommend the Nadia. Within it's price range i think we had the best there was and would definitely go back should I travel to Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Victoriahappytravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Nadia many times before (had to be in Amsterdam every month for business) and have always been very happy with my choice: Its ro etc. The rooms facing the street can be a bit loud (but only on weekend nights), but you can ask for a quiet room facing the back already when you do the online reservation and during the week even the street facing ones are quiet. Location is perfect, just on the corner of Raadhuisstraat aoms may be a bit on the small side, but they are squeaky clean with good beds and cozy atmosphere and nice views on the canal. All rooms have fridge, TV, functioning (!) internet (most other places I stayed at in Amsterdam claim they do, but then the connections never worked or were expensive), hair dryer, safe boxnd the Keizersgracht (canal) across the street from the Westerkerk and the Anne Frank Huis. The tram station is also just across the street. It's three short stops from Central Station (you can also walk; it's no more than 10-15 mins). Breakfast ist great: Good coffee, juice, croissants, toast, cheese, jams etc. It's all there and it's a lot better quality than in other places I've stayed in Amsterdam. Staff is extraordinarily friendly and they bend over backwards to fulfill your needs, be it extra blankets or a microwave or oven to heat up food. Reception is always staffed and you can come and go at every hour. Osam, the manager of the hotel, is a most welcoming host, and a delightful person to meet! I've recommended this place to many people over the last months (people I met on the train going into Amsterdam, friends etc.) and they all got back to me thanking me for my recommendation. All in all, I don't think you find better value in Amsterdam, especially in this price range. All in all: Enjoy! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mona009
Reviews.Content: We were very happy that we chose Nadia to be our hotel in Amsterdam. The location is absolutely exellent and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but contains everything you will need. We will definately stay at Nadia when we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debs071
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Friday to Sunday with a group of 7 friends - hotel staff were really welcoming, checked us in quickly and carried out bags from the bottom floor straight into our rooms. Rooms are small but adequate, warm and clean and as we didnt spend too much time there this was fine. This hotel's staff are what make this hotel special and cannot do enough for you even offering to carry us up the stairs if we came home drunk! If I returned to Amsterdam I would definitely return as its really central.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest place ever! And the chocolates they have at the front desk are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Doooie
Reviews.Content: Having read the overwhelmingly positive reviews on Trip Advisor, my girlfriend suggested the Hotel Nadia. At first I was skeptical about the size of the rooms - I'm a pretty big guy and I certainly like to have some space. Once we got there though it was not a problem at all - in fact the way that the cabinets and wall pieces are shaped, you actually get a phenomenal amount of usable space. The staff were excellent, and very welcoming right from the get go. Free drinks were given to us at both check in and check out, and the flowers we got in the room were really quite gorgeous. Breakfast was excellent - croissants, bread, Nutella, peanut butter, jams, cheese, yogurt, apples and orange juice made for a great breakfast to fuel up for loads of sightseeing. The shower was great in my opinion, and I loved the ceilings both in our room and in the dining room - you could see that what was once a majestic room of some sort had been converted into a large number of small but cozy rooms. The location cannot be beaten - Dam square is literally about 50 meters away. Within two blocks there are two pancake houses, a number of coffee shops and some Italian eateries that are just beautiful. Westerkerk is a block away, Anne Frank house about two blocks away. There are numerous coffee shops within the vicinity, where you can grab a great tasting latte or espresso or pursue ahem other interests. I think the best thing about our experience was our wonderful balcony where we could overlook what was going on. It is true, if you're looking for a bigger hotel room or absolutely can't stand smoke, it's probably not for you. Same goes if you are looking to get to bed before midnight, as the Trams rumble by until about then. Also, the stairs are surprisingly steep, but for those who can handle them, they add an element of dutch charm into the whole experience. Tram stops at Westerkerk just a block away, and from there you can get pretty much anywhere in the city - you can purchase a 24 hour all access tram pass for 7 Euro right on the tram, but to get the longer passes you need to either hit up a machine or go to somewhere like Centraal station where they have information kiosks. All in all, absolutely wonderful place to stay, and I would recommend to anyone looking for the perfect little place in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: trigglett
Reviews.Content: Don't worry about the stairs- the staff are down them to get your luggage as you press the bell to be let in!!..We can honestly say we have never felt more looked after where ever we've stayed and that includes 5* hotels nicola

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a traveller on their own.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_docko
Reviews.Content: Website very informative and as long as you are aware of the stairs on opening the door then you will not be surprised. Staff extremely helpful and courteous. Breakfast room is small but pleasant and food is plentiful. Room was small but for the amount of time I spent in it, it contained all the things I required. Loved the fresh flowers in the room on arrival - a quaint touch. Close to all main sites of interest. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: shiels87
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and have to say were very happy. At first we were a bit taken back with the decor but I have to say that the staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much bother. The rooms were very clean and the hotel was in a very good location being opposite the Anne Frank house with a lovely coffee shop Jennifers opposite. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would go back here, even when we had checked out we were still made welcome to stay on with our luggage being kept for free and tea/coffee still available, this was a first for us ! Many thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: leanne_pearc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a typical Amsterdam hotel where you will experience Amsterdam at it's best! I only have good words for this hotel and having stayed in hotels in Amsterdam at 150 euro plus, this hotel is value for money. Osam and the staff were very welcoming and the service was 5 star. There is no elevator and the stairs to the hotel on level 1 are steep but manageable (most Amsterdam hotels are like this!). It's the small things that made this hotel memorable such as the welcome drink, a run down of the area by Osam and flowers in the room. Room was clean and there was sufficient cupboard and shelf space. Tv with cable channels. Bathroom with toilet and shower. Breakfast was sufficient. Internet was free in the room. Perfect location on the canal and although we did not book a canal view we could see the canal from our room. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Dam Square, 15 minute walk to Leidseplein, 10 minute walk to central station and a 10 minute walk to the red light district. We decided to extend our stay by one night however Hotel Nadia was fully booked so we stayed at a hotel down the road, 4 star for 158 euro per night and i would have to say Hotel Nadia was better and for half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysblendsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the nadia for 7 days with 2 friends. we got the triple room with 3 twin beds. the rooms are small but very clean with lots of shelves. the 3 of us has no problem and werent tripping over each other. we had a street view room so it was a little it noisy when the trams came by and people starting coming out in the morning. its tolerable and earplugs will work just fine. the the bathroom is the cleanest hotel bathroom ive ever seen and the shower was amazing. The staff provided us with housekeeping everyday and a free breakfast. Everyone was SO nice and help us get around the city and get us transportation back to the airport. the stairs arent as bad as they sound i promise!! the location is great, right around the corner from the anne frank house and about 2 blocks from dam square, and there are plenty of restaurants in the area. I will definitely book at the Nadia again when i return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Hotel Nadia made us feel like we were home.”
Reviews.Author: Wanna_go_back_to_AMS
Reviews.Content: My stepson and I stayed at the Hotel Nadia twice this week. Sunday March 13 we checked in and checked out Wednesday morning for a quick trip via Thalys to Paris, France simply to visit the Eiffel Tower. Thursday March 17 we returned to Amsterdam and again to the Hotel Nadia where we were warmly greeted. We were given our original room with fresh flowers and a nice note with the message, "Welcome back home." Incidently, while we were away they were kind enough to hold one of my bags in storage for safe-keeping thus sparing us the burden of carrying it to Paris and back. . The rooms are ideal for two people and the shower was excellent! The water is nice and hot and provided quick relief to arthritis in my foot. The beds were extremely comfortable and the refrigerator kept my supply of coca-cola's cold. Each morning we enjoyed fresh juice, tea, and a variety of breakfast items. The breakfast room is very nice and offers a wonderful balcony view. We are already planning our next trip to Amsterdam for Summer 2012. The Hotel Nadia is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever.... !”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Lizy
Reviews.Content: Hello! I wanted to do something different and special for my birthday this year so my mum, dad, brother, boyfriend and I decided on a holiday.. When we first arrived at The Nadia Hotel we were greeted by the lovely staff who took our bags to our rooms for us. seeing that my brother would be alone in a room, they offered me, my bf and bro the quad delux corner room instead, which happens to be the bigggest room with the beeeeest views! We loved the room! The Sunday was my birthday and as soon as the staff found out, they all wished me happy birthday and brought beautiful flowers to my room too :) I was then known as the Princess for the rest of my stay :D The whole holiday was brilliant and the staff were the loveliest ever, soo friendly, helpful and devoted to our happiness and safety.. Overall 10 out of 10 all round, from the whole family.. especially me.. the 'Princess..' :) Thank You soo much Lots of Love Lizy x x x x x Ohhhh and my mum and I found the house cats who we just had to meet!! soo sweet :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small, friendly with good location”
Reviews.Author: dominic253
Reviews.Content: the street entrance was small, just a door way but well signed. The first thing you notice is the rather steep stairway climb to the reception. Those with mobility issues may want to check if there is a lift, we didn't see one. The receptionist was very friendly and offered us a free drink as a welcome. Explained all of the hotels services, free coffee on all day, breakfast, wifi etc. Our room was small, although clean and with all normal hotel services eg en suite, tv, fridge, safe, coffee and tea. It was a little tired. Overall good

Reviews.Title: “second stay”
Reviews.Author: smiithy
Reviews.Content: Our second stay, says it all realy, well looked after again, flowers a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sellerie
Reviews.Content: My first time in Amsterdam couldn't have been in a better hotel. Great location, very close to the Dam square. The staff was very nice and the rooms were a little small, but very cozy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Animal-escape
Reviews.Content: Hotel nadia is great value for money and well situated just a few minutes walk from the heart of the city! Lovely setting and great family run hotel! Would recommend to any one! With no big groups of singal sex guest the hotel is quite too!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this area if you want to get any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolTrish
Reviews.Content: I can't believe nobody has mentioned the noise in this area of Amsterdam! We certainly had no complaints about the hotel itself except the breakfast room is tiny. Staff are very friendly and helpful, we even had a call from the manager to say a room facing the canal had become available if we wanted to move but we had asked for a quiet room at the back so decided to stay there. Just over the road near the Ann Frank house is the oldest church in Amsterdam and it makes it's presence known every 15 minutes by ringing it's bells as if there is some sort of royal wedding taking place, then chimes out the time! this goes on all day and right through the night so if you are lucky, you can grab 10 minutes sleep before it kicks off again! A nice hotel, lovely city and our break completely spoiled by lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: clancy48
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the Nadia on the way to and from our holiday in Africa. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms, although small, were clean and adequate. It has a great location on the tram line, close to the Anne Frank House and within walking distance of pretty much everything one would need. We had a room facing the canal and did not find the noise an issue. The stairs are steep, but that would be normal for Amsterdam, besides they put our luggage in our room. They supplied a good breakfast and had free WiFi. They kept a winter bag for us while we were in Africa which we appreciated. Also,what we considered a very nice touch, was flowers in our room welcoming us back after our safari. It will be our regular hotel on our return trips to Europe. We had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “its ok for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimsbinned
Reviews.Content: it was ok this was our second stay with nadia staff are very nice and helpfull. wasnt great hotel the last room was better. the room was dirty floor crack in the window rip in the curtains and toilet very smelly as no window or vent in toilet. bed clothes had holes and very dusty rooms.the stairs are very steep and narrow and lots of them it has no lift and very old fashioned hotel. needs to be done up we paid 200 for 3 nights defently not worth the price i would recommend reting an appartment its the same price and much more spacious i will be sticking with stayamsterdam.com there brill. i wont be staying again but the staff are great. good location 5 min walk to dam square, trams busses and ten mins from central station.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure and Great way to enjoy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey_11
Reviews.Content: Wow, We arrived by train short walk to hotel, Michelle was kind, helpful and made our stay a treasured experince. Upgraded our room at no cost to us. Fresh flowers in our room overlooking the canal. Great location Close to Dam Square, Anne Frank house, nice part of town. Could not be more pleased!!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good price, lovely staff, comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: damveterans
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have come back to the Nadia. The location is the best thing, around a 7 minute walk until your at dam square and everything you need. The staff are very friendly and helpful, you needn't worry about climbing the stairs with your case as they come down and collect it. They've recognised us everytime and you still get the usual complementary drink on arrival. The rooms are tiny, theres no other word for them but they are clean! We get the balcony room which is nice as its a bit more space to use! The staff arent pushy, if you dont want the room cleaned on certain days they leave it until you want it done which is nice if your only staying 2 nights and have your own towels etc. Saras pancake house next door is worth a visit although the pancake bakery near Ann Franks' house tops it (Sara isnt very happy most of the time!).

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Wowtraveler13
Reviews.Content: The Nadia is a great location and the staff is warm, friendly and helpful. If you are American, you'll say the rooms are small, bu I loved my stay and all the "extras" The staff went out of their way to be accomodating and you can't beat the location. It can be a little noisey because of the tram and street but most of Amsterdam is. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gofrogs817
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and enjoyed the hotel and their hospitality. There is no lift, so plan accordingly. They did deliver all our luggage to our room on the 4th floor but if your not into very steep stairs, you may want to look elsewhere. Also, our room at least, was on the steet side of the hotel and there is a tram and a good amount of traffic and it was a bit noisy. Overall, very good value and great location, right in the middle of town and equidistant betweem the Leidsplein and the train station, and a 2 minute walk to the Anne Frank House.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy ...”
Reviews.Author: _NF_70
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, good service and a lovely breakfast. They did not lie about the stairs, very steep but luckily our luggage was carried up and down for us. We had a room with a balcony at the front of the hotel. Amsterdam is not a quiet city so keep this in mind when booking a room. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room at the back ;-) We had a very nice stay, good value specially because it is so near to everything ! We are already looking forward to book this hotel again on our next trip to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kela99
Reviews.Content: Believe the beautiful pictures on the web site, that is what you get! My boyfriend and I stayed two nights in early March. The room is lovely decorated, quiet and clean, superisingly with fridge and water cocker in the room, which brought a lot of convinience.
