The Hotel is in the City Central naxt to the Dam, the Train station is just 1 minute walk away, leading us to the central station in 5 minutes and all other fanous views in 10 minutes. The Manager and all staffs are very, very nice. WLAN is free. Staying in the breakfast room with phantastic over the river was a great experience. Only the space in the room is limited but sufficient, well you can not beat the location. Will choose it again for my next stay in Amsterdan, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JemPem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days during July lasy year. Was very easy to get to with the shuttle bus service at Shipol Airport. Location was great, only a 3 minute walk to Anne Frank House and around 5 minute walk to Dam Square. Very basic rooms but they were very clean and the staff were very helpful. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights 26th feb - 1st march. It was reccommend to me by a friend and it was perfect...staff were very friendly and helpful, room was small but very clean,we had a balcony which was nice..there was some street noise but it didnt bother me or my boyfriend. Its in a perfect location and if like us u dont make it up for breakfast theres a lovely pancake house right beside it to keep you goin for the day! All tourist sights are in walking distance and theres a tram right outside! When i return to Amsterdam which i definatily will..i will be staying at Hotel Nadia :)

Reviews.Title: “Superbly clean and comfortable room, a home from home, will be definately returning!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKate
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband booked the Nadia for a relaxing birthday four day break after reading the excellent reviews that we had read on here (our travel bible!) I, myself work for an airline and have stayed in many hotels accross the globe over the years, and this is definately one of my favourites. The service, we were greeted at the door by a happy, smiling Hazem, who promptly took our cases off us and whisked them immediately to our room. Hazem laughed and joked with us about the stairs (as you have probably seen the pictures on here, but not so bad) and said that he would carry us up to our rooms if we were unable to make them of an evening, which I am glad to say was not needed :-) Osam the owner/manager was waiting to greet us in reception with a welcome drink and a ton of helpful information and leaflets etc on the local area and recommendations for bike hire etc, without us having to ask. Many hotels I have found also charge for the safes, and I was pleasantly suprised to find the Nadia do not. I was also impressed by the fact that it was so security conscious and had a buzzer and camera on the door to let you in, we felt very safe there. Also there was always someone on reception to let you in and deal with any enquiries day or night. Our room was very comfortable with a fantastic view, room 413 on the top floor looking over at the canal, Westerkirk and Ann Frank Haus. The bed was lovely with a feather quilt and pillows, and loved the walk-in dressing area and fresh flowers in the room. Tea and coffee making facilites also very handy. The breakfast room is very charming, and we loved the LCD tv on the wall with the calming beach, listening to the waves crashing on the shore! The coffee is to die for and the croissants, and the very helpful staff will make you toast if you ask. We throuroughly enjoyed the breakfast and it set us up for the day to explore etc. The bike hire place they recommended was excellent too if you are thinking of hiring bikes, and just around the corner. Location, excellent! I have been to Amsterdam twice before and never had the luxury of staying so near to the centre and be on the tram route, it was so close to everything and in a very pretty area with everything close by, including Dam Square only two mins away. I thoroughly recommend the farmers market also (on a Saturday only) where we tried oysters for the first time and brought some tasty dutch cheese (after tasting the whole stall!) and some crafts. We also went to the bigger daily market on Albert Cuperstaat which was worth a visit. We never got to visit the Ann Frank Haus as everytime we went to go the queues were very long, but you would need to get there very early or late I think. All in all we had a perfect stay at the Nadia and we would definately go again, nothing was too much trouble and we felt really welcomed on arrival, book it, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yubecha
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly and helpful staff. Vertical living is very Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: JSL23
Reviews.Content: This hotel has fantastic service and staff. Before, I even left for Amsterdam, I phoned the hotel to ask about directions from the Schipol airport to the hotel. The lady on the phone was very patient and went through all the different options with me. There was also a friendly staff member named Hazem who was very helpful and cheerful. He always had a smile on his face! When we first arrived, we received a complimentary drink of either a bottle of water or soda and had welcome flowers in our room. We asked for a room with a canal view and we got one for an extra Â£15 pounds per night. It was definitely worth it! Get a canal view if you can! The room was very small and dated but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also small but very clean. The room had free Wi-fi which was a bonus! The location was superb. It was only 5 minutes away from Dam Square and Anne Frank's House. A word of advice, book your Anne Frank's House tickets online to avoid the line-ups. All in all, the hotel was of great value in a handy location. Also, you can't beat the service and friendliness of the staff. If I were to go back to Amsterdam, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: db1527
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of character, unlike so many of the "chains". We found the staff efficient but also very friendly, welcoming and helpful. On arrival we were offered a complementary soft drink and were delighted to find fresh flowers waiting for us in our room along with our luggage. At the end of our stay we were able to leave our suitcases in the room from where they were collected and stored until we were ready to collect them later in the day. Our woodpanelled room overlooked one of the canals and from the window we could see the square where Anne Frank's house is located. Although not very large, the room was comfortable and had an excellent shower with plenty of hot water. From the hotel we could walk to Dam Square in about 10 mimutes and a tram stopped nearby which we used for Central Station and also for the Museum District. We were also able to walk to some excellent nearby reastaurants and cafes. As the hotel is part of a traditional Amsterdam building, the door from the street opens immediately onto steep narrow stairs which are not suitable for the frail or, perhaps, young chidren. However, we found the hotel combined unusual , almost old fashioned surroundings with 21st century service.

Reviews.Title: “Filled with quirky dutch charm”
Reviews.Author: MrTilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a 5th floor double room on the street side of the hotel. It was a suprise to climb 2 flights of stairs to the reception but the staff were very obliging and carried up our bags ... not something I'd care to do more than once let alone all day long! The temperature was well below freezing on the streets but as we ascended we soon worked up a sweat and found the radiator was at max in our room. The brochure states that the rooms were renovated 10 years ago. Ours was looking a little tired now but it was designed to make the most of the space and giving a fine view of the street below. Herein lies our only reservation ... it was not the quiet room we'd requested. Trams rumbled and clanked by outside well into the night and kicked off again at 6:00 next morning. Still if you're as tired as we were and pack some ear-plugs the accommodation is well worth the price we paid. It's a stone's throw from all the sites and easy to locate. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby and it's an ideal base for walking the canals, shopping, taking photos of the city life, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Perfect Location Perfect Price”
Reviews.Author: purelyleisure
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed for one night in February, the hotel is located at the top of the 9 Nine Streets, which one of the most beautiful parts of Amsterdam. All the Staff are very friendly and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. Our room was quite small, but well equipped and very clean. It also had a balcony overlooking the road, great if your noisy and love people watching. The size of the room is reflected in the price of this hotel, but every other aspect is excellent, especially for the price. I will 100% be staying in this hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant. Lovely. Friendly. Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mattlewist9t9
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at about 3pm Saturday 18th Feb and stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is on Raadhuisstraat, which is really easy to find from the train station and is about 0.6 miles away. Location is absolutely perfect. Had to buzz to get in. As soon as the door opened we were warmly greeted and our bags taken by the staff for storage. our reservation was dealt with promptly and with ease, and we were both given a complimentary welcome drink, which was a lovely touch. we were asked to wait in the breakfast lounge before the staff soon returned to take us to our room (no 210). you could tell straight away that this is a very friendly and relaxed place to be. our room was brilliant, so clean and with a balcony, tv, phone, fridge, safe, kettle/coffee/tea/etc. it was a fairly small room, but i think this is probably the case in many amsterdam hotels due to the building structure. - it certainly added to its character anyway, we loved it!! another lovely touch to the room was a "welcome" bunch of flowers. 24 hour reception means you can return at any time throughout the night. fresh towels were offered daily. we heard no noise from other guests when we were sleeping too. Breakfast was continental; croissants, bread, various spreads and jams, cheese, yoghurt, etc. a great way to start the day!!! yesterday (21st feb) was my birthday, and after i had returned to our room from breakfast, the room was re-made, and another, bigger bunch of flowers with a card saying "happy birthday!" - a lovely personal touch. even on checkout today, we were welcomed to return before we headed home, where we could sit in the breakfast lounge and drink tea and coffee... we took them up to the offer!! baggage was also stored securely for us, ready to collect when we were ready to leave amsterdam. to summarise, definitely use this hotel, we will us it again!! the staff were an absolute delight - so friendly, and i think this is why this hotel is so popular. thank you for your kindness and hospitality and thank you for my birthday flowers!! room 210, 18/2/11 - 22/2/11

Reviews.Title: “small but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sirjoe76
Reviews.Content: small room, but nice and clean. very comfortable beds. we didn't spend much time in the hotel. I mean, you're in amsterdam.. when we travel, it is important for us, where the hotel is located and how the beds are. Both was excellent. So, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel/good location”
Reviews.Author: marriot01
Reviews.Content: Great value for the location and the city! Excellent and helpful staff. IÂ´ll go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “tiny but nice if you get a room with a balcony”
Reviews.Author: 68XXX70
Reviews.Content: Reception area was very nice. We waited in the beautiful breakfast room while a young man carried our luggage up the two flights of stairs. We were given a choice of a cold beverage as well. The room is very tiny, but manageable.There was a bouquet of flowers on the desk in the room when we arrived. We got a room with a balcony and spent the evenings relaxing out on it overlooking a canal and the Wester Kerk. We had a mini-fridge that helped with not having to eat out as much. The bathroom is tiny. Breakfast consisted of mini-yogurts, various breads, cheese, orange juice, tea and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel in a lovely city!”
Reviews.Author: gct62
Reviews.Content: my wife and I have just returned from a lovely stay in Amsterdam, at the Nadia Hotel, the whole hotel experience was excellent, spotlessly clean and very friendly. nothing was too much trouble we even got a lovely welcoming basket of flowers and free arrival drinks. thank you very much to everyone at the Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: jennyg1965
Reviews.Content: When we arrived and looked up the steep staircase we wondered how on earth we were going to get our luggage up there, but before we knew a man ran down and took our cases for us. Staff are the most friendly and helpful that I have ever encountered anywhere, nothing was too much trouble and they offered us a cold drink (at no charge) each day when we returned to pick up our key from reception. They even let us use the computer in their private offices to check in and print our boarding passes the night before we flew home (also at no charge). There was free wi fi which worked well. We were upgraded from a twin to a triple room so that we had room for our luggage. The room wasn't all that big, but had a cupboard, plenty of shelves, a small fridge and a TV, also tea & coffee making facilities. The bathroom was tiny and the floor got wet when we had a shower, but no big deal. The room was very clean. We had a balcony and there was a fair bit of traffic noise at night, but this really didn't bother us. The location is great, a few minutes walk to Dam Square in one direction and the Anne Frank House in the other and about a 10-15 minute walk to Centraal Station. The stairs are very steep and narrow, not good for the elderly, disabled or small children, but no problem for us. Breakfast was fine, filling but not too much variety, could have done with some cereal or toast. It was basically croissants, bread rolls, cheese, the tiniest yoghurts I've ever seen, juice and coffee. The breakfast room is very pleasant. We enjoyed our stay at Nadia Hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room, great people”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonW
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful and welcoming, Osam and his staff have created a very special place to stay. I don't wish to make this so popular that I am unable to book next time I visit but if you wish a clean, hospitable and affordable stay in a great location, this is the place for you. PS - There are stairs, lots of stairs

Reviews.Title: “good value great location”
Reviews.Author: erniegrundy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean, helpfull staff, did not sample breakfast, had room facing main road with balcony traffic noise did not bother us, excellent location not to far to walk to bars resteraunts,red light etc, would definatly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be going back to stay”
Reviews.Author: nuggetina
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the Nadia Hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The manager is so generous, thoughtful and really goes the extra mile to make you feel very welcome. We had a very happy stay from the moment we arrived was looked after very well. Couldn't of picked anywhere more suitable to stay for a long weekend. Our room had free safe, fridge, tea and coffee and fresh flowers. Cleaned every day. Hotel is by no 17 tram stop, and only a 5 min walk from Dam Square. Lots of nice places to eat and drink nearby. Felt safe and secure. Don't hesitate, book it - very glad we did and would recommend to all (who can manage steep stairs!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good service and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobinLynch
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights mid-week, as a base to see Amsterdam and visit the Van Gogh museum. Hotel is 5 minutes walk from the "Dam" square, and so ideally placed for tourism. Canal boat "Stop and Go" at Ann Frank's house just round corner, tram to Centraal station stop just along road. We had a great time, on canals, at museum, walking tour, eating etc. etc. Red light district unmissable, for architecture and history as well as the sights. The hotel was great as an inexpensive base, room very small and cosy, beds narrow and a bit hard for our taste. Breakfast was continental and fine. The steps up from the street are like a cliff face! But the staff insisted on moving your luggage at every opportunity, so it was only yourself that you needed to manoeuvre up and down. Thoroughly satisfied with hotel and recommend for a brief stay. Any longer than 2 / 3 days, and the cosy would become cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: deertraveller
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It does have steep stairs (which is quite fun) and a room is small but it's so cozy. When I arrived they offered me an welcome drink! I had a room with nice view of the old buildings and canal. The staff are so friendly and nice too. I just loved staying at this hotel and definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who can manage to go up th steep stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quirky rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: booth333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly and are only too happy to give you any information you need on local sights etc. The rooms are a little compact and quirky but very clean, lovely views of the canal from our room and balcony, there is a daily maid service of your room. Overall very good value for money and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, it is in a very central location just a short (5 mins) walk to Dam square and Anne Frank's house.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the lable”
Reviews.Author: DublinEil
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Nadia hotel and found it was very close to centre of city it was very clean yes rooms are small but so are all rooms in Amsterdam city centre. I would like to say thank you to all the staff who are so helpfull. We had a room with a balcony my husband loved it because he did have to go down the narrow stairs to smoke If i had one problem it would be the noise from the main road from traffic but if you dont mind that you wont get better for the price and i have been in Amsterdam many times

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: kittylarks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was very convenient, clean and comfortable. The staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. The bedroom was nice with a canal view. Couldn't fault it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I always look forward to returning to this special place”
Reviews.Author: MandarinaHamburg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Nadia 1-2 a year for the past 5 years and every time the staff at the hotel make me feel like returning home. The hotel has really become my home away from home. The staff are always very friendly and helpful, the rooms extremely clean and the location is great for walking through Amsterdam. All in all it is the perfect place to stay, if you go to Amsterdam on business or leisure and I can recommend Hotel Nadia to all wanting to go to Amsterdam on a trip. And to the staff of the Hotel nadia: Thank you so much for the wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: goob61
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the online booking system of the hotel website. The manager, Osam, contected me and arrange everything. The price was the best i could get in amsterdam, by far. the rooms are decent, the service very good, and complimentary breakfast for my early arrival. no lift, but a rather big staircase, but the hotel personel carried my luggage to and from the room. good location to explore amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vintage60763
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent ! It is very centrally located close to Dam Square and right across the street from the Anne Frank house plus it is within walking distance to may other attractions. There is no elevator and it does have steep stairs (which seems to be normal in Amsterdam) but the staff bring your bags up for you. I had a single room with bathroom which was small but what you expect in Europe it was very clean had a fridge,safe, a kettle for tea and coffee which was also provided. The staff were great , very friendly and welcoming and answered my many questions with a smile I initially had been looking into a room with a balcony but went with the one without as it was cheaper but the manager upgraded me to a double room with balcony for my last two days which was a very nice surprise. I can not say enough about this hotel or its staff and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Roger_of_Ashenbury
Reviews.Content: Well located close to Anne Frank's House and canal walks. Comfortable rather than spacious rooms and extremely helpful and friendly staff. (Particularly Hazem who carried my bag up the entry stairs!). Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Gold heart, Green thumb”
Reviews.Author: Ziggyboy
Reviews.Content: On our summer European vacation, we planned to travel to Amsterdam. We referred to the Tripadvisor selection of hotels in Amsterdam while in Germany and emailed a reservation for 4 adults at the Nadia. They responded promptly and offered us 2 rooms. When we arrived at the Amsterdam train station we decided to walk to the Hotel. The reviews said it was within walking distance. With our bags in tow, the first thing we notice was the bicycle parking compound. There were literally thousands of bicycles parked there. The walk was quite exciting, looking in the shops and walking past the canals. When we arrived, we buzzed to enter. The door was opened and there it was, the steep stairway to the hotel desk and rooms. I wouldn't advise staying here if you have trouble with stairs, as there were no elevators here. Don't worry about the luggage. The staff will take care of bringing them to your rooms. We were told that our rooms weren't quite ready and so we were directed to the cozy little breakfast room and offered a complimentary beverage. I think the staff needed the time to bring the luggage and bouquets of fresh cut flowers in the rooms. ROOMS: The rooms are quite small, but comfortable. We had room #4. In it we had 2 Single Beds, a Water Closet, Shower, Basin, TV, and Phone The room had a large window, with a canal and church view. BREAKFAST There is a cozy room set up with a buffet style breakfast and a tiny balcony with a great view. STAFF The staff were the friendliest and most accomodating that I've encountered so far. Mr. Osam (manager) offered to show us his flower garden that is nestled in the hotel complex. The door to enter is about 18 to 20 inches in width. When you enter you'll see various exotic plants and a collection of garden gnomes. He takes alot of pride in his collection and we felt honored to be able to view them. NEARBY ATTRACTION The Anne Frank Huis is about a block away. Just past the church and along the canal. We accidentally stumbled across it, while on a walk. If you are looking for a unique, cozy and welcoming place to stay in Amsterdam, I recommend the Nadia. When in Amsterdam, visit the floating Sea Palace Chinese Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice of stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sherine_m
Reviews.Content: Charming. Friendly. Warm. Those were just my first impressions of Nadia Hotel upon climbing up its narrow staircase (which may seem annoying at first, but trust me, you learn to love it and later on it becomes part of the hotel's charming quirks). The super friendly staff help you with your bags up the staircase, and you're greeted with a refreshing (and probably much needed after the hassel of travel) welcome drink. You absolutely MUST check out their rocking selection if pocket-sized cards of the city's recommended attractions; you'll find them opposite the reception desk, and some cards even offer discounts on places/free drinks. Perfect start to exploring Amsterdam! The hotel's location is also not a bad start whatsoever to exploring the city; my boyfriend and I walked everywhere from the hotel. It's right behind the hip Nine Streets, and there are lots if cafes, restaurants (please try foodism - a tiny restaurant not far from the hotel with amazing pasta, friendly staff, and cool jazz playing in the background), and shops outside the Nine Streets around the hotel. There's cable tv in the rooms with channels in almost every language, there was a tiny fridge in the room which was a life-saver, as well as a kettle and coffe, sugar and milk. The pillows are also super comfortable, and there's a safe in the room, which was very comforting. The bathroom is quiet small, but it didn't bother us at all as there was always hot water running with great pressure. It honestly felt like a home away from home, and we were genuinely quiet sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in the centre of Amserdam!”
Reviews.Author: steffi42
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel the first thing you see are the 37 or so VERY steep stairs if you can manage these all else is good. The room itself although on the small side (usual for amsterdam) was spotlessly clean, we had one with a balcony as we are smokers, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed i have ever slept in at a hotel , we had flowers as a welcome gift and also tea and coffee making facilities, the bathroom although a tight squeeze had everything required. Breakfast was ok the only thing i would say is that a bit more choice or variety would have been nice. The location was great just outside the mania of dam square but only 5 mins walk and literally across the road from Anne Franks house. The staff in the hotel were all very helpful and friendly. On the whole a cracking little hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “compact with great service”
Reviews.Author: whatever040
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and the service was friendly and efficient as the first time. Close to the city center, attractions and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the rooms are small, but clean, very warm and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: mauimau985
Reviews.Content: The service was good. The employes were nice and helpfull. I only aspected breakfast, even with savoury choices (for example: English breakfast), but that wasn't an important problem. breakfast was in everycase wholesome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JennyBee09
Reviews.Content: Everything we read here about this hotel was true. Excellent service, great staff, clean rooms and toilette, a welcome drink and fresh flowers in our room and all that at a reasonable price. The location of the hotel is excellent, 5 minutes from the Dam but still quiet enough for a good night's sleep. Our room was small but perfect!!We were really feeling sad when we had to leave the hotel and Amsterdam as well! I would recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay here again if in Amsterdam. The hotel and the staff really contributed in us having a good time here.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: skura
Reviews.Content: welcoming drinks, super kind staff, tea room always open and FREE, doctor always ready to come and visit you if you need, very clean rooms, they keep your luggage for long time for free. SUPER ADVISED!!!!! Carla & MassY from Rome

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly staff, cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: leuvendirector
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Nadia several times, as a family and with large groups. Upon check in you are offered a cold beverage and you can relax in the breakfast room while the staff takes your bags to your room. (A word of warning: the central staircase to the lobby is quite steep.) Many of the rooms have views onto the Kaisergracht canal and Westerkerk (where Rembrandt is buried). The rooms are small but quite clean and cozy (often with a vase of fresh flowers), with wood panelling reminiscent of ship staterooms. Wi-Fi is available. There is some street noise, but the halls are very quiet. The hotel is located a block from the Anne Frank House. The Dam (central square) is five-minute walk (a few blocks). A large grocery store is also close by. And the tram is just outside the entrance. The staff is welcoming, cheerful, accommodating, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Bob08765
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Nadia three times over the past few years. I highly recommend this hotel for its perfect location, charming rooms, and terrific staff.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: stinky1982
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful and the excellently located hotel was lovely and the rooms were quaint, although very small. The breakfast was very nice. Unfortunately it was very noisey with the local traffic noise and the smoking laws in amsterdam meant that there was lots of smoking in the hotel which drifted under the door in the morning. Despite this I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very cosy place in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: herveclavier
Reviews.Content: Very well situated, this charming hotel has a very good quality / price ratio..Small rooms but well equiped and clean. Familial athmosphere. Michele is very nice and speak perfect french..We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A happy bargain”
Reviews.Author: Cautious_explorer
Reviews.Content: A splendidly agreeable place to stay: I don't think I can remember ever having stayed at a place where everyone was so naturally friendly. Plenty of steep stairs, but these are absolutely no problem; compact but comfy and clean rooms; and they will make you coffee or tea throughout the day without charge or complaint: it makes all the difference in what is a rather pricy city. It's in an excellent location, and they do a fine job. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Cosy and very friendly hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: jemdrum
Reviews.Content: The saff were all very welcoming, informative and helpful. My wife and I booked a double for us and a single for our teenage daughter. We got bumped up to the family triple which had a better shower and small bath . Our daughters room was VERY compact . Dark wood' warm and cosy. The web site says 10 minutes from the central railway but we found it a comfortable 20 minutes with suitcases.Simple but delicious breakfast. Very close to Dam Square. Definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Nice room, services and location”
Reviews.Author: PauloPinatti
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed 2 days at the hotel and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff is very nice, the room is clean and very confortable. I would stay there again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!(paradise!!!)”
Reviews.Author: DUTCH162
Reviews.Content: we have been to this hotel at least 24 times over the last seven years&will not stay anywhere else!!!we are treated like family!!!All the staff are friendly&trust worthy who go out of their way to make you feel welcome!!Nothing is to much trouble!!as someone who has worked in the hotel trade this hotel is a gem&i have recommended it to lots of family &friends over the years&have never had a bad report from anyone!!The rooms are of a good size&always very clean with plenty of hot water&clean towels!!tea&coffee making facilities are refilled daily!!i can't praise Osam &his staff enough and am looking forward to seeing them all again in May!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's everything you would expect from the reviews ... Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a single female traveler I chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and it absolutely delivered! On arrival Osam the manager greeted me and offered a welcome drink. I waited in breakfast room while they brought my bags up to my room. Yes the stairs are steep but I had expected that and just walked carefully. I had a single room on the 4th floor facing the streets but with a double bed. The noise and tram did not bother me at all as some had complained. The room was narrow and small but everything functional and CLEAN! The only complaint I have is that the room got so hot it was a bit unbearable so I had to open the window (considering that it was winter this is not so bad). The water pressure was good but sometimes the knobs are sensitive and water got too hot or too cold. The attitude of hotel is personable, friendly and helpful. The reception offered me a hair dryer and a converter to charge my batteries. The breakfast room is cozy. The croissant was so fresh and delicious!! The location is excellent and only 6 min walk to dam square. I felt safe in this neighbourhood walking at night. My flight was in late afternoon so stored my bags with them while I went to Anne Frank House in the morning. When I came back to retrieve my bags Osam called from offsite to personally thank me and say goodbye. I had a really nice stay, thanks Osam and staff!

Reviews.Title: “our stay at nadia hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaela-harkin
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at hotel nadia, its location is great, staff really helpful and friendly, the room was small but fine for us and nice and clean, we will be in Amsterdam again this year and would not want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A true Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jer7272
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, From the moment the we arrived we were thrilled. They helped us right away carrying the bags up the the two flights of stairs and offered us coffee, tea or soft drinks. When we were shown our room we had an amazing view of one of the old churches in Amsterdam and the beautiful canal. The room was smaller like most European hotels but was really well layed out with refridge, tv, coffee and beautiful fresh flowers. The staff was great and really worked hard to make sure that you were enjoying your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The hospitality of the staff and location of Nadia Hotel made our visit to Amsterdam complete”
Reviews.Author: qawraStPaulsBay
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is a very clean small hotel in the heart of Amsterdam with charming and hospitable staff. On arrival the smiling face of Michele or one the other receptionists will greet you with a welcome drink. Hazem insists to carry your luggage upstairs to your room and makes you welcome. Fresh flowers in the room on arrival adds to the friendliness of this hotel.On departure,the manager Mr Osam will find time to bid you fairwell.

Reviews.Title: “A home in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RoteWolf
Reviews.Content: On several occasions I have had the pleasure of staying at the Nadia Hotel in Amsterdam. This reasonably priced hotel in the heart of town is characterised by cleanliness, hospitality and service. The staff are professional and welcoming, and the rooms I have stayed in are always presentable and well kept. People with walking difficulties may have problems with the steep steps of the building, but other than this I believe this hotel to be ideal for a shorter stays in Amsterdam - whether one is a backpacker, a couple on a romantic getaway or a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but very charming”
Reviews.Author: BBraderman
Reviews.Content: Once you climb the steps and in spite of the very small single room, a very clean and charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great hospitalty”
Reviews.Author: mesut75
Reviews.Content: room was nice and hotel stuff were very friendly and helpfuly...

Reviews.Title: “A dream location for the self-employed professional on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: TheGownRack
Reviews.Content: These are the three reasons why this is my hotel of choice in Amsterdam. 1. Price. The hotel offers amazingly efficient single rooms that fit my budget. 2. Location. You cannot get closer, for the price, to the heart of the city. 3. Amenities. Everything I need, as a professional, is in my room! Wireless internet, phone (even though I voip) it's great for local calling, a clean bathroom with a hot, high pressure shower, a desk workspace with adequate lighting and power sources for all my gadgets, a fridge so I can do my own grocery shopping, a TV to relax, tea & coffee service, a comfortable bed and a private safe so I can leave travel documents, etc. in my room when I head out for the day. There are beautiful old steep stairs throughout the hotel, no elevator, and therefore perfect for the young & fit go-getters. Don't worry, the staff insists on carrying all bulky luggage for you. Very friendly staff and the perfect start to every morning with an essential breakfast! I had the coffee, orange juice and a jumbo croissant with cheese and honey on the side. For me, there is no reason to stay anywhere else when I come to Amsterdam on business. It fits my budget and my personality. I will be at Hotel Nadia next time, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: michelle245
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel management and an all around wonderful experience! Nice safe hotel to take your family if you are traveling on a budget! The freach flowers were a very nice touch! Breaksfast included was very nice too! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: NancyT007
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had such a fantastic time staying at this hotel. The location was great; everywhere we wanted to go was an easy walk. The room was comfortable, with some English stations on the TV, and a fabulous balcony with a great view. There was a mini fridge, which was so convenient. We were able to buy a few drinks and some food at a local supermarket so we didn't have to eat at restaurants all the time. The breakfast room was inviting, and the food was yummy. The best part about the hotel, though, was the staff. Having just come from a very cold, unfriendly hotel in Paris where no one even smiled, we were thrilled to be greeted so warmly by everyone at the Hotel Nadia. Our bags were immediately taken up the slightly scary staircase for us, and the people at the front desk offered us complimentary beverages right away, which was so nice after travelling all day. They were ready with their guidebooks to help us explore Amsterdam, and our room even had fresh flowers. They have a couple of cats there (very quiet, well-behaved cats), which made the place feel like home to us. All in all, a fabulous experience. We thank you so much for making our stay in Amsterdam a memorable one, Hotel Nadia. :o) Nancy and Jason

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nicest management, best location, highly reccomended.”
Reviews.Author: thoff10123
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Nadia during the holidays and we have had the same experience both times. This is a budget hotel with small rooms and steep staircases (not for those who are out of shape). However, the rooms are well designed with lots of shelves and storage, very clean and comfortable, all with fridge, safe and free wifi. The family that runs the hotel go overboard in making you feel welcome and attending to your special requests quickly and graciously. The free continental breakfast is fine and the coffee (served all day) and croissants, excellent. If you know Amsterdam and want to stay in a beautiful canal neighborhood, near the "9 Streets", on the edge of the "Jordaan", the location cannot be beat. Short walk to the Dam, the big Albert Hein, Leidsestraat, near many tram lines, but still in a quieter, residential part of the old city. Lots of small, excellent neighborhood restaurants a short walk ( 't Zwaantje on Berenstraat an de Struisvogel at Keizergracht 312 are among our favorites).

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I HAVE EVER STAYED IN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sheri66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam for a long over due vacation! Our stay at Hotel Nadia was TOPS!!!! The staff was the BEST staff of any hotel we have ever stayed in!! We have traveled quite a bit since we have lived overseas and haven't yet stayed in a hotel as nice as this one!! They went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that we had everything we needed! The hotel is quaint and is located in an awesome location. The tram stop is within walking distance of the hotel which was great!! It was VERY clean through out the entire hotel. And the breakfast room was great and the food was just as great!!! I highly recommend Hotel Nadia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: FreakwentFlyer69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fine location overlooking the canal and the Westerkerk. Handy for Dam Square also. In less snowy weather the other main attractions are within easy walking distance. Our room was on the small side, though it had everything we needed. To be fair, the size of the room goes with that type of building in Amsterdam. It was well heated in what was quite a cold snap.Breakfast was Continental, and perfectly adequate. The breakfast room was nicely decorated for Christmas.The staff were pleasant and helpful. I will aim to stay at the Nadia when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Dream_BC
Reviews.Content: I am going to start with a negative in hopes that the positive at the end of the review will be more prominent... the cleanliness was pretty much non-existent. Used condom, previous guests statements, and lost clothes. Unfortunately also related to housekeeping... we left a tip for the person handling the baggage and left a note specific for him. To make a long story short housekeeping saw us leave and took the tip before we were even half way down the first flight of stairs. (That was when we remembered our jacket and went back.) It is unfortunate the gentleman handling our baggage will have no idea he was ever left a very nice tip. I is also possible that perhaps they all share tips? Or perhaps all tips go to housekeeping? On to the positive... FANTASTIC location. We walked everywhere. The set up itself was unusual because I am from Canada and this was my first trip overseas but I very much appreciated the experience. The service was unbelievable. They did everything they could to make us comfortable even when we were early on arrival. The front desk would get very busy and the lady working was always a pleasure no matter how busy you knew she was. I stayed in a room with two others and my sister, her husband, and their toddler stayed in another room. When assigning rooms they did a great job a finding what was suitable. Our set up was perfects for a couple and a single and my sisters was perfect for her and her husband and the toddler. We were on the top floor and although many might see the stairs as a negative I very much enjoyed them. Definitely must be able to walk stairs but was no a huge issue even with the youngster around. Overall this was a fantastic hotel. Had the cleanliness not included a used condom I likely would have rated this as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My business travel address in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: antoninbcn
Reviews.Content: My usual Amsterdam business travel address continues to deliver on Value and Service. Great location, friendly staff and good rates. You can't lose. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “lovely welcome and helpful throughout”
Reviews.Author: chrisljoy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Nadia hotel there was just single door between shops and a sign above, but on entering you are greeted with a staircase that can only be discribed as the north face of the eiger but no sooner have you closed the door Hazem appears to help you carry your bags and suitcases up the stairs.This was just the start of what only can be discribed as three days of nonstop help from the staff,whatever you need they are there to help.The room was lovely and clean and the breakfast room was a joy to eat in with its views over the canal and highstreet.Ican only say that our stay was made even better because of the friendly staff and the quirky but nice decor that greets you each time you enter the Nadia.We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly service...great location”
Reviews.Author: Trish1701
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel close to all the key sights with staff that made you feel at home from the moment you stepped inside the door. Pleasant room with lovely view of the canal and quiet at night. Cute breakfast room with the best croissants I've even eaten. We had to leave very early on our last day and Nazim organised a full breakfast tray the night before so we would not miss out. Admittedly the stairs were a challenge but staff readily assisted us to take our bags up and down. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: fmBungee
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff at Nadia. Friendly, helpful, courteous. And they are this way 24/7. I had an early flight out and did not prepare as well as I should have. Fortunately they gave me a wake up call, arranged a taxi and brought my bags down to the door. I also had issues connecting wireless to the internet. They were able to help me out there as well. The hotel is very quiet. It felt like I was staying at a relatives house. The room that I had was very small (probably about 6x12 feet plus the bathroom)but clean, warm and comfortable. I used the hotel shuttle bus service from the airport to the Nadia because I didn't want to haul my suitcase arround, however it is a 10 minute walk to the the Central Station if one wanted to save a couple bucks.

Reviews.Title: “little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cazza123barto0
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at hotel Nadia with family members to celebrate a birthday .Rooms were spotless ,location was fantastic and service was 5 star really friendly and helpful staff who couldnt do enough for us .Would highly recommend and would stay there again should we ever return to Amsterdam !!

Reviews.Title: “Returning Home!”
Reviews.Author: Darnelle60
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Nadia and we will definitely return again. The location so close to the town center makes it great for walking or taking the trans and buses to restaurants and entertainment. The staff is very attentive and helpful. The rooms have fresh flowers and are kept clean. This hotel is a great value for the money and it is truly like "coming home"! Entry stairs are only downside but they are doable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet822
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was my final stop on a month long journey through Europe. I had read rave reviews about this hotel over the past few months while planning my trip and the reviews and hotel never disappointed. This is one of the best places I stayed while in Europe! The rooms are clean and cozy. The staff (Wish I got their names) is very funny, friendly, and very helpful!! The owner and staff go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable throughout your stay. I highly recommend staying here because you'll not be disappointed!! If the owner is there, talk to him! He is one of the kindest people I met while abroad. If you have bad knees like I do, then beware of the stairs. The stairs give a great workout, that's for sure! Overall, staying here was a great end to my adventure. I highly recommend staying here, you'll not be disappointed at all!! I will be back!! Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Blackbird_1958
Reviews.Content: The people at the nadia worked very hard to make our two night stay very relaxing,everything we asked for was no trouble for the nadia team.Check in/out was excellent in both hospitality and luggage minding until we left for our coach back to rotterdam.I would not hessitate to recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: bint86
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my mother and I the day I was due to arrive at the airport for my early flight the next monring. The manager was extremely quick in replying to my booking and my extra questions. Service The staff were fantastic and always ready to help. They gave us directions, tips on where to go, brought us extra pillows when asked and were always very friendly and polite. We received complimentary cold drinks (Coke, water, 7Up etc) every day, sometimes twice a day. The breakfast was OK. It consisted of bread, (I didn't see a toaster), one type of cheese, mini yoghurts, apples, croissants, butter cake and tea/coffee etc. It's not the best breakfast I've had and that's comparing it to equivalent hotels. The Room We had a twin room with a full canal view. It had everything we needed, a fridge, TV, kettle and a bathroom with a good powerful shower - always a bonus. It was very small - we had to negotiate moving around the room and it was fairly cold on the bed under the big window as there is no double glazing - being at the end of November it was pretty cold anyway! The beds were also small singles (2ft) but were quite adequate for our 4 night stay. We were glad that we chose the full canal view as our room was on the side of the hotel and as such we overlooked a quieter canal street rather than the main road. Location The hotel is a stones throw from the back of the Palace and Anne Franks House. Everything is within walking distance, some places, like the museum quarter were about 15-20mins but Amsterdam is such a beautiful place to walk around it added to our trip and meant we got to appreciate a lot more of the city. There is a tram stop outside if you want though. Overall I would definitely stay there again. Staff like those we met at the Nadia Hotel are becoming rare and add this to the location and the cost and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: VeraBF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 4 friends and we like everything about it. I absolute agree with the good commentaries about the staff, the rooms are simple and the location is perfect. I was surprised with the accuracy of the photos. Donâ€™t expect luxury, just a bit more of the value of your money. PS â€“ I am a travel agent

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Good location, and Worth for Money”
Reviews.Author: AudreyJakarta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Nadia Hotel with my sister, and friend.We really enjoyed our time , from the 1st time we came in. Friendly and helpful staff helped us to carry our luggage, and while waiting for our room to be ready (we arrived in the morning), we were served with delicious breakfast.Room was warm and comfortable.Staff gave us any information that we needed. The Hotel is also easy to reach from Amsterdam Centraal Train Station . Definitely will stay again,and recommend this hotel for our friends, families, and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the best place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: ee_sundevil
Reviews.Content: We just got back home after spending 3 nights at Hotel Nadia and we absolutely loved the place. The rooms are European style - so there was just enough room to move around- but we had our own balcony, the coziest of beds and to top it all, a bouquet of fresh flowers waiting for us. Every single member of the staff was absolutely wonderful to us. We arrived after a 6 hr flight delay; we were tired, cold and thirsty and were prepared to having to deal with check ins and bag issues... instead we were offered a soft drink -elegantly designated a "complimentary welcome drink" by the wonderful desk person. And while we waited in the cozy dining room enjoying the views of the city at dark, someone else had already taken our bags two flights upstairs to our room! I was never able to tip the guy who did it... that is my only regret. Every single staff member works hard at making sure you enjoy your stay: your room is warm by the time you arrive; it is clean and fresh by the time you return after some sightseeing. Breakfasts are great - we stuffed ourselves with fresh bread, cheese, and non stop hot tea. It can get crowded in the dining room but people don't spend a long time sitting around - the windows have the most amazing views of the city so all you will want is to finish your breakfast and leave for a spin!- The stairs - oh yes, the infamous stairs- are steep but fun to climb. It may be hard for someone with breathing, mobility issues to go all the way up but that is all part of the charm of the hotel. And you will get your cardio for the day. If you are a light sleeper ask for an inside room or one on the side of the canal. Our room faced the main street and experienced a bit of early morning traffic noise. Even though the website says they are walking distance from the train station I recommend that you take a cab - there is construction going on around the station and the streets are icy this time of the year. A taxi will get you to Nadia in 5 minutes. Don't look any further - book with them, NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value”
Reviews.Author: htraveler_10
Reviews.Content: We did much research before choosing Hotel Nadia and booked our room knowing about the steep stairs and small rooms. We also knew the price was much more affordable than most hotels in the area with equally small rooms. What we didn't know was how friendly the staff would be or how great the breakfast and breakfast room would be or just how close the Hotel Nadia is to EVERYTHING. The rooms were clean with great wireless internet connection and big windows. If you are traveling on a budget and appreciate hospitality then stay at the Hotel Nadia! On the night before we flew out, the porter (can't remember his name!) made sure we knew that he would carry our bags down the night before and brought us into the kitchen to package up some breakfast for us to have in our room early the next morning. This was way above and beyond regular service. Finally, when I asked for a non-smoking room they let me know that although smoking is not allowed, they could not guarantee it as it is hard for them to enforce. My room did not smell of smoke but I did smell it in the halls. I HATE smoke but it did not bother me. I really appreciated their honesty during booking our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “best stay yet”
Reviews.Author: somafan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam and an 8 night stay at Hotel Nadia.The location of the hotel is perfect . The manager and staff at the hotel are the best we've seen anywhere! There is a very nice breakfast room with a good breakfast to get you going on those cold Amsterdam mornings.The rooms are a very good value with our room having a balcony and canal view was great, the rooms are not that much smaller compared to others in the city. What really makes this hotel great are the people working there, from the manager to reception to the breakfast staff and everyone in between they really make you feel like it is your home away from home and we cannot wait to return for another stay. Thank You Hotel Nadia for making it our best stay yet while in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “a stay in Amsterdam - with personality!”
Reviews.Author: Camelia_graur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in "Nadia" hotel just for 2 nights in November 2010. One might imagine that November is not the best month to visit Amsterdam because of the rainy and cold weather. But believe me, my stay in this cosy and warm house (I cannot even call it hotel, it felt like I was home in there), made my stay enjoyable and as pleasant as I wished it to be. I found this hotel through a simple search on the internet, made a request and got immediate response and confirmation of booking. The staff is extremely nice and welcoming. The rooms are very warm, cosy, and the administrator and his colleagues, thought of every small detail to make a guest feel like an invited friend in their room. Starting with the fresh bouquet of flowers that is waiting for in your room you when you arrive, finishing with the small tea-pot and conditions to prepare your own tea - they thought of everything. Breakfast had all the necessary ingredients. The only bad thing about my stay there was that it was so short! Thank you "Nadia" team! Conclusion: If you want to feel the real Amsterdam architecture from the inside, meaning small but cosy, combined with a friendly atmosphere, this is the right place for you!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best jewels in Amsterdam Lodging. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tavolaro
Reviews.Content: I was there for five days from Oct 20th to Oct 26th. Great location a 10 min walk from Central Station and 5 minutes from Dam Square. You can get all over the town with trams, buses, taxi or subway. The Staff is just perfect. Although it does not have an elevator (and I was carrying heavy pieces of luggage) they set me in my room fast and with a welcome drink. A courtesy that was repeated when I get back to the hotel breathless between some scheduled meetings and asked for info to the owner/manager Osama. Very Nice people at the front desk that helped me all the time that I need assistance. Good Breakfast with a nice view to the channel and the church. Room is small but not claustrophobic and very well designed. Clean bathroom and surprisingly big for the room. Would recommend for sure and I will be back there when I go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: happynadiaguest
Reviews.Content: The whole staff was sincerely caring, nice and very polite, at all time. Furthermore, the combination of price, location and standing make the Nadia hotel an excellent place to stay in Amsterdam. The only details for which I cannot rate it as perfect (nobody is either) were maybe the size of the single room and from time to time the street noises could be an (small) issue. Overall, a very good hotel, and a truly excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: BrianRHullUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 1 night stay in Hotel Nadia. We chose it because of the Trip Advisor reviews we had read. If you are a very small person who smokes heavily; have a low budget but want to stay in quite a good location in a wonderful European city, the Nadia would be OK. If this is not you, you should avoid it. We doubt that several reviews are genuine. The hotel is rated highly with business travellers. Whatever Hotel Nadia is, it is not a business hotel and yet, it is rated #3 in Amsterdam for business travellers!!! We cannot believe that it would be used by business travellers, never mind be reviewed favourably by them. The excellent reviews often seem to have been posted by people who have submitted only ONE hotel review - Hotel Nadia. The reviews are often in poorly written English, even from people who purport to come from the UK. Read carefully and draw your own conclusions. It is true that the staff are very friendly and welcoming, but both Reception and our room stank of cigarette smoke. Even the manager left a trail of stale cigarette smoke behind him. We have used Trip Advisor successfully several times before but we will be much more cautious in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good cost benefit. Very nice service, friendly. Was my 2nd time, will be the third.”
Reviews.Author: clalima
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel with small rooms, no elevator. But it has comfortable rooms and the service is very good and friendly. Very well located, in the heart of the city, yet a little away from the party zone (walking distance) so you can have a quiet sleep. Some improvements could be done: 1 - Windows. Too much noise from the streets. 2 - TV. While I don`t really watch TV in Amsterdam, they could switch to small 26" LCD TVs and better channel options. Overall, very good experience. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Marita-vacaciones
Reviews.Content: I've read that the hotel wasn't suitable for older people because of the stairs and when I saw them I got scared and wondered how could I take my luggage to the room...hopefully they did it without troubles. Our stay was short but pleasant, the staff was great, friendly and smily all the time. Osam the manager was the best :o) We had flowers in our room, a nice detail. We requested for a room with channel's view and we got one! The location is pretty good, a short walking distance to the Ann Frank museum and to the Damm square and if you are tired, there are tram lines that passes just steps away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, pleasant and very very helpful”
Reviews.Author: AnaLuciaLisbon
Reviews.Content: Stuff is very very kind and nice. The room is realy ok, not big, but not too smal, clean, with friger. We like a lote, and recommend. The room has the windom to the street, and sometimes its a kind of loud, but thats ok, at night we are so tired, so we sleeped very well, beside that. The hotel is very well located, in the center, it's nearly of everything, central station, supermarket, museums, cofeshop, bank....

Reviews.Title: “The staff is AWESOME and very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: LWMotley
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Nadia Hotel. The staff made us feel welcome, they were very hospitable and they were always willing to answer any questions we had, from the type of recommended tour we should take to popular places that we should visit. There are no "lifts" in this hotel and our room was located on the 4th floor. The staff kindly took our bags to our rooms and even brought them down after we checked out of our room. Nadia Hotel is seated in a great location near major shopping areas, museums and restaurants. We found it very easy to get around. We walked as long and as far as our legs would take us! (from 3pm to 1am!) I will definitely visit Amsterdam again. And guess where I'll be staying...Nadia Hotel! Oh...if you have the pleasure of meeting Hazeem, who's apart of their wonderful staff, he's AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise hotel in lovely area”
Reviews.Author: willliveinlondon
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a bit skeptical about the outside building (looked lower 2-star). You enter, and daunted by a VERY steep staircase - but, not as bad as it looks. You're greeting at the reception by a team of friendly managers and staff, offering a cold drink right away. They make every effort that you're taken care of and settled. A single room is small (6' x 12'?), but clean and sufficient. It was nicely heated, free wifi, fridge, tv (though most in Dutch), and clean bath. The hotel makes every effort to keep it quiet for everyone. Breakfast is simple (coffee, roll, juice) - enough to get you by for the morning. I needed to pop in/out during the day for business, and each time I was warmly greeted. Location was perfect - quiet area by Anne Frank house, but a 10-minute walk to Dam Square. Nadia is great if you need a business hotel for a place to sleep or want a quieter area away from all the action. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location, the steepest steps we have ever seen!!!”
Reviews.Author: debprice57
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Very steep steps, we are very fit 50 yr olds so the steps did not worry us but staff insisted on carrying our bags up and down for us. Breakfast included with plenty of food to get you started for the day. We had 2 nights booked at Nadia. Booked online for a standard room. Our room was quiet but we were a little disappointed, room small and old looking with bed against the wall and one of us having to crawl over the other to get in. But we thought "its clean, safe and hard to get cheaper accom in Amsterdam". Got a surprise on the afternoon of the second day when the manager asked if he could move us to a canal view room 2 floors down. Lovely room. So if you can afford to spend a little more, I would go for something better than the standard room. Thanks for the lovely canal room!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, outstanding service, pity about the stairs”
Reviews.Author: Audu
Reviews.Content: Second time we've stayed at the Nadia, the stairs are the only real drawback, you have to be fit to stay here! Otherwise, the location is great, very convenient to walk to almost anywhere in Amsterdam or catch the 'Hop on, Hop off' ferry around the canals, very friendly service, rewarding your climb up the stairs to the reception with a complimentary drink, noticed my birthday and put flowers in our room, rooms small but somewhere within they have all that you need and the showers and bathroom modern and clean, bed comfy enough to sleep in a bit, will stay there again as long as we stay fit enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with super service”
Reviews.Author: CSC_CST
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week and received excellent attention throughout. The location is convenient, on the tram and a few minutes' walk from Dam Square. Plenty of nice restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms are very small, but this is common in Amsterdam. The canal side is prettier and quieter, but the street is not overly noisy once the trams stop around 11pm. Everything is clean and the staff is super attentive. Wireless Internet was available in every room and free â€“ a nice touch when many more expensive hotels charge for this. The included breakfast was simple and fresh â€“ they bake their own croissants daily! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: petraSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Steep staircase as is usual for Amsterdam, but the friendly staff help you with your luggage! We had smallish, but clean room on canal side. Great breakfast in lovely breakfast room. Great location and reasonably priced - would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “A memorable place to stay with superior personal attention.”
Reviews.Author: Harkley
Reviews.Content: Every positive comment before my post is absolutely correct and I would be repetitive if I mentioned the same things. My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary here and we had a marvelous stay. Our room overlooked the canal and had a balcony and we had more than enough room for us and all our luggage (we had been traveling throughout Europe for the past 4 weeks). Osam was not only the manager but a prince of a person who took very good care of us. We stayed 3 nights and by the time we left we felt like we had visited old friends. I felt that this had more of a bed and breakfast flavor than a hotel. If you are not mobile then the stairs would be a problem but my wife and I are in our 60's and we viewed them as exercise away from home and our bags were toted up to our room for us. My personal thanks go out to everyone at this hotel for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Central location at a great price and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hoshengilad
Reviews.Content: We ordered a hotel room after reading a recommendation on this site. The hotel is centrally located, two minutes to Dam Square. To reach the hotel has a large number of climbing steep stairs. Employee of the hotel helps to raise the bags, so stairs are not a problem. Very nice hotel staff, including receptionists and hotel manager. Very small rooms but great service - you will not find such a hotel located in Amsterdam this price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: ironman976
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the center. Good atmosphere. Clean. Good croissants in breakfast. I definately recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cwiltens
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very helpful in every way to get your stay to be the best it can.They arranged transportation,took phone messages,helped me to find specific areas I needed to go,even made a personalized flower arrangement( for the death of my mother) in my room. I have come here for years and wouldnt think of any other hotel to stay at. Its so central to everything. Osam,the manager, made everything possible on this stay and I wish to personally thank him. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay with Pleasant Staff in the heart of Amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: tk1372
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Upon arrival the staff greeting us politely and very friendly and helpful. We were disturbed by the amount stairs at first; however, the hospitality was the best and our (heavyl) uggage was quickly taken to our rooms. The breakfast was convenient and satisfactory. The hotel is centrally located to the attractions, etc. Although there are fancy hotels in the area we would definitely stay at Hotel Nadia again! Be back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but noise and steps were a real issue”
Reviews.Author: Lostones
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers for Nadia Hotel in relation to the staff, they are really great but the daunting sight of the stairs when you enter the hotel even though the staff brought our luggage up to our room was worrying to start with. We were on the front of the hotel and the noise from the trams and the church bells was very loud. We commented on this when we first checked in and the reception staff brought earplugs up to the room. Even with earplugs we got no sleep. We were booked in for 3 nights and after the first night we decided to change hotels. If you are a backpacker and used to lots of noise and very small rooms and the stairs, then this is the place for you. The stairs were really daunting

Reviews.Title: “A gem on its own”
Reviews.Author: Rodelus10
Reviews.Content: The place is centrally and conveniently located in the centre of Amsterdam. The room I got is charming and it serves the purpose. The staff are really friendly and so helpful plus they also offer laundry service which is really handy especially if you'd rather enjoy your time. breakfast is also adequate. I would definitely come back to stay there on my next rip.

Reviews.Title: “Life reexplored”
Reviews.Author: Adagio_In_G_Minor
Reviews.Content: Fantastic . Memories back from 1986 fresh even now/ Nadia presents the best leisure place and fanntastic hospitality and courtesy Will stay again there and all the best Ever smiling people round were the hotel staff Thanks and continue thr good work

Reviews.Title: “Great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kimbell1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia Hotel during a long weekend away with my boyfriend. The location was excellent with most attractions just a few minutes walk away. The service and attention to detail was also remarkable. I was impressed to be offered a welcome drink upon arrival and even happier to find a complementary bouquet of flowers in our room when we went in. Other small things also made a difference. The staff were always friendly and upbeat, we had help with our bags at all times and the seemingly endless supply of croissants during breakfast was much appreciated. On the down side, our room was quite small and you had to perform a contortionist act to get on the toilet (if you stay in the quiet deluxe double you'll see what I mean). The bells ringing from the clock tower nearby could also be annoying but all these things were overshadowed by the overall impression of staying in a cosy, friendly and well located place. A word of warning though - this isn't the place for you if you have mobility problems - the stairs to the reception and rooms are very steep. The phrase "feel the burn" was called for on many occasions!!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: SandrafromSD
Reviews.Content: The people at Hotel Nadia are the reason it is such a great place. Our room, a triple (which is not easy to find), was small but clean, and it had a nice view of the canal. The free breakfast was really good. The location can't be beat - major attractions within easy walking distance. Nice things, yes, but the people are the reason you can't go wrong by staying here. The people at the desk were unfailingly friendly and helpful, no matter what time of the day or night. The daunting task of getting luggage up and down the steep stairs was accomplished quickly and with good humor by a man who must be one of the fittest men in Amsterdam. The breakfast room people were all quick and helpful. Every encounter with every employee was pleasant and efficient. How often do you find that? Hotel Nadia is a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sheri_pdx
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (two women in their 50's) stayed at Hotel Nadia for three nights. The staff and location were wonderful, but the room was extremely small with a tiny bathroom that was difficult for two women to share. The furnishings were very basic and a little worn.The steps to the room were steep and narrow, but quite manageable. In the future, I think I would probably prefer a little more space even if it means being in a less central location. However, if you are looking for a place near the sights, this is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good localization, reasonable price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: atorres42
Reviews.Content: Very good localization is the number one reason to stay there. Don't worry about the stairs (they have people all day & night to deal with you luggage) unless you have any physical problem that prevents you to go up an down. Room is tiny, but comfortable. Breakfast is ok. Internet access is also there... So, if you want to use the hotel just to rest at night, have breakfast and go to enjoy the (fantastic) city, Nadia is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent fun atmosphere, safe and truly Amsterdams Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kulisse
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, a family atmosphere, clean room, open mind and very little space. It is super nice. I will come back again for the third time. All rooms are different, try them all :-)

Reviews.Title: “No good choice”
Reviews.Author: JavierZGZ
Reviews.Content: We were hosted in Nadia hotel last long weekend. The Hotel is just in the city centre, very well located. Parking in the area is like a Lotery. When you arrive and ring the bell of the door, the door opens and you can see the steps, you must climb 37 steps, a high slope, not valid for people over 50 years. The reception is warm and you have choice one welcome drink. Staff is well educated and servicial. After express checking we go to our rooms. The rooms is the smaller one that I never been hosted. Double room not more than 10sqrm bath enclosed. There are a lot of shelters and hooks in the wall in order to use them because you only can see no more than 1 sqmt of floor. Bathroom is quite dark and very small. Single room would be named half person room. The bed touch three walls and the other wall was not more than one meter away. Claustrophobic. Breakfast is just good and well served.

Reviews.Title: “Great but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: mishk4
Reviews.Content: Really freindly staff who make you feel at home. The rooms are a bit small but are clean and with free broadband which is very fast . The breakfast is simple but perfect to get you started on your way . The only real gripe I have is it was a bit noisy due to the traffic outside in saying that I live next to a bush reserve where the only noise you get is the birds!. I would stay there again but next time I would bring ear plugs with me

Reviews.Title: “second stay was as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Gill1903
Reviews.Content: First stayed in April and had a great time. Hotel is well located and the service was great, so stayed again for our recent visit. The hotel cats "Hello and Goodbye" are sweet!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel In The Heart of It All: A True Guarantee!”
Reviews.Author: redrussak
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some of the world's best and most expensive hotels, but the Nadia Hotel provided the friendliest customer service I've experienced to date. I booked this hotel because it was right next to all the main attractions of Amsterdam, from Dam Square to Anne Franke, and close proximity to the main train station and Van Gogh Museum. You want to be right in the heart of it all? Then stay at the Nadia! WARNING: I knew very well what it meant to check into a 2-3 star hotel in Amsterdam. Not many people do, so let me explain. This hotel can be compared to staying at a friends apartment. This "friend" knows everything about the city. The only difference here is you get your own shower, people to help with your bags and a consistently friendly staff. The rooms are a bit tight, but for the price and location, this hotel is a true find. If you're lucky enough to be reading this, then consider this your lucky day. Stay at the Nadia and I guarantee you'll be writing a review like this after your stay. BEST CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE: The airlines lost my baggage. When I got to the Nadia hotel and informed them, they took it upon themselves to keep track of my bags progress and make sure it got to my room upon arrival. That brought a whole new meaning to customer service. PERSONAL NOTES: If you go there...make sure to say hi to "Mo" ;) He'll make you feel right at home. Oh, and have fun walking up the stairs. This place is not just a hotel, it's part of a memory for me and my wife!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel ever! great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lauralikestotravel26
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with 3 other girls aged 24-26 and we all found it a personal, lovely, friendly hotel, with great staff. They paid a lot of time and detail into making you feel warm, welcome and accomodated and were really helpful. The manager was lovely, he would stop and chat and sent fresh flowers up to our room because we told him it was our friends birthday. We asked him advice on day trips and he recommended the windmill tour (which was fantastic) and organised the trip for us. The hotel and rooms themselves were pretty basic, but they were kept clean, which was the main thing. Id recommend this hotel to everybody, I love to travel and have been on a few European city breaks, but have never recieved such great customer service than I had at the Nadia. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location, soft beds, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SnickersMeow
Reviews.Content: Situated in a convenient location within easy walking distance of Dam square, Anne Frank house, and the Red Light district - really, anywhere you need to go is easy to get to by foot. The staff was really nice and helpful, with fresh flowers and complimentary beverages all the time. Make sure you get to the free breakfast before 1030, because they pack up everything on the dot. Basic breakfast, no meat, but the little Nutella packets are awesome. Good for a quick snack before you go find some pancakes. They have a variety of room options to choose from. Call in to request a canal view room with a balcony if the weather is going to be nice. Otherwise, the standard rooms are pretty narrow and small - but the beds comfortable. bathroom is like a closet - make use of the one next to the reception if need be.
