And if you have back problems, or are pregnant, or not able to walk well, this also is not the place for you as there are extremely STEEP STEPS. Overall, great value! Eat at Michelin-rated ENVY which is just 2 blocks away - excellent food! The local oysters are worth it at 5 euros each. Razor clam dish also stellar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steph8008
Reviews.Content: Plus sides - Location, staff, rooms, clean, breakfast, free use of safe in the rooms, rooms cleaned daily. Down side - Uncomfortable beds!!! double was more like a 3/4. a little noisey if on the main street. I would book this hotel again as the staff and the location made this break go with ease, I would book a twin room as me and my husband didnt get a wink of sleep in the double bed, matress was lumpy and we kept on rolling into the middle of the small double bed :-( but as u can see the plus sides clearly out weigh the downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel, with a very kindly staff en good service.”
Reviews.Author: hage1603
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 2 teenagers ( 15, 13) in this hotel for 3 days.Very friendly wellcome with a drink. We could enter the room almost imediatly. The room and bathroom was very clean. There is a small fridge, there is no restaurant, so you can buy some drinks yourself. You can make coffee, thee. We had a room located at Raadhuisstraat and in the evening and night it was a bit noisy. Breakfast was good, small room, but everything went very well and you could eat as much as you wanted. We were the only dutch people in the hotel. On the day we left we could leave our suitcases behind in a save room and pick them up in the evening wich is great you have all day. We will surely visited the hotel again because the location is really great and the people are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it so much I stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: 13vix13
Reviews.Content: Osam and his staff were wonderful and make sure all your needs are met. Because of the length of my stay and extra days I remained I stayed in a couple of different rooms. They are all different shapes and sizes, very clean and comfortable and the staff moved all my belongings. If you are lucky you will also see the beautiful private rooftop garden!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, refit due in some rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ironman48
Reviews.Content: I was switched from my preferred room (double with balcony) to a lesser one due to some unspecified problems. I paid a lower rate for this but received no further discount. I wasn't too happy about dumping all my stuff in the lobby at 12 noon due to the new room not being ready, but nothing was mislaid. Hotel Nadia is in a great location and is therefore popular. There is a commitment to service, staff are fine and I believe that the hotel delivers reasonable value. However, it is tending towards shabby in some areas: curtains, beds and fittings will need replacing soon although my bathrooms were clean. At the point of refurb a no smoking policy should be introduced and rigorously enforced: both my rooms smelt of smoke. Non-balcony rooms are quieter although noise was not a problem to this Londoner. Breakfast is adequate in a fill you up way. Coffee in breakfast room was OK. Stairs are very steep, in keeping with many Central Amaterdam locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mandy49633
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam - experiencing one of the best week's of my life. My stay at Hotel Nadia was so perfect which increased my enjoyment of the trip. I stayed in a single room with a small balcony overlooking a busy street. I loved sitting there, wrapped up against the cold, watching the bikes and all of busy Holland go by. The staff is particularly kind and generous. The approach is very personal and I was made to feel at home. The morning coffee and croissants I will dream about! Yes, there are intimidating steps to climb (I was lucky to be on the second floor, not thrid or fourth!), but this was a very minor inconvenience to experience such a lovely place. I highly recommend Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Nadiaaaaa”
Reviews.Author: GemmaCaine
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was in a great location, around a 10 minute walk from Dam Square. From when we arrived we were looked after very well, the staff are really friendly! We had a 4 bed room that over looked the church and canal. Spacious, clean and homely feel. Flowers on the table :) Also they sent flowers up for my friends birthday! Breakfast was included, try the cake, it's yummy! Hot water all day! The staff are also keen to help you with things to see and do while in Amsterdam, they are also great photographers :) (my friends and i are a lil camera crazy!) There is a long, steep flight of stairs to reception, but you don't have to worry about your luggage, the staff take care of all that! overall a really friendly, comfortable hotel in a great location. will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends and will probably return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: daniaforce
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Nadia Hotel with my collagues in a triple room...Rooms very clean, Manager and staff of Nadia was always available at every hour of the day...Breakfast excellent and location is excellent for going everywhere in Amsterdam from the Museums to the night life :-) I really recommend this hotel for young people, business people and all kind of persons that are looking for a clean and friendly place to stay....Thanks again Nadia Hotel we will surely come back...Greetings from Italy

Reviews.Title: “Another very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: FOONK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nadia on numerous occasions before. This was a quick 3 night break yet I managed to stay in 3 different rooms! My first night was spent in a 2nd floor room and had a nice balcony. My second night was in a 4th floor room. I asked to move for my final night because the window didn't open very far in the 4th floor room. This was dealt with very efficiently by the staff, and I was given a much more acceptable room on the 3rd floor for my 3rd and final night. The rooms at the Nadia are small but well-appointed, and are clean. What makes the Nadia hotel worth returning to is, for me, the friendliness and efficiency of it's staff, it's excellent location by the beautiful Jordaan district, and it's good value for money. I'm about to book another stay there!

Reviews.Title: “A great area”
Reviews.Author: Iamsterdam11
Reviews.Content: I checked out Hotel Nadia based on another guest's review of it and it was a great stay. Osam and the staff were very helpful in the booking process and gave us a good rate. I had been to Amsterdam twice before and was looking forward to staying on the west side of town near Jordaan as it is my favorite area. We stayed at Nadia for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. The staff gave us a nice room with a window overlooking the street. The room was small but that did not take away from our experience. There was a tv and coffeemaker and a fridge which was very helpful. They provided free maps and a free breakfast which was good. The location is wonderful and it is within walking distance (all we did was walk) to everything we wanted to do. The West Church outside of the hotel is beautiful and there were really good restaurants and bars near the hotel. We had no interest in the sketchier part of Amsterdam and really enjoyed staying in this area. There is also a grocery store nearby with cheap water/snacks/beer, etc. We needed a taxi when we left the hotel at 5am and they were nice enough to call one for us. The steps are steep but the staff is willing to help with the bags. If you are unable to walk up about 30 steep steps then this probably isn't the place for you simply because you will probably have a hard enough time getting up to the first floor. But if you can deal with that you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: graybag
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a nice clean hotel that is within walking distance to The Dam, the train station and various shopping areas, pubs, the Red Light District. The only drawbacks that I can say may be found are the steep steps that take you up to the reception area and to the rooms and that to me, the room I had seemed a little drafty: but then again, I am a southern American and am used to in room heating. Also while your are there, try the little pancake restaurant that is among one of the shops just outside of the hotel doors.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mofo_phill
Reviews.Content: traveled to Amsterdam for 3 days during our honeymoon. wonderful hotel! Amazing location, price, customer service - everything you look for in a hotel! upon our arrival we had a bouquet of flowers congratulating us on our wedding. not a big deal, but a real nice touch and definitely started things off right for us and gave us that arm fuzzy feeling that we'll be taken care of. the location is withing minutes of everything - you can walk the whole town from this hotel. the price was great given the location, cleanliness, the fact that breakfast was included as well. great places to eat surround the hotel and there are a number of bars, pubs and coffee shops i would definetly stay here again. the only drawback (and this might only be for a select few individuals - is that there are a number of stairs to get to the reception - this might be an issue if you have knee or leg problems. not sure - thought i would just throw it in there.)

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuisBaptista
Reviews.Content: The location is great, but remember this is just a three star hotel... The staff is very good and cordial, but the rooms are very small, and in bathroom when you have a shower all the floor gets water, because the protection is just a plastic curtain. The mattress is to much soft. The breakfast is limited, for exemple never has ham, just cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: SteelCityCouple
Reviews.Content: Great location, around the corner from the Anne Frank house and Dam Square, but out of the touristic area around Centraal Station. We stayed 8 nights. The staff was incredibly attentive and eager to help with all our requests. For central Amsterdam, it's very reasonably priced. The rooms are small compared to US rooms, but how many US rooms are in an arcaded building decorated with stone crocodiles? The bathroom was spotless with good water pressure & plenty of hot water. The room was well appointed with a (small) TV, safe & refrigerator, and high speed wireless internet. We found a bit of dust on the high top shelves, and the rooms show a some age, but we'd definitely recommend the Nadia without hesitation, except if you have a physical problem with the (long, steep) flight of steps at the entry.

Reviews.Title: “clean, drug-free hotel in the heart of Amsterdam with an attentive, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alwayswalking
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful staff that will help you discover Amsterdam. Continental breakfasts are ample. Rooms are small but adequate, as is the case with most hotels in the city center. Although the single pane windows did let in the noise from outside, I didn't hear my neighbors in other rooms. The beds are clean and comfortable. I have been staying at the Nadia now and then for the last ten years and I have never found a better value so close to the city center. If you are a returning customer, they will make every effort to get you the best possible rate that they can manage. There is a long flight of stairs up to the reception desk. Don't try to drag any of your bags up with you, but leave then inside the street door to the right of the landing. The bags will be brought to your room at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “A very central hotel allowing you to enjoy the best of Amsterdam, be it for work or leisure.”
Reviews.Author: xinyi18
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly, staircases were steep but there's always someone to help carry our suitcases. Room was clean, with a pot of flowers on the desk to say 'Have a pleasant stay', which we thought was very nice of the hotel. Facing the main road, our room was slightly noisy especially during dawn when there was more traffic. Being very centrally located, Hotel Nadia is minutes away from Dam Square and less than a minute away from a tram stop. Good breakfast was provided every morning to kickstart our days and our room was cleaned/serviced everyday, which I thought were the most important things travellers look for in their hotel stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: emertoff
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I have to say that the description of the hotel on the website (rooms, services offered, etc) on the website and on the confirmation e-mail after booking is 100% accurate. You know what you are booking and this is what you receive during your stay. However, what I liked about Nadia in particular is the staff - you feel genuinely made welcome particularly each time you visit reception and not just some anonymous guest. I never had to give my room number when collecting the key, its like they knew me before. In addition, a smile and/or a friendly chat always awaited at reception, in addition to the free minerals generously provided. There is just that homely feel about the hotel which is very re-assuring for a traveller in a new city. The personal touch that many or most hotels cannot or will not provide. On a couple of the important additional features; Room - Small but not the ships cabin I expected. All the listed facilities provided (WC/Shower, TV, Safe, Coffee/Tea making facilities. Of particular note, the housekeeping was of a high standard with towels changed daily, and tea/coffee topped up. I am a light sleeper so the comfortable bed and pillows were great to ensure a good nights sleep, even if the street outside remained busy with trams and other traffic. Location - excellent - just a stones throw from Wester Kerk tram stop and Anne Frank huis. 5 mins walk to Dam Square, 10 mins to Centraal Station. Service - as mentioned above - excellent. The hotel staff are this establishments biggest asset, along with the warm and homely welcome from Osam and the family. In particular I would like to thank them for arranging everything for my departure promptly and professionally - I was worried as I had an early departure from Schiphol but I need not have been as they took care of everything just as I had asked, including opening the breakfast room early. I left Nadia in the early hours with a smile and a handshake, with summed up my experience there, and I would have no hesitation in booking them again on my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and top class customer service”
Reviews.Author: lazydaysWales
Reviews.Content: Great location - our room overlooked the canal and church. Easy to find, the staff were very welcoming and provided bottled water whenever we asked. Breakfast was constantly replenished - croissants were delicious. The room was well supplied and clean - bed linen changed during a 3 night stay. Would definitely recommend and return if visiting Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “If I could I'd go back right now :)”
Reviews.Author: cvlaar
Reviews.Content: Traveling through Europe with my daughter, we stayed in 10 different Hostels. This one had the smallest room, but it was very comfy and we had a balcony to sit outside without going down 5 flights of stairs as we did in all the other Hostels.The staff was very warm and welcoming. And they were very funny too,a great sense of humour ( right Hazem and Osam?)They went out of their way to make us comfortable' even having breakfast ready for us early when we had to fly out at 6:30 AM. Good job guys :)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU NEED A NON-SMOKING ROOM”
Reviews.Author: Navion5150
Reviews.Content: When making reservations, I explicitly said I needed a non -smoking room, due to my asthma. I called when we were delayed and reminded them of the non-smoking room. When we walked into the room, the balcony door was open and a fan was on (should have known this was a bad sign, but had been traveling all day, was tired and really wanted it to be okay). It smelled of cigarette smoke and pot. I figured it was just the prior guest's smoking and that it would air out. We closed the balcony and went out for the night . When we returned the smells were overpowering. The curtains reeked of smoke. We couldn't keep the balcony door open because the balcony is attached to adjacent room balconies. (t had three locks on it, so I assume it's not a safe place.) Also, the hotel is on a tram line, so the noise would not allow much sleeping. I should have asked for a different room that night , but if curtains reek of smoke, I have to assume that management is aware of smoking in the rooms. When I did complain in the morning they acted very surprised and offered to find me a different room after they checked in a lobby full of people. I chose not to wait, as I believe they were fully aware of that they had given me a smoking room initially. I was so sick when I left, I didn't even try to get my money back for the next night. I just wanted out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: Cafrace
Reviews.Content: Anything under 70euro a night in Amsterdam and you will probably be in a dinghy shoebox so to find this hotel was great. As is the case everywhere in Holland the stairs are very steep and there is no elevator but the staff will carry you bags for you in required. The staff are a credit to the establishment, I assume it is a family run hotel and everyone is very friendly I was even offered free drinks several times and maps of the area. The rooms are very small and pretty outdated (mine was anyway) but the bathroom was quick roomy and very clean and they are serviced daily so new towels etc. Also there is tea and coffee in your room, the bed was comfortable, TV even a small desk. For what you pay you can't ask for any more then this. Also the reception is 24hours, you have to ring the doorbell to get access into the hotel and whilst some people where smoking in the reception I could not smell smoke or any other substance anywhere else. Aside from the great atmosphere created by the staff the breakfast (included in your stay) was great, they had a variety of breads and croissants, fruit, cheese etc. It's in a really nice room overlooking the street. It's in a great location and just to the left across the bridge is a bike hire shop, I would strongly recommend hiring a bike to see the city, with this place so close to the hotel it's very convenient. All in all this is no 5star hotel but you shouldn't expect it to be, for a budget stay I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No Negatives For The Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Stolman
Reviews.Content: In four words: accommodating, affordable, clean, comfortable. I am one of those who always reads the negative reviews before the positives. While some exist, the negative pickings were very slim for the Nadia. For good reason. We stayed on 10Oct10 for 2 nites on our first anniversary (and first chance for a honeymoon). We did not disclose either to the staff, yet we were greeted warmly. We felt like the staff was expecting us and was delighted to see us. This easy-to-find, centrally located gem is less than a 5 minute walk from the nearest Tram (13 or 17) stop. If arriving from the airport via the train, just exit the main station entrance. Immediately before you are the Tram tracks. Board either Tram 13 or 17. Pay the attendent on board (Euro 2.60 per person - good for a 1 our ticket) and exit about 7 minutes later at WesterMarkt. Note that the tram will pass in front of the hotel (Nadia on the left) just before it stops at WesterMarkt. Rooms are available facing the street, canal or neither. The Hotel is secure and the bell/buzz-response entry reveals the stairway to the reception area. The stairway is steep to be sure, but a staff member greeted us at the bottom and was quick to carry our luggage for us (both checking in and out). All of Nadia's 24x7 staff made us feel like valued and respected guests. The rooms are clean if not cozy, but my 6'2" frame had no trouble relaxing and sleeping comfortably there. Service is impeccable. The one problem we did have with the telephone was quickly resolved after a sub-5 minute response to our request for assistance. The staff are fluent in English, well-mannered, courteous, professional and eager to be of service (this is NOT and overstatement). The included breakfast is typical (cheese, breads, coffee, juice, etc.) and is of high quality. Beyond breakfast, try Il Panorama, an Italian cafe at the other end of the "covered porch" in front of the hotel, around 200 feet to the right as you exit the hotel door. I am not a fanatic but have consumed my fair share of pizza in my day and I can truthfully say that their cheese pizza, though it sounds simple and bland, was the best I have ever tasted. The waitress suggested that it was the Dutch cheese. That combined with the perfect crust earned the Panorama a 10 out of 10. Finally, the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Anne Frank house/museum and the WesterKirk next door to it. Note: if you have a chime clock at home you will be familiar with the regular sounding of the church bells. If not, consider ear plugs as a sleep aid. Other than that, the hotel was quiet for us. We were thoroughly pleased with our choice of the Nadia and we will not stay anywhere else when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: wallace91
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, very friendly welcome and great service! What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Safe place to stay if you're a woman traveling on your own.”
Reviews.Author: creativechick76
Reviews.Content: Being a woman traveling alone (and this was my first time doing that), I was a little apprehensive and cautious. But the staff at Hotel Nadia made me feel at ease. If I needed anything - taxis, tour bookings or even a meal delivered, they were able to help me out. I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor prior to booking so I was aware of the stairs, but boy are those stairs steep! The rooms were clean. The staff friendly. My only complaint is that the WC are so small that I had to put one of my feet in the shower while doing my "business". I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone (able to deal with the stairs).

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: 24one
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia for one night in August 2010 prior to leaving Amsterdam on a cruise. For the price the Nadia was excellent--staff were great, room small but clean with a view of the canal and location was just right for walking around Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Previous Trip Advisor reviews were on the mark. Ray

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Framptonxx
Reviews.Content: The best service we've had in Europe, every one at hotel Nadia does their very best to make your stay in Amsterdam and at the hotel enjoyable. The rooms are not very big but they're comfortable and cozy. The only thing to watch for is the stairs they're very steep, if you have mobility problems this hotel is not for you. Other than this don't hesitate for one second.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmr47
Reviews.Content: Stairs are quite steep; but help is available with luggage. It felt very comfortable and homey. Staff was very helpful and accomadating.We stayed in Room 203 with balcony, bathroom is quite small. I would still stay again despite the few negatives I have pointed out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, room very small but hotel charming”
Reviews.Author: kyklamina
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal, 2 mins' walk to tram stop and canal bus stop, less than 5 mins to Dam Square, 5 mins to Jordaan district, many restaurants & bars close by. Many steep stairs so not for the elderly/unfit, but staff take your luggage up [and down] for you. Room was tiny but quaint, with adequate shower room, small bed, not much storage, but a balcony with canal view. The posy of fresh flowers in the room made up for the lack of space! Some traffic noise at night but we slept well. Staff very helpful and friendly. Good continental breakfast, tea/coffee always available. Good value for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location - must be able to climb steep stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1226
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our staly here. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The room was small but we had a wonderful view of the church and canal. The bed was warm and comfortable and we had everything we needed. As other reviewers have said, not suitable if you don't like climbing steep stairs as there is no lift, but the staff carried our bags for us - so no problem with that.

Reviews.Title: “Positive and negative points”
Reviews.Author: AnaAmaral
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in Hotel Nadia because of the good reviews. But I have a different opinion about this hotel. Positive points: The staff is really helpful and nice, specially the young lady witch was in the reception (blonde with long hair). The breakfast was good, better than I expected for a 2 stars hotel. The location is also good. A welcome drink. Negative points: The size of the rooms is totally different from that shown on the site. So, does not belive those pictures. The bathroom is not good. To have an idea, one second roll of toilet paper was placed on the floor. And the worst thing: the stais. You have to see to believe. Maybe this is the reason of the welcome drink.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were hoping for and more!”
Reviews.Author: Speedreader
Reviews.Content: The customer service is the best thing about the Nadia Hotel-- super friendly and helpful personnel. They will make sure you have anything you need. The Nadia is centrally located and overlooks a beautiful canal. This hotel is SO cozy and charming! Since it is part of a historic building the rooms are small, but they are completely outfitted with everything you need, and the beds are very comfortable. The street outside can be noisy, so you may want a room at the back, but we loved our canal view and wouldn't have traded it for a quieter room. We didn't mind the climb up the narrow stairs (typical of the historic buildings,) because your luggage will be brought up for you. But if you have stair issues you will probably be better off in a modern hotel with an elevator. The breakfast room is delightful and the continental breakfast is very good. The price was the best we could find in Amsterdam. We were SO pleased and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very freindly”
Reviews.Author: Rossi009
Reviews.Content: A hotel with an exellent location in the center of the town and with a cozy atmosphe . The service is very good . A perfect hotel for a tourist visit.

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly fine 2 star hotel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: haziewaller
Reviews.Content: our recent stay was perfectly delightful! the unassuming locked door w/buzzer on busy Raadhuis Straat was the 1st surprise. the steep narrow steps (37!) to the reception area was the 2nd. fresh flowers in the room was 3rd. the rooms are like ship's cabins, small w/clever built-ins, & the original dark wood. the bathrooms were completely modern & bright. the breakfast room was cozy & welcoming, w/a good variety of fresh breakfast items & a nice view of the Westerkirk. tho the hotel was very busy during our stay, Osam & his friendly staff were very accomodating in helping w/our specific room request. we felt very safe w/several layers of security (front door, hall door, room door, in room safe). we stayed 5 days & walked everywhere, w/the exception of a canal cruise. we couldn't have picked a better location! thanks again to Osam & Hazem!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for money!”
Reviews.Author: wannarideabike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. You would have never believed it was a 2* if it had not been posted everywhere. The hotel was clean and comfortable, location was perfect the staff was friendly and breakfast was good. This was our first time to Amsterdam and the only thing that bothered us was the smoking. I'm not too sure if it is allowed in all hotels or just in this one but the fact that smoking was allowed in the hotel is what made our "sleep quality" not 5/5. We don't smoke so it was hard for us to get good quality sleep because of that. Otherwise we really enjoyed the hotel, and did have a room with a balcony and that even had a good view. I would recommend this to someone who has no problem with smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: doron71
Reviews.Content: For the second time at the hotel and waiting for the third, great location 3 min' from dam square 5 min' fron central station. Clean room, helpful & polite staff, good breakfast...all you need for your stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 2stars hotel without any bad surprise”
Reviews.Author: VictorPaname
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the corner of the WesterMarkt, in a beautiful district. The price of the single room is descent. The single room is a bit too small, but well conceived and equiped, and also very clean. The breakfast is copious. The staff is very professional and multilingual with a warm welcome. The safety is efficient and there is a safe deposit box in the room. I have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MandR50
Reviews.Content: Location good - central - close to trams and Dam Square. Breakfast good. Staff most helpful with carrying of bags. Rooms and bathrooms small but adequate. Nice small touches e.g. room flowers and check in beverages. Not so good - Very steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Try this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pembridge
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a well located hotel within a short walking distance from Central station. The welcoming staff were helpful and very friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The stairs are steep but luggage is taken to your room by a member of staff. The twin room was clean and comfortable with a decent sized bathroom and superb hot shower. Tea/coffee, kettle in the room, which I love after a day strolling around Amsterdam. Breakfast is simple, croissants, rolls, juice etc but very fresh. The hotel is quiet and our canal view room was lovely, complete with a vase of fresh flowers.......a nice touch! Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance and there are plenty of eating places close to the hotel. Thanks to Osam and his staff from the two sweet ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveler60
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviewers - fantastic location, 2* product but 5* service! Couldn't ask for more personal attention. Single room was basic and tiny but clean and comfortable. If you are visiting Amsterdam for sightseeing, this room is all you need since you'll be out all day anyway and only return to sleep. Breakfast is simple and basic, too, but was all I needed to get started - coffee, tea, juice, bread, bread rolls, cheese, jams, yoghurt. Osam is fantastic and tried everything to accommodate me on the third night that was fully booked. Safe was locked, he came straight away to fix it. Had a beautiful bunch of flowers in my room during the stay. My room was facing the back of the building, so the only 'noise' I heard was the church bells - just beautiful. The only negative point in my room was the too soft mattress, other than that, everything was great. I would certainly stay at Hotel Nadia again and not hesitate to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location, in an even greater city.”
Reviews.Author: thatoneguyinwa
Reviews.Content: This place has been the best of my trip so far. Currently backpacking through Europe for six weeks and this place was killer. Centrally located and the staff are so friendly and helpful, just like the residents of the city. Free internet, clean rooms on a canal. What more could you ask for. This is definitely worth a stay if you are ever in Amsterdam. I actually found this in Lonely Planet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In A Great Location & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chars1980
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by some friends, who then decided to travel with us for my partner's surprise 30th birthday. We arrived early and even though we arrived early the staff couldnt do enough for us. We were able to leave our baggage with them and spend the rest of the day exploring Amsterdam. The hotel is literally five minutes walk from Dam Square, with a Cashpoint right opposite the Hotel which was handy. During our stay the staff were great in letting us use ironing board and irons, always with a smile and nothing too much trouble. Considering this hotel is rated a two star the staff offer a better service than in some five star hotels we've stayed in. As it was my partner's birthday they gave him some flowers which I thought was a great little touch to the weekend. Our room was small....but to be fair who goes away to spend all weekend in your room???? They were immaculate and clean. Staff will also recommend the best place to go to for foreign exchange....POTTS...right by Dam Square...To be honest we will definately be staying here again and have our friends to thank for the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT CHIMING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: yauchty
Reviews.Content: The stairs is amazing, but not for the faint hearted ! The room was small but great, overlooking the canal and nearby charming, but often chiming church. The Manager and staff were the best yet, could not do enough for us. Really good central location, just a walk to anywhere. We would return to Nadia again, it is nicely Quirky ! Not the hotels fault, but do not rely totally on the Airport/hotel shuttle bus, they forgot us...could have missed our flight home! But well done Nadia..we'll be back thanks!

Reviews.Title: “2* Hotel But 5* Service, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Blanche&DaveMcColl
Reviews.Content: We had booked the Nadia after reading excellent reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed! This really is a fabulous place to stay, it is friendly, hospitable and welcoming and the location is perfect with the majority of local attractions within walking distance. The stairs are of course as steep as they look, but your luggage is taken up and down for you so that did not pose a problem, the reception is 24 hours and you are asked to leave your key each time you go out, again not a problem. We have booked a balcony room with a side canal room and were put in room 205 which was on the same floor as the breakfast room which was handy! As we had read previous reviews we knew what to expect regarding size, road noise and bathroom facilities etc, we were pleased with our room, it had every we needed to make our stay comfortable and the flowers were a really nice touch. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the world go by, it could be noisy but as it was a busy road that was to be expected. The room had a comfortable bed, tv, fridge, tea/coffee facilities, the hotel kindly lent us larger cups on request. The bathroom was small with a shower area, no bath but not really needed for a short break anyway, overall we had everything we needed, it was compact and comfortable and if you are looking for something other than this then you may be better looking at some of the larger groups of hotels who may be more modern and spacious but would certainly lack the warmth and friendliess this hotel has to offer, the service is really second to none and you always receive a smile and a warm welcome from all the staff. The breakfast room is very cosy, we had lovely fresh warm croissants with cheese every day, there is a selection of bread, rolls and cakes and you could ask for your bread to be toasted. The coffee was lovely, helped by the cartons of cream, it was addictive. I believe you could go in throughout the day and help yourself to coffee. We used the breakfast room a few times during the day as we had problems getting an internet connection in our room, that was not a problem to do so and it was nice sitting overlooking the canal. We did find that the breakfast room got quite busy when we went, which was about 9.15am, but we always got seated. On our last day our airport transfer was 7.20am and we were able to get breakfast before we left, we just let the hotel know the daybefore, they also called the airpost transfer service and arranged our pick up for us, very helpful. Our room was made up on a daily basis, when we went out in the morning we just asked for this to be done when we dropped our key in, our towels were changed daily and our bedding was also changed during our 4 night stay. Before we came to Amsterdam we did a lot of research and also booked a few attracttions on line, mainly to save a bit of time queing up. If you are visiting the Anne Frank house, which is so close to the Nadia we could see the building from our room, I would recommend booking online before you go, this only costs an extra 0.50 cents each and saves around 2 hours queing time, depending on when you visit. We booked a time arriving between 10.15am and 10.45am (you could arrive anytime between this allocation) and it was quite a queue then, you get in through a different entrance and really saves you a lot of your precious holiday time queing up, it was an amazing experience and I found it helped just having read the book and watched the dvd before going, it was one of the highlights of the trip. When we arrived on the Saturday we joined a Sandemans 3 hour walking tour conducted by a guy called Geerk, he was amazing, so funny and informative, certainly recommed this tour as it works on a tipping basis only, and it is in the best interest of the tour guide to keep you informed and we were definitley informed and entertained by Geerk. We has also booked to visit the red light district through Randy Roys Redlight District tours, it had been recommended on trip advisor as the lady doing the tours and I believe owning the company (Kimberley) was meant to be a brilliant, funny and knowledgable guide, unfortunatley when we turned up at the meeting point we were told she was off sick and our tour was taken by someone else, being honest we were very disappointed with the tour and ve even emailed Kimberley the next day with our comments, we also advised her we were to be there a few more days hoping she would offer to do the tour the way we were assuming it would be, but we got an email back saying sorry we did not enjoy it and maybe the next tme we were in Amsterdam we could meet up for a drink, sorry Kimberley but a big thumbs down, that was not the response we wanted. There are a lot of tour companies offering red light district tours that include meeting and talking to ex prostitues which would have probably been more informative and interesting, Sandemans tours do a red light district tour and with hindsight we would have went with them, as a point onf interest as least half a dozen people declined the tour when they heard Kimberley was sick, and also at the drink afterwards the other people in the group were not that overly impressed either. We also visited Madame Tussuads, that was a bit overrated, the Amsterdam Dungeon was geat fun and I would recommend that, it is a bit audience participation but really good, or we thought so anyway. We did a canal trip which to be honest was nothing exceptional, we had booked a combi ticket that allowed us to vist the above and included the canal visit, it was all an experience and worth doing. We had a great time and walked for miles, there is so much to see and do and I could go on for hours, but I better stop here. To sum it up, the Nadia is such a great place, be assured you will not be disappointed if you keep your expectations real, a bit of advice would be to bring earplugs and you will get a more peaceful sleep. There is a supermarket about a couple of hundred yards to the left of the hotel, great for picking up a few beers for the room, or like we did getting some rolls, sandwich filler for a packed lunch, oh yeah, don't forget to try the chips and mayo as thay are great. Please feel free to get in touch if I can help with any info I will. Happy holidays and thanks for reading, hope you enjoy the Nadia as much as we did. Blanche & Dave

Reviews.Title: “Another extremely enjoyable stay at the Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: davejackSheffield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location very close to Dam Square and the main shopping areas. The hotel buidling is a typical Dutch style with many interesting features. Whilst the stairway to the Reception is very steep the staff will always help you with the carrying of luggage. The rooms are adequate with good facilities including a fridge, a TV and tea/coffee making . The breakfast is basic but located in a room with an excellent Kaiser's canal view. The staff are extremely courteous , helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better service”
Reviews.Author: red3967
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your average European hotel, it was in a great location, the rooms are small, but has everything you need, where this hotel outshines all others is in it's customer service. The staff is extremly friendly and helpful, they really bend over backwards to ensure that you have a pleasurable experience. We did not have to ask for a thing. Deffinitely suggest spending the few extra $$ (5 euro I think it was) for a room with a balcony, we did not spend much time in our room, but when we did, we spent it on the balcony. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Again - a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: UsRiggss
Reviews.Content: Another lovely visit. Hotel and breakfast great. The weather was great, no rain and sunny all day.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly and Cosy Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia in August 2010 for a total of 4 nights in all. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly and smiling receptionist. Our luggage was carried up the stairs and despatched to our room on the first floor overlooking the canal which was more than adequate for our stay with additional amenietites such as tea making facilities, haridryer, fridge and personal safe to make your stay that more comfortable. Our bathroom was very clean with a good pressue in the shower and abdundance of fluffy towels of different sizes changed daily. Fresh cut flowers with a personalized message greeted us. A good quality Continental breakfast (croissants, breads, cereals, cheese, bread, cake, jam, Nutella, Calve Peanut butter, fruit, orange juice, Twinnings tea and good coffee the perfect morning pick-me-up) in continuous supply is served each morning from 7:30 to 10:30 in a snug breakfast room looking to the canal and the Weterkirk Church. HOWEVER, WHAT MAKES THIS HOTEL SUCH A LOVELY PLACE IS THE HOTEL OWNER MR. OSMAN AND HIS TEAM OF VERY VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL STAFF WHO GO OUT OF THEIR WAY TO MAKE YOU FEEL AT HOME FROM THE FIRST MOMENT YOU ARRIVE RIGHT UNTIL YOU LEAVE. NOTHING IS TOO MUCH TROUBLE FOR ANY OF THEM AT ANYTIME. The hotel is conveniently located for exploring all the city sights and is just a 7 minute walk from Dam Square and is served by both bus and tram to and from the Central Station. For those who interested to visit the Flower Auction Bus No. 172 passes the hotel's door! Another added-bonus is that the Hotel Nadia is on the Schiphol Airport Shuttle service bus route. I would like to take this opportunity to thank Mr. Osman and his staff for making our stay at the Hotel Nadia an absolute joy. We will definitely be back! With our warmest regards, Maria and Medhat Cairo, Egypt

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable prices but extremely small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rodpicanco
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably nice hotel. The service is decent enough. Breakfast is good. The major problem is that the hotel as a whole is extremely small. The first thing you notice when entering the hotel is the super high and steep staircase. The second surprise is the size of the rooms, that are super small. I stayed on my own, and so they gave me a room that I almost could reach the two opposite walls with my arms stretched. I also felt a little bit deceived by their website, which showed the building at which the hotel is located, and gave the impression that such building was the whole building. It was not, in fact that are many hotels in the same building. That said, the hotel is pretty decent. The price is reasonable (when compared with other hotels on the same category), and the fact that you get your own bathroom (albeit small) is also a plus. There is also free wifi if you are lucky enough to get a room under the reach of their network (I was, my friends unfortunately were not). All in all, I think you will get what you paid for, and my experience staying there was positive.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley fantastic.....”
Reviews.Author: debntom
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed in nadia, and we will be staying here on our future trips to amsterdam, nice, clean hotel, the staff are very friendly and make you feel at home, asim was great, he couldnt do enough to help us. we took our friends with us this time, and they will be coming back too, also my friend works in a travel agents, and will be recommeding hotel nadia to all that ask to book up for amsterdam : ))))))))

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Little Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: damenchia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel A lot of charm! Location excellent, we walked to all areas of Amsterdam. Very good utilization of space in the rooms. They are small (as all hotel rooms in the city are!) but perfectly set up! Great pressure in the showers.The staff was very friendly and helpful. In-room safe, fridge, private bathroom, breakfast were must haves for me and they were all well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location from Centraal station”
Reviews.Author: Diane186378
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very above some shops on a busy main road, you did get used to the traffic, also the trams ran by very frequently, but you will stay no where in Amsterdam where you will not here a tram, the church across the road, you could hear the chimes of the clock during the day and night, which was really nice. The 37 steps upto the reception do not put you off, you need only to climb twice a day. Rooms cosy, and staff very friendly, rooms have bouquets of flowers in them welcoming you to have a nice stay. I even had a bouquet of flowers given to me on my birthday, which i thought was really nice of them, So thanks Osam and all your staff, we enjoyed our stay and shall certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly good!”
Reviews.Author: devlio
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this trip as a surprise birthday present so I had no expectations of this hotel- however, I was very pleasantly surprised! The stairs was steep but really no problem at all. We were given a soft drink while checking in, which was a nice touch, and our room was at recption level. The most surprising thing about the room was the great use of space- it had everything we needed- comfy bed, TV, desk, small but really clean bathroom and a good size balcony with nice views of the canal and the church. There was also a bunch of fresh flowers in the room, which my girlfriend loved! Breakfast was basic but nice- yogurt, toast and tea. One morning we were quite late for breakfast due to a late one the night before, but they put on some toast and tea, which was nice of them. It's very central, 5 minute walk to Dam Square and literally across the road from Anne Frank's house. It was quiet at night time too and very safe. Visit the Bols distillery, good laugh and great cocktails. We mentioned to the bar man there that it was my birthday and he was very generous with the Genever!! We loved Amsterdam and will stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy staying at Nadia”
Reviews.Author: desbennett06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nadia for 2 nights on a trip to Amsterdam to celebrate my partners 30th Birthday....It was my 2nd stay at Nadia and as I expected it was friendly and welcoming, just like the first time....it certainly has a lot of character and the stairs on arrival are spectecular, you certainly know you've just arrived in Amsterdam. We had a Canal View room(207), which was so handy for the Breakfast Room, which is beautiful. The staff were friendly and helpful and very welcoming, and we have no hesitation in recommending this place, it is just a few minutes off Dam Square and about 10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Rail Station, so therefore very handy for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Lagoons
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nadia Hotel for 13 nights visiting our daughter and her family (husband + 2) who reside in a small Amsterdam apartment, hence our need for accommodation. All the good stuff you read about the Nadia is true and not much that we can add that has not already been said. We stayed in room 4 which is a great canal view room and only half way up the first flight of stairs which appear to become less steep the longer you stay. We are aged 60/54 and handled the steps. It is great that the staff carry your luggage up and down for you (thanks Hasim). This is a major plus. Street noise and church bell did not bother us and we image would only be a problem for guests who are used to absolute quiet. This is our third visit to Amsterdam to see our family and we hope to regularly return. We will now book with Nadia as our first option. To the Manager and staff of the Nadia thank you. You have set high standards of customer service in a city not generally renowned for it. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Itsiseasy
Reviews.Content: Like most of the other reviews ,One cannot say enough about the hospitality from the staff at the Nadia Hotel in Amsterdam. The helpful and personable staff are AMAZING. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant”
Reviews.Author: yellow22
Reviews.Content: Had a longweekend at the hotel room was small but adequate but clean towels changed daily staff very helpful would stay there again great place

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner220
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved Hotel Nadia! We had a terrible flight to Amsterdam and the airlines lost our luggage. When we arrived at the hotel around 9:00 at night we were exhausted. They welcomed us and went and got us toothbrushes, toothpaste, and other essentials to freshen up. There was flowers in our room with a card for our Honeymoon stay. While in Europe we stayed in four different cities and four different hotels. In Rome we even stayed in a five star Waldorf Astoria hotel, but none of these hotels were as warm and welcoming as Hotel Nadia. We had a wonderful balcony we could sit on and look at the street life below. There is a beautiful church across the street as well as canals on both sides. We found the location excellent for everything we wanted to do in Amsterdam. Everyone at the hotel was wonderful and we definitly will be staying there when we get back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: StratfordianUk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff could not be more welcoming and were extremely helpful throughout our stay. The rooms are small ( the only reason for me giving them 4 rather than 5 stars) but very comfortable with everything you need. The location is very central and we walked all round the city. The price was very reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - Thank you”
Reviews.Author: kwack17
Reviews.Content: Thank you, thank you and once and again thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Nadia. On my third day in Amsterdam I was taken ill and had to spend some hours in the ER in an Amsterdam hospital. The manager of the hotel phoned for a taxi for me in the middle of the night. On arriving back at the hotel, I was given a room on a lower floor and allowed a little extra time to check out due to feeling poorly. The attention and care given by the staff at the hotel was beyond all expectations. Apart from that the rooms at the hotel was especially clean, hospitality from the staff excellent (even before my illness). In short, not a bad word to say about the hotel. I would definitely like to return to Amsterdam in the future to see all the places that I was unable to visit and if so, I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Once again: THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, people and price”
Reviews.Author: d0nelle
Reviews.Content: Don't let the pics of the ouside of Hotel Nadia put you off cos inside its a very clean, cozy, welcoming hotel. Perfect location just 5 mins from Dam Square. We were welcomed with a complementary drink and beautiful bunch of fresh flowers in our room by staff that were very friendly, funny and helpful. The stairs are exactly as described with an additional two flights to our room, but Hazem carried all our luggage up for us, bless. We were horrified at the daunting climb at first but to be honest they weren't that bad infact they helped work off some of those extra calories we consumed. Breakfast was a continous supply of croissants, rolls, breads, cakes, juice and coffee in a gorgeous room overlooking the canal. Our triple room with balcony was great with a fantastic view down to the main street. Comfortable beds and ample storage . l couldn't fault our stay here and can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Like home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: miauwmiauw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 10 days, business and fun. Normally 10 days in a city can be quite overwhelming but staying in Hotel Nadia made it just perfect! Lovely friendly staff, very helpfull and chatty. A beautifull garden made by the owner, Osam, in which I sat and unwound. Two LOVELY cats to stroke if one needs a little bit of loving. Our room was at the top and the view was simply stunning. I have stayed in a lot of hotels during my tavels and this one is by far the best one. And for the right price too. So, people, don't bother with the more expensive snobby options! Stay with the friendly people of Hotel Nadia where you will be looked after and feel at home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: nici_s
Reviews.Content: The staff and owner could not do enough to accommodate us during our stay, this more than made up for the room being tired (however, I understand that there are more recently renovated rooms than the one that we had). Every description provided of the accommodation by the hotel is entirely accurate, including that relating the stairs however even in this respect Hotel Nadia contributed to a true Amsterdam experience. The fresh flowers awaited our arrival were a lovely touch. A good hotel experience for the price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming-helpful staff, interesting architecture.”
Reviews.Author: caronis
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel- walking distance to what is called "Time Square", trams and the train station. The staff is welcoming, willing to take your bags up the stairs for you and are accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service - great location”
Reviews.Author: quietguy2507
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is up a precipitous flight of stairs of Raadhuis Straat just across the canal from the Anne Frank Huis. Very central and convenient for trams and the canal. The welcome was terrific - in fact all of our encounters with staff in the five days that we were there were very positive. The rooms are tiny - our double was just big enough for the bed, a wardrobe that obstructed the bedroom door and a set of shelves. The bathroom was so small we had to sit side saddle on the toilet for lack of knee space. We were there during a hot spell and keeping cool whilst keeping traffic noise to a minimum was a challenge. No aircon at the Hotel Nadia. I can imagine that during the cooler months, especially winter, it would be very cosy. It was all very clean, fresh flowers in our room upon arrival, basic but tasty breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Rosieb11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff are all very friendly & helpful, especially carrying your luggage up & down the very steep flight of stairs. The rooms are not big but have everything you want in them for a short stay. Although we had to close the windows at night because of the noise outside, fans were provided which kept the room nice & cool. Breakfast was continental style & although the breakfast room was not big it suited our needs. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, would be happy to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: klzomar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was an easy walk from the train station and although the staircase is very steep the staff helped me with my luggage so it was not a problem. I felt very comfortable in the hotel, the room was cozy and had handy amenities like a coffee maker, hairdryer, etc. The staff were very friendly and excellent hosts.

Reviews.Title: “A small well situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: v11rah
Reviews.Content: We liked the Nadia, it is not luxurious but is very clean and well situated. The hotel is 2 mins from AnneFrank Huis and is well situated for Dam square. The breakfast was continental but served our needs. The hotel is fine for a two or three night stay, for longer stays I would possibly spend more and get a little bit more room. But on the whole a great little Hotel. The staff are Great!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Borry10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really easy to find and you can walk there in 15 minutes from the station, or get a tram, don't get a taxi - we were quoted â‚¬15 - waste of money. On arrival at the hotel the stairs are steep but your bags are delivered to your room while you check in and enjoy a free soft drink! We were told we'd have to move room part way through our stay but this was because we were being upgraded to a bigger room due to our big luggage! Both rooms were good with canal view, and dark curtains so you sleep well in the morning. We even got flowers in the second room. From the hotel you can walk everywhere, museum quarter, Jordaan region, red light district etc within 15 minutes tops. But the best thing is that it is so near Anne Frank's house - make sure you go at 8.45am to get in for 9am as the queues are long by mid morning and we could see it from our hotel window! Also definitely take a canal trip as you see more of the city and from a different viewpoint. The staff were all helpful and friendly, and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was plentiful with choice but continental style, cheese, bread, yoghurts, and sweet snacks. You can get a hot chocolate if you ask! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gavola
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here on the recommendation of my brother and his wife. I have travelled to amsterdam many times in the past and this hotel with its charm, central location, excellent views and service which is second to none. The rooms are small but traditionally dutch and cosy, breakfast consistes of tea/coffee, toast, croissants, pastries, cold meats and cheese and was always fresh and served with a smile. I wouls have no hesitatin in recommending this hotel to a friend and i will definately return in the future

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel is a great hotel archetypal of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JeffHammel
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Hotel Nadia. As the first time, I was not disappointed. The staff was extraordinarily helpful. The room, though not large, wasn't cramped and is in a beautiful gallery building right downtown close to everything. I got a balcony room, which was fully worth it, seeing Amsterdam outside in the mornings and evening. The price is very reasonable too. In short, I love the hotel and am likely to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel, friendly service - all in all an insiders' tip”
Reviews.Author: Lineve
Reviews.Content: I visited Amsterdam for several times in the past 9 years and I had different kind of accommodations. I stayed at really good hotels and I also had the pleisure to share bathrooms at hostels :-) After researching the internet for a hotel with rooms having a balcony, I found this hidden pearl, located only a few steps from the Damrak. The Nadia Hotel reflects typical Dutch architecture and my boyfriend and I really enjoyed climbing tight stairs - a real "to do"-thing in Amsterdam :-) Sitting at our balcony, watching the lights of Amsterdam at night, listening to the bell of the Wester Kerk (Church) was a great experience. This is for sure: my boyfriend and I will come back to Amsterdam again and we will definitely stay at the Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: c_different_places
Reviews.Content: Sehr freundliches Personal, angenehme und familiÃ¤re AtmosphÃ¤re, Zimmer sind ordentlich und gemÃ¼tlich, allerdings zur StraÃŸe hin doch sehr laut... (Oropax helfen) Der KÃ¼hlschrank in jedem Zimmer ist ein echtes Plus. Zentral und schÃ¶n gelegen. WÃ¼rden wir jederzeit wieder buchen!!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: smokinthedam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in the heart of Amsterdam. The staff are very friendly and helpful and go out of their way to make you feel at home. I had a low floor balcony room with excellent canal views and the amenities in place take care of your needs. The stairs are steep same as most of the accomodation but its well worth the climb. It is situated centrally and has easy access to public transport. This was my second visit to Hotel Nadia and I will always try to book here first when I return, it's great value for the money and just a 10 minute walk from Dam Square. The most important thing for me was feeling safe and Hotel Nadia staff offerred help with directions and booking trips/tours and provided us with a map and local information. Ive started to save up already for my next visit to Hotel Nadia. Note to the staff at Hotel Nadia: Keep up the good work x

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: opale013
Reviews.Content: A good bargain. A tiny but confortable and lovely room where you can have tea or coffee and read with a view on the canal. Very nice staff. Stairs can be frightening but the staff carries your luggage. A bit noisy but when you close the window that is not a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “not 5 star but cute with character”
Reviews.Author: smerr2
Reviews.Content: nice place to stay, we had a great room . We could hear the tram running all night and the bells from the tower across the street ring every 15 minutes. We slept with the windows open and we had a room facing the street

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: velascva
Reviews.Content: The Nadia is in a very good location near the Jordaan and also to the Central Station. We like the location and everything we want or need is very close. Rent a bike and tour the city from there. The staff is very courteous and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and care”
Reviews.Author: AzmiToronot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very homely,they go out of the way to make things very comfortable to the traveller, centrally located within the city of Amsterdam and a special thanks to the manager osama who goes out of his way to make things pleasent for you. Been to Amsterdam many times and always stay at hotel nadir keep the good work up team nadia

Reviews.Title: “OSAM the great manager and his magnificent staff”
Reviews.Author: krasnopolskies
Reviews.Content: Following a 5 min Tram journey from the Central Station we arrived to the most welcoming, friendly and accommodating staff we have ever met. The hotel was perfect in every way from the location -just in the heart of the city- to the everyday cleaned rooms to the very kind service and to the continental breakfast. Our room was reasonable in size when considered it is amsterdam. It had a nice channel view next to a charming old church and coffee/tea facilities in the room were free of charge. We truly felt like home. And absolutely, the man behind all these wonderful things is Mr. Osam, a real gentleman, a nice hearted person and a real professional. The doctor â€“and i think the boss- of the hotel was a helpful but somewhat an interesting person who did not believe me that i am a doc since we had a discussion on aspirin. His personal belief was that aspirin is not an antipyretic â€“so now i do not believe that he was a doc, lol. The name is Nadia. Thanks you so much for a perfect holiday and we would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modest hotel”
Reviews.Author: OAG61
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is ideally located across the street from WesternKerk/AnneFrank House.It is modest, but clean , with friendly and helpful staff,. Breakfast is simple but good quality.Hotel rooms are tiny, bathrooms are dated, but very clean.Hotel is close to evrything- 5 min walking to DamSquare, 15 min to Central station, 15 min to Leidsplen, 20 min to Museums.Good for the travel on budget.

Reviews.Title: “A Birthday stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: Jamielee40
Reviews.Content: A group of 7 friends stayed at the Hotel Nadia for 3nights, the location of the hotel was ideal for exploring Amsterdam and you weren't short of cafe's, bar's or nice restaurant's a stone throw away from the hotel. As previously mentioned in other reviews the stairs are very steep, so if you have any mobility problems this hotel is not for you, however, there were always staff on hand to help with your luggage. The room and ensuite bathroom were very compact, but very clean and more than adequate for our needs (all the rooms included a small fridge which was handy) and the rooms we stayed in were lovely and quiet. Due to it being my birthday, a friend had phoned prior to our stay to enlighten the hotel of this fact. They had kindly placed beautiful hand tied bouquets of flowers in our rooms with 'birthday wishes from the Hotel Nadia', which was a lovely touch. The staff at the Hotel Nadia, was, what made it such a lovely place. As they were all amazing and bent over backwards to help us out with anything we needed to know or do. On the saturday the manager (who's name escapes me - sorry) allowed us to use the breakfast room for a short period of time as a meeting area, while waiting for our other friends that were staying out with the Hotel Nadia to join us, This was fantastic, as there was 15 of us in total and the bedrooms - would have never allowed for our gathering prior to going out. Breakfast, was of continental nature, there was always plenty of breads, cheese, yogurts, fruit and drinks. The dining area was snug but added to the atmosphere and quaintness of the hotel. If your looking for a fancy hotel, the Hotel Nadia is not for you. However, if your looking for a somewhere functional, central, good value for money with amazing staff - THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU. I would like to take this oppurtunity to thank the staff at the Hotel Nadia for going out of their way and making our stay really enjoyable. We hope to be back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia will take great care of you”
Reviews.Author: Melcifer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Nadia many times and always have a great time. The staff is exceedingly friendly and helpful. The location is great. It is really my home away from home in Amsterdam. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfekt”
Reviews.Author: Bettina44
Reviews.Content: Das Hotel Nadia ist sehr zentral gelegen, in Mitten von 2 Grachten, ein wunderschoenes Gebaeude mit kl. Turm. Alle Sehenswuerdigkeiten, tolle Restaurants, Red Light usf. sind zu Fuss gut erreichbar oder in der Naehe (ein paar Schritte!) befindet sich auch eine Bus- bzw. Tramhaltestelle, mit direkten Verbindungen nach Central Station. Der Ausblick der Zimmer: in ein Innenhof, zur Strasse hin, mit Blick auf die Westerkerk oder mit Canalsicht und Westerkerk, je nachdem ist der Laermpegel verschieden, von ruhig bis Strassenlaerm. Die Zimmer sind zwar klein, jedoch mit Charme eingerichtet. Wuerde sogar sagen, optimal ausgeruestet: Kuehlschrank, TV, Safe, viel Ablageflaeche. Zudem tut frau noch etwas fuer die Fitness, bis zur Rezeption sind ca. 60 steile Treppen zu erklimmen, das Hotel umfasst 3.5 Etagen. So. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, hilfsbereit, multikulti, mehrsprachig, humorvoll, geben gerne und gute Tipps ab (z.B. Restaurants, Events etc.) und v.a. scheinen sie sehr bemueht, jedem Gast die Wuensche von den Augen abzulesen. Wunderbar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family with teenagers.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOf4_2007
Reviews.Content: There's nothing my two teenagers hate more than having to sleep together in a double bed on vacation, so the 4 twin beds in our room at Hotel Nadia were perfect! The room was lovely, and they even provided us with a huge electric fan since the weather was very hot. The breakfast room was very nice with a good selection and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best family hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: oskar757
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be one of the best family hotel in Amsterdam as it is close to the centre of Amsterdam and it has family rooms with 4 beds in so no more ordering 2 rooms if your going with your little ones. The only down side to this hotel is there is a lot of steep stairs to the reception but on arrival the staff do carry your luggage up them to your room and are very helpful thoughout your stay. The rooms are clean and well maintaned and cleaned upon request. A+

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Happy to leave you homeless”
Reviews.Author: gidion
Reviews.Content: Initial booking was made via another person in the group, this person hadto drop out of the trip so we then asked to transfer the booking into a new name (and credit card). Was told this is too complicated for them to do, instead cancel the first reservationa and rebook. Carried out their instructions and rebooked within 1 minute of the cancelation. Was then informed hotel is full and they can't accept.!! Avoid this dump at all costs!!!!!!!! They will mess you around and leave you with nowhere to stay. Also have a ridiculous policy of accepting no bookings over weekends unless you stay sunday night as well (even when most people on short breaks need to be back for work on the Monday). Terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Small Rooms, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jkbDc
Reviews.Content: The people who run this place treat their customers wonderfully. The only drawback about the place is that the rooms are small. Also, if you are looking for high-end chic, you should look elsewhere. We had two different rooms during out stay. One room had a porch, which was very pleasant to sit on. The rooms were exactly what we were looking for: great location and comfortable. The rooms don't have A/C, but the Amsterdam weather is rarely hot enough to warrant it (make certain to bring a sweater or even a light coat with you). Each room had a very cool looking fan (which worked perfectly) and also some great looking Middle Eastern lamps. They also serve a very good breakfast in a very nice breakfast room with some seats overlooking a canal. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “yes, yes, yes nadia hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tabsluckystrike
Reviews.Content: really close to all major attractions and tram stops but not so close that your bothered by the noise. the hotel has very steep stairs but there are people to carry your bags up for you- nice. the last two times i have been to amsterdam i have stayed here and couldn't ask for any better. i enjoyed the balcony room- very relaxing, the flowers that were put in my room were a greatly appreciated finishing touch and i'm definatly staying here next time!

Reviews.Title: “5 * staff @ this friendly & accommodating hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefastwalker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July and found the staff helpful, friendly and accommodating. We were met by Hazem who quickly ran up the now infamous steep stairs to the reception. When there we were given a free soft drink whilst waiting for our room. We were given our room and told our luggage was in there for us. A little bonus from reception was a little travel guide and a map. The map we used continually during our 2 night break and was invaluable as we walked up and down endless canals, nooks and crannies! The room was small and clean, which was not a bad thing for us as we spent as many hours as possible in the city of Amsterdam and not in our room. In the room there was a fridge, small table with 2 chairs, fresh flowers on welcome, small bathroom with powerful shower. An added bonus within the room is a free (yes free!) safety deposit box. The breakfast was of a continental nature with croissants, cheeses, toast, orange juice and fruit, enough to fill us up for the many walking miles ahead! The breakfast bar was cosy and seats looking out over Wester Kerk and the canal made breakfast more romantic! The situation of the hotel is great too, a few metres away from Anne Frank house and within walking distance to other points of interest too. We would recommend buying a tram ticket as there only 7euros for the day which would have saved our legs! All in all this hotel was great, I just want to make sure that you realise you are in a busy city location and though we had no noise from bars and clubs we did have the noise of the trams from early morn until late at night, but as we were exhausted from our walking adventure this wasn't a big problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Masirahqueen
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay in Amsterdam at the Hotel Nadia. Perfect location, excellent service, and beautifully decorated breakfast area ! The Anne Frank museum is around the corner, 5-10 minute walk to the center and about a 15 minute walk to the Central Station. Trams are easily accessible as well. I wouldn't want to stay right at the center because that would be very noisy and too many people! Osam, the manager was very helpful. I was able to print my boarding pass and they also took care of booking a good taxi driver for the airport The room is very small but we didn't really spend that much time in the room. The stairs gave me a much needed exercise :) I would recommend getting online tickets to the museum to avoid the lines. You can also go to the Anne Frank museum first thing in the morning or in the evening. Van Gogh museum tickets purchased online are good anytime for a year. We also took a trip to Saanse Schans(cheese factory, windmills etc) via the Connexion bus #91(central station). It only cost us 5euro/person round trip. I would have taken a trip to Brussels if we had more time. By the way, if you like Thai food, go to Butterfly Cafe (same canal where the red light district is). Best Thai food I ever tasted in Europe! Amsterdam was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “lots of character,great location!”
Reviews.Author: darlinglisa
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in this little hotel on a very busy street, I looked straight up the steepest stairs I've ever seen.I instantly felt at home and knew I was in for a different kind of hotel experience.The staff was great and even though the rooms were on the smaller side,we all found it quite charming!Since there were 5 of us ,we were very pleased with the prices.The free breakfast was actually quite tasty and there was a wonderful pancake house right next door as well!Next time I would take a taxi, as it is hard to find parking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff, Free Water, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LFine
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met up in Amsterdam before heading on to South Africa. We chose to stay at the Hotel Nadia for our stop over. The staff was very attentive and made provisions for us as needed. A few features that we appreciated was the superb central location of the hotel. It is a great starting point for all of the major sites. Another personal touch we enjoyed is that the front desk regularly offered us free bottled water or sodas. The coffee and tea bar was open 24 hours. They allowed us a late check out and free luggage storage as well. A few points to mention are: the stairs leading up to the reception area are very steep. However, I have been to Amsterdam many times and have not stayed a hotel yet that does not have steep stairs. It is part of the architecture of the city. At the Nadia, the staff made an extra effort to assist us with our luggage. Also, our room was small. It was enough for our little group because we are used to traveling on a budget. However, this may not be the place for you if you are the five-star type. Amsterdam is such a lovely city that you won't be spending much time in your room anyway. Lastly, we had difficulty getting a strong signal on the free WiFi from our room. But we were able to use it easily in the reception area. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Nadia. I will return there on subsequent trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “annamargherita”
Reviews.Author: annamargherita2008
Reviews.Content: posizione centrale,buona ospitalitÃ ,stanze stile olandese ,colazione soddisfacente...giusta anche la possibilitÃ  di fruire della piccola cucina.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, friendly, helpful staff and clean room with wifi”
Reviews.Author: Taraterrific
Reviews.Content: Were very impressed with Hotel Nadia. It was very good value for money. The steep stairs are a shock when you enter but a staff member is instantly there to carry your bags. The room was small but funtional and clean with the added bonus of wifi. Breakfast was good and available very early if needed. Didn't need to use public transport as the hotel was so well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Some 73 steps”
Reviews.Author: ettelbruck
Reviews.Content: So there is some walking to reach top floor rooms... But all other things are so good that count that just the exercise you can't get in flat Netherlands! Extremely friendly and welcoming service. Room is not that big but very functional and nice (yes, the flowers too). We had a room with balcony and nice view to the church, really enjoyable to have a little nightbreak before sleep! Location is so near to Anne Frank House and not too much walking to Central Station. Nadia is excellent choice for short Amsterdam visit with little luggage - though they are willing to help you with any kind of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BGtraveller23
