Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location - 3 minutes away from the Dam square, just opposite to Anne Frank house and 15 minutes walking from the Amsterdam Centraal train station and Red Light District. About service there is one word - great. Nice people who made us feel welcome, always pay attention on our personal needs and finding fresh flowers in the room was a very pleasant surprise. They gave us a free map of the city so don't hurry to buy one on the way to hotel. The breakfast room and the food itself was very good and if you are not much into meat you will really enjoy the croissants with nutella. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to people who have problems with stairs because they are so steep. Also the bathroom was very small and we hardly pass by sink to reach the shower. Everything was clean. If I go again to Amsterdam again I would stay in Hotel Nadia for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Superb - best we've had after several trips.......”
Reviews.Author: Flounder40
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - we had 4 rooms between us. All were great bar the teenagers room which was a little on the small side, but you get what you pay for - we went for the delux version and was well worth it. staff were v friendly and helpful. weather was 30c +. Windows open and fan on - sorted us out nicely - traffic noise doesn't phase us - you're staying in a city, what do you expect??? Not a hotel for those with mobility problems as they have some serious stairs, but the porter will carry your bags with no issue. Overall a VERY jolly stay

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, cozy place with a very friendly and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: VerolovesAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: My friend and me were really comfortable in Nadia Hotel. The service is really nice and very friendly. They are very attentive; they even put flowers in our room! The room was small but fully equiped with a little fridge, a secure box, tv, coffee and tea facilities, toilet... and a fan that was very useful because it was really hot in Amsterdam. The breakfast was also perfect, delicious. We are really delighted with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly Service (mostly), Fast WiFi, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: weitsang
Reviews.Content: To enter the hotel, you need to climb up a narrow, tall stairs (not for Claustrophobia and Hypsiphobia). The room is tiny and use of space is highly optimized. The room is, however, fully functional, comes with a bathroom, closet, safe, TV, writing desk, etc. The staff are friendly and helpful. They help us carry the luggage up to our rooms, and is always helpful when we ask questions and directions. The WiFi is fast -- even faster than what I get back home.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages.”
Reviews.Author: Maestrolarry
Reviews.Content: When you step inside the Hotel Nadia, you're greeted by one of the narrowest, steepest stairways you're likely to find. All the halls are narrow, and the rooms efficiently compact. Sharing the room with a partner requires an intricate dance of mutual avoidance. Now the good part: Hotel Nadia is in an ideal location in the lovely Western Canal Ring, a quick easy walk from both Dam Square and the Anne Frank House. From the outside, the hotel is all charm, with lovely architecture and a turret corner. The surroundings are lovely as well, right on the Keizergracht canal on a handsome block within sight of the Westerkerk church. The accommodations are simple but clean and comfortable enough if you're not an unusually large person. The included breakfast is quite nice, in a common room that has a window in the turreted corner. The staff are all very helpful and courteous, and speak excellent English. The manager, Osam, showed particular personal concern for us, helping us to access the wireless internet (included) and to figure out how to use the phone, and inquiring after us later that all was still working properly. That level of personalized service is highly unusual and very helpful in a foreign land. And the steep staircase was much less threatening a moment later when a staff member immediately met us and hauled our luggage up to our room for us. We made use of that service again upon departure! Finally, the price was very reasonable, especially with the discount for using cash. It's an extraordinary value for travelers seeking convenient, no-frills lodging in an otherwise expensive city. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel is teriffic”
Reviews.Author: Ozric67
Reviews.Content: A great location, very friendly staff, comfortable rooms, delightful breakfast room and generally a very positive vibe at Nadia Hotel. We had a very happy and enjoyable stay with our three kids.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: nhwamt
Reviews.Content: From the outside, we were unsure of what I booked online. But once inside, the place was cozy and inviting. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Our room had a balcony that we enjoyed late a night.The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The place was quiet but the location was perfect for sightseeing. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in the heart of amsterdam city !!”
Reviews.Author: bretandkerrie
Reviews.Content: We really like this hotel, the staff are all freindly and helpful/ The location is great, and it is very good value. the second time we have been to this hotel, and we will certainly be returning !!

Reviews.Title: “incomparable service -lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifeafter50
Reviews.Content: First visit to Amsterdam - loved this hotel - charming and helpful staff, good breakfast - fresh flowers -tv etc - Amsterdam is amazing but made very special by Hotel Nadia. Stairs keep you fit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dlippis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a great place! The rooms are VERY clean. The service is excellent, they are very friendly and accomodating of any request. It's in a great location close to the city center. The rooms are a little small, but it's part of the charm! I would have liked AC in the rooms, but they provided fans and it wasn't that bad. I've stayed here twice and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel nadia!”
Reviews.Author: jesss987
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. And for the price, it couldn't be beat. It was very close to the city center, and many bus lines to go to the museum district, etc. The stairs are a bit steep, but they were there to carry our bags up and down. Of course, no lift, so don't go if you can't/don't want to walk up many flights of steep stairs - simple! :) Free breakfast, good location, small rooms - but you're in Amsterdam - get out of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: crandod2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed several days. We were treated with great kindness. Rooms small, but nice. Staff was wonderful. Perfect location!! I would definately stay there again and again

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for your weekend trip!”
Reviews.Author: Jojja
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Nadia hotel. The staff where so helpful, Warm and welcomming. Its a perfect hotel for your weekend trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was too short”
Reviews.Author: AnnaEnEngland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nadia for the past 9 yrs - before i stayed in larger hotels in Amsterdam. The welcoming service always makes my stay special nothing is too much trouble & i find the staff so kind and helpful but not intrusive. Stairs ? i live in a one storey house but if initially you take your time there isnt a problem i feel some people like to find fault whereever, for myself i cannot fault this hotel, superb location & value for money i will return to Amsterdam and the Nadia very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreecefanOttawa
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Nadia. As before, we got a room with a balcony as requested. This time our room was on the 4th floor. The two extra flights of stairs were not a problem and we are 55-60 yrs. young. Our room had a somewhat larger and more modern bathroom than last year - with a good shower with sliding glass door. Once again I have to say that we love the Nadia and will return again next time we are in Amsterdam. I don't know of a place in the central city which offers coffee making facilities, refrigerator, balcony, great location and amazing hosts at such a reasonable price. We'll be back!! Karen

Reviews.Title: “Staff helpful beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: ar7777777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really clean and well maintained with all the facilities we needed (2 adults 3 children). The staff were helpful beyond expectations when one of our kids was sick. This was so reassuring in an unfamiliar city. The hotel has a great atmospere due to the interesting building and engaging staff. We had a great time in Amsterdam because the hotel was 5 minutes walk to shops and supermarket, and an easy walk to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: momotarokawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nadia for 4 nights. As we read many reviews about steep steps, we were prepared but we were still surprised how small and how steep the steps are! The room was very tiny! smallest room I have ever stayed...However, the location is the best! You can walk to Anne Frank house, rental bike shops, convinience stores and other main tourist spots. They also offer free Wi-fi interner!Also it was close to tram station. Staff were very kind and helpful. This hotel would be suitable for someone who only need to sleep for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a small room, with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Peterschmidt
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at the Nadia, our last night in the Netherlands after a two-week trip throughout the Low Countries. It is centrally located, and while it is on a busy street, the neighborhood as a whole is relatively quiet and peaceful. Itâ€™s a short walk to restaurants and cafes in the Jordaan as well as to the shopping in and around Dam Square. Our room at the Nadia was impressively small, but it was cozy and clean enough for a one-night stay in the city. Our balcony had a decent view of the Westerkerk, and it was an excellent spot for watching the busy Raadhuistraat below. Because the hotelâ€™s on a major road with auto and tram traffic, the room had a little bit of street noise at night---but with a fan running in the room, that noise was easily drowned out and we slept well. The Nadiaâ€™s breakfast is served in a corner room with windows opening out on the surrounding neighborhood. The food was a usual Dutch breakfast---good but nothing fancy. What the Nadia lacks in spacious accommodations, it makes up for in excellent service. The staff was absolutely outstanding---friendly, helpful, welcoming, and good humored. When we arrived, we were offered a cold drink, and a porter helped carry our bags up the stairs to the front desk (the stairs, even by Netherlands standards, are long and steep); since we arrived early, before check-in time, we were able to drop our bags and go exploring; and we were also able to visit the house cats, Hello and Goodbye. Overall, the Nadia is probably best for short stays, when youâ€™re looking primarily for a clean, comfortable place to crash and not a room to luxuriate in---itâ€™s a good value. We were impressed by the customer service, and weâ€™d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Living a dream...”
Reviews.Author: sidewalkpoet
Reviews.Content: Yes, compared to some, Dutch rooms are small and the stairs tall, but our week-long Nadia Hotel stay was A1 all the way: extremely friendly helpful staff, great service, and location, location, location!! No more than 15-minute walks to every Centrum attraction in Amsterdam-- museums, shopping, beautiful scenery everywhere you look-- all room amenities in perfect working order, plenty of lights, private bath, public transportation literally right to the front door-- I can't imagine a more positive hotel experience. And very affordable for the budget conscious too. We definitely recommend looking at the Nadia Hotel if you plan to come to Amsterdam. You'll love it too...

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: Venezia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located on the tram system, and within easy walking of the Dam area and the Jordaan. When we opened the front door and I looked up the stairs, my heart skipped a beat as I did not think I could carry my suitcase up them, Not to worry , a young man carried everything up, and I mean up, and also carried them down when we left so the stairs were not an issue, but they could be if you were not fairly fit. One of our party of 4 was in her 80's,and she managed just fine, but she is very fit for her age. The room was small for 2 people, but we managed. The vase of lillies was a lovely touch, and we had a view onto the canal.t was alittle noisy from the nearby main road with the trams, but it did not prove to be a problem sleeping. There was a TV, room safe and a coffee and tea maker. The shower was small, but fine. breakfast was included and was better than some we had on our trip. i would certainly stay here again should I return to Amsterdam. The staff were very friendly and gave us maps and information. i loved the location, and felt at home here. There are no frills, and the room was basic, but i would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants value of money,friendly staff, and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Maria048
Reviews.Content: I trully recommend Hotel Nadia: the position is excellent, only 5 minutes away from Dam Square and Amsterdam Centraal Station, the staff is very friendly, makes you definitelly don't wanna leave anymore the hotel, very clean, safe, internet access. I had booked a quiet room (which I recommend as well), as I needed rest (being also a solo traveller), so If you need a comfortable stay and no nervs, book your room to Nadia Hotel! The right place to be! P.s: the rooms are quite small, but very cozy

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in Amsterdam....”
Reviews.Author: Miffdb
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Nadia and every stay has been absolutely wonderful. My friend and I were given a large twin room on the canal side with a stunning view of Westerkerk from the window. We were greeted warmly by reception staff and Osam, the manager. How, I don't know, but pretty much the entire staff seems to remember their repeat visitors. Beautiful flowers in the room with a 'Welcome Home' card, complimentary cold drinks, luggage delivered up the steps, help with setting up my wi-fi (a bonus since my last visit over a year ago), directions and maps, lovely breakfast each morning, help in trying to print boarding passes. Osam and his staff always seem to go out of their way to help. We had to leave on an early flight on the Sunday, and he made sure that breakfast was ready in the breakfast room a little earlier than usual so we wouldn't have to travel on rumbling tummies. The location of the Nadia is so perfect. Located on the tram line we were able to travel all over Amsterdam with little to no problems. It is also within walking distance of Dam Square, the Jordaan area.... everything. Yes, it is an oldy worldy hotel and some of the rooms may be small - but then, that is part of its charm. I love the Nadia - and appreciate all that Osam and his staff did to make our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “The main feelimg is that we are at home with our own family...”
Reviews.Author: hugo1982
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a balcony room and we just have one word: fantastic!!! the room is not as small as it appears in the photos and the cleanliness was remarcable. when on the balcony we could absorve the life of amsterdam with all the noise related of course. the breakfeast is really really nice in quantity and quality. the staff is super friendly and ready to help us with a constant smile on their faces. we are quite sure that we're returning to amsterdam, and if that's the case, to nadia hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central hotel and a charming manager”
Reviews.Author: bluedeep77
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time in Amsterdam but my frst time in a hotel. Did't feel like spending a fortune on the accomodation but wanted to be central to be able to get lost on those little canals any time I felt like it :) How easy do you find it? I spoted it right from the tram. I asked the conductor wether the tram was goind to raadhuisstraat and she answered rather bored that ALL TRAMS GO THERE!!! (you stupid foreigner...just my comment). Feeling a bit discouraged I checked in and took a seat expecting 5-6 tramstops. And at a certain point I saw it: Nadia Hotel. I jumped at the next station, just 3 minutes away from the hotel, in a straight line accross a canal. With 2 pieces of luggage after me :))) What about the bloody stairs? OK, so the stairs require a healthy sense of humor. They are steep and many. You have to consider that in the past, they used to pay taxes according to how much surface a house occupied on the earth's crust and not according to its real surface. So of course they optimized everything on a vertical plane. The building is old and there is nothing you can do about it. I laughed when i first saw it, thinking about the frustrations it must induce sometimes. Really, take it as an amsterdamese joke and climb one step at a time. you'll be fine the rooms: I only know about mine. a single room with bed, tv, shower and table to put your lap top, wc, towels and flowers :) There were flowers in the room when I arrived and yes it does not make you more comfortable or better about the small space if you need space, but it was a nice gesture, and it spoke about the manager's and the staff's intent to make every guest's stay as pleasant as possible. So back to the room. It had all I needed. The walls are thin and yes there were some faint noises from other rooms but nothing kept me awake. This is the time of the soccer world cup and there are lots of bars around. but i had no problem with the noise. and now that i speak about the bars, do stop at sara's pancake place. have a pancake there, but if you ask for something spicy, be careful what you ask for. you will catch fire :))) loved it!!!! breakfast. no meat on any days, but I usually do not eat meat si I had no problem with that. I did miss my yougurt in the morning and one day i asked for a glass of milk and I was given one. the coffee is good. the cheese could be a little more diversified, I guess, but no real problem for me there either. keywords for the connnoissers: grasshopper, the bulldog ... Ask to see the view from the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Good for weekend travellers”
Reviews.Author: dielena79
Reviews.Content: The owner and the stuff of Hotel Nadia are extremely friendly, helpful and funny. The rooms are very small, the bathroom is even so small that my friend couldn't sit on the toilet with the door closed. He had to leave it open... Room itself was clean, bathroom could be cleaner. The location of the hotel is really great: a 3 minutes walk to Dam Square, 3 minutes to 9 straatjes (Jordaan), round the corner of Anne Frank House and a 15 minutes walk to Leidse Plein with a lot of bars, clubs, restaurants. For this price the hotel was really ok. At least you have your own bathroom and a good location. Would recommend this hotel to weekend travellers who do not make high demands on a hotel and stay outside the whole weekend anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AlmostMrsCook
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the hotel nadia in room 203 from june 7-10 as part of our 2 week european honeymoon. i cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. location, staff and rooms, everything was fantastic!! with the exception of one female member of staff (not sure of her name, but she was dark haired, and seemed to be working in the evenings) everyone was great, and very helpful!!! we received a cold welcome drink when we arrived, received lots of maps and info, and were shown to our room promptly. when we arrived, there was beautiful flowers waiting for us. i would absolutely not hesitate in staying there again. breakfast was great. there is a great pancake restaurant (saras pancakes) right downstairs, and they were great! we went to a great italian restaurant (when you leave the hotel, turn left and walk for about 3 or 4 minutes, and its on the corner). one thing we noticed, and it is not a make or break element for us, but might be for some people ... the free internet that is advertised, is VERY slow, and doesn't work sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TashLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel at the beginning of June. I was able to find the tram and location easily thanks to the hotel's website. I received a welcome drink and lots of information and maps of Amsterdam. I was also shown the breakfast room which has fantastic views. I have stayed in Amsterdam before and hadn't received such a great service. I was also offered drinks a few more times including checkout. The stairs are very steep but I managed mainly because I didn't have to bring up my trolleycase myself! I had a smaller room to start with because the hotel was full which was challenging with my larger trolleycase! The second room had quite a bit more room. I had no problems sleeping in either room on the quieter side. The rooms and bathrooms always looked clean and tidy. I enjoyed the breakfast it was plenty for me and loved the cheese, croissants and cake. I really like the staff they were always very friendly and helpful especially Osam the manager. One of my flights going back was cancelled and he did his best to assist including letting use the internet because my netbook wasn't usable. If I was going to Amsterdam for a future trip I would happily go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would return again, price, location and service very good”
Reviews.Author: magasa101
Reviews.Content: Personal very very helpful, rooms are enough for sleep if you donÂ´t want more than this. Breakfast well, not to much quantity, but it includes coffee, orange juice, croissants, bread with cheese, .... We would return, price by room very recommended. Only one bad thing, the steep stairs, but the personnel helps you with your cases.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest hotel i have ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: schnauzermum
Reviews.Content: my stay at nadia hotel was lovely from start to finish. the room was small but perfect for one and very clean with a lovely balcony . the manager , osam, was extremely helpfull and friendy as were all the staff. the buffet breakfast was adequate for my needs with great coffee. location was great and i would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff, quiet room with view”
Reviews.Author: georanger
Reviews.Content: 2-3 star hotel with 5 star staff. Yes, steep stairs but staff moved baggage for us without being asked (plus gave a welcome drink and water bottles when leaving). The room had a canal view and was quiet enough. The location is perfect for the Jordaan and all sight-seeing - walked everywhere. The only weak area was the breakfast but that relates to the cost. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: BAM1953
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but comfortable. Beautiful building, great location, friendly & helpful staff. Breakfast choices limited, but what is offered is good. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Estelleburns
Reviews.Content: Very good service & staff v friendly. The stairs are steep to climb to reach reception but this was clearly pointed out on the website. Although not lots of space in the bedroom or bathroom, both were more than adequate for 2 people. Bathroom and bedroom carpet were clean but there was a lot of dust on surfaces & kettle didn't look particularly clean. All in all though we really enjoyed our stay and were very pleased with the hotel. It was also refreshing to have a fridge and safe without extra charge. I am staying at the Nadia again this weekend so I would definitely recommend this hotel!! Tip for visit - a free 3 hour walking tour provided by New Europe Amsterdam leaves from the National Monument in Dam Square daily at 1115 - you just give your guide a tip at the end for what you thought it was worth. Extremely informative.

Reviews.Title: “Good prices, but rooms small”
Reviews.Author: carlsson07
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this hotel. The rooms are small and little noisy, but the prices are good. We saw much when we were here and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “if i will return in Amsterdam, i surely hope to stay at Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALICEandLUKE
Reviews.Content: We have appreciated a lot Nadia hotel: the location is perfect to see all the major point of interest in the city. Our room was so nice, with a canal view, and nevertheless was quiet in the night. All the Nadia Hotel staff were friendly and helpfull... and yes also the vertical scales are the perfect touch to feel in "Amsterdam mood"

Reviews.Title: “Small room but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BonB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The room was very small -- you couldn't fully open the bathroom door because the freestanding closet partly blocked it, and walking around the end of the bed involved a partial limbo routine in order to avoid the built in shelf on the wall. We requested a quiet room with no canal view; I don't know if the other rooms are a any larger. But the location is about as perfect as you could wish for. We were able to walk everywhere, which we loved. The room was always clean, and there was a lovely bouquet of fresh flowers waiting for us when we arrived. There was actually a good amount of storage in the room, due to all the built-in shelving. The staff was very helpful in providing directions, etc. This hotel is not for the mobility-impaired -- the stairs are steep and there's no elevator, but that's typical from what we've seen (this was our 3rd visit to Amsterdam). The staff will carry your luggage up and down for you. The continental breakfast was adequate most days, but there was a pancake house about 3 doors down, plus a good Italian restaurant on the corner. Hotel Nadia provides good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “extremely helpful and friendly staff, small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: chagger
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for reasonab;y priced centrally located hotel to act as a base for exploring Amsterdam, and friendly helpful staff is important look no futher. Excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: CVF33
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location right in the middle of Amsterdam. The rooms are small, but comfortable and well-designed, the breakfast room is beautiful, and although breakfast could have been more diverse (no eggs, vegetables, dark bread or youghurt without sugar in it), this is kind of compensated by the atmosphere and the friendly staff serving the breakfast. Friendly staff is what you meet all over the hotel in general, on arrival, at departure, and during the whole stay. The one minus is the noise coming from the street outside the hotel (mainly very noisy trams), but even this is kind of compensated by the lovely balcons that many of the rooms have access to. We went to Amsterdam for the first time some seven years ago, and there was no doubt in our minds that this was where we wanted to have our base even this second time around :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMandM
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the pleasure to stay in Nadia Hotel for 2 nights for my birthday trip to Amsterdam.It is very well located within walking distance from the Central Station and all the sites.Anne Frank museum is only 5 minutes away ( a word of advice- book online to see this museum) The hotel is very cosy and the famous steep stairs are part of its charm. We had a lovely spacious room on the 4th floor overlooking the canal, with a balcony. The bathroom was not very big but it was modern and very clean! On arrival the hotel surprised me with a beautiful bouquet of flowers and a happy birthday message which was so nice, this has never happened before in any of the hotels we stayed! Many thanks to Osam,the hotel manager and the rest of the staff that made our stay truly memorable. The communication with the hotel before our arrival was fantastic, I had an exchange of emails with Osam and he was so helpful and patiently replied to all my questions! We truly felt like home! If we ever go back to Amsterdam we will definitely stay in Nadia Hotel and we will recommend it to our friends as well. Thank you all!!!! PS. The coffee they serve at breakfast is the best! Can you please let us know what it is????

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bozleesmom
Reviews.Content: The staff at Nadia were warm and friendly. The room was tiny but clean and quiet, and the breakfasts were better than expected. The location was superb, just a few minutes by tram from the rail station, and we were able to walk to all the major sights. For the price, we considered Nadia to be a good deal and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best value Hotel in Amsterdam .”
Reviews.Author: Marmaryann
Reviews.Content: The general rule when it comes to Hotels in Amsterdam is you get what you pay for , Hotel Nadia however is the exception to this rule . I've stayed in a few over the years , now I only stay here . The Nadia is great value , the staff and owner are really helpful and friendly , the Hotel is one of the cleanest I have stayed in , and is no more than a 5 minute walk from Dam Square . On both occasions we have stayed the room had fresh flowers in it on arrival . The breakfast is perfect to start the day , tea, coffee , orange juice, yogurt , cheese, jam , rolls , croissants etc .All served in a lovely breakfast room . If you want , good value clean accommodation in a brilliant location , do yourself a favour . Call Osam and his staff now , you won't regret it !

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia94941
Reviews.Content: We carefully combed through reviews and selected the Nadia as the best deal in a central location. We weren't disappointed. For the money, I don't think you can beat this hotel. Sure, the steps are staggeringly steep, but the staff gets your luggage to and from your room, so it's not much of a problem. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and they provide a locked room for your luggage if, like us, you aren't leaving the city until later in the day. The amenities were surprisingly good for a budget hotel--phone, TV (albeit small), WiFi, safe, fridge, decent-size bathroom, free ample breakfast.We even had a canal view! Our twin beds were narrower than usual, but comfortable and worked out OK. My biggest complaint would be the lighting for reading in bed.

Reviews.Title: “good journey by bike”
Reviews.Author: fiammy81
Reviews.Content: goog long week end in amsterdam we went around by bike...the best way to know the city good hotel in a good position near anna Frank's house and pizza Dam....we loved the breakfast :-)

Reviews.Title: “We will return again...”
Reviews.Author: enginersoz
Reviews.Content: Hi, Hotel Nadia have very central location (250 meter to Palace). Rooms small but well equipment (normal size for Amsterdam) Breakfast is very good (coffee, kind of tea, orange juice, jams, croissant, nutella, yoghurt, toast if you want, cheese, butter etc...) Free Wi-Fi is included... Staff are very kind and helpful. Don't search hotel range in 100 euro for double room book for Hotel Nadia....

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: SanFranPair
Reviews.Content: As hard as I tried to find things wrong (ex., the bathroom was so small my feet were in the shower as I sat on the toilet), I could not when I looked at the price in comparison to ALL other hotels in Amsterdam. Staff was helpful (except they screwed up our departure taxi and scared me re timing), referrals were exceptional, location was great, stairs up to the hotel are tight (but kinda fun). Overall, for the price you can't do better. I'm back there whenever i visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with lovely view”
Reviews.Author: cubanjunky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nadia Hotel with my son who lives in amsterdam but has only a little room.We arrived very early and where offert a welcome drink and we left our rucksacks in the hotel as the room was not ready. When we came back in the evening we got a lovely room with a big window looking on to a canal.I was very happy there except the beds where very small but the second night i pushed them apart so at least we didnt kick each other in our sleep.The stairs where not as bad as i thought they would be after reading reviews. I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemeor
Reviews.Content: In May 2010, I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for the second time. My first stay was sometime September/October 2009. Nadia Hotel remains a hotel that offer warm hospitality, very clean room, free internet access, good breakfast and very friendly staff. I cannot find a hotel very well located than the Nadia Hotel and value for money. It is very close to the tram station, Dam square hence the attractions and a supermarket. The hotel manager personally came to the reception to welcome me home!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: LAF53
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and the hotel lives up to everything people says about it. Very steep stairs, but the staff deal with the luggage. Very small rooms, but clean (although not sure why you might need so many shelves even for a week's stay so maybe a couple removed might make the rooms feel a little less small?). Didn't have any problems with noise but had a room overlooking the central courtyard so the only sounds I heard were the gentle cooing of pigeons and the musical bells - very pleasant. The manager and reception staff couldn't have been more helpful - we all had flowers in our room - one of our friends was celebrating a birthday, so had special bouquet. Easy walking to the city's main tourist areas and good restaurants near by. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place, amazing staff, in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MariaF_2010
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is more than excellent, located inside City Center and near to all most important highlights of Amsterdam. The stairs are absolutely amazing and luckily you donâ€™t have to carry the luggage by yourself, somebody from the staff will do it for you! Flowers and a welcome drink will expect you at the arrival. The hotel is not modern and it is a little bit noisy because the old windows but itâ€™s very cozy and the views are very nice. Youâ€™ll have a small bathroom but itâ€™s very clean. What makes the big difference- in the good way- for this hotel is the staff, who is very welcoming and polite, especially manager Osam. You will get all the information and help you need, in a very friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: apple_city
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel despite the room was small and a little bit noisy. The staff is very welcoming and polite, especially manager Osam. There were flowers in the room when I arrived. And a basket of different fruits as a small present from Osam! I had a great holidays in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: DuValois
Reviews.Content: Thank you Osam and staff for another nice visit at Nadia. Everything was lovely: the welcome, the room, the atmosphere. Recommend Nadia highly. The steep stairs save you a trip to the health club!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip”
Reviews.Author: emadalia
Reviews.Content: Location of Hotel is more than excellent, located inside City Cnter and near all most imporatnt high lights of Amsterdam. Very friendly and Helpfull staff speaking different languages to communicate well with customers.

Reviews.Title: “high quality/price rate hotel, in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: alle3nti
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the centre of Amsterdam, at a reasonable price, near to every interesting point on the city this is the hotel for you! Employess of the hotel are very kind, there is free wifi connection, the brackfast is very good with fresh croissant and orginal nutella!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RobynLeeson
Reviews.Content: Though the steep and narrow stairs may make access difficult for some, we (a couple in our 60s) managed OK. It was well worth the effort as the Nadia is a great place to stay. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable, Wi Fi access was excellent and a good breakfast was included. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room were a nice bonus not usually found in European hotels, and our laundry was done for us at a very reasonable price by the housekeeper. The hotel is quite central and on a canal, which is lovely. Trams run by the door and are a ggod way to get around Amsterdam when you are tired of walking.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel for everything”
Reviews.Author: elymay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was clean, warm and welcoming. Reception were always on hand to help with any queries and always very polite. Breakfast was adequate (we Brits do like our cooked breakfast though) it was very central. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The manager is extremely nice and helpful”
Reviews.Author: redbaron1_10
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay in this hotel and we shall return despite the fact that the room was not cleaned the first day. Not even the beds were done........ As mentioned above, the manager is extremely nice and we got - additional - flowers to our room as it was my partner's birthday. This is a very special attention and was highly appreciated. The situation of the hotel is excellent: Close to the trams, close to the boats, in the city centre but absolutely quiet if you have a room which is not situated to the street. 4 stairs to walk but it does not matter as your luggage is carried. We shall come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and serviceminded staff”
Reviews.Author: paaller
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for three nights. This was my second stay at this hotel. We had a room with a nice view over the canal and church square. The hotell have a great location, close to the Dam Square. The hotel have small rooms and is at two star hotel without any luxury. But still I recommend it for all that want to stay central in a hotell with an especially nice and serviceminded staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: LottsaKnotts
Reviews.Content: Great 2 star property in the heart of Amsterdam Top value for money Helpful friendly staff who speak English! We got upgraded to a canal view room Breakfast included - simple but good Very steep stairs - not good if you are less mobile

Reviews.Title: “Stair Climbers Haven”
Reviews.Author: melistella
Reviews.Content: Wish Trip Adviser had a category between Average and Very Good. This is a modest hotel, with great staff and manager/owner. The breakfast room offers the best coffee I've had in a very long time, as well as a variety of morning fare. The location is quite convenient to the shops and restaurants of the Nine Little Streets, 'kitty-cornered" to Westerkerk, around the corner from Anne Frankhuis, and the Jordaan neighborhood Unless you are a very light sleeper, you won't need a "Quiet" room. Our friends had a room facing the Raadhuisstraat, which benefited from two large windows and was more comfortably arranged. The stairs are challenging, the first set is a two floor climb in one stretch.. Benefit: excellent exercise. Although the hotel is 'non-smoking', hallways on the top floor always smelled of cigarette smoke. Management's attempt to use "air freshiner" was allergy provoking and ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but...”
Reviews.Author: Knut1971
Reviews.Content: So, what`s so special with Hotel Nadia? We knew about the stairs and the small rooms, so that was ok.. But the noise from the street outside was very loud! And the breakfast was very simple, no meat and no eggs... Coffee was good. Helpfull staff at the reception, and it was nice with flowers waiting for you in the room when arrived. We didn`t get the transportation bus from the hotel to the airport at checkout, because of the queens day. No taxi or tram either, so we had to walk to Centraal Station with our luggage through the crowd of thousands of drunk and celebrating hollanders... Ok hotel, with very good location, but a little overrated in my opinion....

Reviews.Title: “Do not have a phobia about stairs”
Reviews.Author: Birchyk
Reviews.Content: My first comment as I opened the door to Nadia was "Oh My God I hope they have a lift." I was immediately inform from way up above that they didn't but someone would bring our luggage up. Thank god they did because these are the stepest steps I have ever experienced. We were told that the company we booked through should have advised us of this as if you are unable to climb there is no hope of getting in. The staff & I believe owners here are most accomodating and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The room itself (207) was extremely small with the bathroom dificult to dry yourself in. The bed was fairly uncomfortable but we managed to get used to it. Breakfast was ample & we found an excellent indian restaurant just down the road. Koh-I-Noor at Westermarkt 29 is well worth the visit, we went 3 nights out of 4 & on the other found a great Italian Restaurant La Madonna. Room 207 overlooks the canal & square & during our stay we experienced the Queens Day celebrations. The room was fantasitc for viewing the going ons as walking through it was a nightmare. It was unbeilable the amount of people & boat loads of people that were out celebrating. In all it made the stay an enjoyable one. I would recommend Nadia but be warned that the stairs are step & rooms small with everything else great.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: wheelere
Reviews.Content: Room very compact but with everything we needed. Take care not to slip over in shower as floor can get slippery. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Good location with trams and buses straight outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel-Warm, Welcoming & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: lizzieterry
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at The Nadia Hotel and I really cannot fault the hotel at all. The room we had was small, but it had a double bed, en-suite, balcony, fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, phone & TV (with BBC 1 & 2). It was also really welcoming to have a vase of lovely fresh flowers in the room, with a note telling us to enjoy our stay. We arrived hours before the 2pm check in, but we were able to leave our luggage & have a drink in the breakfast room as soon as we arrived. Our luggage was locked away so we could start our sightseeing without having to either carry our heavy case with us, or worry about it's safety. The staff were all really helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble, from getting extra pillows, extra towels or larger cups for our tea! They also offered information regarding the city, the trams, restaurants etc and always with a smile which was really great. The hotel was really easy to find, we walked from Central Station, but several of the trams stop near by and it is ideally located for all the sights. We walked everywhere, Amsterdam is such a compact city and it's so beautiful to walk by the canals there was little point in getting a bus or tram, but as I said the tram/bus stop is only a few yards away. Breakfast was good. Contintental style, but lots of it and again nothing was too much trouble to the staff who manged the kitchen. The breakfast room is small, but there were always places to sit and the views of the church and canal are lovely from this room. Our room faced the main road, but we were not bothered too much by traffic noise. Obviously it wasn't silent, but when you're staying in the middle of a busy city you hardly expect silence do you? We would definitely recommend this hotel and will use it again if we return to Amsterdam. Many thanks again to all the staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wyrill
Reviews.Content: We loved location and staff. Steps to registration are intense, but if you want a canal house that is what you get. Location is steps from Anne Frank House and Westekerk. Staff gave us great directions and restaurant recommendations. Bathroom is tiny as is room. But how much time do you spend in room. Get a Balcony. Its like getting an extra room. Also discount for paying cash. Good bargain in a city full of expensive hotels Breakfast room was nice and endless coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dec35
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Nadia in April for the first time on my first visit to Amsterdam. Chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. Great location close to Anne Frank House and also only a few minutes walk from Dam Square. Rooms are quite small but I believe this is common to most hotels in Amsterdam. Staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast was a bit mad due to the small size of the Breakfast Room and the amount of people trying to have breakfast at the same time. In general, we were very happy with our experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent staff & breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: EdHirst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd time and were again made very welcome by the wonderful staff who are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and comfortable, with a lovely breakfast room. The location is excellent, very central and within easy walking distance of central station, Dam Square etc. We found this hotel excellent value for central Amsterdam and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gill1903
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam with 9 friends. Really enjoyed our stay. The staff were so nice and really helpful and we also liked the house cats "Hello" and "Goodbye" Stairs were steep, but we were prepared for them

Reviews.Title: “Very familiar atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: arantza2011
Reviews.Content: Excellent service staff very efficient you feel like at home

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsnell
Reviews.Content: Don't let the front door or the stairs startle you. They simply add to the wonderful, unique charm of the Hotel Nadia. It's easily accessible from the airport via the hotel shuttle. The staff is extremely helpful (carrying luggage) and are among the friendliest we've met any where in the world. Although the rooms are small, there is plenty of storage. It's location couldn't be any better-close to the Anne Frank House, Dam Square and many other delightful Amsterdam attractions. When, not if, when we revisit Amsterdam, our first choice will absolutely be the Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for being Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: intherush
Reviews.Content: OK, so Hotel Nadia is not the hotel you'll be bragging on about with your friends. It's not anything that I'd recommend in my home country (Sweden), and the stairs (as mentioned in almost all reviews) are a challenge (any person with leg problems or being up in the ages should seriously consider this before booking). Also, it's not the most quiet hotel since sound isolation doesn't work that good... But apart from that? Nice staff (especially the young girl in the reception), decent breakfast, very central and with a great price. And with great price I mean great price for central Amsterdam. If that price would have been in for example Stockholm, and for that hotel, I'd not have believed my eyes. But this was it, and maybe it was due to the fact that we traveled during the worst of the volcano crisis in April in Europe. Rooms are tiny, yes, but as long as you're OK with not having a big bathroom and bumping into your room mate once in a while, it works. We didn't encounter any bed bugs, and the shower was actually having a cabinet, so no water on the toilet or "standing in the toilet" like other reviews. As for sleep quality, church bells kinda messed that up a bit, but just a bit. In general, would I recommend it? Definitely. A tip; there seems to be a dozen other hotels like Hotel Nadia on the same street, located very close to Hotel Nadia. If Nadia is fully booked, Google Map it and check out the other hotels on the same street nearby. I have no idea about their quality, but on the outside they looked to be the same as Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is a lovely place with lots...”
Reviews.Author: EduTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a lovely place with lots of charcter and a perfect location. The rooms are basic. We stayed in a triple that was on the small side but it had everything we needed. The breakfast of crossiant with nutella was a great start to each day. Be sure to get a pancake at Saras downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Manager Osam”
Reviews.Author: madcyril
Reviews.Content: Helpfull and enjoyable stay. The manager Osam is a really good guy and will help you with anything you want. Will return in August.... x

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staircase”
Reviews.Author: DonB859
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam and had the pleasure of spending the night at the Hotel Nadia. We arrived at 10AM and the staff was very helpful and allowed us to store our luggage with them before our room was ready. The Hotel's location is very convenient to many attractions. We took a nice walk along the canals to the Van Gogh museum and then strolled to Dam Square and the Anne Frank House. We took a canal boat ride that started across the street from the train station. In the evening it was a 10-15 minute walk to the red light district-which was crowded for a Sunday night. The wireless internet worked fine in the room and there is no extra charge. It was a little chilly out and took a while to figure out how to turn the heat on but it worked. The bed was comfortable and the shower worked fine in the AM. Plenty of hot water and great water pressure. The breakfast area was very nice with a good amount of seating. They have a good selection of breads, jams, cheese and other breakfast items. We did not leave hungry. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Nadia again and highly recommend it. The hotel offers great value for their price point with a very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: 1deepsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nadia for a week with our daughter during spring break. Having traveled in Europe, we understand steep narrow stairs and small room sizes, are par for the course in Amsterdam. The staff was very accomodating and welcoming. We had triple room No. 6, overlooking canal. All rooms have private bathrooms. Bed linen and towels were crisp and clean. You have a choice of housekeeping each day, or not (we had them change our bed a couple of times during our weeklong stay). Breakfast included in price is filling and good; croissants, bread, rolls, cheese, spreads, excellent coffee, tea, juice (no meat or eggs). Our room was halfway the stairs leading to the reception, so that was very nice. Staff helps with luggage as needed. The hotel was not noisy, the Westerkekr across the street chimes on quarter hour with it's carrilon, but it's not intrusive. You hear some traffic, but again not loud more like background. It was cold during our stay and the room stayed nice and warm thanks to the radiators. Other amenities include small fridge, safe, hair dryer, color TV. Body wash/shampoo was also provided. A beautiful bouquet of fresh flowers was waiting for us in our room as we checked in. It was mostly couples and families staying at the hotel. Nearby restaurants we tried and would recommend: Sara's Pancakes (very friendly and tasty), Il Panorama Utrecht (corner of Raadhuisstraat & Herengracht, good menu variety, friendly service & prices), Koh-i-Noor (Indian, very nice decor and good service) and Small Talk Cafe (by Van Gogh Museum, with additional seating upstairs, great daily specials). There is Albert Heijn supermarket nearby which also has a great selection for picnics and snacks. Overall, we had a very good experience with hotel Nadia and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A ver y good stay”
Reviews.Author: apeltun
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel and a very charming and lively city!

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia - Great Hotel, beautiful canal views, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Paula0000
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel and we really like it. We will definitely go back. The hotel is one of the traditional type buildings i.e. very tall and thin. When you first open the front door you are faced with a huge tall narrow staircase which is fine as the staff help you up with your luggage! Our room was quite small but perfectly adequate for what we needed. It had a comfy double bed, wardrobe, fridge, 2 chairs and table and best of all, a balcony with 2 chairs outside with views towards WesterKerk Church and the canal. Just gorgeous. There is also a gorgeous breakfast room where you can help yourself to bread, many jams, peanut butter, nutella, crackers, cheese, sponge cake, coffee and organge juice. The breakfast room overlooks the canal too and is filled with lovely green plants with a delightful small vase of flowers on each table. The hotel staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel has charm and character and we can't wait to go back. The area is also very good, not far to walk to anywhere, with trams just outside too. I suppose if there was a downfall it would be the noise from the street outside (trams and cars) seems to go on well into the night and my partner found his sleep disturbed. But he can take ear-plugs next time!

Reviews.Title: “three nights close to the sky”
Reviews.Author: CleideParis
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in this hotel.Charming room with balcony. One thing the fourth floor is so high to climb . No elevator ! And maybe the matress could be changed soon.( too soft). The boss and his team are kind.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday bash”
Reviews.Author: Joeistanbul
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed here with a group of ten male friends for my 40th birthday, while they don't advertize male groups they were ok with us after i explained we've grown out of the smash up the hotel attitude, nice clean tidy hotel only a short walk from the Red Light district and obvious attractions, staff were nice and friendly and the steps were good too!...would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value & location, nice people, room only ok”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller99
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted us to use a good value hotel in Amsterdam, which we found to be an expensive city. The Nadia is in a perfect location, 5 minutes from the Dam Square (you can see the Royal Palace as soon as you go out of the hotel), and 2 minutes from the trams to the station. The people are very friendly and helpful, the breakfast is good, they put flowers in your room, and they take your bags up & down the steep stairs. The room was very basic & tiny, especially the bathroom with a weak fixed-head shower, old towels, and no toiletries apart from liquid soap on the wall. It is also very noisy (both from in & out of the hotel). The bed was confortable though, and I would recommend this hotel if you want a cheap & cheerful base in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: maggie_oakland
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have traveled to Amsterdam twice for vacation, once in 2007 and once in 2010, and we stayed at the Nadia both times. Without a doubt, the Nadia is the most hospitable place we have lodged in all our various travels abroad. The rooms and the building itself are beautifully decorated and absolutely charming, with great views of the city and a convenient location as well. Much more importantly, the staff are quick to anticipate needs and to go the extra mile to help their guests. I could literally give a dozen examples but will limit myself to this one: on our last trip, my mother had received an injury to her ankle before we got to Amsterdam, so she had some difficulty going up and down stairs. The manager noticed her limp right away when we arrived and took the initiative to move our room from a higher floor to a lower floor to make things easier for mom, without ever being asked. I don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel where I felt such a personal level of caring and hospitality as the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: married_couple_oz
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location slightly west of the centre of Amsterdam, just a short stroll from Dam Square. The tram stop only 50m from the front door provides access to the Central Station and other areas of Amsterdam. Close to many historical sites including Anne Frank House and the Western Church, and near many delightful shopping streets and eating areas. Our room was small, but provided all the necessities; the bathroom was 5 star - clean, modern and well presented. The view from our window was 'to die for' overlooking the canal we could watch the procession of bicycles and trams and buses undertaking their normal business, while occasional canal boats traversed the bridge under the road. The beautiful Western Church dominating the skyline. The staff of the hotel were all friendly, helpful and caring. We felt looked after from the moment we arrived. The breakfast room was bright and cheerful and the range of edibles was very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a kind staff, excellent...”
Reviews.Author: barcelonaconnection
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a kind staff, excellent location in the very heart of Amsterdam, and a very reasonable price... And you can improve your shape by going up and down the impressive staircase. No doubt we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “The people at Nadia make you feel as if you've honestly "come home".”
Reviews.Author: MississippiSkies
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say I have never been so warmly greeted everytime I came back in to Nadia (I've stayed there twice, several days at a time--this is advertising in itself. The owner is a lovely, gentle man whose son works with him. The steps are steep, but they all are in Amsterdam--this is part of the charm of the city. The staff will gladly take your luggage up for you. You'll be greeted with a coke (& a smile) each time you pass the desk. Yes, the rooms are small, but aren't you there to see the city, not your room? It's quite clean & the staff is there if you need anything (I'm an American & all I did was ask where I could find ice & a staff member hurriedly found some & brought it to the room). You'll get a Continental Breakfast each morning. Oh! And you can't beat the location! When I'm in Amsterdam I'll definitely recommend Nadia. In fact, I already have. A fellow passenger on a cruise is going to Amsterdam---& he & his wife are staying--at The Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “The cuttest place I`ve ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: KetrinEU
Reviews.Content: Nadia hotel rooms are extremelly small but its kind of romantic to run into each other 5 times a day. There is enought space to put your stuff and unpack your luggage. Room has everythig it might need, well expept microwave, but thats not a problem when you live in the very center of amsterdam and there is a food place every few steps!.

Reviews.Title: “very clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: drewlittle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights great location very clean just what you need bags carried in & out of hotel staff couldnt do enough. Had a antastic time David & Emma (Newcastle)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to be treated like a princess”
Reviews.Author: tiffcare
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for only one night as I had a long layover for my flight hom e. The hotel is next to the famous canal and only walking distance from the Anne Frank Museum. The staff was fabulous and went out of their way to ensure my comfort and happiness. I was greeted with a fresh bouquet of flowers, was offered and given a nice snack (pancake) and a wonderful, clean room. The hotel offers a wonderful continental type breakfast overlooking the canal and a famous church/cathedral. This hotel had the best customer service of any hotel I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected little gem!!”
Reviews.Author: jimball2k
Reviews.Content: Friendliest staff i've met. A welcome drink. And a room cleaned for us even tho we arrived early. Great breakfast too. The hotel has bags of character and some of its hallways and rooms are reminiscent of a ships interior, which i thought was kinda cool!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - clean, value for money and very friendly welcome!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingKate
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Nadia on the strength of the reviews here and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is centrally located without being right in the thick of the busy-ness and is around five minutes walk from the centre of town and literally around the corner from Anne Frank's house. We booked a room with a canal view which was great and as both of us live on fairly busy streets, we weren't bothered by the road to the front which does have trams running along it until midnight. As other people have mentioned, the stairs to reception and the rooms are fairly death defying but the staff carry your bags up for you and the reception staff couldn't be more friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room was cosy but didn't feel cramped and there was loads of storage space. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and freshly tiled. I notice from some of the reviews here that they've had problems with the breakfast room being crowded but we never had this problem. Breakfast is from 7:30 - 10:30am and we were there both days about 8/8:30am and there was always space available. It seats about 30 people but maybe it gets busier later?? If we had anything less than favourable to say about the hotel, it would be that we had twin beds and each of the single beds were pretty narrow. If you're above average width you may struggle not to fall out of bed!! Also, we stored our bags for a late checkout on Sunday and unfortunately, my bag did get broken while in storage. The staff were very helpful with this though and provided a replacement and a taxi to the station. The price of this hotel and the standard of accommodation make it a great find and they also offered us a 10% discount for paying in cash on arrival so it was even better value for money!

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd stay at the Nadia....bliss!”
Reviews.Author: FOONK
Reviews.Content: For my 3rd stay, I decided to treat myself to a balcony room.....it was wonderful! I was greeted warmly by all the staff, and ushered to the breakfast room with a complimentary drink. No sooner had I finished, I was shown to my room, and unpacked my minimal belongings....I always travel light! My bed was next to a huge window which, unlike many A'dam hotel windows, opened fully! I kept my window open for the duration of my stay, and loved the sounds of the trams, traffic, Westerkerk bells, and occasionally, the passing tourists! I spent many a happy time sitting on the HUGE balcony watching the world go by......it had a side view of the beautiful Kaizersgracht, as well as the stunning Westerkerk tower. My bed was very comfortable and I had no problems sleeping whatsoever. There was a curtained closet with ample shelving, as well as a safe, TV, fan, and fridge. I didn't partake in the included breakfast, but it was nice to know it was available if I was hungry! Housekeeping was offered on every one of my 7 days here, and even though I said it wasn't required, I returned to find my bed beautifully made-up with fresh linen. Reception here is professional and friendly. Someone is available 24 hours a day should they be needed. The location of this hotel is really fantastic...............10-15 minutes walk from Centraal........5 minutes from the Dam........the same from the large Albert Heijn supermarkt...........everything is within easy walking distance. I have read with interest some of the negative reviews about the Nadia, and cannot for the life of me understand what people expect! The Nadia is a 2* hotel, wonderfully located, you get a comfortable bed, a TV, safe, fridge, internet access (free), a shower and wc, and above all else, an incredibly friendly service from all who work there. All this for a very reasonable rate that you would be hard-pushed to find elsewhere. It's a 5* for me and I have just booked another 7 night stay for the Queensday celebrations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, very little room”
Reviews.Author: enrico_mordillo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good positioned, is in the centre and people at the reception are very kind. Even the services are good, that is the breakfast and the coffee maker in the room. The only problem is that the room was really little, it was difficult to use the bathroom with the door closed. Care for people with mobility problems, there is a very steep staircase.

Reviews.Title: “Best 2 star hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Lawrobot
Reviews.Content: There are only two things wrong with this charming hotel. 1: there are very steep stairs to get in (although the staff insist on bringing your luggage up themselves, so as long as you can go up and down them comfortably on your own, it's no problem). 2: some of the rooms have large, single glazed windows which look out onto a busy road with trams. If you aren't a city dweller, or if you sleep lightly, definitely bring earplugs. oh, and inside our bathroom was a tiny bit smelly, but not bad. That aside, this was one of the best hotel experiences I have had, even before you consider the price. -The double bed had a double mattress, not two singles. Pillows were OK too. -The staff were exceptionally friendly, available 24/7 and always helpful (including during the booking process). All have good English. They even took my wet gloves and dried them for me after a rainy day! -Breakfast is very simple, but nice - and bundled in with the room. The breakfast room was quite busy on Saturday morning, so we just had breakfast in bed instead :D -The hotel is VERY well located - literally minutes from the centre, and within easy walking distance of everything apart from the museum district (though we walked there once in under 30 minutes). It is far enough away from the areas with dodgy characters and late-night establishments to be suitable for families (or prudes). -The room was small, but had easily enough storage space and surfaces for all of our stuff (though we packed light). It was well decorated, warm and comfortable. -The facilities in the room (esp. fridge, kettle, safe & balcony), plus the always-available breakfast room (and the facilities in it) made our stay much better - we were able to comfortably eat our own food in the hotel, which we purchased from a nearby supermarket. -This hotel is 1.5x the price of a youth hostel, but has 24 hour access, en-suite rooms, comfortable double beds and all the aforementioned stuff. We were so pleased we found it, and it contributed a lot to our enjoyment of our holiday. This hotel is an absolute must for anyone on a budget, but we would both recommend it to anyone who values service, atmosphere and location above things like gym and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, good value hotel in a central location...... JUST PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandycopp
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner stayed here for his birthday back in Feb. As soon as we arrived the hotel staff were very accomodating & helpful. The rooms are just perfect for a short, city break & there is plenty of informtion at the reception, to help yog get around Amsterdam. The hotel is in a perfect spot. It is within a short walking distance to Anne Franks house (which is a must do), Dam Square, Amsterdam dungeons, Madame Tussauds & all the shops/ nightlife. Me and my partner are already talking about going back but in the Summer months. TIP- YOU MUST TRY THE PANCAKES NEXT DOOR TO THE HOTEL CALLED "SARAHS PANCAKES", THEY ARE TO DIE FOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I really felt at home!”
Reviews.Author: AlinaAlberti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is the better choice for those who want to visit amsterdam feeling like at home. My room was perfectly clean, I had everything I needed, like free fast internet connection, coffee and tea facilities, television, fridge and also a nice balcony. A very nice breakfast is included and it takes place in a beautiful dining room with canal view. But most of all, the manager and the whole staff are incredibly nice and gentle, and ready to give you good advices on whatever you might need to know about your stay in Amsterdam. The receptionist speacks very fluently Dutch, English and Italian and maybe also other languages. Finally, the location is the best you can desire: 10 minutes walking from central station, 3 minutes from the city centre! This is a choice you won't regret.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the staff. Very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: WolverineRose
Reviews.Content: The bed was the only downside, too soft for our comfort. Our room with the balcony was fantastic, church bells ringing and you can people watch at any time. The canal view was great too. We would stay there again anytime. Our side of the hotel with the balconies is not for those who want a quiet stay as there is traffic most of the night. Breakfast was was a continental breakfast set in a lovely breakfast room. Nothing special but good and plentiful. The staff was wonderful and very helpful, nothing was ever a problem. Our biggest THANK YOU goes out to the 2 gentlemen who carried our luggage up and down the 3 flights of very steep stairs to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: backpackitup
Reviews.Content: The staff were really friendly and helpful - they provide maps and suggestions when you get there, then give you a drink to relax with while they carry your bags to your room for you. Breakfast is included and the food and coffee are everything you need to get ready for a day stomping around Amsterdam! The location is perfect for easy access to both the centrum and the station. The rooms are tidy and attractive, as is the view if you happen to have one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: UsRiggss
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the room was as described and a very comfortable bed. Compact right with all as promised. if you have problem with wireless service go to office and a kind gentlemen will sort it. 15-20mins from central station but an enjoyable walk (mind the cyclists) Best All excellent for a short syat. Least Stairs (but it was as discribed)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nostromo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nadia for five nights. It is a superb hotel with bags of charm and character. The staff are exceptionally friendly and their willingness to please surpasses expectations. For location it cannot be beat. Pleasantly situated on the canal and just across from the Westerkerk - (the western church built in 1620 and whose spire is the highest church tower in the city. It's also where Rembrandt is reportedly buried) - the church itself is just around the corner from Anne Frank's House, indeed she refers to it often in her diary as it's bells were a source of comfort to her. But back to the hotel. Trams stop just yards from the entrance and it's only five minutes walk to Dam Square. It's very easy to access from the central station. The nature and design of the building is typical of the Amsterdam style, so steep narrow staircases are par for the course, but don't let that put you off. Each step is worth the effort. Besides, you're luggage will be portered for you. Our room was very ambient and kept vigilantly serviced regularly with every convenience a guest could wish for - ours was a twin with a large window offering a fantastic vista and the limited space was successfully utilised to maximise comfort. The on-suite bathroom was more than adequate with a very effective shower. Tea and coffee facilities, multi-channel tv (English and Dutch), room-safe, fridge and free wi-fi internet are all included. The welcome bouquet of flowers is a thoughtful and appreciative gesture. The choice at breakfast is continental with plenty of variety. It would be churlish to find fault with this hotel and I cannot recommend it highly enough! Without question it will be our first choice for future visits to glorious and stress-free Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I will return soon.”
Reviews.Author: penpenAthens
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in the heart of Amsterdam,excellent cleanliness,warm and helpful staff,rich breakfast and special prices.My best wishes to all the people who offered me such hospitality and mainly to mr. Osam, the manager.Pinelopi,Athens.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, welcoming service”
Reviews.Author: warrenUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nadia for two nights, and found the service and value for money to be excellent. Staff were welcoming and professional, more so than virtually any other hotel I have stayed in whilst visiting Amsterdam, regardless of price. Rooms were clean, with a good cable TV service, and there were complimentary tea/coffee making facilities, which again is a service I have not tended to encounter when staying in 2/3 star hotels in the city in the past. The bathroom was clean and very functional, and whilst our room and bathroom was quite compact, this is fairly reflected in the price. On the whole, a very good stay, and I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect service , supperb location”
Reviews.Author: grolsch
Reviews.Content: + great location near to the dam sq. 5 min. walking in the corner of the hotel in only 1 min. you can get the tram. the service was superb! very clean room with fresh flowers. the room was little small but you won't stay for hole life in there!! the view from the room was amazing!!! - STAIRS lot of them ( but the say it )!! so 2 tip's: 1st make stop's in each floor for 1-2 min. 2nd dont walk far distance's take the tram with the day card it cost's 7 euro ! the balcony wasn't quait well cleaned cause i found 2 smoked cigarette's on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Service and Accomodation”
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Oman and his staff for a week on my way through Amsterdam to Africa for Safari. Initially was in a very small room but fully furnished with everything you need including a refrigerator and TV. However I am a light sleeper and the bells from the church across the street kept me awake. Oman upgraded me to a lovely unit and there where no other problems. All staff where very helpful and polite and did thier best to meet all demands. There were two house cats named In and Out (just in case you miss yours). Breakfast was good and just what you need before hitting the streets and seeing the sites. The location of the hotel is only blocks away from city center and all major atractions. Transit passess are cheap and they stop outside the door. Good value and a very clean place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in cozy Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Swiftlet
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but designed in a way where everything is cosily arranged and not in any way cramped. Showers are fabulous (i.e. consistent water temperatures unlike lots of other places I've stayed in.) Stairs are steep, yes, but should not pose much of a problem since it's the staff who carries your luggage to your room for you. Breakfast is simple but sufficient. We arrived with lost luggage and Osam, the hotel manager kindly gave us toothpaste and further sent someone out in search of toothbrushes and contact lense solution even though it was late at night. As returning guests the second time around, we were silently upgraded to a room with canal views with no extra charge. Hotel Nadia states that it's a 2* hotel offering 3* services, I say it provides 5* (if not more). Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception, great location, tasty breaky too!”
Reviews.Author: fairyprincess_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for just 2 nights and were really impressed. We were greeted by a lovely lady at reception(with excellent english!) and our bags were taken up the steep stairs for us by staff! (Thank god!) You are given a cold drink from the fridge upon arrival and departure which is really nice. Our room was really small, however it made excellent use of space, with plenty of shelving and big bay windows that you can unfold your case on. The only place you feel cramped is in the little bathroom. A Great location, i could see Anne Franks house from my window! I left my GPS in the room when i left and when i called they had it safely for me at reception. Great! The tram stops right out the front which is really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - good location, friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lmw10
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel if you are looking for something that is cheap and cheerful. It's not the best hotel in the world, obviously, it's just great value compared to most other places I looked at. The staff are very friendly and we were offered a welcome drink on arrival. We were then given lots of leaflets etc with local information. The rooms are good for the price, although our room had a really odd bathroom. It was very small, and the shower area didn't have any sort of ledge ie like a wet room, but there was no gradient so water was flowing into the whole of the bathroom - we just stook a towel down and the water stayed away from the rest of the bathroom. Not too big a deal, and we didn't actually bother to complain. Only other thing was we could here people coming up the stairs on a night and early morning, nothing too bad though. However, our friends had a room around the corner, and they had none of these issues - no odd shower and heard no noise, so pot-luck really. Anyway, rooms are clean, staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast is basic continental e.g. croissants, toast, juice, tea, coffee, cakes, yogs. It's in a good location, about 10 mins walk from dam square (other review said 4 mins...they must have sprinted there each morning), and a good 20 mins walk to Leidsplein. Another good point is that we arrived at 11am and they put our luggage into storage until we went back to the hotel at about 4pm. And then on the last day out flight was at 7pm, so they let us leave our luggage there until we wanted to pick it uplate afternoon.
