So that was very handy as wouldn't have wanted to be trailing luggage around all day. Would definitely recommend if looking for something cheap.

Reviews.Title: “clean & tidy, good base”
Reviews.Author: korky69
Reviews.Content: hotel is 10 minute walk from train station, very easy to find, room was spot on, comfy bed, clean shower, tv in room with bbc1 & bbc2, a few other in english with dutch subs. no complaints. breakfast included bread, cheese, jams, yogurts, apples, orange juice. although if you prefer a "healthy option" there is a cafe straight across that does fry-ups, also pack a mug if like us, you like a big pot o tea, recommend the albert market, 2 mile away from hotel, but the market must be a mile long up and back down good value for money, would stay again, however if you are a light sleeper the church across does chime every half hour, but there are a few churches about and you would probably get this in most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dburns307
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. Central for all the sights and nightlife. 4 mins from Dam square. The building itself ouzes charm and charector. Stairs are steep but this just adds to the charm of the place. (After all you only go up and down them a couple of times a day). Staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are warm and cosy, it was very cold outside when we visited, and are spotlessly clean. Room that we stayed in was on the busy street side but this did not bother us. If you want a quiet room at the back just request one when booking. Breakfast was continental and ok. Nice to start the day with a chat to other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WalesGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: I booked the Nadia hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor, Wow ! the hotel exceeded my expectations. It is in a brilliant location two minutes from the bustling Dam Square.The information you get from the hotels website is very helpful. We arrived at the central station and easily found the hotel about ten mins on foot. Beware of the very steep flights of stairs, you do need to be agile to negotiate them, The hotel arranges for cases to be transported from the front door to and from your room. We were made to feel very welcome by the humourous manager Osam who offered complimentary drinks on arrival as well as a city map and information. We stayed in a corner room overlooking the canal with a balcony. I would definately pay the extra to stay in a bigger room as the cheaper rooms are very small and have no view, as my brother and his wife found out. The rooms were very warm and clean, the beds comfortable and the shower excellent. The beautifully arranged fresh flowers were a lovely touch. Continental breakfasts were plentiful, fresh croissants, bread, cheese, jams and cake. The coffee free flowing and delicious. The hotel is housed above shops and a delighful Italian restaurant on the canal side which we dined at a couple of times. There is a bus and tram stop across the road from the hotel which we used to get to the Van Gogh Museum. We walked everywhere else, the Red Light District (old quarter ) 10mins, Leidseplein 15 mins. Anne Frank House ( just over the road behind the church ) Tip -pre book your tickets on the internet as there are long queues and the internet tickets let you by-passes the queue ! A canal trip is a must. I would definately recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, well located”
Reviews.Author: MerYChris
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excelent view from our room of the canal, just two blocks away from Dam Square. In the room there is a fridge, and free coffe and tea... Really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ever so good and loads of charm !”
Reviews.Author: walinne
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 day trip to Amsterdam and was very pleased with hotel Nadia. We chose a full canal view room and we had room 5 on the first floor ( less stairs !! ). The room was small but very nice and so cosy, nice and warm too (it was freezing outside!) . Tea and coffee facilities, the shower room and toilet were very clean and the staff is so nice and always so attentive to please you. Breakfast consistes in orange juice, white or brown bread, cheese, chocolate spread, jams, croissants and small rolls, coffee and tea. We slept very well and didn't mind the bells of the Westerkerk (you easily get use to it) and didn't hear a single noise coming from the other rooms. The view from the room was lovely on the canal (keizergracht) and the square with the church. The situation is perfect too and you can walk to all the main attractions. We will surely choose again hotel Nadia when we go back to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuperM75
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel is the perfect location for a solo trip, couples or group of friend!!! it's always nice and clean, the staff make you feel like at home, the breakfast is served in a so nice lounge facing to the city; the rooms are so well designed inside with all the furniture and space that u need! plus tv and shower in each room; trust me for that prices and location is the perfect place for Amsterdam!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a good price”
Reviews.Author: ToddfanOxford
Reviews.Content: At â‚¬61 per night for a twin room (cash price), the Nadia offers clean, comfortable rooms with breakfast included. Sure, the room was cosy, but perfectly adequate for the purpose of our stay. The inclusion of breakfast is very welcome - good coffee and a croissant or 2 is certainly good enough for me. The service was excellent throughout - friendly, polite & informative. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Johnh1995
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at the Nadia. This is a 2 star hotel and excellent value for money. Booked through an agency and paid 156 Euros when the hotel direct would have only charged 150 Euros. The web site describes the hotel perfectly and yes the stairs are steep, but a lot of hotels in this vicinity are all the same. Breakfast is lovely, with plenty to keep you going until lunch.The rooms are small but adequate and certainly very clean. The staff are very friendly. If you are looking for a budget hotel only a 5 minute walk to Dam Square, then try the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the very good location, but rooms a bit claustrophobic..”
Reviews.Author: adinutzu10
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights then went to Bruxelles, and come back for 1 more night. Indeed, the manager there (I think he's also the owner) was very nice, as we had booked a standard room, and for the last night he upgraded it for a nice channel view, for free. The first room was a little bit scary, somewhere at the 4th floor, with very small window, room was just for the bed to match in, the bathroom made me think at train toilets (I dont know why, but this is not good). The second room was the same, except the windows: this time large and so give a little feeling of more space.. About the stairs :))))) Well, think of it as an adventure! Well, after all, the location is great for the price - Amsterdam has pretty expansive accomodation, it is clean... Good hotel if you planning to walk all day. Just think nice thoughts if you're a bit claustrophobic..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireAlSkipton
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome in this hotel, which is small and owner managed. The room was a bit on the cosy side but it was clean. Location is very good, over the road from the Anne Frank House and West Church and 5 minutes walk from Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and compact hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngloLargs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia with my Wife and 8 friends - after negotiating the stairs, very steep which we were aware of - and would recommend it. Staff are very freindly and the rooms adequate. Location is ideal and only a 10 min walk from central station. Breakfast was good - usual continental type - and plentiful. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel in a great, accessible location.”
Reviews.Author: jkapuscik
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a lovely week at the Hotel Nadia. It was in a great, convenient location and had everything we wanted for a very reasonable price. Only drawback is the steep stairs, but if you're mobile, you should have no trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel- great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sammy_ali_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a brilliant hotel, the location is excellent- 2 mins from Dam Square & 1 min from Anne Frank House, then just a short tram ride away from museumplein. The room was quite small but perfectly adequate- fridge, tea/coffee, hairdryer, safe, power shower in bathroom which was unexpected in a budget hotel! Breakfast was good, not a huge amount of choice but enough to keep you going till lunch. The service was 4* drink on arrival, visitor information & map provided, fresh flowers in room, help with luggage (up the very steep stairs!) and the staff were all really friendly & helpful. The only thing to fault about the hotel is the room was pretty noisy. Our room was on the first floor right by the tram route but that really was the only complaint. If I return to Amsterdam would definitely stay at the Nadia Hotel again, I would probably pay the upgrade to a canal view room though.

Reviews.Title: “It is always nice to stay at the Nadia Hotel, it feels like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: MandarinaHamburg
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Nadia Hotel for the last couple of years twice a year and everytime I feel very welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff. The location is great, directly in the old and beautiful Grachten area, from where you can walk to visit all the sites and museums. The Hotel ist quiet and you don't meet your party crowds here. I can recommend this hotel to Business and weekend travellers. I am always looking forward to my stay at the Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Hotel with Four Star Service”
Reviews.Author: busybz
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel for a solo traveler on a budget. The hotel staff provides great service, a satisfying breakfast, and an ideal location. When I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to find that my room had been upgraded to a canal view and fresh flowers were sitting on the desk. I was also offered beverages on arrival and when I returned to pick up my luggage hours after check out. The staff here really go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. The stairs are indeed quite steep, but the staff will bring your luggage to the room. I will definitely return to this hotel the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful long weekend's stay.”
Reviews.Author: StGeorgesTerr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing central Amsterdam and our room had the bonus of a view across the canal. The room itself was immaculately clean and cosy with a very comfortable bed and the bathroom had one of the best showers we have ever used. All the staff were extremely kind and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay a success. When we return we shall definitely be staying at the Hotel Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Central but overrated”
Reviews.Author: Cap_Scarlet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel. We chose this hotel on the strength of the reviews on this site and the fact that it seemed to offer good value for money. To be fair this is a two star hotel so if you are expecting a five star experience, then you are going to be disappointed. As they say on the advert "it does what it says on the tin". Enough has been said about the steep stairs but you have to expect that in this city. On the plus side, the location is good, not too far from the central train station (about a 10 minute walk) and near most of the main attractions. On the down side, the rooms are a bit on the mankey side. They were reasonably clean but definitely not the most modern. Our room (the parents room!) was big enough but pretty cold. The childrens room was small - in fact so small that you could not open the door without banging the wardrobe. The main disappointment was the breakfast. No cereal. No fruit (other than a bowl of apples) and no toaster for the bread. All in all a pretty underwhelming experience but I think we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam - Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: millwall1234
Reviews.Content: MY Partner and I Travelled to Amsterdam via Brussels on the Euro Star for New Years Eve, staying for 10 days. Dispite the usual consistant poor service we received from Euro Star (Staff, or lack of), our Holiday was a Fantsatic Experience. We Love Amsterdam and have become regular visitors over the years, never running short of things to do and see, Amsterdam really has alot to offer besides the famous obvouse Tourist attractions.. Having a Warm Freindly Hotel to retreat to after a hard day on the cobbles, is the Key! We stayed at the Hotel Nadia which is situated above a parade of shops on the Raadhuisstraat, just five minutes from the Palace and Square. Very Clean Hotel, run by a lovely Family who will do everything to ensure you have the best stay possible! They have a selection of rooms to suit all budgets, but more importantly it's good honest value for money. Thats what brings us back year on year anyway! Thanks again Hotel Nadia Mr Barker from London, England.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: favollo
Reviews.Content: Very very good. Perfect central position, good rooms and good services. Very very good breackfast!!! Perfect for this beautiful City...We advice for a travel!!! Adriano e Cristina from Italy

Reviews.Title: “I feel great when I saw the flowers in my room”
Reviews.Author: luke_wanggeng
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the good services. one thing can be improved is to make the window more sound prove. Coz the church bell rings very often, it may disturb ppl at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Davewm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days at the Nadia in a double de luxe room. Not much to say that hasnt been said by other reviewers. Certainly on the downside the rooms are 'compact' and the stairs are steep. That said this seems in keeping with this type of canal side building and the price you pay for keeping clear of mainstream hotels. The breakfast was simple but more than enough to set you up till lunch time. However if these features don't present you with a problem then the positive features of the hotel far outwiegh the negatives in my view. Certainly the staff cant do enough for you and are loaded with useful local knowledge and advice. What they dont know they will find out for you. They seem genuinely keen to ensure that you have the best stay possible, both in the hotel and in their City. The rooms have all that you might need...coffee making, hairdrier, fridge, safe, TV, good shower with plenty of hot water etc. Also we had a superb canal view. Not much noise other than the bells of the nearby church which was no problem at all. Didnt wake us or keep us awake. The location is first class. Easy walking distance to the city centre, loads of good restaurants, museums, markets. A real benefit was being close enough to drop back to the hotel to have a snooze late afternoon before hitting the restaurants in the evening. This is a relaxed no frills hotel that is warm and friendly and all for a really modest price. If you want lots of space, lifts, anonymous corporate trappings then stay well clear otherwise I would certainly recommend it, especially for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Had a delightful stay at the Nadia Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi777
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel.Tthe staff was extremely friendly and helpful in every way. We were very comfrotable and happy with our room and with our breakfastroom experiences. The only drawback were the steep steps but the staff were helpful with our bags and accommodated us with a room on the lowest level possible. As long as we could be on the lowest level we would definately return to the Nadia the next time we are in Amsterdam. The hotel was well kept as was the breakfastroom. The receptionist was very well informed about tourist information and was very helpful on several ocassions.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, brilliant staff and a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryGirl
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews on this site before booking I was interested to see if the Hotel Nadia lived up to its praises. The hotel was easy to find, a 5 min walk from Dam Sqaure and a 2 min walk from Anne Franks House, it is also within walking distance of the major museums. I would agree the stairs are not for the elderly but in my opinion they only add to the rustic charm of the hotel. The rooms arn't the biggest but again they are typical of Holland! We had a canal view room with a balcony and the view was gorgeous, especially at night! Breakfast was delicious if basic but you didnt need anything else. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel and without a doubt stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Friendly, Only Place We will Stay In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Robert-Fiona
Reviews.Content: Third trip to The Nadia and it was as good as always. Friendly staff, clean warm and cosy room ideal for a city break. Great value for money and location We were late booking for a New Years Party Trip and the Manager called us up as he knows we have visited the hotel before. He managed to fit us in and called to confirm which was a nice personal touch. All in all another great trip and would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: bereten
Reviews.Content: Close to the Dam but out from noise and bad places. Extremely kindness by the staff and the Manager Mr. Osam. Third time there in five years, last one few days ago in a family room. I'll raccomand to a friend...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quad room for traveling with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: QED-Portugal
Reviews.Content: Not easy to travel with 2 teenagers and find a reasonably priced quad room in the centre of town. But Nadia Hotel just offered what we were looking for. We travelled to Amsterdam by train on the very day that almost all of Holland was paralysed by snow and freezing temperatures. And although it is an easy walk from the train station to the hotel, we were pleased to arrive in a cosy and warm room. The hotel is in (nice) walking distance of all of the interesting cultural visiting sites of Amsterdam and that 's just what we did, walk and enjoy beautiful Amsterdam in the snow...

Reviews.Title: “We hope to be back - soon”
Reviews.Author: SenexNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located, a stone's throw from Dam Square, but on the corner of a quiet canal, opposite the Wester Kerk, and on several tram routes. We were warmly received and offered the choice between two good rooms. Service was prompt and friendly. The hotel was very clean, and warm; our room had a fine view and was comfortable and quiet. The only possible drawback to the hotel is its precipitous stairs -disconcerting even by Dutch standards - but the management do not conceal this, and arrange as a matter of course for luggage to be carried up and down by their staff. We very much enjoyed our stay, felt the hotel represented good value for money, and shall certainly stay there again whenever we have the chance to visit Amsterdam. ( I would respectfully suggest to the City authorities that they might use some of the City Tax I gladly paid as a visitor to clear the snow and ice from the pavements and street-crossings.)

Reviews.Title: “amazing canal view”
Reviews.Author: beav357
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights 12/28-12/31. We came to Amsterdam for part two of our honeymoon. I'd asked for two single beds because I had been told (not by the hotel) that a "double" bed was just a big twin. The hotel, knowing that we were on our honeymoon, pushed the two twins together and had flowers for us in the room. In looking at previous TripAdvisor reviews, we knew the stairs were steep and the rooms small. Because we wanted a more authentic hotel rather than a large chain one, though, we were okay with this. The stairs are something else. We were lucky in that we only had to go half the flight to get to our room. They're steep and small, but we only had to climb them a few times daily. The staff carried our bags to our room, thankfully. The positives: the view onto the canal from room 4 is amazing. There's the canal, the bridge and a church all outside the window-the HUGE window. So, so pretty. The breakfast is perfect, yummy and included. The hotel feels cosy, the location is great, and the staff is polite. The negatives: we had to turn in the room key whenever we left and collect it upon return. Even though I trusted the staff and there was an in-room safe, this still made me uncomfortable. Not a negative for me, but more of an FYI: our room was a little noisy at night because we were near the street. It didn't disrupt our sleep though. The hallways are pretty noisy all day. The first full day, we asked for our room to be cleaned, but all we got were folded towels. The second day, we returned at 4:30 to cleaning supplies left in our room and towels and sheets all out of place. We had to wait in the breakfast room for at least 40 minutes for our room to be ready. During this time, three other guests also waiting with us were checked into their rooms. It smelled horrible when we returned to our room, but it was cleaner. The fire alarm went off two out of our three days at the hotel (I'm guessing because one of the rooms next to us was smoking even though the staff said it's non-smoking). The hallway often smelled like pot. Finally, we asked for a wake up call on the third day, and no one called. They did have the cab ready for us, though. Overall, for the price, I am happy with the hotel. This would not be the case had I not set my own alarm for wakeup, however, as I would have missed my flight. The view and location make up for most of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jakeena
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed in this hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It is reasonably priced, excellent location, lovely staff, clean and comfortable. Rooms aren't large but have all you need. There's a lovely cafe on the street corner called Il Panorama which is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, cosy hotel and really friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: bradfordtravellers
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Perfect location, very near West Church and Anne Frank House, and within very close walking distance of most places to visit. Great views, cosy rooms, steep stairs (but that adds to the traditional feel of the hotel), and very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is very nice too. Would definitely stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: Bob08765
Reviews.Content: Nadia is my favorite hotel in Amsterdam. The service and cleanliness are impeccable, the rooms are charming, and the location can't be beat. I highly recommend this jewel of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Darnelle60
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides all the comforts of home in a friendly manner. The staff is courteous and professional in a way that made us feel like we were staying with friends. Fresh flowers were in the room daily! We really liked the location. It is convenient to the center of town within walking distance to many attractions. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel is the stairs but after a day or two they become a part of the "home" that we accepted.

Reviews.Title: “A litte gen in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a well recommended hotel for three reasons, location, value and service. Staff were very helpful and tho' the rooms are small and the stairs steep, it offers excellent value for money. It is in the centre of Amsterdam close to Anne Frank house and the Westerkerk. If you want room service, a gym, bar and pool then you know where to go. If you want a friendly little Dutch hotel then book now.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed this Hotel has such great reviews????”
Reviews.Author: susie1964
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the budget price and based on the great reviews on TripAdvisor. So the plus's are 1) This hotel has a great location. Its close to Dam Square, the red light district, all the coffee shops/restaurants and a 5/10 min walk from the Central Train Station. 2) A reasonable price for Amsterdam Hotels. 3) Friendly, helpful staff who will take your bags up the Mount Everest of stairs. 4) Free can of drink when you arrive Negatives: 1) Everything in this hotel is small. 2) The stairs are absolutely amazing and need to be seen to be believed. 3) This was the smallest hotel room I have ever had the misfortune to be in. It was so small I was sure that my husband and I wouldn't be able to both sleep in the bed, but we actually we did. Having said that, it did have everything we needed for our 2 night stay but I couldn't have managed another night. The toilet and shower room was so small it was only just possible to sit on the toilet and put your arms down by your sides! 2) The breakfast was also the smallest continental breakfast I have ever been offered in a hotel. Because we had pre-paid I made my husband eat the breakfast, but thank god there are lots of coffee shops and cafe's close by. 3) Garishly decorated and looked like the whole hotel needed a good scrub! For me this hotel is 1* (and thats being generous), if that and I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel or go back to it. We visited Durty Nellies Hostel where our friends were staying and the standard was much higher than that of the Nadia's and less than half the price per night. My advice go to Amsterdam, enjoy yourself and odn't stay at the Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: 12shoes
Reviews.Content: Central hotel with great value for money. Small rooms, good breakfast and free wifi. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very very clean, so friendly and helpful and CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: flirtyfiona44
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break with four of my girlfriends in Amsterdam and we stayed at the Hotel Nadia and it was perfect. The hotel looks small but it is rabbit warrant inside. We arrived at 9am and although we couldn't check in until 2pm it was not a problem. We left our bags in reception, had a drink on the house and was given a comprehensive map and guide to Amsterdam and off we went to explore. We did Ann Frank house, did lunch and then wandered back to the hotel. Our bags were in our room and although it was small (which considering the space in any traditional hotel in Amsterdam) it was just what we needed. Fridge, tv, bathroom with a fantastic shower, lots of hot water and fresh white sheets on the bed. Tea making facilities and it was just perfect. Afterall we only used the room as a base to shower change and sleep and we could not ask for anything more. The staff were great, so friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. We asked it we could have some ice in our room, yep ice we got, they really went that extra mile. Although it was a hotel I think the fact that it was small, personal and friendly it felt like we were spending the weekend at a mates house. The stairs, yes they were steep but so what, after you have been up and down them once it aint a problem. If you want plush hotel reception, bar and piped music then don't come to the Nadia, however if you want friendly, clean, central and nice sheets then this is the place for you. I would certainly recommend The Hotel Nadia to anyone who wants a short break in Amsterdam and if you would like to contact me to ask any questions then I would be more than happy to oblige. So to sum up, cheap, clean, friendly, helpful and like your mates house. I would not stay anywhere else if I were spending time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sylvia123456789
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed at the Nadia hotel for five nights, the rooms are small but you have everything you could want, there was a lovely bunch of flowers in our room from the staff to welcome us, the hotel is very clean and secure and staff are very welcoming and nothing is too much trouble, it is in a perfect location just at the back of the royal palace 5 minute walk from dam square, We would defiantly stay there again. Sylvia & maureen

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPeregrine
Reviews.Content: The room was compact (any American expecting an American-sized room would be surprised), but well-organized, very clean and neat. The staff was very friendly and polite at every turn and every hour. They also give the traveler much helpful information (maps, guidebooks, etc.). The hotel is nicely located near spots of interest and convenient to the central train station. The included breakfast was quite good. I would definitely stay here again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel in an overrated city...”
Reviews.Author: BigDumma
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Amsterdam for 5 days in November, 2009. My friend and I booked a room with Hotel Nadia based on the positive reviews (location, price, cleanliness) we found on this site, however we were a little disappointed. On the positive side, the location is fairly good. The hotel is right on one of the inner canal rings; the dam and red light district are only blocks away, and you're easily within walking distance to any of the major museums or the Heineken Brewery, etc. But since the city is small, you could really stay anywhere in the city centre or the canal zones and be within walking distance of everything. Contrary to what other reviewers have stated, cafes and/or bars in the area around the hotel are either unremarkable or dead. The only other positive I could think of was the price, as this was one of the few centrally located hotels we could find with rooms under 100 euros/night, but you get what you pay for in the end. The stairs and room sizes were consistant with what other reviews have said, near vertically steep and claustrophobically small, but we knew that going in. What we didn't know was that the bathroom would be so small that the toilet is actually in the shower (pretty funny at first). Not sure about the sanitary aspect of this, but I certainly didn't feel clean in there. After using the shower, you couldn't go in the bathroom w/o shoes because the whole floor was flooded. But the biggest problem was the mold all over the disgusting bathroom walls. We told the front desk every day to have someone clean that up but nothing was ever done. Not sure what the problem was but they would appologize each day and then do nothing. Rest of the room was pretty clean, the beds and especially pillows could have been more comfortable but I've had worse. Also of note, we had requested a room away from the street noise but were given a room right on the street. The strangest thing about our stay was after returning to our room one day, we found that the room smelled like someone had taken a dump on the floor and the windows were wide open. It was so bad I asked to front desk if there was a sewage problem in the building! Housekeeping blew up our room! We had to leave the room for an hour and a half until it aired out. As for the breakfast, average at best. All in all, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again and I won't recommend this place to anyone. The lack of service and unclean bathroom override the location and price. If I wanted a dump, could have stayed somewhere else for half the price. If money is an issue, go with hostel; if not, go with nice B&B on a canal. Skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered on description”
Reviews.Author: michellef16
Reviews.Content: Reading the description from the hotel, i agree with it 100%. It is no more or less than described. While small, the location was great and the service was just as great! Completely recommend for a quick, sightseeing stay. We stayed 2 nights and after a 3rd night, it may have gotten a little old. Completely recommend this hotel. However the cost was a little high. One great thing about the hotel was the shower. Never had such a hot and high pressure shower in Europe in all my stays. One issue was when we came backback to the hotel during a shift change at the front desk and had to ring the bell (to get into the hotel) for about 5 minutes before we were let in. Overall a good experience for our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly european hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: MaryPChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for Thanksgiving week 2009 and had a fabulous time at Hotel Nadia. Yes, the rooms are small, the bathroom is cramped, and the stairs are steep. It's Europe! If you want faux Europe, with giant rooms and American-style bathrooms, go to San Francisco or Boston. The hotel is extremely well located, just a few blocks off the Dam Square and right along the third canal, near lots of great shops, bars and restaurants. The location is really perfect for someone who is looking for a little more evolved Amsterdam visit (not centered around the red light district and coffeeshops). When we arrived we were also helped up the stairs with our bags and offered a soft drink by the friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our room was on the third floor, on the "courtyard," which wasn't a fabulous view, but we spent little time in our room when we weren't sleeping. We heard a pigeon one night, but no street noise and little hallway noise from other guests. The front desk staff was always present and helped when we had a safe malfunction late one night. Our room was small, but more cute and European-feeling, than claustrophobic or cell-like. The room, sheets, bathroom and carpet were all clean and maintained throughout our stay. We were given fresh flowers when we checked in and the only negative thing was that the hotel provided only wall dispenser combination soap/shampoo. If you're picky, bring your own. (You'll use it up and have more room in your suitcase for souvenirs.) Breakfast was toast, cake, croissants (of which some piggie American teenagers ate 5+ each day, so it really is all you can eat), sliced cheese, yogurt, apples, orange juice, coffee and tea. There was jam, peanut butter, chocolate sprinkles, Nutella, honey, and butter also available, but only coffeemilk for the coffee (not fresh). There was free wifi in our room, but the connection was a little persnickety.

Reviews.Title: “After overcoming the daunting stairs, enjoyed every aspect of our stay”
Reviews.Author: Audu Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location close by Joordan District and other central attractions, entrance and steep staircase to reception means a certain fitness is required, but when you arrive, staff very friendly at this family run hotel, room small but somehow had everything you could want, including a small balcony overlooking the canal, breakfast room also charming, owner noticed from check in that it was my birthday while there, so pit some flowers in our room which was a lovely touch, would recommend staying here if you prefer small well located hotels and can climb stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sfrugrats31
Reviews.Content: The staff at Nadia was very helpful and informative. Always polite and appreciated their help in directions and attractions to see. As other users and their web site says. Not for some travelers due to the stairs. The breakfast had no meat so it was a pretty light affair. If you want your bread toasted you have to ask and they will do it for you. The room was small, but that was to be expected but clean. Which was our main concern. I would recommend ear plugs just in case you get a room by the street and are a light sleeper. I did, and had no problems. For the location and the price I would recommend going there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location - careful on room choice”
Reviews.Author: rachstarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a rainy november. paid well over published rates because the IDFA film festival was in town. The location is perfect for getting around the city - a short walk to Jordaan to potter aroud the little streets and cafes, a similarly short walk to the red light district and general centre for a bit more buzz in the evenings. It's also along a beautiful canal, and as we had paid a lot, we got a great room with a lovely view of this. room #413 highly recommended - it has both a tiny balcony over the street corner (canal and big road view) and a window fully over the canal, with a desk in front of it and a cute duck-in wardrobe. small but very romantic. not box like. I did however find the traffic noise from the balcony occasionally quite bad, and when I experienced a different room for a night (right over the road like many of them) this was incredibly noisy - I needed ear plugs to block out the traffic (and I usually live in central London!), so i would advise paying more for a canal view room or the top floor (4th) to avoid this. the staff were charming - helped with bags, very welcoming, sorted all problems quickly and with a smile. breakfast was in a tiny room but great canal view and perfectly adequate space - nothing hot though to eat, only croissants, bread and cold cheese or jam, or cake. i could have done with toast in the freezing winter! the surrounding area feels very safe - easy to navigate home because of the church. only downside is the street has no nice cafes on it - a tacky little "croissanterie" which looks more like a kebab shop and we though had pretty cr*p food, and a very overpriced pancake place that burnt mine and still charged me 9 euros for banana and sugar! there's also a bagel chain which is similarly overprices. a "coffee shop" is nearby too but not one you'd want to linger in. Overall, we really liked the hotel, and it was in a fantastic location for seeing the city easily - didnt see one better the whole time. mainly because of the staff and the unusual character of the rooms and lovely view, i would go back. i would warn against street side rooms though because of the traffic noise, and don't ignore the warning about the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “good clean place,rooms are a bit cramped,good staff”
Reviews.Author: mutleyScotland
Reviews.Content: nice clean place although the bathroom was really tight and the beds were sunken in on one side ,overall for the price its a pass

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: rachy33
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at this hotel and was really pleased with our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a small but the view from our room made up for this fact. Very beautiful view. The only negative point was the stairs as my mum struggled with these however it was pointed out in the hotel information. Regardless of the stairs both my mum and I would happily stay at this hotel again. Hope to be visting agin some time next year and would be booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: lovemytraveling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nadia hotel for four nights. This hotel is located in an excellent area. Itâ€™s literally a five-minute walk from Dam Square, which is the center of the city. We arrived at the hotel around mid morning, and were very happy when they allowed us to check into our room right away. We were a bit disappointed when we saw how small the room was. However, it was immaculately clean and they even had a fresh flower bouquet in the room welcoming us. That was a very nice touch! The bathroom was also small, but the shower had a lot of pressure. As per our request, our room had a balcony and the view was great. We could see the Canal and the famous Westerkerk church from our balcony. The breakfast room was charming, full of plants and with a beautiful view of the Canal. Breakfast was simple, but satisfying. We asked for hot chocolate every morning that they happily prepared for us. We found the staff to be extremely friendly, pleasant and very helpful all of the time. There was a candy bowl in the reception room, which my husband helped himself every time he passed by. On the last day, Osam took a handful of the candies and put it into my husbandâ€™s pocket. Across the street from Nadia, there is Jennifer Croissanterie, a nice little place for espressos, cappuccinos, hot chocolate and sandwiches. Overall, this is a great budget hotel in the center of a beautiful city. Teresa & Jose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, OK service... Would I go back? No.”
Reviews.Author: userunknown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located (10 minutes walk from Central Station), and is run by an Indian family that don't allow groups of more than 5 men, or solo travelers taking "companions" to the rooms. On the other hand, they'll let you smoke whatever you want inside the room (like my neighbors did). Definitely not a problem if you don't mind sleeping with the window open at 3Â°C and hearing people screaming in the streets all night long. The Single Room is extremely small. You may find the mattress hard as a rock... but that impression will change after you've tried the pillows. The stairs could become a problem if you're not in a good physical condition or had a few extra drinks. Breakfast was nothing special: coffee, orange juice, assorted breads and cheese. In conclusion, a hotel for young budget travelers that are willing to overcome some of these situations. Oh, just for the record, I'm 24 and I'm a budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: dinkytoys
Reviews.Content: A very friendly place to stay. Although the room was small (#7), it was clean, lots of light through an entire wall of windows, and with a nice view to the canal. No traffic noise. The hotel is not suitable for people with difficulties walking in stairs (you need to negotiate a very steep two floor staircase before reaching the reception). A plus is the included breakfast; somewhat basic, but ideal to get you going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively expensive and a tiny room, but overall, not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: JLloydLondon
Reviews.Content: I don't know how much hotel rooms normally go for in Amsterdam for November weekends, but at Â£72 per night, this was the least good value for money of the three hotels I stayed at on this trip, which had included Paris and Bruges earlier on in the week. The room was tiny - just enough room for a bed and a wardrobe (with a safe) and for the door to open inwards, with a 14" TV suspended over the foot of the bed and a fridge perched on a shelf above it, combined with a sliver of a wet room, wide enough to allow one person to move from shower to toliet and out again. On a cost per square foot basis, it was poor value compared to my Bruges and Paris hotels, but like I say, this could be the norm for the Dam and I wouldn't know. Onto the good stuff though - the service and the friendliness of the staff was excellent. I'd been warned that the steps from the entrance were steep - and they were! Having walked down from the Centraal Station in about ten minutes, the prospect of humping my bag up those vertiginous steps was awful - but I was rescued - the voice of Tess from the reception level on the first floor saved me - they had a system that carried your bag to your room while you calmed yourself in the breakfast room. That was wonderful. The bed was narrow and I needed a second pillow to make it a comfortable night - there was little room to stretch out. Downside - the walls were very thin, it would seem. I had the TV on very quietly but still got the ominous knocking from next door each of the three nights I stayed there. The breakfast was a little spartan - no cereals, just toast and croissants, juice, tea and coffee and mini-yoghurts. But overall, this was a decent spot to stay in the Dam - perhaps not the best value though.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Content: frendly staff, very clean and warm room, fantastic location, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location, intimate and cosy room, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: cocolica
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect because it's in the centrum, but not in the middle of all it's noises. Dam square is 3 min walking distance. In the neighbourhoud is Jordaan, were u can find lots of restaurants and a classy atmosphere. We were with a 6 month baby and we received a room with an extra bed, room no 6. The view from room is great, you can see the canal, and the Wester church, also Anne Frank's house, which are on the other side of the street. Trams and buses make a good connection with all parts of the city, even you can reach them by foot. Room is not very big, but cosy, perfect for us, with a lot of deposit space, sheets were very clean, bathroom with a lot of space and the hot water pressure better than home. we had no problems with heating-works perfect. Breakfest room is very nice and clean, house made cakes were very tasty. The staff is the best! thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff to Ease your Mind”
Reviews.Author: littledoo14
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I first arrived in Amsterdam to get hustled by a taxi scam. The bulletin board outside the central train station cites your taxi rights and approximate fare, but nevertheless, the drivers run the show and gave us no option less than triple what we should have paid for a 15 block drive with luggage. Frazzled by our experience, we arrived at the Nadia and saw the steep stairs. Voices over the intercom beckoned us to proceed up to registration while someone else took care of lugging our suitcases upstairs. We were greeted with bottled beverages and checked in - even to a canal facing room (advice to others to check availability when you book). Honestly, the living quarters are TIGHT! You have to maneuver a lot - to shower, to get your personal items out and then restore the luggage, but after awhile, it becomes routine and since we were out exploring the city most of the day, it was an ok place for budget travelers. The terrace was very relaxing. The breakfast was pretty nice - the corner room is really cute and the location is fantastic. We were called a cab to go back to the train station - which we were not overcharged on (he used a meter), and sent off with another departing beverage. I think the management definitely made us feel welcome in Amsterdam and for that, I have a pleasant impression of Hotel Nadia. Thanks for taking care of your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place... Couldnt have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: tisha_27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant and exceeds its rating of a 2 star, I cant beleive some of the bad reveiws as we couldnt have asked for more while we were there. Yes rooms were small, but what do you expect in an old building in dam, many hotels have small rooms, its kind of the norm. Even though they were small everything was strategically placed and the room had all the necessary amenities inc hair dryer, fridge, tv, safe (which you wernt charged for). The rooms were very clean, the sheets were changed and we were only there 3 nights! The breakfast was yummy...choice of bread (which could be toasted on request), croissants, cheese, crackers, jam/honey, cake, yoghurt, juice etc. We needed to check out just after breakfast started, so needed to go a little earlier and the staff were accomodating and allowed this. The staff were so firendly and helpfull giving you guides etc, I needed to find an interenet cafe to check in for my flight home and the staff let me use there pc and printer. The rooms were quaint and had charecter, there was a beautiful bunch of flowers in our room on arrival, and we were given a welcome drink. The tram 17 stops just outside the hotel which takes you to central station. Anne franks house 2 mins from hotel including a loveley reasonably priced curry house a few doors down called Koh-I-Noor. Great hotel, location very central, loveley staff, couldnt have asked for more and would come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Very Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SagiTLV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, just 2 channels east of the Dam square. The stuff are very helpful and nice. The hotel is very clean and the the coffee facilities in the rooms and at the breakfast room are just great! The room are small but this is how it is in all center located hotels in Amsterdam. The beds are not the comfortable, but you can live with it...

Reviews.Title: “convenient location above excelent service and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: bluecooker
Reviews.Content: there were no suprises on ariving at the hotel. the stairs were very steep as clearly stated and the rooms were compact also as stated but nothing prepared us for how nice and friendly,helpful and professional the staff were. the rooms were clean and well appointed, serviced to a good standard, just a little small the breakfasts were very good the staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble, you would do well to find better service anywhere

Reviews.Title: “You feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: Yolimart
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Amsterdam is one of the best I visited, clean, service-minded staff, tasteful decoration, giving you this remarkable feeling of being at home. Close to everything, channels, stores, museums and even if the rooms are small they have manage to use every single inch of the space they've got. I really recomend it when you visit Amsterdam next time.You'll simply love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual!”
Reviews.Author: dleglasgow
Reviews.Content: This was my forth stay at the Nadia Hotel and as always it was excellent. I cannot fault them. The room was very nice and clean, and the staff as helpful and friendly as ever. I would never consider staying anywhere else when I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value from Good Friends in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Robert063
Reviews.Content: Had an unexpected five day layover in Amsterdam over the new year. Found myself back at the Hotel Nadia for the third time this year, and was not disappointed. Warm clean rooms, hot water, a good breakfast at a fair price keeps bringing me back to this hotel. Had a brief bout with the flu during my stay and the hotel staff took great care of me, found me a doctor, and got me through the week and back on the road, for which I am ever grateful. Staying here is like staying with trusted friends. Very close to the Tram (street car) from which you can go anywhere. I look forward to staying at the Nadia again. My thanks to the manager, the engineer, and the doctor! See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LikaDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia one night while in Amsterdam. There were four of us traveling together so we booked the family room. The room was clean and spacious with four comfortable single beds. We were very pleased with the servce too! The nice woman working at the front desk when we arrived, recommended a wonderful restaurant for dinner. The Nadia Hotel is cozy and comfortable with an amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by 2* rating...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gavola
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night but wish it could've been longer. Rooms are traditional and cosy, small but well equiped. We had a balcony with the most romantic views over the canal. Only 5 minutes walk from Dam Square. Staff were very friendly and hospitable. Will definately return and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “been there before-went there again-there will be a next time too”
Reviews.Author: carobrucker
Reviews.Content: We've been to that hotel before, it's located in the middle of Amsterdam( perfectly convenient), it's clean (very important!), feels safe, Beds are comfi and it's so nice look into friendly faces when you get somewhere foreign. The staff makes any effort to make you feel comfortable. I really appreciate that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belle084
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the nadia hotel for 3 nights, It was everything that we expected it to be which is very comfortable, great location, very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was beautiful and the welcome flowers were a very nice touch. We had a great stay in the nadia hotel and we will defintely be returning again sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Overlooking the Canal with View of Cathedral”
Reviews.Author: ginoOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: The service was sincerely friendly and they went out of their way to make our stay the best it could be. The staff brought us a bouquet of flowers because we were on our honeymoom. The room was small but the view from our window (which we were able to open and get fresh air) had a spectacular view of the canal and of the cathedral. Were within walking distance to most attractions or you could take a tram ride. The dining room for breakfast was decorated and comfortable and the staff were attentive. The rooms were quiet and on our last day our host Osam ( a very worldly and wise man) told us not to worry about catching our train to Paris and to take time to have coffee and toast with him and he would make sure that we had a taxi to the station--he was right--we made it on time. Thanks Osam!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service, simple, clean, cozy and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: RKBurke80
Reviews.Content: It was the 1st trip to Ams for my husband and I and thanks to TA we had a great 2 nt stay. The Nadia was just right with a dbl bedded room (w/a floral bouquet welcome) overlooking a canal and clock tower, a staff that couldn't have been more accomodating (we were even able to borrow an umbrella one day), and a location convenient to everything. The 48 hr transport pass enabled us an easy commute to/from Schiphol and, though we love walking, jumping on/off the trams allowed us to see so much of the city w/out rushing. The VanGogh, the Flower Market, Dam Square, a canal cruise and all those wonder bikes! We'll return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Address in Amsterdam - Hotel Nadia, Room 412”
Reviews.Author: artstuffPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I return to Amsterdam, we will definately be staying again at the Hotel Nadia, Room 412. Okay, it is a 72-step climb to get to the typically small Dutch hotel room, but the outside balcony with the great view of the Westerkerk and the Keizergracht was well worth the climb. We arrived early on a rainy morning from the US, and at first, were taken back at the sight of the 36-step steep climb up the stairs to the reception area. We were relieved when a voice over the intercom instructed us to leave our luggage downstairs, and someone would carry it up for us. Once in the reception area, we were offered a complimentary drink - coffee/tea, water, soda, juice - which was greatly appreciated after a long flight. Our room wasn't ready yet, so we went off to explore Amsterdam in the dreary rain. When we returned, our luggage had been moved to our room and we were given the key to room 412. We climbed two more flights of stairs, 18 steps each, and were delighted when we opened the door and found a vase of fresh cut flowers brightening up our little room. Although the room was typically small, there was enough area to store our luggage and still have room for my husband to pace. There was a built-in counter desk with two chairs, and shelves which contained a television, mini-fridge, and a coffee/tea service. A closet at the other end of the room had a built-in safe. The bathroom was small, particularly the shower. The room was clean and nicely decorated. There were heavy black out curtains on the windows which helped with the street noise and light. But the best part of the room was the little covered balcony off the front of the hotel, on the Raadhuisstraat, overlooking the Westerkerk and the Keizergracht. We had to climb through the window/door to reach it, and it was large enough to accomodate three chairs, which was perfect since we were travelling with a friend. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting on the balcony, watching the city go by, protected from the rain. The breakfast room was nicely decorated and comfortable. Breakfast consisted of cheese, breads, rolls, jams & spreads, coffee/tea, juice, yogurt. We really enjoyed our two night stay at the Hotel Nadia, and the staff took excellent care of us. In fact, we ended up spending an additional night at the hotel, although it was in a different room. After a passport mix-up, we found ourselves stranded in Amsterdam at 10:00 on a Friday night, and we called the Nadia, and they were able to put us up for the evening in a triple room, complete with fresh flowers! They gave us a 5:00 am wake-up call, and arranged a 5:30 taxi for us, so we could get to Central Station to catch our train. We were having a bit of a crisis, but their hospitality made us feel more at ease.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL”
Reviews.Author: MatureAdult
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, spotlessly clean and well located between the canals. Rooms VERY compact but for as much time as you will spend in them it shouldn't be a major issue

Reviews.Title: “definitely a recommendable hotel. anything I need, and more!”
Reviews.Author: bibisbis
Reviews.Content: Even more than I expected; I read other reviews before coming and I expected a nice hotel with good value for money. Nadia Hotel is perfectly located, close to Dam plaza but far from noise, with a very nice view on the surroudings. My room (single room) was tiny but perfectly organised and clean. Anything I needed was there, and even more (e.g. free wifi, fridge, kettle, phon, securebox, etc....)..little things that make the difference! Breakfast was ok, kind staff. I'll definitely come back to Nadia Hotel and I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place!!”
Reviews.Author: ginalh
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Amsterdam and try to get there at least once a year. When I do go, I ALWAYS stay at the Nadia Hotel - and would not stay anywhere else. Osam, the Manager is an absolute delight - and nothing is too much trouble for him or his staff. Located just around the corner from Dam Square means that you're near enough to the main streets/shops/restaurants. Rooms are a good size and clean, with en-suite facilities. I would not hesitate in recommending the Nadia Hotel - FABULOUS PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, small rooms but good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateKiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in September on our way to Belgium. The place is not suitable for people with poor mobility, you have to climb a steep flight of stairs before you arrive at the reception area. Very friendly lady at the reception, got a welcome drink. Our bags were carried up the steep stairs to the room by the staff. Room was very small, but had a great view on the canal and a church. Small bathroom with OK shower. The breakfast was good with a choice of breads and sweets. Excellent central location, with the Anne Frank museum around the corner. Less than 20min walk to central station. Overall good value, would definitely recommend this place for a short stay for young people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “maximum result with minimum effort”
Reviews.Author: peppetorcolo
Reviews.Content: Great position and family-owned hotel. The only remark is the main stairway: tough to ride!. All the rest is to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It is as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: davidcambs
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, some of the rooms are small but clean.The safes in the room are high along with the fridge so not good if you are short! The stairs are very steep but the staff do carry your luggage. However this seems to be the trend of many buildings in Amsterdam. The hospitality and helpfulness of all the staff cannot be faulted, nothing was too much touble and they made us feel welcomed from the time of of making a reservation to departure. The connexions hotel shuttle bus was brilliant allowing stress free travel to and from the airport. would recommend it if you want a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HelenSOslo
Reviews.Content: Nadia is a pleasant, basic hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It is very well located, near many sights, restaurants, shops... The room was small, but comfortable, and had all we needed. Also the hotel has two beautiful cats, Hello and Goodbye! We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DoctorCompRhet
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18-year-old son, and I stayed at the Hotel Nadia in May during a trip to see our older son who was studying in Paris. We wanted a couple of days in Amsterdam. This is a unique hotel with a lot of character. The room was clean and comfortable, although the one we had was just over the street and there was a _lot_ of street noise (and a church bell gonged all night nearby). We were tired enough that it didn't matter, but ask for a rear-facing room if you're concerned about noise. The location was great, and the breakfast room was small but delightful, with lots of choices of continental breakfast fare. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel in a good location with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: kgreen17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our last stop of our honeymoon. Our room was clean and had great views. We were on the top floor w/ views on 2 sides w/ a balcony. Yes, the stairs are rough but we are young and they bring your bags up and down for you. They also offer you a beverage when you arrive and we also had a vase w/ beautiful flowers waiting in our room. The hotel is located very close to the Anne Frank house in a more quiet area of the city. The price is great w/ breakfast and great service. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “if only all hotels were like this”
Reviews.Author: tartanbill
Reviews.Content: hotel nadia welcoming staff great rooms great location-arrived at 11am to see if we could store our luggage and the man at the desk could not of been more helpful with a free drink and info it made a great 1st impression the room with balcony brilliant -clean and not a modern box a room with character for first timers to amsterdam the location is perfect you can walk to most places in minutes would not stay any place else

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value, but watch out for the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Pasty99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Nadia. We thought the location was excellent for what we wanted, just about half way between Dam Square and The Leidseplein. The room was small, but clean, and the bed extremely comfortable - a big plus in hotels generally. We also found the staff very friendly aand helpful. One major word of warning though. We stayed on the 4th floor, and the stairs (all 73 of them) up to the room were both steep and narrow. Anyone with difficulties in climbing stairs should not even consider staying here. Other than that, I would happily recomend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service/free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: uhsoncoya
Reviews.Content: i think its a 2 star hotel. the service is amazing. we booked this hotel when we arrived at amsterdam. it was too good to be true, but it was true. service is great, rooms are okay for 2 star hotel and price was good. free breakfast. had welcome drinks. me and my friend got sick in amsterdam and they even gave us free meds! not in the middle of red light district but a 7 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: jcotter27
Reviews.Content: I will keep this brief, but I would applaud the Hotel Nadia for everything from its price to its "welcome drink". Once you navigate the steep stairs (and low ceilings), everything is quite nice for the price - location, breakfast, rooms, service. Only one recommendation (because nothing is absolute) would be a bit more care taken in cleaning the rooms - the bathrooms could have been wiped down a bit more. Something small which by no means overshadowed all of this hotels positives.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: polyana30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, and perfectly located. The staff are very friendly and really helpful. Although the stairs are very steep and narrow, the staff were there straight away to carry our bags both up and down the stairs, so they were not a problem at all. I will be returning to Amsterdam and if the Nadia have vacancies I will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “FAB Find”
Reviews.Author: A13J
Reviews.Content: Friendly, good location, nice breakfast, excellent price - as per other comments small but clean & tidy rooms - nice touch with the welcome flowers in room :o) would go back to this hotel -Amsterdam was a lovely city with something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the stairs or small rooms keep you away!”
Reviews.Author: arcadian7
Reviews.Content: Plenty has been said about the stairs and the size of the rooms and it is all true. I can only suggest to potential guests to look a the pictures on this site and see for themselves, if it is acceptable. BUT, if you want to stay in the heart of Amsterdam, feel like a valued guest, be close to excellent neighborhood restaurants, within walking distance of the Anne Frank Huis, with a tram right outside and stay in an area where you feel like you're coming home after a day of sightseeing, the Nadia is the place for you. My friend and I stayed 5 nights and we each had a single room. I had made the reservations and initially my friend was a little overwhelmed, but after 2 days she also felt very much at home. Each member of the staff will go out of their way to accomodate you, and while the breakfast buffet may have fewer selections than some, it is more than adequate with the best coffee. We found that the sound of the Westerkerk bells every 15 minutes to be very welcome and contributed to the neighborhood feel. The Nadia can't be beat for value or the personal attention from the staff. I definitely hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBluesman
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly and helpful staff. Bags carried for you. Good position. Good breakfast. Powerful shower. Clean towels & sheets each day. Excellent Italian restaurant within 2 mins (who also did take-away pizzas!) Cons: Small rooms. Small (single) beds. Steep stairs. Overall: Quirky and unique. Website entertaining and accurate. Recommended at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSeptember2009
Reviews.Content: Very small, cozy rooms, but a good value in a great location. Wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFoos
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The location and staff was perfect. We will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: warden364
Reviews.Content: As the first stop on our summer vacation, we arrived in Amsterdam at 5:00 am. We weren't scheduled to check-in until early afternoon. We were exhausted from our long flight and previous 24 hours without sleep. We went to the Nadia and they offered us breakfast, stored our luggage and prepared our room by 10:00 AM! The employees were very polite and accommodating. The view from our corner room was beautiful as we were on the canal and a short walk (200 yards?) from the Anne Frank House. The room was spartan and inexpensively furnished, but comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet was in a small but quaint room and the food was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cute Cats”
Reviews.Author: amandaj24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was perfect for our recent stay in Amsterdam. It was very easy to get to the hotel from the train station on the tram...5 minutes at the most. The hotel was very centrally located and is close to the Jordaan neighborhood, which is filled with cute cafes and restaurants. The Anne Frank house is a 2 minute walk, which made getting there right at the opening very easy! I was prepared for steep steps at the hotel, but was really shocked at how steep they truly were! Not a problem if you're healthy and mobile, but would never work for anyone with any physical impairments. The room was very small but cozy. Nice big windows facing out to the canal and neighboring church. Our bathroom was also small and smelled a bit musty, but considering the amount of water in Amsterdam, I'm sure this is common. Breakfast was nothing fancy, but enough to get by with. Definitely check out Sarah's Pancakes below the hotel if you want more. Best part for me were the adorable two cats who have a bed in a side stairwell. They do not roam the hotel but were always happy to have visitors in their little area.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but central location”
Reviews.Author: turistola
Reviews.Content: The first thing that welcomes you, is a very steep staircase to the reseption, more than 45 degrees steep and narrow as well. Warm welcoming at the reception, with a cold drink and practical information. Room are tiny but clean. Bathroom tiny as well, close the door and take your seat at the toilet, there is no legspace, your knees are located in head height. Take a shower and flood the floor. Breakfast is ordinary, butter,jam ,cheese,.youghurt, orange juice, coffe, bread,croissants. Thats all. Tiny breakfastroom, with a stunning view of Westerkerk. WiFi didn't work round the clock, unstable at best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a good price. The place to stay to visit Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: hestia69
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my sister about 11h at the front door, rang the bell, door was opened. A high stairway before us and a friendly voice told us to leave the luggage downstairs. Very friendly reception, all possible information and documentation given, and although checking in time was 13h30, we already got a welcome drink. We chose coffee and were invited into the cosy breakfast room with a beautiful view of the Westerkerk. When we came back in the evening our luggage was already in our room and a beautiful bouquet of fresh flowers was welcoming us. Twin beds, fridge, safe box, coffee set etc., every comfort needed. The room was not huge, but surely big enough, nice bathroom with shower, all extremely clean. Good beds. I slept wonderfully the 2 nights we were there. I was a bit afraid of the street noise, but this was quite plausible and not annoying, knowing that we were in the middle of a busy town. Location is perfect, trams at about 100 m., 2 minutes walk to the Dam, etc Breakfast was nice: good coffee, fresh bread, yoghurt etc. in a well ventilated room, fresh flowers on every table. You feel really welcome and safe. All personnel is very friendly. When leaving, our luggage was down within seconds. I'll surely come back here when visiting Amsterdam again. Thank you so much, Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly,helpfull and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: kala1987
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excelant location as only a short walk from dam square and a good coffee shop! Sara's pankakes are defantly worth a visit which is a few doors down from the hotel. Overall a lovely hotel but could do with a good clean in the bathrooms- mould and dirty grout. Also some soft toilet roll would be nice! I will be staying here again the next time i visit amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a canal view”
Reviews.Author: mjgwdc
Reviews.Content: After the initial shock of the steep staircase to the reception room wore off, we had a great time. The hotel was clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The welcome bouquet was very special, and we loved the view of the canal from our bedroom window. I do, however, wish that the breakfast had more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: DeepRhythms
Reviews.Content: Service is great, the people are very kind, the location is excellent, and the breakfast is also very good. The bathroom is small, but it serves the propose.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming atmosphere and well organized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Newbiewanderer
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, well situated in the heart of Amsterdam within walking distance of all major city attractions, only about 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station and the Anne Frank House. The rooms, while small, had high ceilings and were therefore extremely well distributed. The room we stayed in had three single beds, a small fridge, TV, safe (piled up along the walls), desk and three chairs, but it didn't feel cramped at all. There were plenty of towels in the bathroom, a hair dryer and no fewer than 12 hooks on the back of the doors - something that came in handy when we got stuck in a major storm and needed to hang our wet clothes. Breakfast was included with the room, and consisted of fresh croissants, slices of bread, juices and great coffee. Hotel staff were very friendly (expecially the woman on the day shift), and when we arrived we were given a package of city maps and brochures. The only downside is that, like many other old hotels on this block, there was no elevator but large, narrow staircases- something to keep in mind if you have knee trouble. However, hotel staff brought up our suitcases to the room when we checked in, and then brought them down to another room when we checked out at 10 a.m.- which was very handy as it allowed us to explore the city a bit more before our train left at 1 p.m. What I liked most: central location, smoke free facility, welcoming staff, room with plenty of places to hang clothes, lots of towels, and the ability to leave luggage in a separate room until check in (at 3 p.m.) or well after check out (10 a.m.) What I liked the least: all the stairs, but after two days I actually thought it added to the hotel's charm!

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martin068
Reviews.Content: my husband and i enjoyed four nights at the Nadia Hotel. Our room was clean and comfy with a great view and cosy balcony. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and flowers had thoughtfully been put in our room on arrival as it was our anniversary. The Nadia is in a great location only a short walk from the main centre and all other locations, with plenty of places around to eat and drink. Breakfast was continental and there was plenty of it and it was very tasty, the breakfast room is also very charming. A great find we would definately recommend the Nadia Hotel and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Real Dutch Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KiwiM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and found the Manager and his staff courteous, pleasant and very helpful from the straightforward helping with bags up and down stairs, complimentary drink on arrival and departure to help with requested requirements or advice and the beautiful flowers which were awaiting our arrival wishing my partner a Happy Birthday - such thoughtful touches all add up to a a memorable stay. As others have previously mentioned the stairs on first viewing appeared rather daunting - but fortunately we were based on the first floor. The deluxe room although small was clean and compact -reminded me slightly of a ships cabin, with a lovely view over the canel and westerkirk church (although the 1/4 hourly chime/bells were heard all night on our first night - thereafter didn't seem to disturb us). The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was quite adequate and the setting was lovely. The two cats were quite laid back and also friendly. This hotel was ideal in its location for us.

Reviews.Title: “very good service but street rooms are so noisy !!!!”
Reviews.Author: kl_le
Reviews.Content: very good service, the staff is great BUT got a street room and couldn't close an eye for two days. our room was ok but friends got a room with a very very strange bathroom set up, very small with the shower right next to the toilet and the whole bathroom getting soaked. location IS great though. just don't forget earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Personalized”
Reviews.Author: Rodahp
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Nadia was just perfect, booking was very easy and fast, as soon as I got there I knew that's what I was looking for; great location, very friendly staff; they treated me as part of the family. My room was small (of course .. Dutch size), but really cozy, clean and comfortable, the breakfast room was also very cozy with a beautiful view of the westerkerk. I am very satisfied with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamc13
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this hotel at all, from the moment we arrived the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and went out of their way to help with anything we had to ask of them even going so far as to supply maps, literature on the city and refreshment on arrival. The location is really excellent, less than two minutes walk from Dam Square and Anne Frank's House and also a stone's throw from a taxi rank and the metro lines. As other reviewers have said the rooms are very small so we had anticipated that, some taller travelers may have a little difficulty with the bathrooms in some rooms as they are very small. The rooms are kept immaculately tidy, we had requested a room with a balcony and received a room with a good sized balcony overlooking the canal/road. This may be a little noisy for light sleepers but my partner and I had no issues with it, even when sleeping with the balcony door open on particularly warm nights. I would heartily recommend this hotel but please be aware some of the rooms are very small, this wasn't an issue for me but i can understand how it would bother some travelers. Also for elderly or disabled guests the stairs would be a bit of an ordeal I could imagine. I will certainly return to Nadia Hotel on my next visit to Amserdam.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...just avoid a room on the street”
Reviews.Author: travelerzindc
Reviews.Content: overall, we really enjoyed our experience. great staff, excellent breakfast, clean rooms, fantastic location. unfortunatley, we booked a room on the street. big mistake. the street felt as though it was one of the busiest in all of amsterdam. even on a sunday morning the cars were, trams, and buses, seemed to be rolling past non stop. just be sure to request a room off the street and the value and service can't be beat

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful and very refreshing experience!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyNumberSeven
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular visitor at Nadia Hotel now for years! From the moment I came in the first time (May 2003) I have felt very comfortable with the entire staff and find the hotel very cozy and charming. The staff truly care about the needs of its guests, they are hospitable and open and make you feel very much at home.
