Although I now live in the Netherlands and have even studied in Amsterdam, I always feel I am on an amazing vacation when I stay at Nadia in Amsterdam. The combination of excellent service, charm and comfort is what makes it perfect for me. The breakfast is good, the location is excellent and once again the service is truly remarkable (something I have never experienced before.) I come back to the Hague refreshed and compeletely renewed. I recommend the hotel to all my friends and family, I would never want them to stay anywhere else because Nadia hotel and everything it includes, is an experience I want others to have as well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & great place!”
Reviews.Author: LilBabySun
Reviews.Content: Would definitely go back to this hotel in my future visit to Amsterdam. Quiet and clean hotel, tat's wad I was looking for. Room is slightly small but just nice for 1 person. Very central and convenient to places in Amsterdam. Tram is just 2 minutes away. Very friendly reception & staffs. Nice view from the breakfast area too - Westerkerk view. :)

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel with a great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: tenpro1
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor once again came through with a great hotel at a v ery affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, spotless & convenient (although small, and some access issues)”
Reviews.Author: drmarkf
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and efficient staff, nice breakfast baked goods, and spotless rooms are strong positives. The location's also good, and the price offers excellent value in comparison with similar hotels in the city. Very comfortable beds. The rooms are somewhat quirky and small, and the entrance stairs are challenging for anyone with mobility problems. The street can be noisy if you like to sleep with an open window (although the rooms are quite well sound-insulated from each other). My room fan was efficient but also quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “good permanence”
Reviews.Author: lindusnomad
Reviews.Content: we are stayng in nadia hotel for 9 nights:the hotel have fantastic location e very fine wiew.The room de luxe is small

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TonsbergBlues
Reviews.Content: I was greeted upon my arrival by the hotel manager Osam who I found to be very polite, pleasant and helpful and I recieved a free drink while I cheked in. The staff is very pleasant and be sure to say hi to the nice cats Hello and Goodbye. Breakfast was also very good and free of charge. I did my research before booking Hotel Nadia on TripAdvisor. I was only in Amsterdam for one night and wanted to live near to the city centre, but at the same time in a clean, safe hotel at a reasonable price. Hotel Nadia was the perfect choice for me. Located in the middle of the centre, just a few minutes walk from everything, but at the same time in a nice, safe and quiet area. Hotel Nadia is aprox. 10 min. walk from the Central station and is very easy to find. Walk down Damrak, turn right at Dam square. Walk down the Raadhuis Straat and you'll find Hotel Nadia on the left. I wish to thank Hotel Nadia for a very pleasant stay and I wish to return as soon as possible. My room, 403, was spotless clean and the bed was very comfy. It may be the smallest hotelroom I've ever stayed in, but for 65,80 Euros pr. night (special discount for cash payment) this was just perfect. The bathroom was also spotless clean and had good waterpreasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: rebeldepot
Reviews.Content: This hotel features friendly and helpful staff that are focused on the comfort of their guests. My wife and I took trams everywhere within the city, so it was nice to have a tram stop very close by. The bustling Dam Square area is only minutes away on foot. The hotel, however, is situated in a much quieter neighborhood than the crazier "all hours" neighborhoods that are nearby. We slept with the window open each night, and neighborhood noise was basically unnoticed after midnight. The nice view from our room included looking down at a canal/bridge and across the street at Westerkerk church. The small room was not fancy, but overall clean & functional. The decor was dark wood walls with funky/bizarre/cool? lighting fixures that provided little actual light. The bathroom was almost spotless (a couple of tiny mildew spots on the shower door, but nothing major). There is no air conditioning, so the window open/fan running combo is necessary on warm evenings, as the room would be stuffy otherwise. The included continental breakfast was a nice way to start each day. The breakfast room itself was actually quite nice with good views of the neighborhood. Pros: Great hotel staff, charming views of the neighborhood, quiet sleeping, great mellow location (yet near enough to everything), good value Cons: Not the kind of room to spend a ton of time in (which we didn't plan on doing anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Don't even waste your time!!! It's a hole in the wall!!”
Reviews.Author: Jocelynbrooks37
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room for one night and check out after seeing the room. I did not even bother asking for a refund because they sure needed the money to make that hotel suitable for human beings. I should have known that there was a problem when I they suggested that we take the things that we needed out of our luggage and they would keep our belongings downstairs in lockers. I was just further disappointed when I saw the box that they called a room. The door could not even open fully. I travel a whole lot and I have never seen anything worse than this hotel. The stairs are like a ladder to an attic. Hotels .com heard out fustration and found the Lloyd's Hotel which was a beautiful property. Large rooms, elevator, restaurant, internet close to transportation. If I visit Amsterdam, I will definitely stay at the Lloyd's hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TylersGooma2006
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Everyone working here was terrific. The stairs, typical of this city, are a bit daunting but as soon as you ring the bell at street level, they see you on the camera and someone comes running down to help you with your bags. Even when I was leaving, they insisting on helping me down with my luggage and (large) souvenir bag. The room was very small but with plenty of shelves and nooks and crannies to store everything. The shower was immaculate with plenty of hot water and excellent water pressure. The location was perfect as well. I would definitely stay here again, at least as long as I can climb stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but watch your step”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler47
Reviews.Content: We like small hotels in big cities and responded to great reviews on this site for the Hotel Nadia by booking it for two nights. It is in a good location, on a beautiful canal and in the city center, within walking distance of important sights. The drawbacks are the same that you find in other Amsterdam hotels we used: Very steep steps, up two flights, to reception. A small room and bath, even when paying for a "deluxe room" with a canal view. The hotel does warn us "older travelers" on its Web site and in e-mail confirmation that it may not be suitable because of the stairs. Overall, it was still a good value and we would recommend it to my "fitter" friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: madnad79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is located in the centre of Amsterdam, a 2 minute walk from the Anne Frank house. I would not recommend staying there to elderly people, as the stairs are steep (typical of Amsterdam, I suppose) and there is no lift. Our room was very clean but also very small - however, I know they have different types of rooms and I believe some of the others are more spacious. The bed was very comfortable. We requested a quiet room which meant it didn't face the canal but a yard overlooking adjacent houses, and it was not that quiet because I could hear people ring the door bell for reception when coming back in the night (problem solved with ear plugs which I got for free in reception). The room was furnished with a TV and a small fridge, which was handy, as well as a kettle with free tea and coffee. We also got free Wifi connection in the room. Breakfast was lovely - fresh croissants, rolls and different types of bread, jam/marmelade, chocolate and peanut spreads and cheese (no ham), teas, coffee, orange juice, cake, yoghurt. All the stuff was super friendly and helpful!! I would always stay there again and will definitely recommend this place to friends who want to visit Amsterdam - it was one of the cheapest places we could find in the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Indeed, a very special discovery in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: anne_bain
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is indeed a very special discovery in the heart of Amsterdam. I happened upon this hotel six years ago when I was travelling in Europe. The kindness shown to me at that time by all the staff at Nadia has led me to return every year since, and the friends to whom I have recommended this hotel have never been disappointed. More recently, I have just returned to Scotland following an immensely arduous course at the British Language School in Amsterdam. Throughout this time, 5 weeks, I stayed at the Hotel Nadia. Had it not been for the unfailing generosity, support and kindness of all the staff, I sincerely doubt I would have made it through to completion of my course. What is individual about the Hotel Nadia, and what makes this hotel so exceedingly special, is not the size of the rooms, some of which are indeed small, but it is the fact the people who run and manage this hotel on a day-to-day basis are instinctively kind and their only concern is that their guests are provided with all that they need. This kind of hospitality is not something that can be bought, nor is it something you can place 4 or 5 stars on, it is merely something that separates Hotel Nadia from the rest. It is indeed unique.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: debntom
Reviews.Content: what an amazing hotel, the staff couldnt have been any nicer, everywhere was clean throughout the entire hotel, our double room was lovley, with safe, fridge, and tea/coffee facilities, like home from home, we were extremley impressed and will be using nadia hotel every time we travel to amsterdam in the future. : ))))

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, basic hotel, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay and will most likely be back. The Nadia is in a central location and has helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are very small (as are most in Amsterdam) but well equipped. Its worth opting for a balcony room to get the extra bit space, especially in the summer. The hotel is reached by a steep flight of stairs so won't suit everyone - but they do bring your bags up for you.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the money, but that's not knowing what other Amseterdam Hotels have to offer. The room I was given was very small, dark and dingy. Reasonably clean though. The welcome drink on arrival is a choice of canned soft drinks, something I appreciated after a long trek from the station. Breakfast was limited - croissants, breads, jams, coffee, orange juice and tea. Wireless internet didn't work at all so I had to ask one of the staff for help, and a password to one of their secured networks. As mentioned by some other reviewers, you have to hand your key in each time you leave the hotel. This is fine for me as at least you know other guests wont be bringing pro$titutes back in the middle of the night! I asked for the key to the room safe which required a EUR50 returnable deposit. The location is pretty good and in a nice safe area. I found that I could walk to most places in 20-30mins or less. About 5mins walk is Dam Square, 25-30mins to get to the Van Gough Museum. All in all I would recommend the Hotel Nadia if you are on a budget and need somewhere in the City and reasonably clean. However, next time I go (which probably wont be for many years) I'll look for a 5-star hotel deal instead and probably travel off peak when the streets will be less crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nasu101
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff was very friendly. Rooms were quite small, but clean and had everything we needed. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “who are all the people giving this place good reviews???”
Reviews.Author: seajaycj
Reviews.Content: OK....reality check. We choose the Nadia after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked through hotels.com at a rate of approx $160 USD. The room assigned to us was unbelievably tiny with a small window approx 7 feet from the ground - picture a prison cell. We then asked for the best upgrade they could give us and for 20 Euro a night extra we upgraded to a "deluxe room". Yes, it had a lovely canal view but it was also tiny and very run down looking. There were cigarette burn holes in the bedspread and the sheets had multiple holes in them. There is old carpeting on the floor and a general funky smell to the hotel. There is nowhere to open your suitcase other than on the bed. My advice - pay extra for a better hotel. We learned our lesson the hard way. We are in our 40s and professionals. This is a hotel for young single frugal travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but central location & good value”
Reviews.Author: mc1Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good central location to a lot of different areas (ie dam sqaure, anne frank house) and is an easy 15min walk from central station. The stairs are steep and narrow! Rooms very small but clean and come with ensuite, fridge, safe, in room tea/coffee which is handy. Breakfast is pretty basic (bread, pastries, juice, tea/coffee) and in a small room so may need to take food back to your room. In room wifi was a bit hit and miss in terms of connection. Staff friendly and helpful. I was in a top floor room and had no trouble with noise. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cozy, a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Juusto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nadia with my teenage son for four nights at the end of July. Booked this hotel based on its fabulous location, the good rates and the reviews on Tripadvisor. Especially I was taken by the comments on the friendly staff, and they all proved to be true. They all really make visitors feel welcome and are truly helpful. There was the welcoming drink and someone to carry the luggage to the room, facts that have already been mentioned in other reviews. We also got checked in early, and the day we left, we simply left our luggage to our room when checking out, and when we came back to the hotel in the afternoon, we were offered drinks again and we were able to sit and relax in the breakfast room while waiting for the shuttle bus. When it arrived, the staff came to get us and meanwhile the luggage had been carried to the bus. I've never had such a good service in any other hotel. The location is very good, it's a nice neighbourhood with all the canals and historical canal houses, good little restaurants and cafes, shops, museums and other attractions, all within walking distance, and we certainly felt it very safe at any times. If you get a room with a canal view, you can just relax in your room between touring the city, and watch people and boats go by. I've often felt that it's boreing to just stay in the hotel room, but sometimes it's necessary to get a rest, and in this hotel it was fun due to the views and the people watching. Yes, the room was very small, but it was also functional. There was everything we could possibly need and we didn't feel crammed. Five days passed far too quickly. Amsterdam is a friendly and beautiful city, and we are missing it and the hotel already. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gold class service at it's best!!”
Reviews.Author: rechelle87
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Nadia hotel in July in the family room on corner it was quite spacious and very clean with a lovely little window looking out on to the street. From the welcome drinks on arrival, assistance with bags, first aid kit that helped out my friend who had a sore throat - Nadia hotel were always there to lend a helping hand. This may be a 3 star hotel but definitely has 5 star service! Would definitely stay here again - location is fairly central as well everywhere within about 10 minute walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: andi_hub
Reviews.Content: I read about the hotel in a guide book and tried my luck, good location, very friendly service (even with welcome drink), all very helpful, nice breakfast (included in price) near herengracht, so easy access to most areas

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but better than adequate”
Reviews.Author: NeilOakland_CA
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in Amsterdam with family (10 and 14 y/o kids) pre-cruise to norway and a) needed a quad room (uncommon in amsterdam / europe) and didn't want to spend a fortune. chose nadia based on TA reviews, which were overall very accurate. great location, off the crowded (and grimy, touristy) center by a couple of blocks but we walked EVERYWHERE from here room was basic / spartan but a true quad with four beds and a wonderful view from this room over canal and westmark cathedral. bathroom small and toilet essentially IN the shower but good water pressure and fine service excellent; all staff very helpful stairs are no joke! i suppose typical for dutch canal houses but quite steep! fine for us though included breakfast basic but adequate and helpful staff willing to toast bread and cheese for my kids. great coffee! they target families and seem to be succeeding in doing so (there were a few there while we were) but there's still a defnite smell of pot smoke in the hallways, so they're clearly still getting some amsterdam partiers, but it wasn't intrusive and never felt usafe. overall, certainly not a 'high end' american style luxe hotel, but if you want a nice quad room in a good location with great service at a fair price, this is just the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Lovebugtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel Nadia is in an excellent location very close to all the history and sites of Amsterdam. The room was clean and plain with an incredible view of the canal and Westkirk. The staff was so nice, even helping with our laundry for a small extra fee--and after two weeks traveling Europe I was so grateful. Don't miss the charming breakfast room and great breakfast. One note: Very steep stairs up to the lobby and rooms are not for everyone, but they did bring our luggage up and down the stairs for us, which was very nice. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: uPtownCH
Reviews.Content: After reading several excellent reviews on the website, I decided to book a room for myself at Hotel Nadia for a short stay in Amsterdam (3 days) for myself. The Amsterdam Hotels are generally pricey and not good value for money. However, Hotel Nadia is different. It is a marvellous little 2-star hotel in the centre of the city with 5-star service. Upon arrival, my bags were carried to my room, I received a welcome drink and there were fresh flowers in my room. The room itself was not big, but tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable (double bed for a single person). All this for â‚¬61,10 per night including the breakfast - that's excellent value for Amsterdam! The choice for breakfast was limited, but it was quite nice. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and I felt very welcome at all times. I definitely recommend Hotel Nadia for a great stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve_88Cincinnati
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is close to the Anne Frank house, a supermarket, and tram stop. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the breakfast was toast, jam, coffee. Being of the European style the hotel had a typical steep and narrow staircase, small rooms and small bathrooms. That being said; the rooms were very clean, the staff great and we would stay there again! This place is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: clarems
Reviews.Content: After alot of research of hotels in Amsterdam we plumped for this one as the price included all local taxes, breakfast and if you paid cash on arrival got a further 6% discount - I found it very hard to find anything this cheap (unless you start looking at hostels and sharing bathrooms etc) in central Amsterdam so we took a gamble.... Well, we were very pleasantly surprised. We walked with a couple of overnight bags from Central Station and found it very easily. As someone else mentioned - I was prepared for the stairs but was still shocked.. but its SOOOO Amsterdam and to be fair they look daunting but while they are steep they aren't too bad. Check in was delightful.. the woman behind reception offered to get someone to take our bags from the bottom of the stairs to our room and offered us a can of ice cold diet coke, 7up etc comlimentary - while they took our bags to our room. Our room was no. 4 and was half way down the stairs so not too bad to climb at all. We got to the room there was a lovely bouquet of flowers on the table with a note saying 'welcome, we hope you enjoy your stay' and found ourselves looking straight through 3 huge windows! out to a lovely canal and the beautiful Westerkerk Church. Yes the bells rang a bit but these are the same bells that Anne Frank heard (the Frank house is just a small block away) during their time in hiding and this is Amsterdam so we weren't expecting no noise. The hotel is in a nice neighbourhood and the stroll to Dam Square is only about 10 minutes but that is also far enough away from the crazyness (but hilarious-ness) of the red light district to be quite alot less busy and we weren't disturbed in the night. We had a fan in the room, which was nice. My only complaint would be that we were given 2 single beds (which in itself isn't a problem) but the single beds were tiny!! I would say a few inches smaller than a normal single bed and I did feel like I was going to fall out a few times. Oh and another thing was the toilet roll.... really not what you would expect from a hotel... bit like school toilet paper... The breakfast was pretty good, breads, rolls, cheese, croissants, yogurts, coffee, tea, biscuits, jams, peanut butter, honey, apples etc... We certainly filled up enough and enjoyed it.. the breakfast room is very small but everyone seemed to get a seat and it does run from 7.30-10.30am so time for everyone. So, all in all I would definately recommend this to friends, family etc Quite small rooms but enough for your needs - who stays in their room while in Amsterdam? very friendly staff, clean, tidy, price and location all massive plus points. ....and they encourage Trip Advisor reviews (in a Thank you for staying email) which in my mind is very encouraging that they take customer service very seriously and do their best to keep everyone happy. oh and they also have free wifi... bit slow but it worked and enough to let us check in online etc and check emails.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK, but with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Taski63
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is very friendly and helpful. Location is very good, and the neighborhood is nice enough. Free WiFi was a nice bonus, but it didn't work very reliably. We didn't mind the smallish size of the room, but it's apperance was a bit shabby. The shower was a joke. Without the A/C, the room was a sauna; steep stairs made you sweaty already, and hot room didn't help it (day temp in Amsterdam being 22...26 centigrade on our visit). The table fan made sleeping just tolerable, but not enjoyable. Breakfast was extremely basic, it was the poorest that I've had in any hotel. Pretty good coffee, although.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly and good position.”
Reviews.Author: Wen95
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before going,I can only agree with the majority of people..It was clean, the staff so helpful and friendly, the rooms very small but with a fridge, safe and fan. I knew about the steep steps to the reception but was still quite shocked when we opened the door. Overall no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service - small rooms and steep stairs!”
Reviews.Author: MBDK
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a charming hotel that offers great value at an excellent location in the heart of Amsterdam. The neighborhood has a large number of great restaurants and cafes and everything is within walking distance. The hotel rooms are quite small, and the stairs to the hotel are really steep.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price - Good service - well located”
Reviews.Author: SwedenThomas
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel is a bit more than OK due to the good service at the reception desk and the luggage handling (the steep stairs are not easy with heavy bags...). Trafic will be heard in the rooms towards the street, other rooms may hear the sound of church bells every 15 minute (including extra "tingeling" each hour for about 5 min). Small but comfortable rooms, well equiped with fridge, safe and TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peanut66Kent
Reviews.Content: You may see reviews, commenting on the size of the rooms or the stairs. If you stay in any old property in Dam, the stairs are all the same, narrow and steep, think of the exercise. After the initial shock, you get used to it, think of it as some exercise ! OK the rooms are not massive but hey you only really want somewhere to sleep as there is so much to do in Dam. We love this hotel, the rooms are clean, the staff are really friendly and remember you from previous visits, how often do you get that ? Two years ago, flowers were left in our room as it was my partners birthday ! This year we had flowers and a 'welcome home' note, which was so nice. The staff give you all the information on Dam you need if you have never been before. The hotel location is brilliant only a few mins walk to Dam Square. Anne Frank's house is just round the corner and there is a yummy pancake house on the street outside, which is highly recommended too. The hotel is quiet at night and it is so worth having a room with a balcony to sit on in the evenings before you go out. You can reach the hotel by foot from Central Station, it only takes about 8 mins. On another note, we have stayed in various rooms and all the beds have been really comfy. So please don't complain about the rooms or the stairs, this is typical for Amsterdam ! I will definately be going back to this hotel again. Good value for money (would be better if the Â£ to â‚¬ was a bit better, but that's not the hotel's fault :-) ) And on another completely random note, my boyfriend proposed to me this trip, so for me this hotel will always be special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer care”
Reviews.Author: ethete
Reviews.Content: Flowers in the room, view of a canal, drinks upon arrival, breakfast with a view, and don't let the stairs scare you. While the room was small, it didn't matter because we didn't spend much time in the room. Amsterdam is a beautiful city with many things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel room”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFlowergirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is the perfect place to stay as long as you are not planning on spending a lot of time in your room. I have stayed in small European hotels (I like the charm and authenticity they offer opposed to cookie-cutter chain hotel rooms or ultra modern hotels that could be in any city in the world) but this one was definitely the smallest. there was enough room to fit in, but even 2 people in a double room was very tight. Luckily, we mainly use the hotel room for short rests during the day and to sleep at night and not much more. The room was clean and the bathroom seemed to have been renovated recently. There was no air-conditioning (I knew this before booking) and you might not think it would be a big deal when the temperatures were not that high, but there was also very little air flow (could not put the fan in the window) so it was uncomfortable to sleep a few of the nights we were in Amsterdam. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel, so maybe the front rooms with a canal view would have have more air-flow; also, it is quiet in the neighborhood at night, so I wouldn't worry about asking for a quiet room - go for a canal view of street view room. The staff was very friendly and helpful in every way. The breakfast was very good and plenty. There are a handful of shops/restaurants and internet place nearby, although no internet access/use of a computer is available in the hotel. Overall we had a lovely stay and the room was fair according to the price, but I would probably not re-book here due to the heat factor. I play hard on vacation, so I need my rest at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: terrafloodwake
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, very affordable pricing and fantastic location (close enough to be in the action, yet far enough away to rest easily without the chaos). The Nadia was our home away from home for 3 nights. I felt perfectly at ease and completely safe. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to attend to our every need...which were many (cork screws, cough drops, directions, weather info etc...). The breakfast was delightfully European: Cheese, croissants, rolls, butters jams, EXCELLENT COFFEE. My only critique is the very small "teaser" size coffee cups:) If you want an American-size cup of Java in the morning, you may want to bring your own mug. The bed was soft and comfy, adequately large to suit two full-sized adults plus a toddler. Our room was the best! A tiny jewel box on the top floor, complete with balcony and turret! The custom light fixtures cast a lovely warmth to the room and the windows were VERY large. What it lacked in square footage, it more than made up for in ambiance and character. We spent many hours enjoying the views and we never had to wonder what time it was as the glorious church next door had a clock on the tower that told the hour! I will return to the Nadia next time I come to visit Amsterdam and you should also. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Amsterdam, Hotel Nadia is a Keeper!”
Reviews.Author: DAC_13
Reviews.Content: I had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at Hotel Nadia. Osam, the manager, was always warm, composed and hospitable, and had his staff on the same page! My room was more than adequate, with lots of storage space, was creatively designed, and had plenty of hot water for showering. Breakfast (which was included) was bountiful and delicious. I can easily go back just for their nicely brewed coffee! Situated beside Keizersgracht, diagonally across from the beautiful Westerkerk (Western Church), Anne Frank house, a fresh herring stall and a canal bus stop, Hotel Nadia offers a great deal of convenience. Its regal architecture reflects heritage and charm. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a beautiful view of West Church”
Reviews.Author: Tak123
Reviews.Content: Not recommended to travellers with big baggage due to very steep stairs. Very friendly satff and great view of West Church from the breakfast room. Conveniently located to explorer the city. The bed was right next to the window, which did not shut (kept open the whole time) with a glass separator. It was simple and nothing luxuarious, but great deal for the location and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Poor room.”
Reviews.Author: AandAKent_UK
Reviews.Content: Whilst the service and friendliness of the staff was above average, the room was a huge disappointment. The poky single wood panelled room had worn carpets, paintwork and bedding. The decor was very dated. There was no view from the window. I was relieved to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, super safe for solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: Ashes21
Reviews.Content: The room was small but way more than adequate for one person. The balcony was great, wish it had more of a canal view but was still great to have. The fact that they keep your key (24 desk service though) and don't allow visitors was a great thing for me as a single female traveler. The hotel is small enough that they know guests by face but not so small that you feel like anyone is monitoring you or anything. Breakfast was good, really no complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Near center, near 24h bell and chimes, very small rooms, fair price.”
Reviews.Author: ziegelofen
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, a few minutes behind the dam, opposite Westkerk. The churchbells are quite annoying. Service is very good, but the bedding was not all clean. The room was a bit to small. No place for one bag. Very basic but good breakfast. Couldn't find a better price for a *** in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb, yet again...”
Reviews.Author: danzica
Reviews.Content: This was the third time staying at the Nadia and still it's just as good as the first time. There is not anything that is too much trouble for any of the staff, they make you feel really welcome and will help with whatever you need. Rooms are small but really well equipped and very comfortable. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a nice clean and budget accommodation that is only a five minute walk from Dam Square and walking distance to everywhere really!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: brad2400
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel great, had a corner room, terrific view, breakfast was very fine. We will stay here again. Easy walking to most things downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: AnAggieTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a small, quaint, hotel directly in the City Center of Amsterdam. The staff is fabulous and extremely service-oriented. They make you feel like they are actually very pleased to have you and go out of their way to make you feel welcome....unlike a lot of hotels that just throw you the room key (card) and send you on your way. When I say "authentic Amsterdam experience" I mean, steeeeeeeeep staircase leading up to the hotel, no A/C in the rooms (but the weather is so spectacular, who needs one?!), and tiny, tiny, tiny. It really made us feel like we were experiencing Amsterdam...not just visiting. The hotel is very clean, comfortable, and I highly recommend it. If you're used to "stuffy & ritzy" $300+/night hotels and don't like to experience new things, then don't stay here. This hotel is for travelers who want a clean room, excellent service, and to really be a part of the place they are visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Gates of Jordaan”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaCaseira
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, and that balcony on Breakfast Room is so cute... You all, are to nice...I'l, hope to came back.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sayana
Reviews.Content: Nadia is a very nice budget hotel, with friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: drstexas
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights in Hotel Nadia with 3 rooms total for family group. Yes, Hotel Nadia has those stairs, but it is a true Canal house. The Hotel handles your bags, no need for you to drag them up. When you tour Amsterdam, you see the hundreds of canal houses, you can stay in one and see how the locals live. We had the quad room 3rd floor and it had the most lovely view of the canal and the Westerkirk. Another family member had a balcony room for 2 second floor and although a very small room, the balcony was terrific. I read a book about the Anne Frank house (the house is just around the corner) while lying in bed quad room with the Westerkirk church tower right out my window in full view. I came upon a photo in the book of the tower out the attic room window where Anne lived that was the exact view of the church tower but from a 90 degree turned angle. That is, I was looking at the west side and she the north side but identical view. Made goose bumps on my arms. Sheets clean and crisp, clean bathroom, no A/C but was cool with windows open and fan on. Nice breakfast, breads, juice, tea, coffee, cake, many jams, nuttell chocolate spread. Fresh flowers in the room. The walk to the city center Dam and then down to the train station area to do a canal boat tour took us down busy streets crowded with young people, and to our older eyes, strange people, but the strolls down the canals themselves were much calmer and more quite. I liked the city much better away from the Dam. Long walk to the flower market and on to the art museum was wonderful along the canals. Stopped for cafe meals. Sara's Pancake House two doors down from Hotel Nadia has wonderful crepes (pancakes - but not the american type) and great hot chocolate for a pm meal, open til 9:30pm. We felt Hotel Nadia was a good value for its location, cleanliness and exceptional view. Get away from the city center and walk along the many canals for a pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Clodovigo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia's entry stairway is an imposing two-flight affair. Please take seriously the stated warnings about the unsuitability of this hotel for the mobility-impaired! However, this is an excellent choice for those who want a high degree of service in an affordable hotel and an excellent location in the Jordaan. Our room was tiny (think cabin size on a cruise vessel) but comfortable and well-appointed. The building is historic and has several interesting features, and the free internet works well. On our last morning, we received a phone call telling us the breakfast room had been opened early so we could have something to eat before leaving for the airport. Yes, the beds could have been more comfortable and the fire escapes more reassuring, but overall, this would a very good choice for a traveler on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jenrob89
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Nadia Hotel, and every employee I met was helpful and friendly. The rooms are small but comfortable, and I rarely heard a peep from other guests. Refrigerators in the rooms make it easy to pop by the grocery store just down the street and stock up on healthy snacks, and they'll even let you bring your dinner to the breakfast room to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaJael
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent seven nights at the Hotel Nadia and were quite pleased with our stay. In an earnest attempt to provide a balanced review to my fellow travelers I will do my best to provide my view of the pros and cons (from an American perspective). When you open the door to the Nadia Hotel prepare yourself to be greeted by perhaps the most astonishing set of stairs you have ever seen or will see. Really, there is not much difference in incline between these stairs and a ladder. The staff is prepared to assist you with your baggage up this monster and is quite expert at doing so. If you have a disability you will most likely want to stay somewhere else. There is really no way around this each time you come in the building (no elevator). The stairs take you up to a tiny lobby where you will be greeted by a gracious member of the staff. He or she will give you your room key, a complimentary beverage, and answer any questions whatsoever about the city that you might have. Every single person manning this desk during our stay was exceptionally kind and went out of his or her way to help us with our trip planning, be it calling the train station for us when we thought we had goofed up our tickets to Belgium, recommending a restaurant, which tram to take to a museum, etc. As a side note you pick up your room key when you enter the building and drop it off again with the front desk when you leave, presumably to minimize lost keys. Making your way from the lobby to your room is also interesting due to the narrow dimensions of the hallways. Only one person/piece of luggage at a time might proceed. When you open the door to your room you will see the tiny theme continues with your Lilliputian accommodations. This is definitely the smallest room I have ever stayed in before. The bathroom is similar in size and setup to the bathroom you find in an RV. The sink is raised about two inches higher than the toilet and shower, which is good because the shower is on a flat plane, even with the toilet. The water seeps out from under the curtain and floods the general area around the toilet while showering. This is partially due to the fact that the shower drain was somewhat clogged but I can't complain because I never mentioned it to the management and on second thought I wish I had so they would have a fair chance to fix the problem. The bed was comfortable and the down comforter quite thick and warm, but there were two holes in the cover. The major minus to the room is the lack of control you have over the temperature- we never saw any way to make the room cooler (or warmer in winter....). Fortunately a fan is provided and we left the balcony door open at night with the fan in front to blow in cool air. You will have to request house keeping if you want them to come every day, otherwise we noticed a frequency of about an average of every other day. None of this is particularly troubling to us as we came to Amsterdam mainly to see the sights and not be in our room. The one incredible plus to our room was the marvelous balcony. A few evenings we were back relatively early and able to take advantage of this wonderful feature. It was made especially wonderful by the fact that there is still light until 11:00 or 11:30 at night in Amsterdam in June. From our balcony we could see a beautiful church tower and one of the canals. Directly across from us was Jennifer's Croissanterie, a lovely place to pop in for a pastry, sandwich, cappuccino, etc. I often did just so to augment my breakfast from the hotel. The breakfast room was charming and offered a wide range of breakfast items, but unfortunately no good sources of protein other than cheese and sweetened yogurts. I would have loved some hard boiled eggs to supplement the bread and croissants. Our location in general was excellent. The Anne Frank house was just out of sight across the street, the post office was two blocks in one direction and an inexpensive Internet cafe one block in another. The Red Light district and Dam Square were about a 10 minute walk away, Central Station just a bit further up the road. A couple trams and buses a short walk from the hotel would take you to Central Station as well, further simplifying your movements around the city. I would stay here again, indeed I dream of returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place with very hospitable and thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: alithia
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome from the staff there immediately upon arrival at Hotel Nadia. Not only did they carry up our heavy suitcases up a steep flight of stairs to the reception area they also brought it up to our room (another floor up) while we waited at the breakfast room (to be checked in) which was beautifully decorated with nice fresh pretty flowers. They gave us a nice welcome drink too! Talk about great service! Though we stayed for one night only at Hotel Nadia and booked the cheapest room available, they made that one night special for us by giving us a free upgrade to a room with a lovely canal view. I thought that was very very thoughtful of them! The room was also nicely decorated with antique lamps and red furnishings. It had a fridge which was very helpful for us to keep our beer cool! Fresh flowers with a welcome note was a nice sweet touch.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oushi
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Hotel Nadia for three nights and loved our stay. From the moment we stepped into the hotel, we could tell that this place was something special. You need to ring the bell to get into the building, but the bellhop was at the door quickly to help us bring our luggage up the steps to the reception. Yes, the steps are steep (and pictures don't do them justice), but we found this to be the norm in all of Amsterdam. The staff was the most hospitable of all the hotels during our trip, offering a welcome drink and flowers in the room. They were always quick to offer us tips and advice on the town's attractions. The resident cats, Hello and Goodbye, are also a treat. They have their own little nook, and greeting them each morning after breakfast was a great way to start off the day. Don't expect big, modern facilities if you stay here. This is a small, cozy hotel with a lot of charm. The bathroom can be a bit small for larger people, but the average person should find it enough. Do note that besides a curtain the shower is not separate from the rest of the bathroom. Everything in there will get wet. This can be strange to Americans that are used to having spacious, modern facilities but it really isn't as bad as people make it seem and isn't uncommon for Amsterdam's hotels. Just bring some rubber flip flops and remember that you're traveling through Europe to broaden your horizons, not to restrict them. The location is great as well. The hotel is a block away from the Anne Frank house (highly recommended), a 3 minute walk from a large Albert Heijn supermarket (those sit-down restaurant bills add up!), and 5 minutes away from bustling Dam Square. In conclusion, if you're looking for a big, modern hotel like you're used to in America, this place is not for you. If you're looking for a clean, cozy place to stay with an unsurpassed staff, you need not look any further. We highly recommend Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travefarther
Reviews.Content: We (a family with a young child) recently stayed at the Nadia Hotel in Amsterdam. It was a great stay! The hotel is very centrally located; many sightseeing attractions are within walking distance. Our room was tiny, but very clean, sheets were fresh and everything else in good order. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful with any questions. The breakfast room is quite charming and cozy, and offers a decent selection of breakfast items. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service and value”
Reviews.Author: nancelita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia Hotel with my husband for 3 nights in early June. From the Central train station, we took the #5 tram to the Dam stop (you may also take the #1 or #2). From the Dam stop, the hotel is about a 5 minute walk. The hotel is located on the fringe of the Jordaan neighborhood. It is also only a 2-minute walk from the Anne Frank museum. I liked the location because it was quiet at night and at the same time, it was not too far from the train station and major sights. It is a bit of a hike to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum but the tram makes getting around extremely easy and convenient. Before boarding the tram, buy a strippenkart. It costs about 8 euros and comes with 15. The strip may be shared. A single trip within the city center costs 2 tickets. You can use the same tickets if you transfer to another tram or bus within 60 minutes of validating them. The hotel is fantastic for budget travelers. Breakfast is included and it is typical of breakfasts on the continent â€“ coffee, tea, juice, bread, cheese, croissants, ham, etc. Our double room included a safe, mini-fridge (no mini-bar), as well as coffee & tea making facilities. But, be warned â€“ the rooms and bathrooms are very small. In addition, the stairs are quite steep so if you have problems with stairs, this is not the place for you. That said, the service is outstanding. When we arrived, we were a little surprised at the steepness (and number) of stairs. But, they took our bags up for us and during check-in, we were given complimentary sodas. The hotel offers complimentary WIFI. Initially, we had a difficult time connecting. We informed the front desk and they spent 15 minutes helping us until we were able to get online. They even called us later to confirm that the internet was still working for us. One morning, I called the front desk at around 8am to ask about laundry service. Within 5 minutes, someone had come up to the room to retrieve my laundry. We went down to breakfast and at around 9:30am, the laundry was returned â€“ washed and dried! It was amazing. Finally, I wanted to buy the Anne Frank museum tickets online but I was unable to print the tickets. I went down to ask about a nearby internet cafÃ© and the staff offered to print the tickets for me. Needless to say, I am very pleased with the service received at this hotel and I will definitely stay here the next time I am visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: gedgill
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a relaxing stay of three nights in this well located hotel. Just a few minutes from Dam Square but away from the main hustle and bustle of the city centre. Perfect for the Anne Frank House which is just around the corner alongside a canal bus stop. Fear of the daunting steep stairs are soon banished as the staff are very quick to come and carry baggage to reception then on to your room. Welcome at reception was very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, with fresh flowers, and it would appear that all rooms have and individual look. Breakfast was relaxed with plenty coffee, tea etc. The only negative thing we found was that the matress was not the most comfortable we have slept on. Almost full marks!

Reviews.Title: “budget accomdation”
Reviews.Author: ccon78
Reviews.Content: great place on budget, rooms compact but contain everything u need, staff very friendly and helpful. great location. only downfall no lift

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - great value and a home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: mbergt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia twice during our European vacation. Both times we were impressed with the staff and accommodations. Our initial visit was only for a couple of days, but upon check in, our bags were carried up the steep (but not as bad as you think) stairs to our room. We were also presented with a free drink and maps of the city at check in. Our room was small but cosy, with a clean bathroom, starched sheets and a complimentary flower arrangement. We even had a balcony with a view of the street and Westerkerk. The location of the hotel could not have been better, with Dam square a few blocks away, and even the train station within walking distance. Overall, I'd say that Hotel Nadia is hands down one of the best places to stay in Amsterdam, based on price, amenities, cleanliness and location in Amsterdam. We loved the fact that there is both FREE WIFI and BREAKFAST at this hotel- seemingly a rarity in Europe. The staff go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable while enjoying the beautiful city of Amsterdam. We will surely be returning there again, and I advise others to do the same. Thanks Hotel Nadia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a family weekend break, on a budget. We found the hotel on Trip Advisor so we knew to expect steep stairs and small rooms! As other reviews have said, the rooms though small had everything you needed, including very powerful fans to give a nice breeze on a warm night. The staff lived up to their reputation from other reviews, they were friendly and helpful. We had one or two problems with one of our rooms - shower would not drain properly, and boiling the kettle shorted the fuse but both problems were fixed immediately and efficiently - no waiting around for staff to come and see to it. Good tip - you get the best deal if you pay up front in cash - also helps you budget for your stay we found. The hotel is in a great location - not only just round the corner from the Anne Frank House, but also close to the pedalo rental place. If you haven't tried it, do, if you have nice weather. You get a really good view of the canals, can go down little canals that the big tours can't get through, and can take your time. Probably better on a weekday rather than a weekend, as traffic on the canal gets busy on the weekend and you can spend a lot of time avoiding the big boats. If you don't want to walk to the museums (though they are only about 20 minutes if you take the direct route along the canal) you can get a tram. We also enjoyed the proximity to Jordaan, with all the little restaurants and bars, and pleasant atmosphere in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “cozy & convenient, stairs & bicycles”
Reviews.Author: MyWave68
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Nadia for 2 nights in March. Our main criteria for choosing the hotel, based on the reviews we read, were the relatively inexpensive price, and the access to the tram from the train station and airport. It is right off the #15, (and possibly #13) tram line, very easily accessed if you are hauling luggage around. It is also only about 4 blocks from the red light district, and even closer to the Anne Frank house, so very conveniently located. The Van Gogh museum is a bit further away. The hotel itself is very unique, and quaint, a bit quirky even. When entering through the front door, first you have to ring the bell and they will buzz you in. Then you scale approximately 40 narrow stairs straight up, which we had no problem with, it was kinda fun, or funny, but I could see an issue for elderly or handicapped guests. They may have accommodations to help if needed, but before staying, you might want to check that out. Amsterdam, in general, doesn't seem very handicap accessible, so be prepared. The staff was very friendly to us, although we didn't really have any special requests, and they did have flowers for us in the room upon arrival. They gave us a quadruple room even though we didn't ask for it, which had a double bed, and two singles. The room was quite cozy in size, I am wondering what we would have gotten if we only had a double room. The room was not modern by any means, but hey, its in a building probably a couple hundred years old. The bed linens were crisp and clean, very luxurious for this class of hotel, so that was nice. There was some noticeable noise from the locals on the street at night, but we were jetlagged enough that it didn't keep us from sleeping. Breakfast was included in the cost of the room, but wasn't much more than bread products, jelly, and coffee, maybe some juice I cant really remember. In all, I would say Hotel Nadia exceeded my expectations at about $70 US per night, just don't set your expectations for a 4 or 5 star hotel. My reviews tend to carry on so I wont give my review of Amsterdam itself, just watch out for the Dutch, they are friendly enough but always in quite a hurry, and the bicycles are crazy! We did have a great trip, and would love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest and most accommodating staff we could wish for”
Reviews.Author: ContentedCustomer
Reviews.Content: We were received by the most friendly staff we could have wished for. All the staff went above and beyond the call of duty for our family and small children. There was a really comfortable and homely feel about the place and we were all greeted by bouquets of fresh florist flowers in our rooms. The stairs are steep but you can leave all luggage at the bottom of the stairs and they are brought up for you. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel They Even Make Toast Taste Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Martinali
Reviews.Content: me(tom) and my gf lorah from (UK) ESSEX SOUTHEND have now stayed at this hotel twice... it was so nice the first time we were more then happy to go back ... this time we was even more impressed our room was lovely room number 412 excellet views from the balcony and nice n cosey :) the members of staff were wonderful got a weclome call from the manager n enjoyed every moment in the hotel there breakfast althou simple its perfect toast and croissant and tea's n coffee it really sets u up for a early start... we was able to come and go as we pleased and the hotel is in a really good location just a fews mins from Dam sqaure Super market and Grey Area one of my favourate coffee shops i would recommend this hotel to my friends and family ... i hope you peoles also enjoy your stay i plan on stay there again in august :D Amsterdam is the place to be :) thanks for having us nadia

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: FW42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a three night stay and we couldn't have endured another night. The room was tiny and the stairs very steep. The staff were friendly as previously indicated and the breakfast adequate, atlhough one day we could fit into breakfast room and had to go somewhere else. . For a 2 star hotel I guess its ok for a one or two night stay but I would recommend paying more and going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jabenny123
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Nadia and will stay again in the future. The location is great (close to Dam Square and tram stops). The staff is wonderful and willing to help in any way needed. The rooms are small/tight but is expected in the old buildings. Most amenities are available in the room or on request. The hotel staff is very eager to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff -steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: grcunningham
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have accurately noted, the Nadia is for folks who don't mind a steep climb to their room. Our room was on the 4th floor (415) and required climbing about 70 or so steps from the entrance. This climb was not a problem for us but, I would strongly recommend those who are out of shape or infirm to think twice about booking. Our room was as expected-very much like a very small sea-going accommodation. Since we travel with one piece of luggage and a shoulder bag each, the shelving and storage easily accommodated our stuff. We quickly got used to the combo shower/wc. Our room was spotless and remained so during our stay. The breakfast room was cozy but with terrific service . Table were kept spotless. If you are a traveler who likes space and an elevator to your floor the Nadia will be lacking. However, if you can handle the stairs and tiny accommodation, the wonderful staff will make the Nadia a worthwhile booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LisaLibrarian
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Clean, well-designed for small rooms giving lots of space to unpack. Tasty breakfast with good coffee. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Monarch414
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was a great experience. It is located in the central area of Amsterdam, right near Dam Square and the Anne Frank house. I walked from the central train station in about 10-15 minutes. The friendly service was like no other hotel I've stayed. I was offered a free beverage at check-in, which is nice when you've just been traveling. The front desk gave me helpful maps and tips to get the most out of my stay. Upon walking in the room, there were fresh flowers waiting for me, a very nice touch! The hotel remains locked at all times, which made me feel very secure. Everything was very clean and in good condition. The breakfast in the morning consisted of coffee, OJ, various breads and pastries, yogurts and crackers. Overall, this hotel is an exceptional value. The rooms are very small if that sort of thing bothers you, but in Amsterdam, I can't imagine you'd be spending much time in the room with so much to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Blgfrirenglith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very happy with our stay at the Nadia Hotel. The entrance stairs are a bit steep, that's for sure. However, the location was super, the breakfast room beautiful, and our balcony very nice. The most important postiive of this hotel for us was the extremely helpful and courteous staff. Being that it was my first time ever in Europe, we hard a bit of a learning curb; the hotel staff helped us on several ocassions when we needed assistance, and recommended a restaurant that I couldn't have been happier with. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, location and staff is sooo nice!”
Reviews.Author: EMAA12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about a five minute walk to the heart of Amsterdam. It's location allows you to walk to all attractions but sleep with not so much noise. The hotel is small but cozy. The rates are reasonable. The stairs are small and steep with no elevator but other than that, the hotel is clean and the staff is the friendliest staff I've ever had the pleasure of. The breakfast room is beautiful and allows many beautiful pictures to be taken on the balcony. The rooms are quite smaller than usual, but thats why you are paying less money than a five star hotel. The beds are comfortable and rooms are pretty clean. The best part of the hotel was the staff- they make you want to come back because they are such nice people who will assist you with anything you need!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: CityLovers
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay for six nights at the Nadia instead of the conference hotel and I'm so glad we did. The conference hotel (which cost quite a bit more) had none of the following (which were provided at the Nadia): coffee and tea service in room, free continental breakfast, refrigerator in room, free wireless, a beautiful big boquet of fresh flowers. Hair dryers, irons and electrical adapters are available if you need them. The location is splendid, right in the heart of things. The view of the Kieser canal from our room was charming. But what impressed us the most was the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff. Tip: bring your own shampoo and face soap if you are fussy about these things.

Reviews.Title: “Another 5 Star stay”
Reviews.Author: Riverside1971
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from my 3rd visit to Nadia Hotel and yet again I had a perfect stay. I had the same room as last time, which had a lovely balcony. Even though Amsterdam is a beautiful city with loads to see the highlight of my holiday was relaxing on the balcony with "The Diary of Anne Frank" an incredibly moving book. And the Westerkerk which features in the book and the Anne Frank house itself is just around the corner. If you do decide to pay a visit to Anne Frank House I would definately advise you go there as soon as it opens around 9:30am otherwise you will have to queue for ages. Back to the hotel. I couldn't recommend it enough. The room was spotless, lovely powereful shower. The fridge and kettle are always most welcome. The hotel staff as usual were extremely friendly and helpful. Overall another perfect stay and I will definately be visiting again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Great Location, Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: BabyJustn
Reviews.Content: The Nadia was fantastic- we showed up much earlier than check in (11am) expecting them to just hold our bags for us (which in its self would be much appreciated) but they went beyond that and asked us to sit in the breakfast room while they got us a room ready. We were given maps and information and beverages. While they got our room ready we were able to enjoy a drink and plan our next few days in Amsterdam. The infotmation they gave us was very useful. Hotel staff was excellent. Our room was ready within about 30 minutes and was clean and well organized. The room was tiny (of course, everything in Amsterdam is tiny) but the way they have them set up works well and keeps it from feeling too small. They supplied fresh flowers in the room (a great touch) as well as a TV, Coffee Maker, and Towels. I will be sure to stay again when I head back to Amsterdam. Oh and yes the stairs are pretty hectic but the staff is great about getting your things to your room. All you need to do is get yourself up the steps. :-)

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond hospitality”
Reviews.Author: stellatravel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. The host and staff were truly phenomenal, they carried our bags in and out (up many steep staircases), got us coffee and tea upon arrival, it was like we were old friends and they were welcoming us into their home with beautiful warmth. We had reserved a standard room and they actually gave us their penthouse suite instead, they said "enjoy and welcome to amsterdam~" There were even flowers waiting in the room for us. This hotel includes a nice European breakfast bar with croissants, cheese, yogurt, fruit, bread..... and of course coffee and teas. It's in a great location, a few blocks away from the red light district, so it's quiet and quaint, right near the Anne Frank house, which is a really rad area of town to walk around and discover all that historic Amsterdam has to offer. We arrived with a car and they coordinated the best price valet service for us. They also helped us decide what to see and do, as we didn't have too much time there. The host's recommendations were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, kind, and helpful staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RAmiller87
Reviews.Content: I've spent the last month travelling around in Europe and hands down, the best hotel I stayed at was Hotel Nadia. The staff is incredibly kind, helpful, and always willing to go out of their way to make sure that your stay is comfortable. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very quaint. Free breakfast is available and coffee is brewed fresh all day long. Free wifi is also available throughout the hotel. The stairs are a little scary at first, but the staff is more than happy to carry ALL of your luggage to your room for you. Loved this hotel and wish more could be like it!!

Reviews.Title: “stairway to the stars”
Reviews.Author: cathedralUk
Reviews.Content: Two flights of very very steep stairs greeted us-not to worry we were very fit at the end of our week.!!.Cheerful staff whisked our luggage up to our rooms.Our first room was tiny "-not enough room to swing a cat"was the phrase that came to mind!- the hotelier changed our room for us as we were staying for one week-much better.We picked this hotel because of it's central location and because it was one of the very few hotels in Amsterdam that included breakfast in it's overal nightly cost.The breakfast room was small but coped very well-the quality of the breakfast was fine with (for a change in our experience) good quality coffee and set one up well for the day.The hotel owner and reception staff were very friendly and helpful-all spoke English like a native "Brits"; as did all Dutch people it seemed.Our room had TV -safe-fridge-tea/coffee faclities and a constant supply of piping hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Hospitable Service”
Reviews.Author: hoffmad
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very well run and the warmth of the service was fantastic. The rooms are typical European-style, which means a bit small, and sometimes unusually designed...but that is part of the design. We had a great view of the canal. We would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: plemontEngland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful welcome This was our second stay at Hotel Nadia and we would not consider staying anywhere else when we visit Amsterdam. Staff our extremelly friendly and helpfull. The 3 bedded rooms suited our needs great - 2 adults and 4 young people. Also it is a fab location, close to all attractions etc. Thanks again !!

Reviews.Title: “Like being in a ship”
Reviews.Author: Pickles
Reviews.Content: Great location -- walking distance to center but not in the noisiest section. However, our room was tiny; it was more like being onboard a ship than being in a hotel. We are two average adults with two medium suitcases and one small suitcases, and we had to move to an upgraded room (given to us without cost, which was nice) to fit. Although this did not bother us too much, I am surprised the tiny room size was not mentioned in other reviews. Also, it does bear mentioning that anyone who has trouble walking or climbing stairs should not assume hotels in Europe are accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Amsterdam?? Stay in Nadia!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharron17
Reviews.Content: Well, I have to be honest (as always in these reviews) I had my doubts about Nadia as it was the first time I had ever booked a 2* hotel. However, having read the previous reviews coupled with the excellent price of approx Â£90 for two nights, my three friends and I booked up in good faith, and we were certainly not disappointed! On arrival, the stairs looked an absolute nightmare, but actually weren't too bad at all. Thankfully there are handrails! It was a laugh if nothing else trying to get up and down them. Wouldn't recommend for people with walking difficulties, but then I'm sure you knew that already. We booked two rooms and made a few special requests. We had previously emailed our requests several times although never received a response; I can understand why now though, the staff are clearly too busy catering to the guests once they arrive in the hotel, something which, after staying there, you can totally forgive them for! When we arrived we were greeted by a nice gentleman in reception. He took note of our request for twin rooms and a balcony if possible. We also asked that the rooms were close to each other. He did brilliantly with all our requests and we were very happy to get one room with a balcony (and chairs) which meant we were able to smoke without having to trek the stairs each time. There is a balcony in the breakfast room but it is only big enough for one or two people and there are no chairs so you should request a room with balcony if you wish to smoke. I really can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. They blew me away with their generosity and kindness. Every time we went through reception we were given a drink on the house, and actual cans and bottled drinks too, no cheap rubbish here! We arrived back late one night and the man who was on reception (I think he was the manager) was just brilliant. So friendly and willing to cater to anything we wanted. Amazing customer service! As for location, it's fabulous, very close to Dam Square. The only small thing I would have to say, and I can't even call this a complaint because it did not matter to my holiday one bit. The toilet / shower area in the rooms is absolutely tiny! But that's it, that's my only thing and it didn't put me off. I will definately be staying at the Nadia if I return to Amsterdam. If only for the staff and service alone. I can honestly say I have stayed in 4* hotels and not been treated half as well as we were at Nadia. The staff deserve a medal for the way they treated their guests, oh and the flowers in the room were a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s not expensive and the hotel is a charming and comfortable place, very clean and well organized.”
Reviews.Author: Mel26SaoPaulo_Brasil
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is the best place to stay in Amsterdam. It is not expensive and it is close to the main attractions of the city, such as Anne Frank House, Dam and museums. The hotel is a charming and comfortable place, very clean and well organized. Certainly the kind of hotel that makes you feel â€œYes, I am on vacation!â€�. The stuff is absolutely great, everyone is very nice and ready to help you in anything you need. The breakfast is served in a beautiful room from where you can see spots of the city. Every time I go back to Amsterdam, thatÂ´s the place I am in! Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: No need to expect luxury or lots of space for these fabulous prices. To get such clean rooms and such fine service for such a good price is terrific. The steep stairs are no big deal for those without health problems. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: Bassoon_Player
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable stay at the Hotel Nadia in April, and I've been meaning to write this review ever since. Using Park and Ride on the outskirts of the city, we had a quick and convenient tram ride to the exact location of the hotel, which is central to all the sights you are likely to want to see. Our room had a superb view. Although the room was fairly small, it was cleverly provided with plenty of space for clothes etc, and the bathroom was well equipped. But, as others have noted, the main highlight was the friendliness and helpfulness of the manager and his staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them. (Don't be put off by the rather steep stairs to the reception - the climb is well worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “One word "Excellent"”
Reviews.Author: MsHou
Reviews.Content: Every year for the last 3 years we went back to Amsterdam,we always stayed at Nadia hotel.It was pleasant,welcomed,just like home.The stuff were very friendly,You couldn't ask any more of them.I would say millions of good things of the hotel.I would recommend to every one. Ps:The manager of the hotel he is such gentleman.

Reviews.Title: “excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: poppopLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia and its staff are both welcoming and extremely friendly. It's in a very good location, the maps make it seem like everything is miles apart, but once you get your bearings it is really easy to get about. You don't need to worry about the trams and cars, it's the thousands of bikes that plague the place!!!! Just make sure you have got eyes in the back of your head! A really good place to visit and would definately go back again,staying at the Nadia, where they can't do enough to make your stay enjoyable (except maybe they could carry you up and down the stairs, you will see what I mean when you stay there!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly service - would go back”
Reviews.Author: aly_87h
Reviews.Content: Situated close to dam square and the Anne Frank house, canal views, friendly service and it was near a taxi rank!! The rooms are very clean and the hotel had lots of charcter!! The staff are very friendly and would give free drinks!! They even put flowers in my room for my birthday! If i was going back to Amsterdam I would go back there!!

Reviews.Title: “If only...”
Reviews.Author: OWOParis
Reviews.Content: The location is central, the price is low but the room I was in was VERY small and basic with furniture that badly needs updating and the breakfast is sadly lacking. Maybe other rooms are more modern and more comfortable; I don't know. One gets what one pays for, I suppose. The outstanding element of this hotel is the staff: they could not have been more friendly or more helpful. Even a week later, their kindness and positive demeanor are still in my mind. Would all hotels - at whatever price - have such an outstanding staff and manager!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tipiHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We liked hotel really much. Hotel staff is really nice! But if you have broblem climbing up many stairs, then this is not suitable for you. And we were also thinking that if you have a really bad weight problem, its difficult to get to the shower/toilet because the door is not so wide. Rooms on the side of street are also a little noisy but it was not problem for us. Breakfast was ok and cats really nice:)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, but little worn out”
Reviews.Author: DutchDesire
Reviews.Content: After climbing the steep stairs we found a tiny reception. Very friendly, like all hotel staff. Our room (canal side, view on the Westerkerk) was of sufficient size and very clean. Interior, including linnen and curtains a little worn out though. That goes for the hotel as a whole. Bed was fine, slept like a rose. Breakfast very basic. Location is good if you prefer the grachten area and de Jordaan.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: rdsomers
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the canal district, this place is great. Clean with very pleasent and helpful service. If you have trouble with stairs, this is not the place, but they carry your bags up and down for you. It is typical of the area with small rooms and stairs but clean as a whistle, the water is hot and plentiful and the tram stops right outside. Very pleasent and helpful staff. Their website is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location; room small by clean”
Reviews.Author: YanksAbroad
Reviews.Content: If you grew up in America in the 1970's and had a basement "rec room" or bar that your father built, you'll know exactly what the rooms at the Hotel Nadia look like. Paneling, acoustic-panel drop ceilings, simple shelves with brackets underneath. Both the room and the bathroom are tiny, but they are clean (not just clean, but "Dutch clean"!). The price is very good for the central location, and the staff are very helpful, supplying free drinks and a warm welcome. Best of all, they give you free WiFi access within the rooms, which is almost unheard-of these days. Breakfast is meager, and the stairs will give you a nosebleed; nevertheless, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is good value for money in a great part of the city”
Reviews.Author: AJP-Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Value for money, smallish rooms (but that's no surprise in a major European city), but clean, very helpful staff, good free Internet. The rooms have a small fridge, and fan (useful in the summer.) Short walk from main shopping and restaurant districts. I'll stay there again, for business or leisure. Yes, the stairs are steep, but staff rush down to help carry luggage! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: GORDIANKNOT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building.The location was excellent.The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Single room small but very clean.Security and useful internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: PHWPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: First visit to Amsterdam, traveling with my daughter. Perfect location and easy to find. We took the tram from Central Station and it stops almost across the street. Our room was on the 1st floor so we didn't have a lot of steep steps. Room was very small (think train compartment!) but was laid out with thought and had everything we needed-tv,fridge, clean bathroom and overlooked the canal. Did not see any other rooms.I would advise one to pack lightly(I always do). Continental breakfast was good (very good coffee)and the staff was friendly, accommodating and helpful.
