The management let me use their laptop to email my husband at home. That was most appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great service, friendly staff, noisy road and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ErikthevikingUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Had a very small, but perfectly formed and functional single room which overlooked a tram route, which was very noisy at night. However, the location and staff made up for it. Recommended for the single traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest, but the friendliest+best service possible”
Reviews.Author: Damo555
Reviews.Content: Good location,only 10 mins from the station. Let us check in early with free refreshments while we waited. Very friendly and genuinely welcoming. Excellent room with balcony,very clean. I would not recommend the hotel for elderly patrons as the stairs are VERY steep! Let us leave bags all day after checkout and provided more hot and cold drinks. Cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RMTSwansea
Reviews.Content: Room was a little bit small, but adequate. It was well equipped with an electronic safe, a fridge , television and fan. Breakfast was usual Continental in a pleasant breakfast room. good location for Trams or to walk to attractions. All the staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: HomesickBelfast
Reviews.Content: Did online search for Amsterdam hotels, and found either established chains that were very expensive (Eur 150 per night), or cheaper places (Eur 50) which sounded awful on Trip Advisor! Then discovered this relatively cheap (Eur 65) hotel online, was impressed by their helpful website, and was very pleasantly surprised to read rave reviews on Trip Advisor, so went there with a real sense of anticipation that i had unearthed a rare gem! While the hotel certainly provided good value for money, i just want to ensure people don't go there with falsely high expectations: you get what you pay for! Enquiry emails beforehand weren't replied to; the (tiny) reception area was smokey; the room was also tiny (had to do most manoeuvres sideways!); the decor was a lot more old-fashioned than that depicted on the hotel website photos; the window was left open & light on during the day (presumably by cleaners), so i spent the nights fighting off mosquitos; someone nearby (? receptionist) liked whistling at 0600 hrs; breakfast was very basic; and my request for an earlier departure than i had originally planned created negative vibes. That said, faced with the same choice again, i would probably return, but at least with realsistic expectations, ear-plugs, and insect repellant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. Our room was small, but more than enough for us. We enjoyed the welcoming flowers and personalized note. The location was excellent. You are not in the middle of the Red Light District (I know some might not want to be located there), but are within walking distance if you want to head there. We could see the Anne Frank House from our room, so it's not a great distance to go to this Museum. We also had a nice view of the canal. You are within walking distance to many Amsterdam's tourist destinations. The stairs are daunting (steep climb and many of them). You will be fine as long as you don't have mobility issues. Say "Hi" to the cats. We enjoyed seeing them daily. The complimentary breakfast daily was great! The staff were nice, helpful and informative. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I am not easy to please, but I considered this place to be wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasent Stay At The Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Ronale
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and it was even better than the first. What makes this hotel stand out is the attention to service such as complimentary drink upon arrival and access to tea/coffee 24 hours a day. The hotel manager and reception acknowledged that we were returning visitors straight away, and even spoke about the room type we had previously booked. Now I am sure he did not remember us from the year before, but had made the effort to look up our previous booking and make us feel like he appreciated our repeat custom. The manager was away on our departure, but he called us to say thank you again and offered us a departure drink, now that is what I call service, which you do not get now-a-days especially from large hotels. This time we got a twin balcony room on the first floor. I am sure you have read from other reviews that the rooms are compact (fine by me as I do not spend much time in them) so having a balcony for a bit extra makes the room feel a bit larger. We went on a 1 hour canal cruise from the pier by central station which was nice. There are different companies and the price varies quite drastically. The Lovers cruise which is recommended in many guide books was 14 Euros, but we ended up going on a cheaper cruise next to Lovers for 8 Euros. The boats themselves did not look much different so I assume the commentary on Lovers must have been the reasoning for such a large price difference. The commentary on our cruise was pretty rubbish in English, but it was nice to sit on a cruise and see the views as it is a beautiful city. Food wise, I would recommend Gaucho which is just off Dam Sq. It is a bit costly (30 Euros for main and a glass of coke), but when you can cut steak with a normal knife (as opposed to a steak knife) you know it is good. Ask for a window seat on first floor - very romantic. Another good stay in Amsterdam which was definitely enhanced by the good service and quality of the Nadia Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and fun”
Reviews.Author: kaleylou
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Amsterdam and we found the Nadia Hotel a very welcoming, well located hotel. The staff were very friendly but very efficient and went out of their way to ensure we had everything we required to enjoy our stay. The room was fairly small but perfectly adequate. Breakfast too was perfectly adequate. Would definitely recommend for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: angelcakes
Reviews.Content: A party of five of us have just returned from a one night stay. Originally, we booked two triple rooms but one of us fell ill so we ended up being given a family room at the top of the house and, it was superb. I have never come accross such accommodating staff in a hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. We arrived very early, far too early to be checked in and yet we were given a lovely free breakfast in the delightful breakfast room which has fab views. The breakfast is continental and plentiful. On our last day we had a late night flight and again, we were given as much coffee and drinks as we wanted out of the fridge. All this for 40 euros each! The hotel itself is centrally located, about a 10 minute walk from Anne Frank's house. As mentioned before, the steps are incredibly steep and not suitable for some people. Its part of the charm of the building though, great fun after a night out in Amsterdam!! Our room had five beds and bay windows over looking the canal. Im not sure how child friendly this room wouldve been though, the windows open all the way!!!! Beds were very comfy and there was plenty of linen and towels. Be warned, if you are a light sleeper and are in a room opposite the church, the bells chime every 15 minutes!! We had a great stay and will definitely be recommending the Nadia to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Still lovely, still welcoming, still good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JoseyNottingham
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Nadia before and were very relieved to find it hadn't changed at all. It's so well located (just by Westermarkt, v. handy for Jordaan, Dam Square etc.) and for the price charged we feel it is very good value for money. The rooms aren't big but who wants to spend time inside anyway? Stairs are very steep tho so not great for young families or anyone with mobility issues. But the Nadia's real selling point is the adorable staff who can't do enough for you, and told us on this second visit that we should see the hotel as our second home. And we do!

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mianmianfly
Reviews.Content: location is very convenient to all resorts & public transportation, staff are very friendly & helpful, room is a little small but clean. very nice stay in Amsterdam !

Reviews.Title: “Fab Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: brown10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in march and the hotel was fab...rooms were really small but adequate for what you need it for and very clean, we had clean towels every day and the staff were very friendly could'nt recommend it enough. Breakfast is also included and ample to start your day off. The hotel itself is in a great location a stone throw from Anne franks house and Dam square would def stay here again.. ***only thing is if you have any difficulties climbing steep stairs,then not the hotel for you***

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Patent27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. A standart 2 stars. The rooms have the minimum size needed, but what do you need for 50 sq M if you are spending only your night there. The service is realy excellent, and very helpfull. The only small problem was sometimes with suggestions for place to eat: for example when we wanted a cozy small restaurant we were suggested a chinese restaurant for 700 persons. The hotel location is excellent: during our whole stay we used public transport very exceptionnaly, all major things are within the walking distance. However as a consequence to that you can have some street noice during the night, ask for a room on the canal side, it is much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient service - just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for 2 nights and couldn't fault anything. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. They were always friendly, efficient and happy. As mentioned in previous reviews, the stairs are steep but since they carry your luggage to the rooms, it isn't a problem. If I ever return to Amsterdam, I would definitely stay at the Nadia Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Stay Here!! Beyond Awesome Service, Perfect Location&More”
Reviews.Author: LamboPete
Reviews.Content: Wow. Amazing first time in Amsterdam! My girlfriend and I stayed at The Nadia Hotel our first Five nights in Amsterdam, though we had only booked for three nights online in advance. The Hotel is so easy to get to, a short train ride from the airport to Centraal Station, then a short walk or tram ride to Dam Square and you're there. The Hotel has no elevator, and the stairs are quite steep as are most in Amsterdam. They carry your luggage right to your room for you. The rooms are not huge but they are comfortable and consider your location in the city! Very modern Clean bathrooms. Fresh flowers in the room. Gorgeous canal views from the balcony from room 413. Also stayed in room 409 which is a larger room with a HUGE balcony. Traveled around Europe and went back to Amsterdam and stayed again at the Hotel Nadia. I would not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. The Staff includes the owner and they each exceeded my expectations. They really make you feel at home. I 100% recommend the Hotel Nadia, especially for your first time to Amsterdam. You are in the heart of the city, but you can leave the window open and it's not unbearably noisey outside. Raadhuisstraat is a very beatiful Street in Amsterdam and the Nadia Hotel is a stones throw from dam square. Perfect picturesque sunsets with the West Church lit up at night. I can't say enough about the Hotel Nadia!!

Reviews.Title: “a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: ensca
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms, but expecially great staff and service. When we will come back to Amsterdam we will choose again this hotel! The price in our case was a little bit high, but we choose the queen's day period, so we think it was for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “We had a perfect stay at Nadia hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wytze
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the family in a very nice room: direct view on the canal and the Westertoren ! The staff is very friendly, our 2 daughters (10 and 8) felt very well at home; they were spoilt with candies and soft drinks. We are sure that we will visit Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: xraymary
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Nadia. We were warned about the stairs and they were steep but they carry your bags to your room so it wasn't an issue. It was clean, quaint, great location and very accomodating. Osam was a great host. Michelle at reception was very helpful getting us around Amsterdam. The breakfast was nice compared with others we had on this trip. The rooms are small but who cares. It was the only place we stayed in Europe that had coffee in the room. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “compact accomadation - nice and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: krsamy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on (25th APril). The room was very small than I expected but for a nights stay it was ok. The steps were very steep as found in the reviews. The reception was very good and friendly. The breakfast had only a few items (my be because there was no asian stuff). For a solo traveller, the accomadation is sufficieient and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale; amazingly courteous service; compact but efficient”
Reviews.Author: GenevaExplorer
Reviews.Content: Though the entrance door and the steep steps to reception give a 'narrow and congested' feeling, the warm reception and completely 'information' packed reception desk make you feel happy quickly (a cool welcome drink too!). Again the rooms are quite compact and not very standardized but the service rendered is amazing. You feel you are being taken care of and feel at home. They help you with the luggage delivered at the room while you reach. Toilet and the room is quite clean and neat. Only suggestion for improvement is: please make the room dust free. I could see layer of dust on the table and the many shelves they have kept in the room. Everything in the room was in working condition (mini firdge too!). A very courteous buffet breakfast though there a limited variety of juices & fruits. But you will tend to forget all these minor discomforts when you feel the warmth of the people. The lady at the reception could instantly strike a smiling dialogue with my 16 month old son and he was laughing all along we were in the reception. My 6 year old son too loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like coming home; comfortable, convenient, warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: Beebox02
Reviews.Content: We are professional travel writers but were on a personal trip so were interested in saving time AND money. I researched over a hundred hostels, hotels and b and b's and lucked upon the Nadia; chose it for location (easy commute - train direct from Schiphol to Centraal Station then tram number 13 or 17 and viola - we were there in just a few minutes). EVERYTHING in Amsterdam depends on location and the Nadia has it - it also has a warm and welcoming staff who is attentive to your needs. We ran out of Euro's for the tram back on our last day and hated to pay the exchange rate etc. for just 3.20 Euros and the owner dug in his own pocket and gave it to us! The room (#6) overlooked the canal, was quiet and conducive to sleep after a long international flight. All the comforts you would need (in-room tea/coffee maker, hair dryer, room safe, telephone, TV) but the most enjoyable were the upscale duvet covers, the plump pillows, the pleasing decor and the quaint, intimate hightop garden that was just out the hallway window - we were even greeted with a vase of fresh flowers and a welcome card! We stayed again on our way back through Amsterdam, enjoyed a local pub just a block away and a pancake house as well the next day -- though the breakfast of fragrant coffee, buttery rolls, toast, cheeses was more than ample. If you are looking for comfort, safety, location, value and the warmth of a very caring staff I don't think you could do better than this EXCELLENT, warm and inviting hotel. I know we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: hommy1491
Reviews.Content: Room was very compact but included a fridge, t.v and free safe so all good! Breakfast was a lovely start to the day, fresh bread, cheese, cake and lots of different spreads and jams etc with fresh coffee and orange juice. The staff were extemely helpful and friendly, free drink from the fridge behind reception on arrival which was very welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay at a very competitive price”
Reviews.Author: Vivacious62
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews; we knew what to expect; and we were not disappointed. The steep stairs are rather daunting at first but handrails either side are very helpful (we are active retired). The hotel has character and is superbly positioned a short walk from Dam Square on a corner where a canal passes under the main street.We dealt directly with the Hotel and chose an upgraded room overlooking the canal with an excellent view of the Westerkerk. A discount for cash was a bonus! We appreciated the welcome drink and fresh flowers in the room. We were glad to have two safes, tea and coffee making facilities a fridge and lashings of hot water on tap all day. The continental buffet breakfast is simple, wholesome and filling but with a limited choice of fresh fruit. The staff are charming and helpful and their advice about reasonably priced restaurants nearby was first class. Security too is very good. No one can enter the hotel without being admitted. Everything is managed efficiently and the service is very friendly. Overall we had excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: burzio
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay. Small rooms, but clean, and very friendly and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MrHydeUk
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, really friendly and welcoming. Nice balcony view and you can hear the bells of Westerkerk! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Rimo38
Reviews.Content: Value for money in a great location. Room even had a canal view but was a little snug for our family of 4 . We would thoroughly recomend for couples on a budget. Breakfast was simple and nothing too fancy.The location was great, and the service was super friendly. Even providing us with refreshments on arrival. The rates were very reasonable. The staff were all very friendly and provided us with all the information we required for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NillaB
Reviews.Content: I can't decide on my favorite part of Hotel Nadia. My balcony overlooking the street and canal below, the tram just steps away to take me wherever I needed to be or the lovely staff always there to help out. For the price I really don't think you could come up with a better place to stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the minority for sure”
Reviews.Author: Wen47
Reviews.Content: We wanted a balcony room in case we wanted to smoke. The room was the worst we ever saw. You could not put two 21 inch carry on suitcases on the floor at once. One person could not stand and have the other open the bathroom door. The window did not open and we had to sleep with the balcony door open even though the balcony is basically shared with other rooms while separated by a flimsy divider. The balcony had a light going on and off all night as part of the hotel name sign. The description of the two steep flights up did not do the actual flights justice. We then had to go up two more flights. The fact that you are given the remote control at the desk and asked to return it says to me that the usual guests take them! I use these boards to guide many trips and am always pleased. I feel as if I fell into the twilight zone because of the many, many positive reviews of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central location, better youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: Charly17Kassel
Reviews.Content: the rooms are simple but very clean, it's great to have a fridge in the room, the rooms in direction the to street are loud at night and in the morning, breakfast was very simple and not so good, the staff was very friendly and gave some information about going out at night and so on, very friendly offer because we were youths

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LittleCasp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for a few nights in Dec 08. It was small but cosy and very clean. The ensuite shower room was modern and so clean it sparkled. The room also had a fridge and TV. The welcome at the hotel was very warm and they kindly took my bags up the stairs without me even asking! There were fresh flowers in the room and I was offered a free drink on arrival. The location is great for both the station and exploring the city centre. I've been to Amsterdam many times and I'd say this is the best value for money and the warmest welcome.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sbourque
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Nadia for 3 nights total, the first two nights were alone in a single room with a balcony and the last night was with my teenage daughter in a double room facing the canal. On first arriving I was greeted with a friendly welcome and of course a refreshing drink after walking from the central station and tackling their staircase. Fresh flowers upon entering my room as well as my suitcase miraculously making it to the top of the hotel without my notice waiting for me already was a very welcomed surprise. The employees in the reception treat you with more familiarity than other larger hotels do, I never even had to tell them who I was when I retrieved my room key after daily outings, they just knew which key to give me every time! Even when my 13 year old daughter arrived she raved about the hotel and staff for the most part of her first day in Amsterdam. Osam, thank you for everything. I look forward to staying here my next time in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: neibo
Reviews.Content: The location was great, and the service was super friendly. The rates were very reasonable, and we got a discount for paying in cash up front. The room was tiny but had a terrific balcony overlooking the canal and Westermarkt church. And free breakfast and coffee... plus it's across from a waffle stand that's open until 3am which was great for the late nights!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in the Center of Old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: aclarinet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia Thank you so much for your WONDERFUL staff and making our 9 nights in Amsterdam so amazing! The rooms are small but the location and staff make your stay very good if you ask for their recommendations. We arrived from the US with our time clocks askew, and yet the staff welcomed us in the dining area with a fresh pot of coffee in the wee hours of Amsterdam. The small refrigerator in the room helps you take advantage of the local market's delights. The hotel itself is across the street/canal from Anne Frank's house and Westermarkt. Trams and tickets are 1/2 block from the hotel. Osam and staff made us feel so welcome and like a part of their family. It's easy to understand why this family run hotel is such a treasure. You need to be fit enough to climb the "stair-master" to the lobby several times a day, so if you want the typical US elevator/Disney/non-Amsterdam experience, find another place. If you wish, however to immerse yourself in the old Amsterdam, museums, artists, shops, canals, chocolate, and cheese - the stairs are well worth it! The rooms have fresh flowers from the local market - an unexpected delight! I would gladly come again and again to Hotel Nadia! Osam - only one suggestion - your breakfast is simple and plentiful - I would like to suggest adding a bowl of Muesli type cereal and a large cold pitcher of your tasty local tap water in the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service awaits at the top of the stairs”
Reviews.Author: klouve
Reviews.Content: Don't be deterred by the daunting staircase just inside the door at Hotel Nadia--it's well worth the climb. The rooms are almost cartoonishly snug, but the service was impeccable. I found lots of needed guidance and directions from the patient, helpful and humorous staff at the front desk. It was also nice to have breakfast there each morning--sightseeing with an empty stomach is no fun.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, kindly staff and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: feeverde
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the center of the city so it's very simple to reach the most important places just by walking!the rooms are very comfortable, nice and warm such as the rest of the hotel.The staff is very kind and serviceable!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: fiftyplustravellers
Reviews.Content: Cosy rooms, with fridge, TV and tea/cooffee making facilities. Loads of shelf space. Stairs a tad on the steep side, (70 to the 4th floor, but worth it for the views) Staff very friendly and helpful. Arrived early, complementary coffee in breakfast room, whilst room was being made up. Fresh flowers in room were a lovely touch, and much appreciated. Great location and excellent value for money. Would stay again. - A pair aged 50+

Reviews.Title: “extremely well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamofive
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Europe last night, so this review is as fresh as can be. We really enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and appreciated the warm welcome from everyone at the Nadia Hotel. The drinks at the top of the stairs were a very-appreciated thought. We were parched after lugging our luggage from Centraal station and the fresh flowers in our room, such a nice touch. They brought our luggage up for us, which was essential, as I don't think I could have done it. I hope they use some kind of machine, because the stairs are steep and I don't envy whoever has the job without some kind of mechanism. The attention to these kind of details make this hotel such a treat! The location couldn't be better and the manager went out of his way to help us find our way around the city. They have large maps on the walls to help you get oriented and then give you more versions to take with you so you won't get lost in the old town where the houses all look similar and the street names can be confusing for travelers. I would only say two things that crossed my mind on entry to our room: "How would we get out in case of fire?" and "What is the carbon foot print of the hotel when the heat is cranked high in an empty room? This is not just about the Nadia. Many hotels we stayed in have these issues. It is a challenge to retro-fit such things as fire exits, I suppose, but it does give one peace of mind to see them. Also, it seems to be a common thing to crank up the radiator even with no one in the room. A little heat on a cold day is okay, but it was so hot we had to open the window, and I felt guilty about that. (The view from the balcony was terrific, though!) We loved the breakfast. It was plentiful and delicious and on offer early if you need it. Very much appreciated. I searched through many, many hotels on trip advisor before our trip and this one was well worth the search. I hope to return soon to Amsterdam with my family and enjoy this place again. Hint: Trams run early and late, so if you don't like the noise, ask for a room at the back. I enjoyed the atmosphere, so it didn't really bother me.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappytimeTilburg
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for four nights in the quadruple room of Hotel Nadia. It is a very nice and friendly hotel where we experienced a very happy time. The staff is very kind and helpful. We first received a very warm welcome with some welcome drink. When we went into the room, we find that it is very clean and comfortable with a great view of the canal and the Westermarkt. About the breakfast, I like the croissant and the cake they provided. Besides, the lady who served the food was very nice with sweet smile. There is one thing I would like to mention is that the stairs are very steep. But you don't have to worry about carrying your heavy luggage upstairs. The staff can help you to do that. That is very nice. But you still need to be careful when you go up and down the stairs. Overall, this hotel is a good hotel with a reasonable price. I really recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, excellent location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: yankeeinwilmingtonnc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nadia for a week in March and had a wonderful time. The price is excellent and the location 3 blocks from Dam Square with a tram stop on the next block was very convenient. Plenty of good restaurants within a 10 minute walk, good cafes all around the neighborhood (Cafe Kolkhaven and Het Schuim became favorites). The staff was very helpful with dining recommendations and even booked a table for us at a restaurant that we had selected ourselves on our last night in town. The places they recommended were all very good as well. A highlight of the trip for me was going to the UEFA cup match between Ajax Amsterdam and Olympique Marseille and the manager was extremely helpful. I bought the tickets online and had them delivered to the hotel before I arrived, he accepted delivery and kept the tickets safe until I arrived, giving them to me as soon as I checked in. He also emailed me at home to tell me that he had received the tickets for me. On the day of the game he helped with directions on how to get to the game. My wife's birhtday came the week we were there, I swear everybody on the staff wished her a happy birthday and they even had fresh flowers sent to the room. The cleaning lady went as far as to give her a big and genuine happy birthday hug. I can say only good things about the service. The location is excellent. The price was also very good. My only warning is that the rooms are small, so if you need a large room then the Nadia is not the place for you. But for my wife and I the Nadia was otherwise perfect, as it proved to be a very reasonably priced, well located hotel with an unsurpassed level of personal service from all members of the staff. We hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: POVERIBEN
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very central located. it's 5 minutes by foot to dam square , the staff was very kindly , the rooms were little but confortable and very clean . if i will return to amsterdam surely i will go to nadia hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Amsterdam Option”
Reviews.Author: TC1968
Reviews.Content: Placed right between Dam square and Anne Frank the location couldn't be any better. Once you get over the shock of the stairs/ladder you'll find the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are small but clean and well equipped for the budget (mine had a safe and fridge). Breakfast was included in the rate and it was limited but fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_08
Reviews.Content: Nadia is a small hotel with narrow, steep staircases, narrow corridors and very small rooms - but it is very charming, cosy and with a perfect location in city center. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and we felt very good taken care of. I travelled with my daughter, and she really enjoyed the hotel too - with child-friendly breakfast (hot chocolate milk, soft rolls and chocolate spread - OK, we are on holiday!) and two hotel-cats lying in a window frame in the corridor. A welcome-drink from the reception upon arrival and fresh flowers in our room was nice details which we really appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good place kind people”
Reviews.Author: ItalyAlly
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a beautiful city, people are very kind, there are many museums, parks, canals, bridges, shop and coffee shop to visit. It's cold and windy in march but it's ok. I seuggest the city and Nadia hotel to others friends or to my family. The hotel infact is near Dam Square, in a central position. The breakfast is good, the rooms little small. 4 days in this city is enough to see most important things. I hope to return maybe when flowers will grow up. Do you put our photos on your website? great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia: My Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDoneThat52
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Nadia, this time with a friend and prior with my son. We feel welcome in this friendly, clean place. Good continental breakfast, fresh flowers everywhere, and the location is perfect for exploring Amsterdam. Just outside the front door is Anne Frank Museum and the Jordaan area. The location is perfect and the price is a bargain. I'll stay here again next time. Thanks everyone at Hotel Nadia for making coffee 24/7 and keeping everything spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff was the best, hotel historic and real Dutch.”
Reviews.Author: bassman21
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Amsterdam and at The Nadia could not have been better. There are a few stairs to climb up to the lobby, but it is worth it. Plus after you have the pancakes at Sara's next door you'll need the exercise. The staff is the greatest from their warm greeting (and help with our luggage), to the flowers in our room for our anniversary. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place with lovely staff, generous breakfasts and convienient location.”
Reviews.Author: joyce_herward
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to all modes of public transport and shops. The staff are very welcoming, friendly and always helpful. The breakfasts are a great foundation for a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Daymo91
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The stairs leading up to the reception area are very long and steep so may not be suitable for older or disabled travellers. The breakfast room is very pleasant and you get a continental breakfast each morning. I had a single room, it was small but comfortable. The room had tea/coffee making facilities, t.v, a safe and a fridge all of which came in useful during my stay. The location of the hotel is great, the anne frank house is not far and it's only a few minutes walk to Dam Square. If you do stay here it is worthwhile visiting their website beforehand as it has some very useful links and information on Amsterdam. Last but not least it is on the same street as Sara's Pancake House which has now become my favourite restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljcheadle
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful.Good location behind Dam square, good value. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Practical and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jambo5
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in Amsterdam, Staying at the Nadia made it very easy for us to get to everything we wanted to see. The family are very kind. The breakfast room is lovely and cozey but not a very exciting choice (some fruit would be nice) We were welcomed with a lovely bunch of flowers in our room. Our room was nice, big windows, but small bathroom. It was a nice place to stay. Not practical for people who dont like stairs.

Reviews.Title: “A great, friendly and cosy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandPenelope
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel is without a doubt the best hotel I have ever visited, the staff very extremly friendly and helpful which added to the cosy laid back atmosphere which the hotels brings. It is only a 5 min walk for Dam Square, the rooms are small this is however ,the case for most building in Amsterdam, but the rooms have all the necitites you need. The only problem visitors to this hotel may have is the steep stairs to the reception but this is also common of most tradtional buildings in the city. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is our new Amsterdam home.”
Reviews.Author: europeanatheart01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just completed our 10th trip to Amsterdam and our 1st stay at Hotel Nadia. We will never stay anywhere else! Every aspect of our stay was perfect. We each had a birthday while there and were given special treatment. europeanatheart

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireSmudge
Reviews.Content: The Nadia was everything we expected from a 2/3 star hotel-great location, very friendly staff and nice clean room. As everyone else says, the steps are steep but there is a welcoming soft drink at Reception when you get to the top. We booked a balcony room and got chatting to Osman when we arrived. Without asking and to our delight he upgraded us to the tower room which had two balconies! Great views! When we were leaving we left our bags to explore Amsterdam further and upon our return we were invited to have a coffee in the dining room if we had time. Nothing is too much for the staff here. Our bags were even waiting downstairs in a locked room for us so we didn't have to carry them! If you want a basic, friendly, traditional, clean hotel for night or two, then look no further than the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: jvlp
Reviews.Content: Received a wonderful welcome at the Nadia hotel. Very friendly staff and most helpful. located in a very good part of Amsterdam but hope any guests don't mind the bells from the Wester kerk.

Reviews.Title: “A nice comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: k8tmcm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Nadia from 5th March for 3 nights. I chose this hotel because of all the good reviews it had on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is very central and there was plenty of warning about the stairs so they were no surprise. The staff lived up to their reputation - friendly, pleasant and helpful and we were made to feel welcome from our arrival. Our room was on the 4th floor with a balcony, it was clean and always warm. It had an ensuite shower room, tea/coffee making facilities, tv, safe and a fridge,which was great but it was compact and the smallest double room I have ever had in a hotel. However, there were fresh flowers in the room to welcome us and when I told the owner that the trip was a birthday surprise for my partner more 'birthday' flowers arrived later, which was a really nice touch. We would recommend this hotel and would definately stay in it again. Thanks to all the staff for making it a perfect birthday treat!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: MitchamBabe
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly hotel, 5min walk from Dam Square, very helpful staff, basic breakfast though but all in all would def go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Dâ€™Light at the Top of the Stairs”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: When you ring the Nadia Hotel's bell at the street level (see photo), the door is buzzed open, and you enter and stare up toward the top of a tall, narrow staircase that is a transition between busy, impersonal Radhuisstraat and the delights at the top of the stairs (see photo). A young man is stationed in the hall outside of the reception area at the top of the stairs, and he'll bring your suitcases to your room. The pluses: We find that the most pleasing hotels are small family-operated hotels such as the Nadia because they provide more genuine hospitality and know their guests personally. We felt as if we were singled out as VIP guests until we realized that all guests are VIPs here. Guests enjoy a welcome drink in the well-decorated breakfast room (see photo) with a view of the Western Church and Keizer's Canal. Guests will return again to the room for a continental buffet breakfast including a delicious processed Belegen cheese, yoghurt, juices, coffee, fresh fruit, and rolls. Most of the guests were couples or groups of single ladies. Perhaps because it was low season in March, we were upgraded to a beautiful room on the top floor with a view of the canal and the Westerkirk church. Osam, the manager, provided shopping and other recommendations pointing out locations on an aerial photo of central Amsterdam, which was better than a map because it showed landmarks. Free wi-fi in each room was fast and reliable. Osam said that he distributed routers in a dense pattern throughout the hotel so every room would have a strong signal. The bathroom in our top floor room 413 was small but adequate. The room also had a very small porch overlooking Radhuisstraat and a small crouch-in closet. Once you crouch and enter, you'll find the closet quite spacious. The TV was small, facing the bed. The refrigerator was so efficient that the freezer froze our ice pack. My wife and I felt the canal-side view and decoration made the room quite romantic. Sounds from the street were not bothersome. The hotel is in a very convenient area, a short walk from the Dam and central post office, across the street from a boat bus stop, right next to a major tram stop, and at the north end of the Nine Little Streets (Die Negen Straatjes) shopping area. It also is within walking distance of Jordaan. There are many good restaurants nearby. The staff recommended and made a reservation for us at a nearby Dutch cuisine Restaurant where the prices were right. The minuses Westerkirk bells ring, but they did not bother us. Then thereâ€™s the stairs. Really, we thought nothing of the stairs after our first climb except that they made the Nadia Hotel more special, more apart, and more romantic. Iâ€™m 70 years old and out of shape, so if I didnâ€™t mind the stairs, nobody should. We found the Nadia to be an unusually delightful and friendly hotel, and we recommend it to anyone looking for good value and delights in the heart of Amsterdam..

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend the Nadia Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jules_and_John
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia hotel for 3 nights. We were overcome by the friendly staff and service they provided. My boyfriend fell ill with the flu on our second night. The staff went beyond their call of duty to ensure his recovery. The owner even came up to our room and supplied him with panadol, cough medicine, home made soup and a warm lemon drink that made him feel so much better! Breakfast was great, our room was comfortable and the heating was perfect (we travelled in winter). They cleaned our bathroom and made the bed daily. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “the most friendly hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: redsandy1892
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly like it states on its website. Please read whole review. First off I will get the negatives out of the way. When the front door opens you have 37 very steep steps to climb, they are very vertical but you are told this on the website. And when we arrived we were told to leave our cases at the bottom so that the porter could bring them up which he did very promptly. The rooms are small but again that is stated on the website. Now for the good points. This was the most friendly hotel I have stayed in. We arrived early and were given a welcome drink, a map of amsterdam and a whats on guide. Whilst drinking our coffee they rang thru to the breakfast room to say they had a room ready for us which we checked straight into. The room whilst being small had everything in it, including a mini fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, tv and safe. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a balcony room at the front of the hotel with side views over the canel and westerkerk (church),(be warned it can be noisy, but we live on a main road so didn't affect us). The room was very clean, the bedsheets were very clean and very white. The room was cleaned daily and hygiene was very high. The breakfast was just enough with toast, pastries, cheese, cake, juice and hot drinks available, all included in the price. All the staff were respectful and helpful, giving you advice and directions to everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel location is fantastic, 5 mins from dam square, so was very local to the city centre and the tram stops. I would have given the hotel 5 stars but for 2 reasons I'm not. One is the size of the rooms and the other is that there is no bar here and I like a nightcap when I come in at night before I retire to bed. Having said that there is a pub opposite the church about 50 yards up from the hotel. So in summary, a fantastic friendly hotel in the centre of amsterdam which is value for money. I would reccommend this hotel and certainly stay here again. I love amsterdam, it has great culture, great architecture, great history but doesn't take itself to seriously. The red light district is fun to walk round, the coffeshops fun to try. But probably the most fun is to plonk yourself down at a cafe table outside and watch the world go by, there are some wonderful sights to see. Go and enjoy yourselfs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lara793
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel is a friendly family run hotel in a great position a few minutes walk from Dam Square. It is in a busy location on a tram route handy for everywhere but be warned the Westerkerk bells do ring every 1/4 hour including the night time.The stairs are not for the faint hearted and certainly not suitable for elderly or children. We were greeted warmly and were amazed at the ease with which our luggage was carried up for us. The room was basic but fine and clean. We had a great canal view. The ensuite was newly refurbished and the power shower the best I have had in a hotel. Really great! We visit Amsterdam regularly and have stayed in various hotels budget to 5star. We will definitely be going back to the Nadia on our next visit. Thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Will Definately Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: noonoooooo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a great place to stay. We were there for 5 nights and cannot find a fault. Its a typically styled Amsterdam Hotel with the added extras of clean rooms and really friendly staff we will without a doubt return to this hotel on our next visit. The location is fantastic with a pancake shop and good restaurant just down the road. We had a balcony room and was asked if we would like to move to a bigger room on the second night which made the trip. You could not get nicer more welcoming people I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. Even though our first room was very small it was spotless and perfectly adequate. Thanks again to the people at Nadia for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful time at Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: creade5
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Hotel Nadia. When visiting Amsterdam on my own last year, it was so nice to be made to feel so welcome. Going back as a couple this week. no effort was spared, every member of staff is friendly and courteous, Thanks so much for giving us a'packed breakf ast' as we had to leave so early. The breakfast room is charming. with lovely views, and the hotel ideally located in the centre. I cannot recommend Hotel Nadia highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, friendly welcome, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMFLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny but comfortable, a miracle of modern engineering and good planning to accommodate a double bed, sitting area and en-suite shower room, it looked and felt like a ship's cabin. In-room safe, plentiful coffee & tea supplies and complimentary street maps and newspapers, and knowledgeable reception staff ready to assist at all times - they carry your bags up the steep steps from the front door while you enjoy a complimentary drink. The owner took a lot of trouble to ensure I got wifi connection as my laptop has an unusual configuration. A delicious and generous breakfast buffet served in the pleasant breakfast room until 10am set us up nicely for a day of sightseeing, guided by the reception staff as to the best trams to take to get to all the popular sights - trams and buses are right outside the hotel on a main road but it is still a fairly quiet location a few minutes walk from Dam Square by the Westerkerk with its magnificent Clock Tower from where the bells ring out the hours. We loved staying at the Nadia in our little cabin with its own balcony and view of the canal and the bustling street life, and are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's hidden diamond”
Reviews.Author: deejaypeaKingston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more than we could have asked for. the location just off Dam Square, the Royal Palace at the end of the street, shopping streets all around, we could see the line for visitors to the Anne Frank's house from our bedroom window, what more could you want. Osam is a wealth of information, the room was very clean and cozy. The service was impeccable,. The stairs are steep, but they helped you with your luggage and the steep stairs are not unique to this hotel. Breakfast was adequate, enough to take you through a good part of the morning. there were so many things that we enjoyed, just walking all over the city, the canal ride, the flower market, the redlight district, the many different offerings of food, the friendliness of the people, Sara's Pancake House downstairs the hotel. We had a terrific time in Amsterdam, and Osam and his staff played a very big part in ensuring so. We would definetely go back to Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy little Hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tuor
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. They even moved me into a better room (from 4th to 2nd floor with a balcony) without me even asking. The single rooms I was in where just barely big enough, but the beds had a decent size. I also liked the dining area, situated in the corner of the building, with a nice view down to the busy street filled with bikeriders.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back 100%”
Reviews.Author: danube_shipper
Reviews.Content: Two days before ariving in Amsterdam I googled "amsterdam accomodations" and stumbled on to Hotel Nadia website. First thing that amazed me was the stairs to the reception. Climbing that stairs is unique experience. Than, there was this friendly face of hotel manager who explained me where to park my car to save money because parking your car in center of Amsterdam costs you 5â‚¬/h!! With few tips of this cool guy I mannaged to pay only 2 euro for all night and morning! I can't forget complementary drink of choice while checking in. Cool approach! Also, I must add that my room was very tidy and clean, bathroom also. Breakfast was ok, although meat is not served, coffe was just as it shoud be: strong and refreshing. But, the most important thing is that you can feel domestic atmosphere all around hotel. So, my impression is more than positive.

Reviews.Title: “Made us feel like welcome guests”
Reviews.Author: attielattie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Nadia, we were made to feel as if we were their only guests - even though the hotel was full. And, every time we collected our keys from reception, they didn't need to ask our room numbers, they remembered us. Yes the stairs are steep, but not as bad as I thought they would be - I'm not exactly fit, but I found them no bother - and the lads will carry your cases up and down the stairs. The rooms are small but extremely clean (they even changed the sheets the second night) and well cared for - the fresh flowers and welcome note are a nice touch. They manage to squeeze in a safe, small fridge, the usual tea and coffee making stuff (which is unusual in Europe, we usually have to take our own). The staff are all really friendly and helpful - I was chatting to Osam the owner and mentioned that ,when I lived in the Middle East, I liked to smoke shisha (not drugs I hasten to add) - the next day he had arranged with Ali (one of his staff) to bring in his shisha pipe from home so that I could have a puff. Unfortunately, because we'd arranged to meet up with our friends who were also staying at the hotel, we could only have 15 minutes talking to Ali and enjoying the shisha. I see one of our party has already commented on the lovely restaurant they arranged for us on the Friday night (Haesje Claes), and the Pancake House and Struisvogel restaurant. Transport to and from the hotel is easy - the trams and buses run right past the hotel and the canal bus is just over the road. All in all, I would say if you want a friendly, clean, central hotel with a lot of character, this is the one for you. I would definitely recommend it to my friends if they ever visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia -- You Can't Ask For More...”
Reviews.Author: nycmombrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Two moms and 3 teenage sons from NYC visited Amsterdam in early February 2009. We had completed significant internet research before picking this hotel. From the moment we selected it, we knew it was going to be special. Osam the manager CALLED our home in NYC twice to ensure he had understood our reservation correctly (one triple, one double). Then he personally replied to all emails requesting clarification and/or more information with patience and thoroughness. The hotel itself is extremely well run due to Osam's and his staff's attention to every detail. We found flowers placed in our room upon arrival. What a nice, welcoming touch! The room was always clean and comfortable with plenty of hot, running water for showers. Osam was "on it" every second, and attended to every request for all hotel guests . As soon as he was able, he upgraded one of our rooms to a quiet, canalside double with a view of the famous West Church. It was a special room - again with fresh flowers. This room will always be a highlight of our trip memories. Against this backdrop, Amsterdam was a great city to begin a European trip with our boys. The city was as appealing, attractive, and warm as Osam -- we all had a great time. Take the Sandeman's walking tour (free) for a great city overview. And relax about hotel selection if you choose Hotel Nadia. It's a "no brainer."

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MilongaDublin
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel is convenient to the Anne Frank House and Dam Square and to tram stops if you want to go to the Flower Market, the Leidseplein or beyond to the Van Gogh Museum. The strong point of this hotel is the staff who are extremely helpful and accommodating. We stayed in a standard room. It was really tiny and difficult for 2 adults to move around in, but it did have tea/coffee making facilities, tv, tiny room with private wc/shower. Having said that, the manager could not have done more for us and we were offered the choice of 4 different rooms on our arrival.There are very steep stairs leading up to reception and you need to be in your health to tackle them, although staff insist on bringing your bags up for you on arrival. The breakfast room was nice, the fare was simple but satisfying and the staff replenish it constantly, offerring to make toast if you want it. Central, clean, lovely staff, but strictly for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: karen b
Reviews.Content: The hotel room and bathroom was so small and claustrophobic that we checked out after 1 night of our 4 night stay. The bathroom smelt of urine and you couldn't even stand in front of the sink to brush your teeth it was so small.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DeborahandAndy
Reviews.Content: I met my sister and niece (adult) for a 4 day get together in Amsterdam. We were impressed by young men who ran up and down the steep stairs delivering luggage! We were offered a welcome drink (choices from refrigerator at reception). The hospitality of the manager and staff was memorable! A vase of pretty fresh flowers greeted us in a very cosy, clean room with three narrow but comfortable single beds, and supplies for making coffee/tea. Excellent shower and great view of canal. Unlike many hotels, no charge for using phone cards to call home. Adequate continental breakfast included. Great location, places to eat, supermarket, nearby sights, and convenient public transportation just outside the hotel, if needed. Bells of the nearby church chime every 15 minutes may awaken light sleepers - we slept soundly most nights. I felt so comfortable and at home that I stayed 3 extra days at the Nadia instead of moving to the Marriott to meet friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: ginkoOopNorth
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the main attraction of the hotel is the staff. Our main contact was a charming young lady - multilingual - and very helpful. Bags are carried up the VERY steep stairs, a drink is offered and bags are looked after before check-in and after check out time. We were upgraded to a triple room so I can't comment on the size of the doubles - however room 3 itself is not brilliant. Sited under a glass canopy of the shops below, the canopy directs traffic noise up to the windows (trams) tho' we were so tired that it wasn't a problem. The room was clean, tho one bedcover had a cigarette burn in it (this must be old as smoking has been banned for some time I think). The shower was very good and roomy. The room itself had a very DIY look to it, 'panelled' throughout in dark varnished plywood (like a gloomy boat interior) with odd things like a clothes rail screwed into a redundant corner. 2 single beds were there instead of a double in an alcove which gave no clearance up the side of either bed. The breakfast room was very nice. If you are lucky you might get the canal view or that of the Anne Frank neighbouring church (see photo). Access by tram is easy from the station, and is within minutes walk of Dam square, for many other tram links. Eats were recommended t- he Kantjil and Tijger Indonesian restaurant 10 mins walk away - good and inexpensive. 44 Euro for a rijstafel for two.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: drbls101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nadia for 2 nights for my mother's birthday. I had mentioned it was her birthday in an email with Nadia and as soon as we arrived the man at the front desk wished her a happy birthday and there was a bouquet of flowers in the room!! The first thing you do notice is the crazy steep stairs, but it's no big deal really. The beds were small and the water pressure wasn't so good, but really it was a great hotel, I was nervous when I booked it because you never know, but it turned out great. The breakfast is pretty good too.. typical European, cheese, bread, etc.. but it was included! which was nice. The bathroom was very clean and cute with the pink towels.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay just as nice as the 1st!”
Reviews.Author: serah_rah
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at Hotel Nadia! The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff makes this hotel worth the return. Our first stay was very pleasant. The rooms are quite small, but we are in EUR afterall. The beds are firm and the sheets are clean and crisp...very nice! However, some updating would be an improvement. Just some light colored paint to brighten up the rooms. The managment is very accommodating with a friendly eagerness to please. Plus, the fresh bouque of flowers with a welcome-back message was a very comforting touch. Thanks Nadia!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money with a personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: luvshoes26
Reviews.Content: The proprietor and his family could not do enough for us during our stay. He even managed to get us a hotel reservation for eight people on a busy Friday night for at a fantastic traditional Dutch restaurant. Continental breakfast was provided until 10.30am and you could visit the Breakfast Room all day for complimentary tea and coffee. Our room had four single beds which meant the children could stay in the same room, this is uncommon in Amsterdam. The hotel has nearby bus, canal boat and tram line stops and our room had a beautiful view over The Westerkirk. Sara's Pancake House next door was a favourite with both the kids and adults alike, and the De Struisvogel resturant on neighbouring Keizergaten was delicious!!! Highly recomended - it's not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination, but sincerely all you could want for a short break in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mauzie2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Very clean and very welcoming too. Took our luggage to our rooms and gave a welcome drink. The most amazing help when my son-in-law was ill. They arranged for him to have a doctor visit him, made chicken soup for him and made sure he was looked after with regard to medication and drinks. This hotel showed us that they are prepared to look after their guests in anyway they can. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great breakfast loved amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mariasamad1
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Nadia.As previously said, very freindly and nothing was to much trouble the room was very well equiped but very small.We were greeted with a welcome drink,offererd a hairdryer or a plug to adapt to your own,we even herd some other guest were offererd to use an umbrella.Dont think we could of asked for much more than Nadia Hotel.Hotel Nadia is not the ritz but has an awful lot to offer,it was spottlessly clean,and great value for money.We found amsterdam very expensive,larger,Â£5 a pint,magners Â£6.50.and all eating places expensive to,but this was not to spoil our trip around wounderful amsterdam,we made great use of an irish bar for they had two happy hours,i can't remember the name but it was in Warmoeestraat ,a street running off dam square and that worked out great also i would highly recommend a chinese restaraunt just doors away from the pub was called SI-CHAN 17 warmoeestraat.This restaurant was very cheap, the meals were large and you got free rice and prawn crackers.Oh yeh i almost forgot the breakfast was lovely tooat this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jontiw
Reviews.Content: Once we got over the steep stairs we found the hotel to be everything it promised on its website. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a clean, mid priced and very central hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “ideal for midweek break”
Reviews.Author: mel212
Reviews.Content: just come back from the nadia hotel and we were very pleased with it. the room had everything we needed, fridge,safe tea and coffee and i was offered a hairdryer. shower had plenty ov hot water. the room was lovely and warm. the breakfast room was lovely and the food was good. the owners and staff were very friendly and nothing was to much trouble.i would recommend this hotel to anyone as long as they were fit enough to climb stairs because they are very steep, but not impossable. we will be staiyng there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rfarnsworth
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the Hotel Nadia - a small but perfectly-formed hotel in a location that couldn't be more central for visiting the prime attractions of Amsterdam. The staff were unfailingly friendly, offering us a welcome drink upon arrival and upgrading us from a standard room to a room with a balcony. On most occasions they had our room key ready for us by the time we had climbed the stairs (more on those later...). While the room was small, it was typical of Amsterdam hotel rooms - and come on, are you really going to spend all day in your room? I think not. It was absolutely spotless and you could have bounced a coin off the sheets. The cleaner even folded our clothes. As many other reviewers have mentioned, there is a formidable flight of stairs to negotiate before arriving at reception, so is unlikely to be suitable for disabled travellers or those with small children. However, the staff are happy to carry your bags up for you and will also allow you to leave your bags in their luggage room if you have a late flight and wish to do some last-minute sightseeing. We had not expected breakfast when booking so were pleased to find it was free - and very good indeed. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Nadia and would not hesitate to recommend it to others visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: iseeLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from Dam Square - there are a number of other one and two star properties in the same 'block'. I stayed in a single room which was tiny but perfectly fine for a two night stay, and considering the rate I paid it would be churlish to complain. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia is great”
Reviews.Author: zacosis
Reviews.Content: I searched quite a bit of time for a hotel in Antwerp. I wanted to be in a good location, but not too far away from the train station. Here are the elements about the Nadia which I liked: *Friendly *Clean *Free Wi-fi (I found that in other parts of Europe, it was 20 Euro a day) *Very close to the "9 Little Streets" neighborhood which features great independent coffee, food, beer, etc. The only downside (not for me) would be the very steep stairs to get up to the Nadia hotel. For those with health issues, this would be a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “good frendly hotel secure and comfortable for all ppl worldwide”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hello all who read this reveiw me and and my feionce are from scotland and have visited the dam 4 times on this occaision we stayed at nadiashotel because it had balconys for smoking on ,ideal so i booked in when we got there at the main door you buz in threw cctv buzer go up 20 stairs to recepion which will be a blonde haired lady or the other lady which was blonde to and ther is a porter in normal clothes to help with your bags if you want she will ofer you a welcom drink as you book in fill your card in and register ,the rooms are small but just right for the space used you will have cable tv phone on wall fridge shower and balcony o ye and welcom flowers and yes they spell it as welcom on the card there is 24hr security reception on the desk and cameras in all hallways very safe and secure place for ppl but you can here ppl walking past in the hallway sometimes thats the only little flaw but overall good place for ppl to stay

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home to family”
Reviews.Author: andywarholNewYork
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old daughter and I stayed at Hotel Nadia one night and day on our way back to the US from South Africa. Our primary purpose in Amsterdam was to go to the Anne Frank House and tour a bit. We chose Hotel Nadia because it is 1/2 block from the Anne Frank House (we could see the Anne Frank House from our hotel window!). I mentioned when booking that it happened to be my daughter's birthday, and when we arrived, there was a stunning flower arrangement in a glass vase. Osam had upgraded us to a triple room on a canal (three single beds, which my daughter loved!) Osam and his staff greeted us like long lost family when we checked in and made a fuss over my daughter. We immediately felt comfortable and taken care of. We found the room to be more than enough room. It was very clean. The continental breakfast buffet is tasty (yogurt, toast, cake and fruit) and is enough food to fuel your morning of touring Amsterdam. We will return to Hotel Nadia the next time we are in Amsterdam. Osam and his staff treat their guests top notch. The location is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. Best of all, however, is the personal service. My daughter will never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia was Fantastic, exceeding my expectations”
Reviews.Author: lmcmann
Reviews.Content: I booked the Nadia through last minute.com where I'd seen some good reviews, but its never until you've been that you can judge for yourself. I am pleased to say that it more than exceeded my expectations. The staff were absolutely brilliant, SO helpful. They couldn't have done anymore. The room was compact but cosy, it also had good facilities with coffee, tea, good heating controls etc. Clean and very comfy bed. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: giladkro
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice simple hotel that is close to the center and yet far enough from all the mess - Hotel Nadia is the place for you! With reasonable prices, clean and organized rooms and, above all, a very warm and welcoming staff and manager - That is, without a doubt, the hotel to stay in. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Started off as a nice break”
Reviews.Author: eileenmcm1966
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were warmly welcomed and offered drinks on the house. Our case was taken to our room which was overlooking the canal on the first floor. Yes the stairs are scary but ok if you are generally fit and well. It was very cold at that time of year but the room was well heated and cosy. Actually reminded me of a ships cabin with the wood panelling and it had lovely (Tunisian?) glass shades which gave off a lovely warm light. Bathroom was small but everything clean and well appointed. We were planning a trip back in the summer with our children and had intended to stop at the hotel again. However we wont be returning for the following reason. Whilst there it was my birthday and my husband gave me a lovely new Sony camera. I didn't use it as wanted to read the instructions etc. when we got home. We duly packed our cases and left them in the room as instructed. Came to collect them later and didnt check the case as we assumed it had been in secure storage. Got home and the camera was gone. Not accidental as the case I bought for it was also gone. I have tried to email the hotel (3 times now) with no response. Has left a sour taste in my mouth. I think there might be a light fingered member of staff here or someone who has access to the baggage store who helps themselves to bags. Either way we have reported to the insurers and to the police in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: nadia053
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in the nadia a number of times i have always had first class treatment there from the staff very clean hotel the breakfast is out of this world .overall it is really a home from home.i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone yours sincerely geoffrey henry

Reviews.Title: “NewYear'Eve in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: giulis75
Reviews.Content: 5 stars staying! Nadia Hotel is situated 300 meters from Dam square (the heart of downtown) and all the main attractions (Anne Frank House, Madame Toussaud Museum, etc etc). The room was very clean, the breakfast very good and the crew..they were EXCELLENT. They are 24 hours at disposal of clients.They suddendly called me back when i wrote to ask more info. Everytime extremely kind with all of us. I suggest this Hotel to everyone who wants to stay in the centre with no expansive rates and.... if u wanna feel like home..welcome to the Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: travel_mad83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia with my partner and two friends over 2008 New Year. I booked the hotel mainly due to its location - it is about 5 mins walk behind Dam Square which is great for being able to pop back throughout the day amongst the sightseeing. The Nadia is very warm and welcoming. The stairs on arrival looked daunting but after using them a few times you soon get used to them. The room was very small but it was fine, functional, warm & comfortable. It was also very clean and the room was cleaned daily. I can't fault the Nadia, price location and hospitality were excellent and we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly and perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: kingoubleck
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for New Year 2008 and decided to stay at the Hotel Nadia for the third time. Before considering the Hotel Nadia you must consider Amsterdam as a whole. It is a vibrant beautiful city but not the most accessible at times. If you are deciding on which hotel to stay at and are concerned about the size or layout of the hotel then you simply must realise that this is Amsterdam and everything is condensed. With that in mind on with the review.... The Hotel Nadia is quite simply the most friendly hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. The staff are always approachable and will always greet you with a friendly hello. Nothing is too much to ask from them and they have given us some great advice and help over the years. When you arrive at the Hotel you will be greeted not only by a friendly member of staff but also a daunting stairway up into the main reception area. I can not sum up just how daunting the stairs are at first but as mentioned before this is Amsterdam and everywhere is like that here. But I promise you that you do get used to the stairs and the staff are always willing to shuttle your luggage up for you. Once you are up the stairs you are greeted with a complimentary drink (much needed!) We were also greeted in our room by a fantastic bouquet of flowers welcoming us back "home" and its really apt as staying here is like staying with friends more than staying in a hotel. The rooms are small (again like most hotels in Amsterdam) but furnished wonderfully with some really quirky features. Everything you need in your room is there (Shower, WC, Fridge, Safe, TV with tons of channels etc) but the best rooms are ones with a balcony as the view is tremendous as you can see the stunning Westerkerk from your room but also the canal that runs alongside the building. The location is perfect as its central enough to make most important sights a mere five minute walk (Anne Frank House, Red Light District, Dam Square) and also slap bang in the middle of two supermarkets and a load of little cafes and restaurants that are also reasonably priced as they are slightly off the beaten track. There are also some lovely boutique shops two minutes away along the canal. It is the safest hotel we have ever stayed in too, Amsterdam can be quite boisterous at times what with stag weekends etc but thankfully Nadia is a family hotel that avoids the usual tourist groups due to its location. The hotel manager is also a great security plus in the hotel as he is a lovely man but you certainly wouldnâ€™t want to get on the wrong side of him!! Breakfast is more than acceptable offering coffee, juices, teas, bread, toast, croissants and various cakes. The breakfast room itself is a sight to behold as it is beautiful. We have dietary requirements when staying in a hotel and this was and never has been a problem for us in the Nadia. All in all I have nothing to say other than good things about the Hotel Nadia. If you are looking for a flashy sterile five star hotel then this probably isnâ€™t the place for you. But if you are looking for a safe, reasonably priced friendly hotel with awesome five star staff and a wonderful location then I strongly suggest booking the Nadia ASAP. Just donâ€™t book it when we want to stay here because I donâ€™t think we could ever stay anywhere else even if it was a five star hotel for free! We would miss the staff here far too much and it would feel like we were cheating on them! That how much we love of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gilles_M
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend the Nadia Hotel. We had a wonderful stay : a very romantic canalview room, fresh flowers, friendly staff, just a short walk from Dam sq. Hope to go back soon, I'll choose the Nadia for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: jancarballo01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nadia hotel over Christmas with my three sons and we loved everything about it! For us it was a trip tinged with sadness as my husband, (their father) died two years ago and Christmas has been a particularly hard time of year for us since. So we decided to do something completely different this year -and we are very glad we did! From the moment we arrived the welcome was very warm and friendly. Nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff. They are cheerful and helpful without being intrusive and the manager (or owner?) has a good sense of humour. The hotel is full of character and had been beautifully decorated for Christmas especially the lovely breakfast room - one real plus for me is that tea or cofee are available at any time, in the breakfast room or in your rooms. I wish there could be milk in little jugs though rather than the individual creams/whitener in foil containers but that's such a small thing. The rooms are small but perfectly comfortable and ours had a lovely canal view, with two churches also in view - one which played it's bells on the hour every hour - very quaint and Christmassy!! Dam square is just around the corner - the hotel is in the perfect position for exploring Amsterdam. We packed a lot into our four days there - Anne Frank House, Van Gogh museum, The ice cafe (not worth it) The Amsterdam Dungeon experience and ice skating outside on Christmas Day in Liedsplein square to name a few. The hotel staff recommended and booked us a lovely place to eat on Christmas day and we also found a really good Spanish tapas bar/restaurant called Casa Don Pedro just along the road. If you like Spanish food go here - it was excellent. This hotel is well worth the price we paid and we will visit again. In fact my son is planning to return in February! Oh yes - I nearly forgot - the resident cats, 'Hello' and 'Goodbye' were also one of the highlights! Very cuddly and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: redman183
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights at the NADIA in Dec 2008. Excellent hotel with OSAM the manager leading the team of very friendly staff. Nothing was any trouble to any of them, a credit to themselves!! We will definetly use this hotel again should we visit Amsterdam. The only downside to our trip were the prices of the beer.......eg, 2 x pints of guinness 16 euros??? ridiculous. Amsterdam will need to seriously lower its very extortionate beer prices to attract our custom again!!! Dont hesitate to book into the NADIA tho, although small rooms, top service guaranteed!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tutey
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was great. I spent the weekend there with my boyfriend. It was really close to Dam Square and easy to find. The staff were great all the way through our stay, really friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure we were enjoying our stay. They carried our bags to the room and we had free welcome drinks. The room was small as expected but it was clean, warm and comfortable. I will definitely stay at Hotel Nadia when I visit Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: backpacker13
