Reviews.Content: Charming hotel right in the middle of everything. Reception and other staff were very welcoming and even gave us welcome drinks! Little touches like carrying our bags to our room, welcome drinks, personal recommendations about where to dine etc make this hotel fantastic! I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody, and the central location just tops it off!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully charming place”
Reviews.Author: Abigail79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed 3 nights at the Nadia and could not have been happier with our experience. The woman working the reception desk when we arrived was warm and helpful, and our bags were waiting in our room for us by the time we finished checking in. Our room was very small but the wardrobe and plentiful shelving made it feel bigger. The lighting and decor were both very cute -- overall it was incredibly cozy and comfortable, and it could not have been cleaner (same for the bathroom). The breakfast room was delightful, too -- especially since it was decorated for Christmas. There were several ladies working to make sure there was also fresh coffee and juice. The entire staff were always friendly and helpful -- they helped us arrange for a shuttle service to the airport at the end of our visit, and helped us down with our bags. Security at the hotel is very good -- they monitor the always-locked front door via camera and don't allow in anyone who is not a registered guest, so you can be comfortable that there's never anything too shady going on in the rooms around you. The hallways smelled pretty strongly of cigarette smoke at times, which didn't bother us since our room never smelled smoky at all. But people who are extremely sensitive to cigarette smoke might be bothered. Our room was on the interior side of the building (not directly exposed to the street) so outside sound was no problem whatsoever. I do think the walls between the rooms and the hallway must be very thin, because we could hear people passing by and/or talking in the hallway very clearly. It was never particularly bothersome but if we had visited at a more crowded time of year it might have gotten annoying. Though you can always sleep with earplugs. The location could also not have been better -- it is very close to Dam Square but just enough out of the bustle and mayhem that you are able to really relax. We discovered a number of wonderful restaurants and bars within a 5-10 minute walk of the hotel. Overall we were thrilled with the Nadia, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rkpreston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nadia for two nights. It is, essentially, a small hotel that appears to be family run and is not directed toward the business traveller. There is no doorman at the curb and there is no place to stop your car an unload. I imagine most guests arrive by train and walk or take a cab or bus from the station. We had a car but did not want to have access to it. The hotel contacted a car park service and charged us 50 Euro for two nights. The hotel is well situated for those who want to tour the town. It is located between two of the inner canals and one side of the hotel faces the canal and the other faces a major arterial for the city center. The Jordaan neighborhood is quite close as is Dam Square, the Anne Frank House and other attractions. Great shopping and restaurants are nearby. The main street in front of the hotel is a little shabby but very busy with trams, traffic and pedestrians. There are two or three other even more modest hotels in the same building. You have to find the sign and ring the bell to be buzzed in. The hotel lobby is two flights up a very steep staircase. The staff is helpful and insisted on grabbing our suitcases and pulling them up the stairs. The lobby is very small and is not an area where you would hang out. The manager offered us a beverage (bottled water, can of coke etc.) from a fridge as we checked in. The hotel restaurant is on the same level as the lobby and it has a view over the canal and the Western Church. The food was good and plentiful but the room was a little cramped for the number of guests at the hotel. Our room was very small but it had a great balcony overlooking the main street with a view to the canal. I have posted several photos. The hotel does have free wifi and basic television. Only CNN in English. It also has a mini fridge that is empty for your use. The mattress on the bed was plastic lined which was uncomfortable for me as it did not breathe. I think it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Experience at Nadia Hotel - 11/20/08 to 12/2/08”
Reviews.Author: carnation8
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have been all over the world but our vacation in Amsterdam at the Nadia Hotel has been by far the best ever yet! Nadia Hotel is centrally located in downtown Amsterdam - just walking distance to the Ann Frank House, the Dam Square, the Central Station, Kalverstraat, the deBijenkorf department store, and pretty much all of downtown Amsterdam. Our bedroom overlooked the canal, wich I believe would be a stunning view during the summer, but given the weather situation during our visit, was still a sight to behold. The charming little kitchen (with a balcony and overlooking the canal), serves breakfast from 7:30 to 10:30. Breakfast was something we never missed as it made dining so much more enjoyable. What a way to start your day! Mr. Osam, the owner, and his wonderful staff, were always at our beck and call. Their boundless hospitality made leaving Nadia Hotel even much more difficult. My sister always said that she would never go back to the same place twice, but given the royal treatment we received, she would make an exception to this case. We would definitely recommend Nadia Hotel to all future travelers, if they make Amsterdam their next vacation choice. For me, this hotel deserves a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wings_of_isis
Reviews.Content: A big Thank You to the owner and staff of Nadia Hotel. This hotel is clean, safe, cozy, and romantic. It is in a great location, so walking to many places of interest is easy and fun. Even though I liked the hotel very much, my favorite part about it (besides the cleanliness and overall pleasing atmosphere) is the superb staff. They are very friendly, helpful, and generous. I am especially grateful to the owner and his very kind and respectful son. They were both gracious. So even though the room was small, and yes, the staircase is steep, I will always stay at this hotel when visiting Amsterdam, and have already highly recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: fayeCoWestmeath
Reviews.Content: this is our second trip to the nadia hotel, the stairs was daunting at first but the staff carried our bags up and down, we got used to it. the personal touch of flowers to welcome us and a spotless, warm room, with lovely view. the staff are very helpfull, friendly and welcoming. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to dam square and the tram stops just up from it. thanks to all at the nadia for a very comfortable stay, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: valevince
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay in Hotel Nadia.it is in a typical dutch building and otherwise it's not so big it's a very nice and cosy hotel.staff is very helpfull and gentle and does its best to satisfy the clients.the hotel is convenient located close to Anna Frank Museum not far then 150mt and 300 mt to dam square and shops.i really suggest this hotel to everyone would like to stay in a warm atmosphere in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetg12651
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eight day stay at Nadia. This was my fourth stay at Nadia in two years. The hotel is very conveniently situated - 5 min. walk from Dam Square, 10 min, from Centraal Station, Tram 14 stops in front of hotel, the Anne Frank House is 1-1/2 blocks away. Although the rooms are small and the stairs are steep and numerous, the rooms very clean, and quite cozy. Each room is equipped with a fridge, TV, safe, and free WIFI . They serve a more than adequate continental breakfast in the charming breakfast room. If you desire a more substantial breakfast, Sara's Pancake House next door has wonderful pancakes and omelets. The best selling point for Nadia is the 4-star service you receive in this 2-star hotel from the wonderful staff and manager, Osam. They are most helpful in providing information about the city and no request is too much for them. They treat each and every one of their guests as royalty. I highly recommend Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: jsturgis
Reviews.Content: The location is great...you can easily walk to Centraal Station in about 10 minutes. The staff was very nice and helpful with directions to different places around the city. The rooms are really small- almost like staying in a train car! But if you are not planning to spend a lot of time in the room it is fine. The room was clean and quiet- I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the nutty 6!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spikedog123
Reviews.Content: we stayed for weekend and had great time hotel was nice and central. when we arrived and seen stairs we had to climb we nearly died but you get used to climbing them. staff were so friendly carrying all our bags up stairs for us and we were able to leave them after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very small room”
Reviews.Author: cplnguy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Walking distance to so many attractions in Amsterdam. You can hear the bells of the Westkerk from your hotel room. However, I found the bathroom extremely small. It was like being in an airplane bathroom. There also appeared to be some sort of plumbing problem which resulted in a foul odor coming from the bathroom. Housekeeping was able to temporarily improve this problem, but the odor returned the next day. The staff was very friendly and helpful, except for one instance where the front desk disconnected my friend who was trying to call me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel. 5 minutes walk from Dam Square.”
Reviews.Author: JamboSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Rooms very cosy, clean and warm. Ideal for travellers who like a decent base to work from. Rooms are on the small side and basic facilities offered. Central location only 5 minutes walk from the Dam Square. Friendly staff available all times. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bentayfun
Reviews.Content: The place of hotel is excellent. You can reach city centre by walking in a couple of minutes. The personnel of the hotel is very warm. I like it very much and I advice everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nookieknight
Reviews.Content: very enjoyable stay for both me and my girlfriend....had a lovly little room overlooking the canal. The hotel can best be described as quaint...its comfortable and clean but by far the biggest highlight was the service. Honestly the staff are very friendly and try to be as helpful as possible. its a 15 minute walk to the train station but the location is very central, next to dam square ten mins to red light and 15 mins to ledisplein square. Definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Holdik
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for reasonable price. Nice view to a canal ;-). I would like to thanks for great hospitality. Our stay in Amsterdam was great also because of this hotel in its â€œcrewâ€� :-).

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: PersoHam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a charming place to stay at the center of Amsterdam. Lovely small rooms but well equiped with comfortable bathroom (we stayed in room 7). Nice view on the Westerkerk and Keizersgracht. Warm welcome (nice flowers), friendly staff and good breakfast. Many highlights of Amsterdam on walking distance. The hotel is not suitable for disabled people because of the steep stairway. Remark : window(s) may need a replacement (difficult to open/close).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pelotravelling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a nice hotel in Amsterdam, close to the city center. It is very easy to get there from the airport by train an tramway. The rooms contain everything a visitor could need and if there is anything you need on top of the available, the manager and his staff are extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming. The rooms are very clean and the whole equipment is maintained with accuracy.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: Ratz64
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed again very friendly and warm. They gave me the feeling being at home. Nadia is a very nice and familial hotel, they fulfilled all my wishes, helped and gave very good hints of Amsterdam. My next stay in Amsterdam is for sure again at Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rudiwitsch
Reviews.Content: We loved it! The staff is very friendly and the rooms clean and cosy! The location is very central with nice views on a canal and perfect for exploring Amsterdam. Really a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Could'nt be more helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Richie0908
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel and it's staff especially ''Osam''(manager) were most friendly and helpful. As there was eight of us (4 couples) staying all the rooms were different, small, clean but comfortable. Breakfast was continental and plenty of it. The only draw back would be the stairs (not suitable for elderly) but this was not a problem for us even-though we had a room on the top floor. Ideally located close to Anne Frank's house, Dam square and Canal boat pickup Central Station 10 minutes on Tram would have no problem recommending this hotel. Richie. Sept /08 Waterford Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia gets better every time.”
Reviews.Author: Gwynionydd
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit and the welcome we get at the Nadia makes us feel as if we are visiting a Home from Home. All the staff seem to get along so well with each other and this is reflected in they way they treat their guests. Hopefully I can vsit there again while I am still young enough to climb the stairs!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Nadia!”
Reviews.Author: joeninho
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The maid service was above and beyond the call of duty. The room was spotless and the heating was great which is important in wintertime. Nice and toasty when you get home after a night on the town. We would recommend the Nadia and will definitely be returning. There is a reason we did not give 5 stars. We booked a delux room. There were flowers in the room on arrival but there wasn't that little extra touch. In comparable hotels we have had things like chocolates on the pillow or a bottle of wine on arrival. This is not a complaint! Just explaining why its not 5 stars to us. Maybe we've been spoiled. Who knows? We loved the Nadia and will be booking here whenever we return to Amsterdam. Thanks again for a great stay guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SouthportSouthport
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a two night enjoyable stay at the Nadia Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel and the staff are warm and welcoming nothing was too much trouble at anytime of the day. We had a lovely double room at the front of the hotel with our own balcony.For a two star hotel it was exceptional would rate it higher. We would definately stay there again. It was close to Dam Square and the major sites of the city everything was within walking distance, there are a couple of nice bars near to the hotel. Everything about this hotel was excellent and we would have no hesitation to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best Accommodation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kostaAlexandria
Reviews.Content: i think it's the best hotel u can ever stay in it, very nice, cosy, very clean, the service is great, staff are so friendly , location is max 3 min from the centre(dam square), over all , i really recommend it for anyone who will think about spend a nice holiday in amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hollsx2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam many times before, at a wide variety of hotels, but this was our first stay at the Nadia .....and it won't be our last! From the very onset of our stay, the hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly and really couldn't do more for us. We arrived early so our room wasn't ready but the Nadia is more than happy to look after your belongings until your room is available. Be advised, like many hotels in Amsterdam, the Nadia has very steep stairs and no lift, but once again the hotel staff insist on carrying your cases up and down any stairs for you, making life much easier. Remember to leave your cases at the bottom of the stairs when you first arrive (reception is on the first floor) and they will collect them for you. The hotel is very well situated. It is directly across the street from Westekerk (near Anne Frank's house) and trams stop there regularly throughout the day (although Amsterdam is best experienced by foot - there are some great finds down the little side streets) It is a few minutes walk to some of the best shopping areas in the city. Our modest room was very clean, comfortable and had everything we would need for our three night stay. Breakfast (breads cheese, cakes, croissants, yoghurt, juice and tea or coffee) takes place in a lovely balcony breakfast room where again the staff are very helpful and friendly. We celebrated our first wedding anniversary while we were there and the staff left a beautiful bouquet of flowers for us - we believe it is the touches like this that make a hotel stand out amongst the rest and helped to make our stay so enjoyable. When we next plan a visit to Amsterdam we will phone the hotel directly for their special deals as advised by the hotel staff. A lovely hotel and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: mikeytiger
Reviews.Content: Second time at Hotel Nadia and again everything was perfect! Location is great, just a view minutes walk to feel the vibe of the city. Staff did everything to make our stay as pleasant as possible. We will for sure come back to Amsterdam..........and will stay again then at Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPresh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at the Nadia. Yes, the rooms are very compact but they are very clean and have all the usual facilities and the location is great - just a stone's throw from the Anne Frank House and a few minutes walk from Dam square. The staff were extrememly friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble for them. For the location and service the hotel is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “cosy spot”
Reviews.Author: jarusa
Reviews.Content: Good, central location. Cosy room , excellent shower. Clean. Secure. Welcoming staff, especially kind to our child. Great coffee, good breakfast....a long wait for croissants at times. Some traffic noise at the front and single-glazed windows do not provide sound-proofing and are thermally inefficient. Very nice touch - bouquet of flowers sent to room on arrival, usually unheard of in a 2 star hotel. No hassle exit, kept luggage in room until we needed to leave town after check-out. Would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Friendly attentive and clean”
Reviews.Author: Vivalavaca75
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest hotel... the rooms were very small but well set up so that you had the feeling that they were larger. The rooms themselves were nicely decorated... we had a room with a balcony which is a must in Amsterdam! The staff could not have been friendlier and they were attentive to our every need... There was construction outside and they offered to switch us to another room (it was not really that much of a bother so we stayed) Overall I could not have been happier and I will stay here every time I come to Amsterdam.. Hotel Nadia I love you! I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in, from Emer in Dublin!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmerInDublin
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel is a lovely hotel to stay in for a weekend away!! The location of the hotel is very central only 3 mins walk to the Dam Square where there you will find bars and restaurants and shops, The staff are very friendly and kind and will help you with anything you need, the rooms are clean and tidy and have everything you need in your room, I have stayed there twice this year and I can say that I will be definitely back again!! I loved the Nadia Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cockmad
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived at nadia hotel to the time we left the hotel we had the most relaxing time nothing was any trouble. We asked for extra pillows they were there, we asked advise they were very forthcoming.Staff are very helpful even carried our bags up the very steep stairs.Rooms are kept very clean and towels are changed daily. I would recommend that anyone traveling to amsterdam should seriously check this hotel out it is well worth a stay. TOP MARKS YOU GUYS AND THANKS AGAIN FOR A WONDERFUL WEEKEND FROM CAROLYN AND SIMON (ROOM 312)

Reviews.Title: “querky hotel - love the stairs”
Reviews.Author: JKC45
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the door way under the arcade I pressed the door entry buzzer, and the door lock was released, we started to walk up the stairs, an oh boy were they steep - but then it was a traditional Amsterdam building and I knew it would have steep stairs - it was one of the reasons we choose to stay there. A lovely surprise was the bouquet of fresh flowers in the room. The shower room was very economical with space, but all aspects, shower, toilet and sink were in working order and clean. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: SteenTina
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home to Denmark from a 3 night stay at the hotel Nadia. It was very good and the location was central, we had a good canal view - we stayed in a deluxe twin bed room. The staff there was so great and extremely helpful. loved the flowers there was in the room on arrival. Even though the room was a bit small , it was charming and had everything we needed. Very good value for money and we will definately come back another time. Best regards Steen and Tina

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: DDH11
Reviews.Content: The hotal had been recommended by a friend. The stairs are steep as you go in but the staff are on hand to carry the bags. The service was very firendly and helpful. The room was cramped but comfortable. The welcoming flowers were a lovely touch. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommy96
Reviews.Content: Just had a two night stay at the Hotel Nadia in Amsterdam. The hotel was lovely, near Dam Square and on good bus/tram routes. The hotel staff were all very helpful and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again next time I go to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “simple good”
Reviews.Author: BRUNOZagrebHrvatska
Reviews.Content: If we come back in Amsterdam we will stay again at hotel Nadia. Manager and personal were excellent , helpful and very friendly . Hotel has warm atmosphere is nice and you feel like at home.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a canal view”
Reviews.Author: intrepid_traveller24
Reviews.Content: Located within 10 minutes walking distance of the Dam this quaint hotel offered us comfort and ambience. After roaming along the canals for hours it was such a relief to get back to our room. Here, we could could relax on our beds and watch the passing traffic. Boats, small and large, old and new, slid pass our window along the Keizers Gracht canal while bikes with odd attachments to carry kids or shopping plied the canal roadsides. Our room was clean, adequate in size, beds slightly narrow but comfortable with a bar fridge and coffee/tea making facilities which we did not have in most hotels in Germany, Switzerland and France. A substantial continental breakfast was included - cheeses, meats, jams, bread, toast, coffee, tea. We ate in a breakfast room high above the street with views to the canal. The staff were friendly and helpful. Nadia is located across the canal from the Westerkerk where a carillon rings every 15 minutes. We did have ear plugs but we liked the sound and it seemed to merge into the background after a day or so. We stayed for 7 nights. The cost of a room with a canal view is extra and you need to request this when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jaiden82
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was better than we expected. Although the room was a little small, it's more than enough to be like home. All the staff was very friendly and helpfull. We are returning to this hotel every time will go to Amsterdam. 100% recomendated: clean, close to the city centre, homelike, great staff,...

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave7702
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is an excellent hotel in the heart of Amsterdam, right around the corner from the Anne Frank House and within walking distance of numeruos sights including Dam Square, the RLD, Centraal Station, and countless shops and restaurants. I booked one of the doubles that comes with a balcony. Free wireless was also a definite plus. I booked my stay for 6 nights through the hotel directly and they respond very quickly. Note that they normally offer a 6% discount if you pay in cash. My rate was around 670E for 6 nights so a great price for the location and service. The onyl drawback is the size of the rooms, but a visitor should use the same mentality as in New York City...if you are spending that much time in your hotel room that the size of the room becomes an issue, you are not having a good vacation. In the end, safe, clean and amazingly reasonably priced hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. Can't be beat. Note that at the moment there's scaffolding and a large screen on the canal side...not sure how much of an effect this has but for balconies on the street side there was no noticeable difference as there is no screen.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: Pices_in_SF
Reviews.Content: With the exchange rate what it is for us Americans, I was really looking for a good value, and got it at Hotel Nadia. And the staff is very friendly. As you'd expect, the rooms are nothing fancy, but provided a good sleep. I asked for a quiet room, and got it ! Much quieter than expected, given the buzz of the city, cable cars, etc. I liked that the rooms have a frig, TV, safe, and remodeled bathrooms. However, the shower head spray in room 518 is a bit interesting / difficult --- No complaints at all on the WC in the first night's room. (we started and ended our trip with 1-night in Amsterdam); As you have probably already read, there is no elevator. The staff helps with the bags, thank goodness. Please know for older people or those who are not active at all, the stairs can be tiring -- We were on the top floor; that's 73 curvy steps up. At 40 yrs old, I'm glad that I was hitting the gym, before the trip ! Of course there are rooms on lower levels, but still more stairs than one typically climbs in the U.S. It's hard for me to rate it, as my only other hotel experience (over the past 8-yrs) has been at a much more expensive hotel. For this category of hotel, I recommend Hotel Nadia to anyone looking for a value in my favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably friendly staff - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Babyjan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - service beyond our wildest dreams. Osam and his staff was really friendly, helpful and accommodating. They treated our children like royalty for our short stay, and we really appreciate that. The steps up to reception look daunting, but it adds to the authenticity of the building in my view. The only downside was the weather, and I can't blame the hotel for that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Compact but cosy”
Reviews.Author: Lashes83
Reviews.Content: The hotels website is a little misleading as the pictures seem to have been taken with a special magnifying lens which makes the rooms appear a lot bigger. So as you can imagine we were a little disappointed with the room size, particularly the shower room which was tiny. However the hotel was clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful all week. The location was excellent - right by the main square. Overall the hotel was lovely and the staff were welcoming - I would definitely recommend to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel great stay”
Reviews.Author: sirioslo
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel a ten minute walk from the central station. Location is good, exept for a bit of noice from the tram and traffic. Lots of steep stairs, but no problem if in average shape. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff that made us feel very welcome. Small rooms, but the room and bathroom was in good condition. Overall, a lot better than what you would expect from a 2 * hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great to Relax”
Reviews.Author: kzzer24
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for the weekend the hotel is in a great location just minuets walk away from Dam square. The staff were very very friendly and helped in every way they could. The room we stayed in was a little on the small side but it had everything it said it had and a great little balcony overlooking the canal. Were already talking about going back at Easter 09 and will hopefully be staying at hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Like a second home :D”
Reviews.Author: Selface84
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time staying in the Nadia Hotel :D I always go back :) Not only for the amazing service and people but for the excellent rates and cleanliness of the hotel. The staff are the most accomodating I have ever met! They really make sure they can help you at every available opportunity!! Make you feel like your at home :) Excellent hotel, they don't make em like the Nadia anymore ;) Thanks, Selena :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Katie15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Nadia for 2 nights before leaving on a cruise from Amsterdam this past May. A perfect place to stay, and the perfect location--central to everything. The Hotel staff were pleasant and most accommodating. We had a small but very clean room with a balcony--couldn't ask for more. A very enjoyable experience. Flowers were sent to our room after the staff learned when we were checking in that it was my husbands birthday. What a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Amsnad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for 4 days prior to our African Safari in Tanzania and 2 days on our return, this past September, 2008. The staff at the hotel is very friendly, caring and helpful , especially Michelle and Tess. Upon our arrival we were surprised to have a lovely welcome vase of flowers in our room! On our return visit, a "welcome back home" vase of flowers was there to greet us. Free bottled water was available whenever it was needed. This hotel is a gem with lovely rooms canalside. I highly recommend Nadia Hotel and know your stay will be very pleasant. Olivia Evans

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeles_caMarty33
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at hotel nadia. it was a great stay,the staff was helpful and friendly from start to finish, they offered complimentary drinks upon arrival. excellent location,15 minute walk from train station, 5 minute walk to Ann Franks house,5 minute to Dam Square. rooms are on the small side but very clean. I would definitelty recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Central location, polite staff but equipment needs a refreshing”
Reviews.Author: bozhura
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very central location, which is very convenient for touring around the city. The staff is very helpful and polite. However, the rooms and the bathroom are really small and the towels and the bath curtain surely need to be changed with new ones. For the price we paid (over 100 euro per night), we surely expected more. Also, if you are disabled or elderly person, or with kids, this hotel is not for you because the stairs are very tough and there is no lift. Anyway, given the overpriced hotels in Amsterdam and the overall impression from previous visitors' remarks about the tininess of most hotels there, this one can do a job for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - klein aber fein - immer wieder gern”
Reviews.Author: chillertalerin1
Reviews.Content: The first impression was that the hotel is pretty small - but really nice and typically for Amsterdam. Situated in the centre of Amsterdam you can walk around in the city and visit all the nice shopping streets and sights. Staff is very nice and if you need recommandations for shopping or something else just ask the nice guys at the reception. You can enjoy the lovely breakfast in a nice breakfast room. Rooms are rather small but everything is super-clean!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel like Home”
Reviews.Author: llcoolm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia and the staff are extremely friendly and it was a great stay I had in Hotel Nadia. It was my second trip to Amsterdam and also It was my second stay in the same hotel. It is very near to Damrak and to the center plus the service is really very conveniant. Thank you..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Franks3255
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very accomodating and polite stuff, 24h service, free WLAN, free safety box, close to city centre. Room was small.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: IBC_atendee
Reviews.Content: We just've returned from the stay at Nadia Hotel. It sure was a pleasant stay, the staff indeed do what they can to make you feel like home, and are happy to help you with any problems. I sure can recommend this hotel, because of the staff I almost felt like home ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Customer Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: csmns
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location, and the best customer service money can buy, you "must" stay at the Hotel Nadia. Upon our arrival, I realized that the stairs were a little to steep for me and my husband. Osam, the Manager of the Hotel Nadia, immediately changed the location of our room. Throughout our visit, we had several other requests that were handled with a smile and can do attitude. In addition, the rooms were very clean and well kept. Breakfast was plentiful and was served in the most charming breakfast room overlooking the city. If you ever have the opportunity, and good fortune to visit this charming city, I highly recommend the Hotel Nadia. You will not be disappointed. Mae & Richard, Los Angeles, California

Reviews.Title: “ratings from malta :)”
Reviews.Author: krt247
Reviews.Content: its the third time we stood at the nadia hotel and cannot complain, the steep stairs are a little bit of a trouble after a coffee shop night :) rooms are a bit small but the owner Mr Osama is a brilliant gentlemen with very friendly and trustful staff. highly suggested to young couples webiste is www.nadia.nl

Reviews.Title: “a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: catalannn
Reviews.Content: When we first arribed to the hotel (which we easily found, Holland is really good indicated, not as Spain) we couldn't believe the stairs. We knew there were terrible stairs there (because we came with the recomendation of my brother who stayed here a year before), nevertheless, we'd never seen such high steps (but during the week, we saw this kind of steps are everywhere in Amsterdam). However, the staff are so nice they carried our luggagge up at the moment we arribed. The breakfast is good, I falled in love with the breakfast room and its views. The rooms are confortable and the cleaning is very good. I'd like to thank the staff of the hotel because they were very nice and hepled us by telling how to get to everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended for a 2-star hotel - can't wait to go back !”
Reviews.Author: DamLoverHalifax
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 nights with the wife at the Nadia and loved it. The hotel is very well situated for eveything really, just a short walk to Dam Square, The Jordaan, Anne Frank House, RLD, Spui square etc. Trams run directly outside the hotel and also just out of the hotel to the right for trams towards the museums and Leidseplein. The hotel itself is excellent for a 2 star rated hotel. The rooms are small, but we expected that and booked a room with a balcony so we could sit out with a coffee. I would recommend this, it's not that much extra. As has been said previously, the stairs are very steep, but the staff do carry your luggage up and down for you. We were also able to leave our bags when we arrived early in the morning and they were delivered to our room when we checked in later. Breakfast is included, which was fine for our purposes - a coffee and juice and maybe a croissant just to set us up for our next day out round Amsterdam. However, for me, the best thing about the hotel was the friendliness and hospitality of the staff. They were unfailingly cheerful, polite and helpful. On the morning of our departure the gentleman on reception even went and set up the breakfast room an hour early so we could have something to eat before leaving. We will be back next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Americanfriends5
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of five couples that stayed at Hotel Nadia in early August 2008. We all loved the hotel. It is not for everyone but if you are looking for a well-located, clean, friendly place to stay, this is for you. If you have trouble climbing stairs you would be better off going someplace else as the stairs are steep and there is no elevator. The rooms are small but clean. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. I don't think any of us have ever been to a friendlier hotel. The rooms are small but have everything you need. We were there for two days before a cruise and had decided to put what we thought we would need for our Amsterdam stay in our overnight bags. That turned out to be a very good idea because of the small rooms. We stored the larger suitcase. We wanted to find a good, clean hotel that was well-located so that we could walk or take the tram and this was the perfect hotel for that. We also wanted something that was what we call a "local" type hotel and not something that was just like at home. Hotel Nadia was perfect and exceeded our expectations. We loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ek100
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at Nadia hotel. Very friendly, efficient and helpful staff, clean room and bathroom. The hotel is located in the city centre (just a short walk from lots of Amsterdam attractions) but inside it was very quiet . Would stay again at this hotel and would recommend it to my friends. Ekaterina

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: klwales
Reviews.Content: We were given a room at the front of the hotel and the noise from the traffic was horrendous for 24 hours of the day. The noise made a good night's sleep impossible and the lack of sleep significantly affected our stay in Amsterdam. The rooms really are very small indeed, but our room was clean. The staff are extremely friendly and most helpful, but light sleepers beware!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HAPPINESSIS
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly situated for our needs It is on several bus/trolley lines and is within walking distance to many churches and museums on our list. There were lots of restaurants close by plus stores and stores and stores. The hotel is located above shops and the stairs are extremely steep so it is not the best place for babies or small children and individuals not able to climb a steep staircase. They do not have an elevator but do offer to have your bags brought to your room. Our room was a typical small hotel room - and we managed quite nicely once we realized just how much space we had. Luickly they had planned well and one wall held numerous shelves which made it quite easy to live out of our suit cases and still have lots of space to put stuff we used often (cameras, backpacks, etc.) The hotel is very clean and the staff is delightful and most helpful. Breakfasts were great and the dining room is so pleasant with many hanging plants and flowers decorating the room. We felt that the hotel is a hidden gem because from the street you would have no idea that it even existed a floor above the shops.

Reviews.Title: “It is always great to feel home while abroad , great and friendly hotel ,”
Reviews.Author: alinotes
Reviews.Content: I am a travel addict I come to Amsterdam 2 time or more /year Nadia is my Only choice if they have availble room if not , I may re adjust my trip Rooms are still small ( LOL ) but everything I may need ar around up to extra such as charger of my Mobile or converor of my computer Internet is Free and of High speed I met several clints now and sometimes we arrange to meet in Nadia

Reviews.Title: “"The" hotel you want to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: swissaussie84
Reviews.Content: This is simply one of the best hotels available in Amsterdam for its price range. My girlfriend and I stayed for 2 nights in Amsterdam at hotel Nadia and after hearing nothing but horror stories about the accommodation from friends who have travelled there before we did a lot of research and decided to stay in this hotel and it was a good choice. From the moment we arrived, the staff where as helpful as possible and carried all our bags up to our room and got us sorted out with maps and information. We stayed on the top floor in a lovely room with a private balcony overlooking 2 streets and a canal. The room was clean, comfortable and decorated in a lovely traditional manner. At night the room was quiet and breakfast the following morning was excellent. The hotel is easy walking distance from the main train station and the dam is a quick stroll away so the cities nightlife is only a few minutes away. We will defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisIndy78
Reviews.Content: Pro's- Nadia has a great central location, tram stop is in front of the hotel. it's a short two minute walk to the Anne Frank house and a 10 minute walk to the square. Excellent customer service. We arrived early after an overnight flight and they went the extra mile to get us into a room right away. Room was clean and comfortable for two- had a deluxe canal view room. Secure- have to buzz to get in the hotel. Overall an excellent value and you won't find better attention to your needs anywhere else in Amsterdam. Con's- none really. Yes, the stairs are steep so if you have issues with this please take it seriously. Breakfast was good- not great. and there is a very good pancake house right next door. Overall: I would no doubt stay with Nadia again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: BCSLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, the stairs steep, but the rooms are clean and very functional. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect, close to train, bus tours, central Amsterdam, etc. This was our second stay, and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, immaculately clean, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: farnook
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last weekend. It's a funny looking place, accessed from a door on the street where you scale a mountain-like staircase to the reception. The welcome is super friendly, highly organised and we were checked-in and out on the town within ten minutes. We were also offered free drinks on arrival - nice touch. The room though was absolutely tiny. Bed pushed up against the wall and the smallest bathroom I have ever experienced. However everything worked and there were carefully thought-out features like hooks on the doors, shelves where there's no space for a bedside cabinet etc. The weather was extremely hot and the hotel has no AC but this was not a problem. It's an old, naturally cool hotel and the room was also kitted-out with a fan. We were also plagued by mosquitos on the first night - annoying but not really the fault of the hotel. Breakfast is included but hardly worth bothering with. Average coffee, juice and a mediocre selection of soggy croissants, bread rolls, cheese and preserves are all that's offered. The breakfast room is also ridiculously small! All-in-all I would recommend this place even though it's quite expensive for the facilities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful gem”
Reviews.Author: planeteer
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam to see our son perform with the Halle Youth Orchestra at a lunchtime concert in the Westerkerk. The Nadia is a charming hotel, occupying the end part of a very historic building. The location is absolutely fantastic, with the Westerkerk opposite, Anne Frank's house around the corner and the stop for the Canalbus just over the road. We had read about the friendly staff before we arrived and were not disappointed. Nothing is too much trouble for this family. They are welcoming, provide valuable tourist information and go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. It is true that the rooms are snug - my husband felt that he was in the cabin on a ship! Everything is there to hand though - tv, fridge, fan and a safety deposit box, which is invaluable in a city hotel. Everything is perfectly kept, with fresh towels daily. The owners seem to know exactly what makes a difference to customers and the service reflects that. Breakfasts were good, with fresh juice and the usual continental fayre. The dining room is in period style, with lots of plants and fresh flowers. It too is tiny for the number of rooms, but seems to be able to accommodate the people it serves and we never had to wait on the three days of our stay. What is not to like about the Nadia? The only problem could be the stairs for the less mobile. They are certainly a challenge, but help to burn off the calories and are good exercise! Staff anticipate difficulties and carry bags etc., so the only thing you have to worry about is yourself. This is Amsterdam and the Nadia reflects the typical style of the buildings! We had a lovely stay, would definitely stay here again and will recommend the Nadia to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - great for family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: kn0wmad
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Nadia with our three teenage children plus one girlfriend. We found it great particularly the location near Anne Frank House but also the character (loved the long, steep stairs) and the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff. Nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are 'cosy' though and there is some street noise. But it was perfect for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “frÃ®endly people in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuzernIna
Reviews.Content: I just stayed two days in Amsterdam. My parents were a short time ago there for a week and they told me it is a lovely hotel. I really love this city, even if it was raining one day! the people working in this hotel were so friendly and helpful. If I go back to Amsterdam, I would come back to this hotel as well! Thank you so much! Best regards Christina Rackl

Reviews.Title: “a great Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutch2Ghent
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in Hotel Nadia. I am Dutch, I know Amsterdam and I can tell you that this was a great hotel. Very helpful when checking in. They will bring your luggage to your room. With the steep stairs, you will be gratefull!! The breakfast, which is included, is so delightfully dutch. The location is ideal, at the Keizers Gracht en Wester Toren, you can walk everywhere and the Tram stops are almost in front of the hotel. If your budget is not for the Pullitzer Hotel, which is not a dutch experience, the Nadia Hotel I can highly recommend. The owner of the hotel was so helpful and kind, it added to a great stay in Amsterdam. And next year I definately plan to return to Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two days in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sjjci
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Nadia Hotel. The staff were very welcoming and when we arrived early it was great to be able to leave our bags in a safe place while we looked around Amsterdam. Our bags were waiting for us in our room when we got back. We found it very awkward that we only had one key for our room but two doors to go through (one door to go into the corridor, then our room door) , this meant that the three of us had to go everywhere together otherwise we couldnt get into the room. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. Our only problem was that it was a bit noisy due to being at the front of the hotel, the next time I would ask for a room away from the main road. Breakfast was good, plenty of bread, cheese, jam etc and hot drinks. We made good use of the maps and information brochures that were available at the reception desk. The hotel is in a very central position,so we could walk to most places, but we could have taken the tram or bus as they were just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: yosep
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at Hotel Nadia for one night during our recent whirlwind tour of Western Europe. It was recommended to us by a friend. The hotel is a convenient 15-20 minute walk from the train station and is located about 2 blocks from the Anne Frank house. We stayed in a canal view room, and it was worth it! The view from our room was beautiful -- overlooking the canal and a small square. The staff was very helpful from start to finish. They offered us a complimentary beverage upon arrival and gave us pointers on places to eat and visit in our short time in Amsterdam. If I make it back to Amsterdam someday, I will definitely look to stay there again. One possible concern for some though: the check-in desk is at the top of a really steep staircase. If you are not able to do stairs very well, then you'll probably need to look elsewhere. My brother and I were fine with the stairs and actually liked the uniqueness it presented.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia: Lovely staff & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CedarWych
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Nadia and had a lovely time. The location is very central, just a few minutes from Dam Square, not far (short walk) to most main areas and quite near the Jordaan district with its lovely shops, restaurants, & cafes, but far enough away from the late night noisy city-centre activity. The staff were lovely, exceedingly friendly & helpful. The rooms are small and the stairs are steep so be prepared, but this is a traditional Dutch building and is part of the charm and there's so much to do in Amsterdam how much time do you want to spend in your hotel room? You're provided with a free drink on arrival and any suitcases are carried to room so you don't need to struggle up the stairs with them yourself. There's no air conditioning, but electric fans are provided and putting the fan on with the window open made the room perfectly comfortable even on a hot summer night. It's an easy to walk to the central station but if you have luggage the tram stops is very close by. Breakfast is served until 10 and if that's too early for you, there are some lovely cafes for yummy Dutch pancakes very close by. You can leave your luggage safely in their secure luggage room after you've check out, which if you have a late flight means you can enjoy your last day without having to carry all your luggage with you. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Melcifer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Nadia twice now and enjoyed my stay each time. The owner is very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for access to all attractions. The rooms are typical Dutch, small but cozy. Free wifi is also a plus since most hotels make you pay and it is expensive. I highly recommed Hotel Nadia. It is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Vikkioria
Reviews.Content: I was worried, having never been to Amsterdam and staying in a lowly rated hotel, but the reviews from the travelers were good. I always trust fellow travelers over travel critics. I was pleasantly surprised when we got there, we got there way before check-in and they held our bags for us so that we didn't have to walk around the city with them and offered us complimentary breakfast even though we weren't checked in yet. The staff was amazingly friendly, everyone was very nice and gave us recommendations of places to go. The rooms were small with a tv, minifridge, and a private bathroom. They had the most amazing windows, I loved sitting on the window sill just watching the city in motion. The free breakfast was great and in a cute little room. The best part was the location. It was within walking distance of most places. If you are looking for a five-star hotel this isn't it, but if you are looking for a clean, safe, convenient, cheap hotel this is the pick! Warning: If stairs are a problem for you, don't stay here. Depending on you floor you will easily be required to climb at least 100 steps if not more.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting, quirky, very friendly little hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Das24
Reviews.Content: Positives The location of this hotel is perfect. 100 yards from Anne Frank's house and on the edge of the beautiful Jordaan area. Also only 5 minute walk down to the Dam. Really friendly staff, who thankfully carried our bags up and down the stairs, remembered our names and provided us with plenty of free drinks. Negatives We had a deluxe room and it was quite small, pretty basic and the smallest single bed I have ever slept in (since I was about 5 anyway). Breakfast not overly exciting, but there is a great pancake shop below the hotel which I would recommend. The stairs are very steep (as I suspect is the case with many hotels in Amsterdam), no lift, not really a problem for us but would be if you had young children or weren't too mobile. Overall a nice little hotel, very clean, very friendly. I would def stay here again as it's a great location and the staff are so friendly. Rooms are a little quirky and small so don't expect too much but it is definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: witneytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after looking widely for a good place to stay in central Amsterdam but without breaking the bank. The Nadia fitted the requirements exactly. Located just 5 mins from Dam Square but away from the hustel and bustle late at night. 10 - 15 mins walk to all main areas and easily found from central station. I walked it as only had small case on wheeels, but if heavy luggage - take a tram. Stairs are steep, but we were ready! Great welcome, free drink on arrival, cases carried to room... Room was small by comparison to some but again we were pleasantly surprised after reading about the rooms on here. Very clean, view of canal, small balcony, powerful shower (bathroom small but was fine), free wi fi, TV, kellte and coffee in room - all in all if its just a bed you want - why pay more? Also, everytime we came back, we were offered a drink from the fridge in reception. Breakfast was basic, bread, croissant, coffee etc. but again was fine for us Staff very friendly and helpful. Can leave luggage securely after check out. Would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “"Okay" hotel”
Reviews.Author: snorkelersara
Reviews.Content: From what I read on the website, I expected the room to be better. We stayed at the Nadia for 3 nights at the end of a 4 city tour in Europe. Compared to the other hotels we stayed in, which were all in the same price range (although in different cities), I thought the Nadia was the least enjoyable. As others have mentioned, the rooms were small; we had a real hard time even trying to find places to lie down our suitcases. We resorted to moving the chairs from under the desk and placing our cases below the desk. The room didn't appear as clean as I would have liked. The drapes appeared dirty and I noticed holes in the bed linens. On the positive side, the location was nice and close to main attractions and the staff was very friendly and helpful. If I return to Amsterdam, I would look into other hotels before re-booking at the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “A++ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Safari-Family-Jambo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I was looking for a quad room, reasonably price and a good location. The Nadia meet all my requirements. The room was a decent size with a private bath, refrigerator and a canal view. It wasn't fancy but was clean and comfortable. The staff is outstanding and very friendly and helpful. I had to book this room directly with the hotel. The internet travel sites I used did not offer an option for a quad room. I contacted the hotel directly and submitted a request for a quad room and the dates I wanted. They responded very quickly with a room rate. The hotel is in a great location - within walking distance of the Anne Frank house. The entryway has very steep stairs to climb and if you have trouble walking or climbing this hotel is not for you. Luckily the staff carries your luggage to your room for you! The location is great but it can be a little noisy because the hotel is located on a main road. One night I had to wear my ear plugs but the Dutch had just won a World Cup match and cars honked their horns and people partied until early morning! I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly reommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So o o o Good!!”
Reviews.Author: Elgebe
Reviews.Content: Could not praise Nadia more - we had a wonderful stay. Let's get the steep stairs/small rooms stuff out of the way first! If you're not up to steep stairs (and I mean steep) then forget it, and if you are looking for the luxury of wide open spaces, this is not for you - look somewhere else. That stuff aside, you will do well if you find a better value-for-money hotel in Amsterdam. The staff are friendly and helpful, exceptionally so, and I mean all of them. The rooms are clean and are serviced regularly, shower excellent, fridge and safe provided in the cost, very secure and, inspite of the size, comfortable. The breakfast room is sweet and attractive, with a little balcony overlooking the street and canal and across to the Westerkerk. The breakfast is, as you would expect, continental; croissants, rolls, various breads, cake, butter, jams, fruit juice, coffee, etc. More than adequate for us, but if you want more, there's is little pancake cafe next to Nadia. And if you have problems the hotel staff can't do enough to help!! I lost my wallet in the city, the support and advice of the staff and their practical help was wonderful (thank you again Nadia). I got it back by the way, a street musician handed it in to a police station - would that happen in Norwich?? So, that's my 'penneth', if you decide to give it a go I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nulesKildare_Ireland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is great.The Steps are very steep,but u get used to them.The staff were so nice and friendly anything u wanted, the staff were very happy to help. Room was very clean, room was cleaned daily and fresh towls when needed. Will stay there again on our next trip back to dam. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bubwal
Reviews.Content: The Nadia, is a good budget hotel. Ignore the bad comments from other people - they clearly only make complaints and would not dream of writing a good report. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are small, which is the norm in Europe. The manager and staff are great and friendly and most importantly the hotel is clean. If you plan on sitting in your room for most of your stay while in Amsterdam then stay elsewhere, but if you want a good, clean hotel to be used as a place to sleep/base while exploring the city then you can't go wrong with the Nadia. My only criticism is that the bathrooms were a bit too small but again it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “love tour”
Reviews.Author: lucillo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position because it's near the centre, the station and the most famous Amsterdam's monuments. The owners of the Nadia hotel are very friendly and expert, but the breakfast should be more various and bigger. Amsterdam is a beautiful city with good services and the Nadia hotel is a good place to stay. P.S: sorry for our bad english.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, friendlly staff, great location & very clean”
Reviews.Author: love2travelloads
Reviews.Content: We were in a triple room for 2 nights. There was nothing that you can fault in this lovely hotel. We arrived early on the Saturday morning and were welcomed into the hotel and invited for a lovely complimentary breakfast and coffee. Our bags were moved into our room when we were able to officially check in. Breakfast is simple and delicious. There was plenty food and staff kept bringing more out. The breakfast room is quaint and cosy - a lovely way to start your day. The rooms were extremely clean and well serviced. Each room has a private bathroom. The shower has great water pressure and a proper shower door â€“ thus there is no mucky shower curtain to cope with! Beds sleep well and have lovely white sheets and duvets - no old blankets that get used for each guest. Good quality tea and coffee in your room and is filled up every morning. Should you require more - simply ask at the breakfast area and nothing is too much trouble. Each time we went to drop our key at reception - we were invited to take a complimentary cold drink / bottled water. Finer details like these make a really good impression on guests and instantly make you feel at home. We walked every where from the hotel. It is close to all the sights and is walking distance from the main station. It is on the tram routes â€“ however we never used the trams as Amsterdam is lovely to walk though. I would highly recommend this hotel for the average traveller. It is more than a budget hotel and falls in the budget price range. Treat yourself to a stunning stay at Hotel Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Davel-pool
Reviews.Content: Good location, approx 12 mins walk from Amsterdam Central stn, quick and efficient check in, rooms as described accuretlly on the web site, perfectly adequete for a short stay, Easy acess to public transport if you require to use it, but central enough to walk to most city locations. It will be the first hotel I try next time I visit Amasterdam

Reviews.Title: “loved the location of Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: cyberp
Reviews.Content: really friendly staff, always willing to help, clean rooms, nice area in the centre of the city

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia Hotel was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: vicious3k
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive, centrally located hotel in Amsterdam. The Hotel Nadia fit the bill perfectly. The room was small, but clean. The staff were very helpful. I had a balcony with a view of the canal. within walking distance of all the major sights. when I go back to Amsterdam I will stay at the Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: tinaindenver
Reviews.Content: What really makes this hotel stand out is the people at the front desk who are very helpful and the manager, who is extremely helpful as well. They went out of their way to help me contact my daughter who was delayed and could not call me because my cellphone was not working. they were also very nice about getting me into my room fairly soon after arrival even though I arrived quire early. I really can't say enough about them. the location is extremely convenient. We walked to and from the train stations and to the museums. the stairs are quite steep. I was unprepared for this, but the staff carries the luggage so it is no problem except for people with physical limitations. The room was rather small, as is typical in European cities, but very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: WestAussieTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Amsterdam and our first stay at the Hotel Nadia. Its location is perfect â€“ everything you want is so near and it offers great canal views. We were very much looking for a true Netherlands experience and found exactly that at the Nadia. We were lucky to be upgraded to a brilliant room (with balcony) with magnificent views of the canal and City . The staff and management were genuinely warm, friendly and helpful â€“ right from when we booked (over the internet) and throughout our stay. Yes the stairs are steep but that is all part of the hotelâ€™s charm and the 24 hour security is excellent. A continental style, self service breakfast was included in the price and what was on offer was tasty and served with good coffee. Staying at the Hotel Nadia was a great experience for us - we would definitely return and recommend it to others. The Hotel and its staff really made our stay! Donna and David, Perth - Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Justbeinghelpful
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is in a great position centrally, close to trams and buses and I found it an extremely friendly, clean and helpful place to stay. The staff were so polite and obliging. Yes, the flights of stairs are steep but there are handrails on both sides and staff wil help with luggage if you have it. My room was compact but clean and with everything you could need. The breakfast room looks out over the canal and was a welcoming place with beautiful fresh flowers on every table. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and recommend others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great service!”
Reviews.Author: travelfan352008
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Nadia was a great experience for us. The staff couldn't be more accomodating - they will insist on making the check in and check out process easy. There are steep stairs up to the check in desk, but for a true Netherlands experience, the steep stairs are worth it. The breakfast is mostly bread, coffee, and juice, but it's presented well and the breakfast room was clean. The bedroom was clean as was the bath. One of the best things about the hotel is the security - there is a buzzer to get in and the front desk is manned 24 hours. The hotel is ideally located with a great view of Westerkirk church and within easy walking distance to some worthwhile stops such as the Anne Frank House & the Theater museum.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is very good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSusie
Reviews.Content: The rooms, although small, were quite comfortable and clean. Breakfast was included in the room price and was good. The staff were most helpful, friendly and accommodating. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, poor value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I've traveled around the world and lived in many countries, and I have to say that the Nadia Hotel is one of the most disappointing experiences of my entire travel life. I booked two rooms, one for myself and one for two friends. Each room was about $225, so I expected far more than we actually got. The only way that I can describe the decor of the Nadia is that it reminded me of the many Intourist hotels that I've stayed at in the former USSR. This is not a compliment. Cheap furnishings, heavily-varnished woods, small TVs, and the worst of all -- a pervasive musty, rubbery smell. As many others have commented, the rooms are no bigger than large closets. The bathrooms are OK, but with extremely small sinks and no shelves. The breakfast was also very disappointing -- essentially various pastries, bread, one kind of cheese, juice, coffee, and tea. No eggs, no fruit, no yoghurt -- in short, nothing of distinction for the price. The staff seemed to be caring and well-meaning, but there's not much they can do to improve the experience given the overall substandard nature of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Doll-house”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette10
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, but very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good job we weren't health and safety inspectors!”
Reviews.Author: TedUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: We had been looking forward to our three days in Amsterdam for months, unfortunately the hotel was a let down to our holiday. First off, the room was not ready when we arrived. After returning later in the day to settle in, we were shocked to find.... 1) The amount of steep stairs to access the hotel 2) The overall lack of cleanliness- the room was literally caked in dust, including in the cracks in the wall. You were not only looking at dust through the window, it flew around the room visibly in the sunlight! The safe was covered in dust and so was the fan, and the carpet did not look like it had been vacuumed since it has been opened. 3) The size of the room- you could not fully open the door as it hit the desk, and you couldn't even get your case through! The walkway between both beds was literally a matter of inches. 4) The beds: One's mattress was larger than the base so that it pushed you out of bed and forced you onto the floor due to such worn springs. The other was literally hanging out of the window and the blanket got lost down the gap! They seemed itchy and infested- the place felt alive with bugs and no matter how long you spent in the shower, you didn't feel clean 5) The "breakfast" consisted of cold bread, crackers, and cake. Anyone with a wheat intolerance would go hungry! No hot food was offered at all 6) The bathroom was like a portacabin but smaller, with a shower which flooded and a toilet which broke during our stay 7) The TV remote didn't work properly and was constantly stuck on one setting We were always offered free drinks from the bar, almost as if the staff felt embarrassed by the hotel. We also had our picture taken with reception staff with the promise that it would be emailed to us when we returned to England. However, since being back we have received nothing and feel this is the last insult from this hotel. DEFINITELY one to avoid for all travellers who like a clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: deporresWaterford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day stay in the nadia hotel.,and will summarise our experienses as follows. CONS room tiny,no space for clothes, had to work out of our cases. one of us had to sit on the bed while the other moved around the room. sparse breakfast. CONS perfect location lovely staff. osman and his staff couldnt have done enough for us.even though the room was tiny the bed was sooooo comfy and there was a safe ,fridge and unlimited supply of softs drinks.was a bit disappointed after reading from other reviews about flowers being presented we didnt get any even though i mailed in advance that the reason for out visit was we w ere celebrating our 25 th wedding anniversary. after paying 125 euro per night i felt wass too expensive for the room we got

Reviews.Title: “charming nadia”
Reviews.Author: kuenzli
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just came back from a weekend-trip in amsterdam, a wonderful, fascinating city! Our enthusiasm about our stay has also to do with the choice of our hotel: a lucky choice! hotel nadia is a charming little hotel, located in the Jordaan Quarter, one of the most beautyful quarters of Amsterdam. the room we had was not big, but quite enough for us two. we paid 260 Euro for two nights, breakfast incl. we had our own bathroom (very clean!), fridge, safe, etc. and tv (if somebody needsâ€¦). we prefered the canal view (and the quitness in the nights). but above all: not only our room, the whole hotel is really pretty and tasteful furnished. the hotelmanager and his staff was very nice, always helpful, with an extraordinary kindness. we enjoyed also the two housecats, one is called Â«helloÂ» and the other Â«goodbyeÂ». isn't that lovely? in the end: we really can recommend the hotel nadia and for us it's sure, that we will stay there again during our next visit in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nadia was great value in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dazoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 3 nights at Hotel Nadia based on reviews here. A little apprehensive as we rang the bell of the tiny door in the street but our welcome was fantastic . We were a little early but were offered a cold drink, coffee as we relaxed in the breakfast room getting our first glimpse of the Amsterdam canals. The staff also insisted on carrying our bags up the stairs for us. Our room was small but very clean and perfect for our needs - it also looked out to the canal in the side street - the fridge also meant we could stock up on some food from the nearby supermarket for picnics by the canals. Breakfast was adequate - rolls, cheese, coffee, tea, croissants, juice. Perfect location with easy tram ride from station (the tram numbers are on their web site) and 5 minute walk to the main square, 10 minute walk to red light district and many restaurants and bars in between. Amsterdam is a very interesting and perhaps unique city and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We hired bikes for the day from "Yellow Bike" and they pointed us in the direction of the farming area by catching the ferry across the water at main train station - spent about 5 hours leisurely exploring the farms, dykes and villages. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and its staff who continued to be extremely helpful right throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: bobfischer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Nadia on the recomendation of my daughter who had stayed there on several occasions.The basic room we had for the first 2 nights was rather small and cramped for our needs but an upgrade to a better and larger room overlooking the canal was very satisfactory.The stairs are rather daunting on first appearance,not suited for the faint hearted!!.The flowers in the rooms are a nice touch as were the complimentary soft drinks.The service was both friendly and courteous and the price not overboard.We will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: N_irelandJade
Reviews.Content: Michael & Patricia N.Ireland A lot of reviews would say you get what you pay for, in the case of the Nadia we certainly got a lot more. Our room may have been on the small side but it had everything you would need and it was spotless and had a lovely view of the canal and church also the location of the hotel was perfect for the sights of the city. Hamid in reception was a first class host along with owners they made us feel very welcome they also provided flowers for my wife on her birthday (nice one). I would recommend this hotel and hope to return. A BIG THANKYOU TO THE NADIA FOR A LOVELY STAY IN AMSTERDAM.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & nice staff”
Reviews.Author: FredoBonno
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia offers a good quality of service : not too expensive, central location and friendly staff. Our room was a little bit too noisy but that's the only inconvenient. The stairs are worth the trip ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMiller
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel more highly. My husband and I rented a private apartment in Amsterdam and when we arrived, it was dirty & awful. I frantically emailed 5 or 6 highly-rated reasonably priced hotels and found the Nadia. From the moment we arrived, I felt at home. Although the hotel had 50 rooms, the owner and people that worked there treated us like family and sympathized with the bad experience we had had at the last place. Anything we wanted- we just had to ask. The room we had was very small, but as people checked out, we were upgraded to a larger room with a balcony and view of the canal, at no extra charge. As for the hotel itself, it was spotlessly clean. A basic but delicious breakfast was included and was served in a beautiful room overlooking the canal. The location was also perfect and was within walking distance of all the sites. We could not have found a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Small but all you need”
Reviews.Author: Marseyparsey
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday (Friday 9th May) from a few days in Amsterdam which could not have been better. Weather was perfect and our Hotel (Nadia) was located ideally. Only minutes from Dam Square. In the Hotel you get what you see on their site. Room was very small but clean and with its own shower and wc was all we needed for our short stay. The Staff could not have been nicer if we were staying in the Ritz. Thank you all again. Martha Walsh Dowdall

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: BabaFrance
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Hotel was very friendly from the beginning. The location was also perfect. However, the standard single room was really, really small and hot, with no air conditioning. Be prepared do climb very steep and long stairs to get to the reception and to the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TheGownRack
Reviews.Content: Since finding the Hotel Nadia last year, I have never considered staying anywhere else! The rooms have absolutely everything I need to either work or relax while on a business trip. I work in fashion, and do a lot of photography of clothing and jewelry. Some of the best pictures I've ever taken were on the balcony of Hotel Nadia! Even when I'm not lucky enough to get a balcony room, I really don't mind because I always have a room with large windows that open wide for fresh air, and let in lots of sunlight, which I love! The building itself is so charming and historic, I really feel like I am part of Old Amsterdam when I stay at Hotel Nadia! The staff is super friendly and attentive to my specific needs and requests. I always find the bathrooms squeaky clean and the shower very inviting after a long train ride. The beautiful breakfast room is a lovely indoor garden. It is open all day and night for guests like me who like to sit in peace and watch the water in the canal, or read a book and have some coffee. I always feel very welcome and comfortable at Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia it's the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: browserd
Reviews.Content: I've been with my wife in Amsterdam from April 30 to May 06 and believe me when I say that, a good part of our Amsterdam experience was the staying at Nadia Hotel. It was by chance that we get an available room. I've passed by the hotel site after reading some reviews here and tried to do a reservation.
