Unfortunately there was no room available and I went for another hotel (believe it or not, almost the double of the price with no taxes included and no breakfast). Just two or tree days before our trip I've received an e-mail from Nadia Hotel saying that, If I was still interested they had a double room with a balcony available for me. In that precisely moment we decided to cancel the other reservation and sign in with Nadia. It was our best move in the all Amsterdam trip. We arrived Nadia near midnight. Ringed the bell and immediately the door was opened and we saw the famous stairs. Before we could start climbing Mr. Osama, the manager, told us from upstairs to leave the luggage down. As we signed in he gave us all the maps and paper infos that someone could ever need about the city. He also told us to grab a drink from the little freezer on the reception and we went to the breakfast room waiting while the luggage was carried for the room. It was nice to be in the first floor but even if it was on the top one, the stairs are not so bad as some people say. Our room was the 205. Not a big room. A small one to be honest but hey, more than enough for us. A double bed, a small tv, a small freezer, a safe over the closet, a table and some tea and coffee facilities. Also a small (well, very tinny) bathroom. Once again, more than enough. Everything was very clean and the heat was already on (that night was a little bit cold out on the street). While my wife was undoing the bags I was already turning on my laptop and in a minute connecting to the Internet trough the free wi-fi from the Hotel. And no, it was not some bad line divided by all the rooms. Nadia seem to have a router for each floor allowing a hi-speed connection everywhere. I know that some people are hunger for huge hotel rooms. We don't. There are some specifications that are essential for us: Private bathroom, clean, the most central possible in our destinations. We usually just go to the hotel to bed, bath and nothing more so Nadia had everything we wanted . Next morning we went for the lovely breakfast room and yes, once again we thought how lucky we could get. For all those who say that Nadia offers a basic breakfast I just can say: define basic. If basic means no read beans and fried bacon with eggs ok but I really think I could not eat that kind of things in the morning. Instead Nadia breakfast had everything I use to have at my own house making me feel at home: Several different kinds of bread, toasts and croissants, several jelly's and butter, Nutella and big slices of a delicious cheese. They also have a wonderful cake to go with the coffee, the tea or the hot milk. All this and the view from the breakfast room windows just gave us a great start every morning. What more can I say? We just loved this little hotel. All the staff is of a extreme sympathy from Mr. Osama to the blond girl (that I cannot recall the name) passing by everyone else. One afternoon when we arrived at the Hotel Mr. Osama saw me with the camera and told me if I would like to go up to the roof and take some photos. That day was not possible for me but he remember it the next day and just before checking out I went there with my wife and indeed that was a view... This review is to long already but I must say that, if I ever go back to Amsterdam, I'll stay at Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lily_of_the_valley66
Reviews.Content: We've been in NADIA-Amsterdam only for 4 days, but this hotel is like a fairy-tale with polite and friendly staff. It was a great time, the hotel was near Dam square, the view from the restorant was so lovely. I havn't been in Amsterdam before and if you want to feel the real atmosphere here you have to arrive in Amsterdam on 30th of april. We were realy impressed by hospitality of manger of the hotel and his heartily behaviour to us. We were like at home. The breakfast is good enough: bread, cheese, tea, buns, butter, jams. Only some fresh fruits may add to the menu. During our stay I was pleased at all modern conveniences in room. Although it was a small room everithing was perfect: clean and quiet! Bed was wide enough, the curtains stop the day-light, that was very important to our rest. We paid 125 euro per night for a room which we thought excellent value especially for this period: 30.04 - 04-05.2008. I would say that if I'll visit Amsterdam again I'll stay in NADIA again, and again...! Perhaps it's not the most convenient if you want to have a luxury, but who needs luxury if the smile and the kindness in NADIA are everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: welshie2879
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault the staff and service that we received at this hotel, everyone was so friendly and nothing was too much for them. The rooms are small but are equipped with everything you need including a fridge and reception will provide hairdryer, iron etc on request. I found the room we had to be a bit noisy as we were on the street side as we requested a balcony and it is a very busy road. Please be advised that there are steep stairs leading in to this hotel so it would not be suitable for anyone with walking difficulties but dont worry about having to drag your cases up the stairs as the staff are only too happy to do this. Overall a great stay in a reasonably priced hotel with great location (near Dam square & Anne Frank House) and only a short walk from central station.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: patsyd
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel just about 8 minutes walk into Dam Square, 2 minutes from Ann Franks's House. Quiet location but very convenient to plenty of sights and amenities. Some rooms very small, even by British standards but ours was ideal. Our friends had a ridiculously small room (No. 7) but were told on leaving that they could have changed it. The hotel was very clean throughout and the staff were marvellous - couldn't do enough for you and were the most friendly and helpful we've ever come across - even delivered a bouquet to our room on my husband's birthday! A lovely touch. The breakfast was plentiful and taken in a lovely little corner room with a small balcony with canal views and diagonally opposite one of Hollands oldest churches. The only downside we could see would be for people with walking difficulties as the stairs up to each floor, and reception, were very steep. Having said that, our cases were taken to and from our rooms for us with no bother at all, and the exercise did us good but we were only on the first floor! We would definitely stay at the Nadia again - if we can have room number 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Guk215
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Nadia I really don't have a bad thing to say about it, the staff are really friendly help you with anything you need rooms are clean. I've stayed in 4 stars that aren't as good. Its a 5 minute walk from the centre and is located in what I call the nice part of town. I try and visit Amsterdam every year and this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews before you decide!”
Reviews.Author: stilletos
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Nadia with friends - apparently we paid for a twin de-luxe room! The room was more like a corridor and there was no wardrobe or anywhere else to put clothes. My bed was pressed right up against the window, my husband was right up against a wooden partition - we had a 6" gap between the beds and it was impossible to walk in the room unless one or other of us went into the en-suite bathroom or sat on a bed. I think the room would be impossibly hot during the summer months, and we were unable to open the window except for about 1" at the top. There was a very small fan that was placed high up on a shelf and had no effect whatsoever. (A word of caution - if offered the key to room 7 have a look first before you decide). The stairs were certainly VERY steep but not too much of a problem and if I was strictly honest the plusses probably just about out-weighed the minuses. The staff were excellent, the breakfast was unexciting but adequate, the room was fairly clean and quiet, no passing traffic inside the hotel and there was not a great deal of noise from the street or canal. We are all in our 60s and I would not recommend this hotel for people who are not in reasonably good health and fitness (luckily we are!).

Reviews.Title: “Service Mind Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noiris
Reviews.Content: We are Thai family who were enjoyed our time in Nadia hotel. Even though, the stair is long, narrow and steep, the staffs help you carry luggages to the room, means don't worry and be happy for us. while waiting for the luggages, you relax with welcome drink, basically a soda can. I would like to ensure the stair is not difficult to hike :D because My father who is 70 up can walk up easily. The funny thing is the stair is narrow and steep enough to have the stop area in between for traffic jam. We had 3 rooms which all were good. We would love more if the shower in 2 room were new and could spray water throughly but on the other hand, you could experience old time small shower. The hotel is well situated if you are not trying to walk from the train station and check in, try it if you walk like a horse. It is around 300 meters walk from the tram stop. We could also walk to the dam. There is a supermarket near by. The guests were also nice and not kind of party lovers which means the air and atmosphere in the hotel is clean and look safe. The breakfast were adequate, juice coffee bread cheese and sweetness. However, the breakfast room is lovely, even though, it is small comparing to the hotel scale. For those who like the view, may sit in front of the windows and sip coffee. The staffs are nice and informative. Service mind is what they inhibit. Keep on going, thumbs up. One of the thing is that you have to listen to tram running and ringing bell from church once in a while. Near the hotel while you are walking direction to the dam, a few step aways before you reach the first intersection, you would found a souvenir shop which also sell cigarette and beer. It is operated by a Turkish who could give you a good variety enough, bargain, and a will to service. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Love to Lounge at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: SJDub
Reviews.Content: I will not be able to say enough about the hotel and the staff. Travelling from Nova Scotia, Canada, we arrived, and as advised, our bags were taken immediately to our awaiting room - 4th floor (top floor). We were greeted with a free non-alchohol beverage and very warm smiles. After a tour of the breakfast room, we were advised our room was ready. We were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary and my husband casually mentioned this when booking the hotel, late in 2007. Though we didn't send a reminder, there was a fresh flower bouquet with a "Happy Anniversary" message from the Nadia. That was the first of many surprises. Our room was small, but the celings were very high, there was plenty of shelving and a closet. There was also an in room safe. The room was immaculately clean. Our bedspread had the most terrific message - "Lounge". We had a balcony, which was a wonderful added touch -like another room altogether. The breakfast was a perfect start to the day - a variety of breads/pastry and cheese - tea/coffee/orange juice. Lots of choice for spreads - loved the nutella and croissants - and the coffee - Wow! The in room fridge was put to good use as was the in room kettle and tea supplies. There was a very powerful fan, for any one who likes to partake in the "greenery" of Amsterdam - this worked well to keep our room smelling fresh. The bathoom was also extremely clean, and the shower was powerful and HOT! Just the way I like it. The cleaning staff was excellent, even calling our room to make sure everything was okay. The customer service desk was open 24 hrs/day - with a "buzz to get in" rule, it is best to get a 24 hr hotel instead of one that will put a curfew on your evening out. Yes, it was rough to walk up four flights of stairs after a full day of walking but it was so satisfying to get up there and take a load off. I would recommend this hotel to any one who is able to handle the stairs. I must assume though, that a lot of the hotels in the area would have the same steep stairs. Thank you to the Nadia for helping to make our first visit to Amsterdam the best it could be. We miss you.

Reviews.Title: “Less than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: seeksocean
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia was okay. Just okay. The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed at in my life! I couldn't dream of unpacking a thing. Not a thing. And the breakfast was very basic; bread, cheese, croissant, coffee...that's it. I have stayed in Amsterdam before and have paid less for more...much more. The staff however was very nice and very helpful. I do feel though that they were obsessed with what their rating from me would be. It's amazing what the Travel Site ratings impact is on hotels now. I think they get terrified of getting a negative review. Sometimes I wonder how much these reviews are 'rigged'. So, I will give them a neutral.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassmanbirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia this weekend it was a great hotel clean ,very friendly and the staff where helpfull. Breakfast was nice in a really cosy breakfast room. Location was great tram stop just outside walking distance to Anne Frank house and the lovely area Jordaan full a nice little bars and restaurants. Our room was warm, beds comfortable great shower and we had a balcony could be a little noisey in the day with the trams but ok at night. I would definatley stay there again. Mr Latham

Reviews.Title: “rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: almg
Reviews.Content: All the reviews about the staff are true they are so friendly and helpful. While we were there my husband was unwell and the manager and staff went out of their way to help us.A word of warning dont try the hash unless you are used to it, it was our first time and we had a very bad experience had to spend the first evening in the room which was much too small for two people . The breakfast was fine and free tea and coffee all day was nice touch. Stairs not as bad as I thought they would be. Try to get a room with a balcony or could get claustrophobic . Great location could walk everywhere. Get train from airport then no. 13 tram stops outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hotel Nadia!!!! You wont be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: bigcheese88
Reviews.Content: In a FANTASTIC area of Amsterdam, right by the Anne Frank House and on a canal. We had a canal-front room and it was great! Great view, and comfortable room. The staff was SO nice. They helped us carry our bags up the steep steps that Amsterdam is known for, and couldnt have been more accomodating and friendly. They even send us Holiday cards a few times a year through e-mail. They go WAY above and beyond what is expected. I would never stay anyplace else in Amsterdam!! Hotel Nadia will convince anyone of that!! Thanks for being so nice and helpful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Plsant Stay”
Reviews.Author: eni77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I originally booked a hotel, which is in the same building but 4 doors down the street from Hotel Nadia. But we had to move to Hotel Nadia because our booked room was too small. We were so happy we found Hotel Nadia. The staffs were super friendly and helpful with tourist information and day trip ideas. The room although small, can be considered a decent size, as in Amsterdam standard. The beds are very comfortable. We have a shower/toilet in the room, as well as a fridge, a safe, a TV and a desk with 2 chairs. Breakfast was served in a beautiful petit dining area on the 2ned floor. The buffet style breakfast isnâ€™t fancy but has all the basic items. The location is perfect!!!!! A short 3 minutes walk to Anne Frankâ€™s house and the trendy Jordaan neighborhood. 10-15 mins walk to Central station, Dam Square and Red light district. 15-20 mins walk to the museum area. I would stay at Hotel Nadia again on my next trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jenvalet
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I'm kind of mixed about the Nadia. While I found the location to be perfect and the staff super friendly, the rooms are tiny (which I know is par for the course in Europe) and the beds were so uncomfortable - the sheets are like sandpaper. We had 2 separate stays while in town and the first half we were upgraded to the suite. I'm not sure how much that normally costs, but it was a good sized room with a nice view and a balcony. The stairs are rather daunting, around 75 total to the 4th floor, but it was our daily exercise. The second stay was in a room that was really small and almost had no place for 2 people to put their luggage, and we traveled lightly. The rooms were both clean and each came with a fridge, and coffee/tea maker, which was nice. The staff was always helpful. I can't comment on breakfast since we wanted to enjoy those delicious Dutch pancakes in town. If I didn't have to sleep in those beds again, I would recommend the Nadia. Again, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: caffeinehit
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Amsterdam every week for some months now with work. It's been the Easter holidays so I've found many of the hotels booked out. I had been checking Tripadvisor and Hotel Nadia was quite high up the list. I like my creature comforts when I'm away and to be honest with you, my heart sank when I walked up to the front of the hotel, it didn't look great... I always think you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover though. The people on reception were very friendly and helpful. The room was small, and a little noisy (it was at the front of the hotel next to the main road), if you get a chance ask for a room with a canal view as it will be on the side of the hotel where there's less traffic. Other than being small the room had everything you'd need, there was also free wi-fi which is hard to find in Amsterdam. It's really close and easy to walk to Centraal Station as well as all of the tourist spots nearby. All in all a very pleasant (and cheap) stay, I'm sure I will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely days”
Reviews.Author: kitaOutrup
Reviews.Content: We were 8 adults staying at the hotel for 3 nights. The service was exellent. The staff were smiling, helpful and very nice, so we had 3 very fine days. Our rooms were small, but clean and well-equipped. The hotel has a good atmosphere and is situated near shopping-areas and the center of the city. Birgit B. Jepsen Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel....Love or Leave it?”
Reviews.Author: blacknthai
Reviews.Content: I've traveled throughout Europe quite a bit and stayed at several different hotels. I know that most older hotels in Europe are not as big as what we're accustomed to in the States, and prepare myself for this ahead of time. The Bad Stuff-The photos used on Nadia's website are very misleading. A panaromic view is shown which gives the viewer an illusion that the rooms are bigger. We had a triple room with a balcony. The room was ridiculously small! Two people would've fit comfortably in this room. The bathroom/shower was a joke! The shower leaked throughout the bathroom which made the situation even worse. If you're not young & in decent health, I would leave this hotel alone because of the most treacherous stairs! The Good Points-The hotel staff is most delightful! They were all very eager to help & gave us great advice. Although they were pleasant it's still not enough for me to go back. The balcony was fabulous. As far as the location, it was great. Not far from Dam Square & the Red Light District. The price was fair considering what we lived with for 4 days. If you don't mind being in small spaces, climbing like 80 stairs & sleeping on a rock hard bed with matching pillow, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rosey21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Nadia for two nights with my boyfriend and really enjoyed the experience.We stayed in a double room with balcony, on the top floor. The stairs were a bit of a mission (but you soon get used to them!) the room was an awkward shape and the en suite made it quite small, but my boyfriend and i both felt the lovely view from the balcony outweighed these negative points. The staff on the front desk were lovely - we came into contact with three different people on reception and each were polite,friendly and very helpful in giving directions and recommendations. The breakfast was simple but adequate, and served in a lovely breakfast room with views over the canal and the catherdral. All in all, a lovely hotel with character and a great base for those wanting to explore amsterdam. **WORD OF ADVICE** there is an italian restaurant quite near the hotel called "Venezia del nord"...horrible food,atmosphere and service-i would avoid at all costs!!instead there is a lovely indian restaurant opposite catherdral which is definitley worth a visit!! Also, there is a airport shuttle bus, run by connexxions, which is a cheap and quick way to get door to door service between the hotel and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lgmbs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is the best place to stay in Amsterdam. Great location, great service and great price. I always feel like at home at your Hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “See Both Sides of the Coin in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: loulove
Reviews.Content: In the beginning it seemed very hectic when we arrived, but the staff handled everything very well. The staff let us check in way before check-in time which is rarely seen. The location is great! It gives you the opportunity as a traveler to see both sides of the coin in amsterdam. The rooms are a little bit outdated, but very clean, cozy, and affordable. It is a very secure hotel, and would definitely recommend returning...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; good value for money”
Reviews.Author: andyetandyet
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and competent staff; very clean; free wifi access to the internet is a definite bonus; truly lilliputian rooms (at least the single room I had) but then this is Amsterdam...; breakfast OK but nothing to write home about; thin-walled so earplugs are a must if you have no desire to listen to your neighbour's tv programmes; overall good enough value for money for Amsterdam (in absolute terms though 90 euros per night is really expensive for such a small room... it really is just for sleeping and showering ;) )

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Traveller48_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a place to experience ... the rooms are small but it is all so interesting ... it is real, unlike a lot of new hotels. Osam, the manager is lovely as too are the other staff (esp the lady that works at reception) ... you are made to feel welcome and are well looked after. The breakfast room is also inviting, once again not much space, but that's Amsterdam. The breakfast room has a view of a canal and streetscape offering a nice way to wake up. Our room also had a view of the canal and a small balcony. Worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yuexiaozz
Reviews.Content: we were travelling in a group and stayed in three rooms in Nadia. one of the rooms we are staying in was pretty small, but the other two rooms were better. the hotel staff has been very helpful and kind, rooms are quite clean. love the hotel cats as well! but breakfast is not so good as there are little variety and no toaster

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: goose66
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Nadia whilst travelling around europe on our honeymoon.We arrived at the hotel to be greeted with the mount everest staircase.We were pleased when a staff member said they would take care of our bags.We checked in and were toldwe had been given a room upgrade.It was a larger room facing the canal.We had been in the room 10 minutes when there was a knock on the door.They had sent a bunch of flowers to room for us to celebrate our marriage.We spent 4 nights there and the stay was 1st class from beginning to end.We were given helpful information an were to go and how to get there.The owner of the hotel helped us book our transfer to the airport and even rang when we were checking out to thank us for staying with them and to wish us well on the rest of our travels.I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying there.It is in a great location and is value for money.I would not hesitate to stay there in the future

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: pookie13
Reviews.Content: The rooms were just the right size and clean, as were the bathrooms. The location was great. We were able to walk most places within the city limits. The service was great, and friendly. I also felt very secure in the hotel and the area. It was an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alexander041669
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Amsterdam and staying at this hotel and have only positive things to say about it. Their staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room and facilities were very clean and well organized and was great to come back to after a day of exploring. It is excellently located in the heart of Amsterdam and within close walking distance to the major sites. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit. Thank you to everyone at the Nadia Hotel! Mr. L.T. Renton, Washington United States

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: NorthernMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Our family with a teenager stayed at the Hotel Nadia. This hotel had everything we could ask for in a vacation. The hotel staff were very helpful with everything from sightseeing directions to calling a cab for us when we needed it. The hotel also provided a very good location and a great view while we had morning breakfast. Our room was a family room with 3 sets of windows which overlooked the canal and we could also see the Anne Frank Museum across the canal, which is just a short walk. We could not ask for a better location and view. It was The Best. The tram, canal taxi, and bus also has stops within 2 minute walk. This hotel will always be at the top of our list for our next visit to Amsterdam . Give the Hotel Nadia a try, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “what a friendly, helpful well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: guppyMerthyrTydfil
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a two night stay at the Nadia, It is a great location, right opposite Ann Franks house and a short walk to Dam Square and the other sights. No good if you cant climb stairs, but there is lots of help with your luggage etc. The rooms are small but spotless, really clean and compact, tea and coffee in plentiful supply, also free welcome soft drinks on arrival. Breakfast is continental and fresh and lots of hot coffee. The staff and management made our holiday memorable, so friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english, Thank you Nadia see you again soon for my next birthday !!! had fab time five star *****

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rupimc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is located about 5 mins from Dam Square and conveniently a supermarket and also an excellent coffee shop called Abraxas. The hotel itself is warm and very comfortable. It is well cared for and all the staff especially Michelle and the manager are fantastic. Prices here are excellent. In the morning breakfast is great too which a nice range of sweets and drinks to choose from. I would always return there if I go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: All in all, the Nadia is a decent choice for the budget traveler in their 20's-30's. This is a friendly no-frills place with a fabulous location right near the Jordaan and many of the tourist sites in Amsterdam. Our room was small but acceptable, with a mini-fridge and desk space, shelving for our clothes, and a nice big window facing the quiet rear of the building. There was a drop ceiling and very dim lighting. We stayed 7 nights and by the end of the week my back was REALLY hurting from the saggy, lumpy bed. In general, the lovely staff, the great location and the reasonable price made up for the drab, run down feel of the room and the slightly seedy appearance of the main entrance to the hotel. One of the best features, which was not advertised on the website and came as a pleasant surprise, was the free Wi-Fi, which we used a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Kirstie-H
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in the nadia hotel when we visited amsterdam. When we first got to the hotel we were greeted by the staff, who were very friendly, they gave us both a complimentery drink and took our bags to our room. At first i thought it was quite small, but once youve unpacked and sorted yourselfs out its perfect size. Nice and cosy! The hotel is in a wicked location, only a 5min walk to dam square and from dam square everything is next to you. I will definatly be returning to the Nadia hotel on my next trip to the dam!

Reviews.Title: “Nadia a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garynottingham10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great weekend in Amsterdam We stayed at the Nadia Hotel and had a great time. This is a traditional Dutch Hotel that has been recently modernised, but still retains its original character. The staff are great, very helpful and friendly. the rooms are cosy & compact but have everything you need. The hotel is ideally located for the centre and is only 10 mins walk to Dam square where you can walk or catch a tram to any part of the city. The Anne Frank museum is only 5 mins walk along the main road. We had a front facing room with a balcony and a great view. Because of the noise of traffic, light sleepers would be better asking for a rear facing room. Overall an excellent value hotel, ideally located for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Returning back to Amsterdam and Nadia”
Reviews.Author: kozturk
Reviews.Content: After 8 years we had a chance to visit Amsterdam and Hotel Nadia again. Warm welcome, friendly staff and clean rooms are the bonus of Nadia and once more they proved customer satisfaction is their one of most important priority.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: gaialiverpool
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Nadia and, as ever, we have no complaints. Staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and it is well-situated for all attractions The 'welcome home' bouquet was a nice touch, when we arrive this time!!

Reviews.Title: “Different, friendly, but bring your climbing boots!”
Reviews.Author: gipi
Reviews.Content: A lot of what I'll say has probably been said, but perhaps there's no harm in an update. The most recent trip was my second time at the Nadia, and I enjoyed it as much as the first time! A few observations, plusses and minuses It's about 10 mins walk from the Dam and all the sights and sounds around there. It's less than 10 minutes to the Anne Frank House and other sights in that area. It's on the tram route for the Rembrantplein and the Zoo. The staff couldn't be friendlier and more helpful - from carrying bags upstairs, offering (non-alcoholic) drinks on arrival, providing maps & event guides, and making reservations for the hotel/airport shuttle, they couldn't do enough. The rooms are small, but comfortable and had all amenities - I was in a single room on the top (4th ) floor, and had a good size bed, ensuite with shower, TV, tea/coffee making facilities, safe and chair & desk. The room was spotless, and housekeeping called every day to make/change bed, clean bathroom, etc. The building is old and quirky - so you won't get a sterile square box to stay in. You may hear next door watching TV or....(well, it is Amsterdam!). You may hear your neighbours who've stayed out later than you coming home, saying goodnight and heading to bed. Yes, there are a lot of steep steps and no lift, so don't wear high heels and don't get too drunk while out for the evening! The staff will carry cases up and down, just ask! I asked for a non-smoking room, and was told they're in short supply - but I got one, so didn't have any difficulties mentioned by another reviewer. General noise - I was at the back of the hotel, so heard very little outside noise. Remember that you're in the middle of a city, which doesn't sleep, so noise is to be expected. I spent 4 nights here this time, and was very happy with the experience. Two tips - get the Conexxion hotel shuttle from Schipol to the door of the Nadia. Return fare is â‚¬21 and well worth the trip. You'll be dropped at the door, and the hotel will book the return trip for you. - Cafe Panorama, at the other end of the block is a nice place to eat (Italian pasta/pizza and steak).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sena2005
Reviews.Content: Our room was very, very, small, but very clean and with a great canal view. Nice shower! Very nice staff! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jim_CDerryN_I_
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short, as everything has been said. We had 2 wonderful nights in this hotel, which , at 2 stars, is punching way above its weight !!!Don't be a snob, don't go for the corporate bland option, stay here and discover the real Amsterdam & its people! Climb a few stairs, stay in a smaller room. If either of those bothers you, then shut up & pay more. You will not find better value for money than this hotel. I will be back and sooner rather than later. Thank you Osam for your hospitality it was not just polite, it was warm and friendly. We could not have expected anything like the welcome we got. Thank you for making the trip so special!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about this place”
Reviews.Author: LondonMoxie
Reviews.Content: We don't understand how this hotel got such good reviews on Trip Advisor - we only booked it because it did and were quite disappointed; now maybe will think again about the reliability of this site. Positive: * Staff very friendly and helpful at all times of day - in fact, they were too nice for such a disappointing place * Rooms well equipped and clean * Central location * Nice balcony (if you can stand the noise - see below) * Free drink on arrival (non-alcoholic) * Nice shower, in our room, at least Negative (where to start...): * We had rooms at the front of the hotel which were very noisy - the tram rails were being changed during our stay, so we were woken 2 out of the 3 nights at 3 or 4am (I think that's what time it was) by the most awful noise that even ear-plugs couldn't block out * The hotel was very smoky - fine if you're out for a "good time", but forget it if you have children, worth avoiding; everyone came back wheezing and coughing and we all stank of smoke of all types; people smoking in the middle of the night, smoke coming into room under doors, etc. * Breakfast was very disappointing - if you like cold croissants, cold bread, packaged rusks, packaged ginger bread and processed cheese (hardly what you'd expect in the land of cheese!) then you'd love it, but we didn't; no cereal, no fresh milk, no hot food (unless you asked for toast), no yoghurts, no fruit, nothing, even the bread was out of a packet * The rooms we had were tiny - no room to swing a cat; the only comparable thing is a berth on a ship and even then, we had bigger when we went to Santander by ferry; sitting on the toilet, your legs hit the door; also rooms very poorly lit * Expensive for what it was - we paid about 560 euros for 3 kids in one triple bedded room and 2 adults in a double bedded room for 3 nights and that included a discount for cash * TV was okay - lots of channels, but not all TV's received BBC - our kids room did, but our's not; CNN (puke!) was all we got Other points: * Stairs - we knew there'd be lots, but 73 steps to our floor was a bit excessive, especially after walking the whole day (we were on the top floor) and all were steep * We're sure there are probably decent rooms in the hotel, but we didn't get them; perhaps a stay on the 1st or 2nd floor or inside rather than outside would be better - would recommend asking if you want to stay here * Stayed in much better places for much less money even on previous visits to Amsterdam. Would recommend looking for somewhere else and think about being slightly further out as that's probably what makes this place so expensive; think about a non-smoking place as well, you can always visit a cafe or a pub - they smoke everywhere anyway!

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: mairemullin
Reviews.Content: Nadia is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location near the square in amsterdam. we stayed for 3 nights &the staff were extremely friendly and accomodating-if/when i go back to amsterdam i will stay here again! great place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool, Well-Located Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PurpleFlowerTaipei
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Nadia Hotel. It's such a cool place, with its steep, winding staircases and quaint rooms. My room was rather small, but very clean and had everything I needed, including wireless connectivity, a TV, and plenty of shelf space. The breakfast area felt warm and classy with lots of windows to the world outside, while the coffee, cheese, juice and bread made for a good start to each day. What's more, I found each and every member of the staff at Nadia Hotel to be super friendly and very helpful -- more than happy to help in any way. Staying at this hotel -- which is very conveniently located, I might add -- was a key part of the great experience I had in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Toffees1
Reviews.Content: The Nadia is a great value spot in Amsterdam. The rooms are spotless, and the showers are great. The room we had was very small, but it did the job, and was spotlessly clean - it had every amenity you needed, fridge, safe, tv etc. The staff are excellent - very friendly, and it's a really welcoming hotel. The location is very central and it's definitely one of the best hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Loved amsterdam and will be back again”
Reviews.Author: tanyat3
Reviews.Content: The very warm and helpful staff at the Nadia made our stay in Amsterdam most enjoyable. There are many stairs to climb at the entrance, but the staff handles all the luggage, and the stairs were really not as bad as they looked. Our room was tiny and simple, but it had everything - TV with lots of channels in English, shower, toilet, even a balcony. Some people might find the tram line noisy, but it didn't bother us. Everything was very clean. The shower/toilet room was also tiny and became very wet and steamy after a shower. The location could not have been more convenient, close to Dam Square with lots of tram lines in the area. It was easy to walk almost everywhere, although the trams were handy at times.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: indialindia
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel, we have just got back today, and wanted to say thankyou to all the staff for being so kind and helpful and welcoming. its just as it says on the website, really central, clean comfortable rooms with amazing views, not too noisy at all, generous breakfast, and the stairs that everyone mentions are part of the charm, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mazzitelli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very welcoming. It is situated in the centre of Amsterdam so in a very good position. The staff at Nadia hotel are fantastic, they will answer all your questions. They provided us with many brochures that helped us alot aswell. The prices are very good too. The rooms are so cozy and warm that you'll forget all the cold of the outside in the winter. If I had to go back to the beautiful city of Amsterdam, I will definetly stay in this hotel again because I felt at home there. I would suggest this hotel to everyone that is going to Amsterdam because in this hotel you feel more welcomed than anywhere else. Rita & Justin.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia is not a recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessiefeng
Reviews.Content: We went to Nadia hotel for a weekend stay at Amersteram, 2 nights stay; Frankly speaking, I choose this hotel because I saw so many positive review , I believe I will not be disappoint but actually I am, I hope my review following will be help for you. 1. Location is OK, the western side of magna plaza about ten minutes by walking, in front of htl is rail of tramway, several lines, the traffic of tramway has great noisy and you can not sleep well, hence we changed the htl rooms to a canal faced room; 2. HTL doesnâ€™t hv reception at ground floor, you need to take very narrow stairs to arrive the front desk, pls refer to photo I took 3. Rooms are terrible slim, pls refer to photo, even the refrigerator needed to be handed up 4. HTL only hv shower, but you canâ€™t take shower at all because the tap of shower installed around 2 m high, canâ€™t regulated, the water splashed anywhere in the bath room 5. The breakfast is continental , very simple; 6. As for hotel staff concerned, they are very help and kind, only positive point at htl Nadia

Reviews.Title: “loved amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: meadowHalesowen
Reviews.Content: other reviews are correct staff were excellant, couldnt do enough for us. We arrived early (10.00) and we were allowed to help ourselves to breakfast which therefore gave us an extra breakfast. The hotel then allocated our room at 10.45. As we were also leaving late, although we checked out we were also able to go and get a drink and sit in the breakfast bar. Rooms at the front were noisy and if I stopped again I would request a room at the back. As said rooms were very small and it was hard to sit in the rooms, however we did just want the hotel as a base Really close to Anne Franks house which is definatly worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, stairs aside!”
Reviews.Author: norcalman95628
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a time-zone-adjustment stop on a 16-day trip to Europe. The staff was incredibly accommodating, including welcome drinks, directions, calling cabs, good English and overall attitude. Yes, as noted in other reviews, the stairs are pretty remarkable, especially after a full day/night out and about, but those aside, the hotel was a good value, clean and, as noted above, friendly and hospitable staff. Very close to Anne Frank Museum, coffee shops and other sites in the area. I'd recommend this hotel highly though you must be mobile in order to handle the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “7 wonderfull days in Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doom
Reviews.Content: we stay at nadia hotel for 7 days and it was wonderfull.all the staff was very kind and they help us a lot.Mr Osam was very kind and he was very fun.The hotel it was very clean our room has a full canal view and it was very romantic.we hope to see Mr Osam and all the staff very soon. Next time we will take the same room 104.Spiros and Maria from Greece.Thanks for everything .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: TravelmanPerth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ''The Nadia'' betwee Xmas and New Year and chose this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location , around the corner from Anne Frank House and a short walk to the Dam Square. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable and the service form all staff memebers was fantastic, i would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel or staying again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: KansasTravelman
Reviews.Content: this little hotel is great. first of all it has a great location just off the Dam square. right under this hotel,(as many are actually upstairs there) is shopping and a few good places to eat! When you first arrive there is a buzzer door you smile into the camera and they buzz the door open for you. in you go and the craziest stairs are right in front of you to the hotel level on the second floor. when you are arriving they send someone down to greet you and carry your baggage up for you as there is no elevator. up the stairs is the front desk with a humorous and very helpful staff. Of all the hotels i have stayed at in amsterdam, this one has had the best service. of course the rooms are tiny, but who needs them while in this cool city. they were clean and comfy and i had a canal view room with a spacious balcony for two or three even with chairs. More about the location, it is only five minutes walk to the dam square which is great since we were there for new years. it lies i believe west of the dam for your info and in a good area too! they practice the notion of keeping your room key for you when you go out so no worry of losing it since you probably wont remember much any way!

Reviews.Title: “Good BUDGET Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intllady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed during our 4 night stay. This is a Budget Hotel that is centrally located, with nearby Tram Stops. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The steps at the entrance are very steep (I got a great workout!), but have a sturdy handrail and the staff will carry your bags to your room. The occupants in the rooms on either side of us were heavy smokers (it felt like they were in the room with us!), so we switched rooms after our 2nd night and had a great view of the fireworks on New Year's Eve! I do not recommend this hotel for families, older people, or honeymooning couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ClarePete97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia for 2 nights, on arrival the stairs did look scary but there was someone who came running down to take our luggage for us, when we checked in the staff could not of been more helpful, you get a FREE arrival drink and they took our luggage to our room, where there is fridge, tv and safe! The rooms are VERY tiny but they are perfect if you are just sleeping in them and a quick shower, the only problem we had was the noise from the road and i am a very light sleeper we stayed in room 307. I cannot comment on the breakfast which was from 7.30am - 10.30am as we were not up in time for it. On check out we had no problems and we were offered again a FREE leaving drink. I would certainly recommend this hotel and for the price you cannot beat it. - ABSOLUTLEY 1ST CLASS SERVICE, Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: t2k2l
Reviews.Content: Having done lots of research i found Nadia to have the best reviews, and booked 4 nights as a suprise birthday present for my boyfriend. You will not be dissapointed. The stairs are steep but the staff are excellent and carry everything for you, rooms are small but perfectly formed. The staff are excellent, on our last night i sprained my ankle in dam square (mind those cobbles!!) and they found me a bandage to hobble back to the aiport with!! They also sent flowers to the room to wish my boyfriend happy birthday when they saw the cards in our room, lovely touch. Breakfast was basic but fresh, coffee, tea,orange juice, bread, croisssants, rolls, cheese, jams. All in all our stay was perfect and if we return to amsterdam we will most DEFINITELY be going back to the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at The Nadia!”
Reviews.Author: judith82
Reviews.Content: We chose hotel nadia based on their rates - they were the cheapest place we could find - and we were pleasantly surprised by its amenities. For a 2 star hotel, they offer many of the amentities of a higher rated hotel. We were greeted at the door with a smile, a porter took our luggage to the room. Our room was quite small - enought room for a double bed and not much else, but we had a balcony! We had a continental breakfast each morning we were there. The hotel is also extremely centrally locate. About a block from the Anne Frank House on one side and about 3 blocks from the Dam Square on the other side. Not to mention the fact that a tram line runs right outside. There was 24 hour front desk coverage and the hotel staff were able to accomodate every request we had. They aren't the most glamorous hotel, but I loved staying there, and I would recommend it to anyone, and should I go back to Amsterdam I would stay there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Corkonian0
Reviews.Content: just back from 3 nights at the nadia hotel. couldn't really fault anything. yes, the stairs are VERY steep as mentioned previously, but we never once had to carry our luggage up or down the stairs.we were met on arrival and as it was too early to check in, our bags were brought to the luggage room and when we got back to the hotel later and went to the room our bags were already there.when checking out, they too looked after the bags and were downstairs ready for us to leave. the rooms are small but had more than enough facilities- tv,fridge,toilet/shower,safe,tea/coffee and hairdryer & irons were available from reception on request. would not think the room would be suitable for a girls weekend though - especially if your inclined to bring alot of baggage... location: 3-4 minutes from dam square and a further 10min from central station.the hotel is also on a tram route so all the major destinations/attractions are easily accessible if you don't fancy walking. the shuttle bus from airport to hotel is very handy-would definately travel this way again. staff very helpfull & friendly, received map of amsterdam and welcome drink on arrival. breakfast was typical continental style. some hotels charge extra for this. would definatley consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vonbricky
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel made our stay is Amsterdam all the more special. Our room was very cute, the service was excellent, we were greeted with a smile from start to finish and had a beautiful view from our balcony. I would recommend the Nadia Hotel to anyone wishing to have a pleasant stay in the beautiful Amsterdam and will definitely stay there upon my return to the city of canals and bicycles. Richard.

Reviews.Title: “magical christmas”
Reviews.Author: sikaEngland
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from the nadia hotel amsterdam and very reluctantly i might add . This will have been our fifth stay with these wonderful people in less than two years it is so close to central amsterdam and so many surrounding attractions, entertainment and outstanding restaraunts we were very sad to leave but hopefully we will be returning soon. thanks again to the people of nadia for the fantastic welcome and service throughout our stay the dymonds.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back to the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: swastikrath
Reviews.Content: I just love the Nadia Hotel. Spent 2 nights there during my Honeymoon this year. Location is excellent, its right on Dam Square and most Tram conductors will point it out to you in case you cannot find it. Stairs are a bit steep, not a problem for us, but may not be suitable for the elderly. However someone is always available to help you with your luggage. As you check in they ask you to pick a drink out of the tiny refrigrator in the lobby (on the house). As we were a little early, they offered to put our bags in the room while we decided to venture out into the city. Rooms are really tiny...but really cute... and they have a even cuter balcony...It was too cold for us but its a nice place to while the evening away. Bathrooms are even tinier..can step right in the toilet from the bed. Rooms however are very comfortable. Staff is amazing, They helped us a lot on our city tour, plotting out trips for us on a map..suggesting Tram routes, places to eat. All in all a great place for a romantic holiday. Would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant exerience.”
Reviews.Author: Kipcat
Reviews.Content: Great location, deluxe room was lovely, staff incredibly nice. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Nadia, lovely staff, nice clean hotel with small rooms, cosy and clean. See you next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeSearcher
Reviews.Content: Though I travel the world-over on weekly basis for business, I have yet to come across a more accommodating staff. -Because most of the staff ARE the owner's, you'll be sure to have the best service ever, too! For a recent holiday stay I easily booked the reservation through the company's website at [--] and I promptly received a confirmation via email. Arrival was just as planned and the hotel took care of everything. A short walk to any of the central downtown attractions, the hotelâ€™s location is convenient. The tram is easily accessed for more distant destinations or during poor weather. The hotel rooms are of course compact in size, but very clean and certainly adequate for a good nightâ€™s rest. I will return again anytime my travel takes me by way of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot99
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The staff was very willing to accomodate any needs I had, and was particularly keen on offering me free drinks "on the house" which was nice. The breakfast was very nice, and the location was good. I didn't realize that the Jordaan carried with it the hustle and bustle of downtown but at least the Nadia helped to make the hustle less severe. I would definitely return to the Hotel Nadia if I am in Amsterdam again. It is an excellent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place”
Reviews.Author: orna_7
Reviews.Content: great location, friendly staff, small but convenient room with full canal view. will be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loverly Hotel, Not a right angle in the room”
Reviews.Author: suggs99
Reviews.Content: Got here late on a Friday evening, all wet. Was expecting the steps and was not disappointed. Offered a welcome drink on arrival and asked to wait in the breakfast room, while our booking was sorted out. Nearest tram stop is Westermarkt from Central Station Tram number 13, cost 1.60 euro Room we got was next to the breakfast room and as we found out in the morning had a balcony overlooking the street with a view of the church and the canal. Excellent. Trams run until midnight, so you can here the bell ringing as it passes. Oddly I didnt hear much noise form the breakfast room in the morning which was good. The room was small, not a right angle in sight, but this, to me, adds to the charm of the place. The Staff very friendly and helpful where needed, no problems with taking the extra supplies of Hot Choc to deal with the damp. If we go back to Amsterdam, we would be back to the Nadia.

Reviews.Title: “The Nadia is the Place”
Reviews.Author: tldehart32
Reviews.Content: The Nadia is both beautiful and centraly located. The staff is as friendly and helpful as any I've had in a hotel. They make you feel like you are part of the Nadia family.

Reviews.Title: “how many stairs??????”
Reviews.Author: sandyswales
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this hotel for a four day break.The staff were really helpful and friendly.As reported by other reviews the stairs were really steep no good for anyone with dissabilities etc.they are typical of Amsterdam buildings. The bedroom was small but who stays in their room all day .The sheets etc were crisp white cotton, towels changed every day.If you have a room starting with 4 look out you have 71 stairs to climb yes i did say 71 and they are really steep and narrow. The breakfast room is small,but quaint .We booked the shuttle bus from the airport for a return ticket it was 19.50(euros)a little expensive but you are dropped off at the door and picked up at the door so very convinient.Anne Franks museum is a must so is the Dutch Resistance museum. Fab location.Out of the door turn right 5 mins to the Dam (main square), where you will find the red light district and all the pubs.

Reviews.Title: “great friendly service and staff, great location and room”
Reviews.Author: fezman
Reviews.Content: I found out a week before that I needed to be in Amsterdam for business for just one day. Since that was a Friday, I decided to stay through the weekend and enjoy Amsterdam (my second trip). My company was trying to get me to stay by the airport, but I did a little research here and found the Nadia. I emailed regarding availability and they got back to me quickly to confirm. Since I was travelling solo, and knew of the small rooms I picked the basic accomodation. I also added an additional day a few days before I arrived and was given no hassle at all. I arrived very late on friday following my meeting. Since it was late, cold and rainy, I took a cab from centraal station. Even though I knew the fare was escessive, and commented on it, I still got taken advantage off by the driver. Please beware of this! My reception was warm and I was offered a drink by the gracious man at the desk (sorry I didn't ask his name). He was very helpful my whole stay. The rooms are very small, but typical of the other places I've stayed in Amsterdam. Accomodations were clean and confortable, my top 2 requests. The bathroom was very small, it was hard to wash my face in the sink even! Very close to trams and Dam Square. Excellent location. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Although if you need western/'american style hotel rooms, you're best to look elsewhere. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “37 Steps to Reception - Brings me "Home".”
Reviews.Author: HenryHopkins
Reviews.Content: 3 visits to Amsterdam this year and 3 stays in the Nadia. My first visit was in June when I booked a city break through a Travel Agent. I made my subsequent bookings on-line direcly with the Hotel. On the first visit I took a taxi from the Airport which cost about â‚¬40-00. The next time due to busy traffic and taking an alternative route that turned out to be equally busy cost â‚¬70-00. Third Time I took Train to Central Station for â‚¬6-80. My first thoughts on arrival was:- there's the sign for the Nadia Hotel but where is it? The Taxi Driver rang the doorbell and when the door opened I was was a bit taken aback to see a really steep narrow stairway ahead of me. Maybe someone knew that the 39 Steps is one of my favourite films. Having overcome the intial shock, I made it to the Reception. Was given a "Welcome Drink" from the fridge and sat in breakfast room while my bags were taken to my room. (The hotel staff brought my luggage up and the down stairs on all my visits). I was also given a guidebook to Amsterdam 2007 and a leaflet about the Hotel. Had to lodge â‚¬10 Deposit for the Room Key /TV remote control - not asked for on subsequent visits. I did not read any reviews of the Hotel until after my first visit. Most reviewers comment on the friendly staff which I fully endorse. What sticks out in my mind was on Sunday morning when I asked where I would find a Catholic Church ,Osam (the Manager) was very helpful with directions and when I returned later in day the first thing he asked me had I found it. I stayed in a different room each time. One had twin beds. All the rooms I stayed in are all very small. Very Compact. Bathrooms also compact - Toilet -Wash hand basin and Shower. Wouldn't fancy it if I was any way overweight. I found the beds comfortable. Each room has a small fridge and safe. I did find that the safe was a little too high in my last room. One note of caution, mind the bed clothes that you don't trip. Also check if any small step from Bathroom to Bedroom. My most recent room had a balcony overlooking the street. There is a very nice Tearoom on the opposite side on the street called Jennifer's. There are a number ATM machines nearby, although one a few doors from Jennifer's did not take my type of card. I used the Shuttle Bus to return to the airport each time. The Hotel Reception did the booking for me. On my most recent arrival when I took the Train to Central Station, I had intending taking the Tram(which stops close to Hotel) but as it was a dry evening I ended up walking. Probably took about 15 minutes. On reflection maybe a bit too far to walk when pulling a suitcase. The Anne Frank House is only a few minutes away. Dam Square is about 10 minutes. One of my first stops there was Madame Tussauds. The Breakfast room is small. Even though I only have tea and toast at home when I go on holiday I like the Full Fry. So the continental breakfast is always a bit of a disappointment. Tea and Croissant still nice. It is not too difficult to find a restaurant around town that does the big fry. At breakfast, to make tea put teabag in cup and pour Boiling Water from Coffe Type Jug. If you need a bigger cup just ask. The Front door of hotel is always closed. Guests have to buzz everytime thecome in. You have to pass reception to get any of the rooms. Whenever I get back to to Amsterdam and as long as I (or if I should have a travelling companion) can make it up those steps anticipate I will be staying in the Nadia. (Where I hope to hear Osams words of greeting - "Welcome Home".

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: *just*me*in*nyc*
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia for 4 nights in September. I should have written this review sooner, but just didn't get around to it. I completely recommend the Nadia Hotel. Osam and his staff really care about making your stay terrific. My single room with a street side balcony was perfect for me. I was welcomed to the hotel after a long overnight trip like a long lost family member. There were beautiful flowers waiting for me in my room on arrival. After the first night I asked the staff if they could find me a thinner pillow and it was waiting in my room when I returned later that day. One evening I wandered to the breakfast room looking for a fork for some take out food I'd brought back and Osam kindly offered me some of his own dinner. I would stay again in an instant! In fact I'm thinking of springtime this time and am wondering how soon to contact Osam to reserve a canal side balcony room!

Reviews.Title: “stayed 3 times now.”
Reviews.Author: garyfarq
Reviews.Content: very helpful and friendly. near town centre and central station too. nothing a problem for them. will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Tigsnkooks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Nadia Hotel,this hotel is located in a great spot for everything in Amsterdam. The management and staff should be proud to say that they own/work in such a clean,hospitable and friendly place. I lost my wallet on a sat evening and returned to the hotel to cancel my credit cards,the staff were more than helpful and can only but thank them for the help they gave. Going back to the hotel we found the staff to be very knowledgable about their great city,the rooms were very clean and kept clean,the food was very nice and would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will be returning to the Nadia Hotel again in the near future..

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: qt2000x
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in this hotel based on some of the good reviews I read, but unfortunately, I do not agree with them. The hotel was not what I expected. However there were some positive points, I must say that the staff was very friendly and courteous and the hotel location was central. I personally didn't think the hotel was that close to Central Station (it is a brisk 20 minute walk so plan for it if you need to catch a train or a plane) and the stairs are kind of scary and steep. The room smelled bad and the bathroom is the smallest one I have ever seen. Breakfast was not much basically coffee, croissant and bread. I personally would not recommend this hotel unless you are a carefree traveler who is not looking for much in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great sensible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chozan
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at The Nadia in Mid November. Have stayed here numerous times and always have an enjoyable experience. The staff goes out of it's way to accomodate you, the location is great, the rooms are smallish, but modern and clean with all conveniences, you get free breakfast, and the price is right, What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fab ,Friendly and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: lexie4
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend in Amsterdam and we had a great time. The Nadia is a 5 minute walk from Dam square. Is is right next door to a pancake house which serves the most amazing food I have had in years! The hotel staff were excellent. They carried the bags up and down the steep stairs for us, they offered us complimentary drinks each time we passed the Reception. They recommended places to eat, things to see and more importantly took the time to show us how to get their! We were up in the gods, on the 4th floor. The room was small but plenty large enough for a weekend stay. The bathroom was spotless and all towles replaced daily if you wanted. It had tea & coffee making facilities and a tv. Continental breakfast was served and really set us up for the morning activities. We would return and recommend this hotel to all. It was in a safe area, clean, friendly and we felt at home!

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Nadia!!!”
Reviews.Author: biscuitbomber
Reviews.Content: We went to Europe for our honeymoon, and planned to be in Amsterdam for only 3-4 days. We booked online at Hotel Nadia, and when we got there, we were welcomed with cold soft drinks and a bouquet of flowers in our room congratulating us on our marriage! We traveled to Germany and Czech upon leaving, and were intending on traveling on to Italy, but we loved Amsterdam and Hotel Nadia so much, we came back for another 4 days! We had no reservation, but the amazing staff worked their magic and found us a room. When we were shown our room, there was another bouquet of flowers, this time welcoming us home! The rooms are cozy and clean, most with a great view of the church, canal, or both. And if you love cats (like we do) make sure you visit the two kitties who live in the hotel--you can see them thru the window on the way to the breakfast room. Also, we got great dining recommendations from the staff, and even went to a concert with Dennis and his friends. Basically, the only place we stay in Amsterdam is at Hotel Nadia!

Reviews.Title: “This place grows on you”
Reviews.Author: OutandAboutAlaska
Reviews.Content: OK, here's the deal. After a flight from Moscow, a train ride, a tram ride, a short walk with a ton of luggage, I was pretty upset to see a dingy door leading to two flights of VERY steep and narrow staircase. No elevator. I was not happy (but very polite). Well, there was help. A small man told us we didn't have to worry about bringing our luggage up the stairs and that our luggage would be delivered to our room. OK, I'll buy that. After climbing the stairs we entered a very small and depressing receiving area - the front desk so to speak. Still not happy (and still polite-I do have manners). The man behind the desk took total control of the situation, offered us soda's and told us to wait in the breakfast room while our luggage was being brought up and our room was made ready. We headed down a poorly lit hallway with metal room doors on either side. Still not happy and wondering what we got ourselves into. We took a right and entered the breakfast room. Instant happiness! The room was everything you would want in an old European hotel. The room was small but very well decorated and cozy. There were large and beautiful windows and a door leading to a small balcony. I'm happy now. Anyway, the man told us our room was ready and gave us our key. We walked up two more flights of, again, VERY steep stairs. As we entered our room we were so very happy. It was the top corner room overlooking the canal and church. A door entered onto a small balcony and a set of half-moon windows opened to the canal and church. The room was extremely clean and efficient. High ceilings and everything you could possibly need to make your stay comfortable. The bed was very comfy. In the morning we returned to the breakfast room for the complimentary breakfast. The best croissants, jam, coffee, and juice. Again, very nice. The hotel is located near the Anne Frank house on a canal. I recommend this hotel ONLY if you want to brave the stairs. There is no elevator so you need to be able to climb the stairs. The staff at the hotel is far above average. So - excellent staff, great location, cool room, very clean. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ugruk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for two nights, having arranged to layover in Amsterdam on a trip back from Russia. We stayed in a deluxe room with a balcony. It turned out to be a corner room with a great view. It was pretty small, but well-appointed and very nice. Since it was our first trip to Amerstedam, it was a little bit of a challenge figuring out the routine for getting to the hotel via train and tram, but not bad. The 2nd time would be a piece of cake. We ended up getting off the tram too early and dragging our overstuffed luggage a couple of extra blocks to the hotel. We were pretty tired when we arrived at the front entrance. Then -- when the door opened there was an almost vertical narrow staircase descending into the heavens and no lift. We quickly overcame our initial reaction, however. The staff were very friendly and carried all of our bags up to the third floor room. The breakfast was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel value”
Reviews.Author: bobrob69
Reviews.Content: Excellent Dutch experience. Fine canal-side corner building with balconies and one side over-looking a fascinating street. Diagonally oposite over the canal is a most beautiful and majestic church. The views day and night from the rooms were wonderful. People watching will have you smiling and warming to the city immediately. We stayed on the 4th floor and although aged mid-60's and not particularly fit, did not find the stairs up any problem. Enthusiastic staff ask to carry anything up and down before you can think of it. Manager, Osam, very kindly on less than 24 hours notice allowed us to postpone our booking for 7 days without penalty after a problem with airline tickets. Exceptional care and attitude to us guests. Very good free city map supplied - better than any others I've seen. Our first night was on the street side with good balcony and pleasant sitting outside day & night. Fresh flowers in the room and daily room service. Very clean and tidy small rooms. We enjoyed the unsual design of the distinctly Dutch hotel. Steep stairs (amused us) and small rooms are very sensible to an inner city hotel at good prices. This is not your everyday hotel chain boring same-old-some-old experience. Distinctly Dutch - give it a go! Subsequent nights we moved by invitation of the manager to another corner room over-looking the canel. Wonderful with balcony again. We left the window open to hear the church clock bells and night sounds far below. Breakfast was nice again in a corner room which could be busy but wasn't for us. We had good croissants orange juice, tea & coffee with some cake: eat as much as you like. Dont be too fussy, this is not the Ritz, but it is good clean accomodation with excellent staff and very central to everything. Walking all over is easy, safe and trams are good when tired. Be friendly and get friendly back. If you do as we did and complement the Dutch on their multi-lingual skills you'll have only smiles and pleasant times. Meals out nearby were most excellent at Foodism and Dutch fare at 't Zwaantje where tables are close enough to strike up dinner conversation with locals by asking for menu advice.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Karospondent
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews on this site, the hotel was much as we expected. The stairs are really steep (more like a ladder) and the room was very small but quite clean. The en-suite shower room was particularly small as was the hand basin in it, but if you want to stay in a budget hotel in the middle of the oldest part of Amsterdam this is what you get. The staff were very helpful and friendly and were able to answer all our questions like the best time to see Anne Frank House (we could see the size of the queue from our room!) and what trams to catch. We would rate the Nadia as offering good value and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia - Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: pejpm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in the Hotel Nadia on the 10th November. The hotel is in a fantastic location, only a couple of minutes from Dam Square, and close to the Anne Frank Huis. As with many buildings in Amsterdam, you enter via a very narrow steep staircase so the hotel would not be suitable for older people or people with disabilities. Upon arrival we were given a free soft drink, and were allowed to leave our luggage until our check in time later that day. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was very small, but the bathroom was nice and the room was very clean. I stayed with a friend in a 2 bed room, and the beds were literally only 1 foot apart, but it was fine just for a weekend. If I were staying for more than a few days I would get a single room to myself. The hotel serves breakfast, although I didnt try it as we were more interested in exploring Amsterdam. On the whole, I would reccomend the Hotel Nadia to budget travellers, and short term visitors. For the location and price, it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! We keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: Becky1982
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I stay here every time we visit Amsterdam. The staff are friendly, the rooms cosy and clean and the breakfast lovely. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's easy on the budget and very central. Thanks for another great stay guys and see you next year. Lots of love, Becky, James, Toni and Nick UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: tdob217
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for two nights. The room was small, but clean and well organized....with two large windows overlooking the street and canal. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Beware of the extraordinarily steep stairs going up to the reception! Very typical of dutch canal houses. I will definitely stay at the Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: psnewman
Reviews.Content: Osam and his staff could not be more friendly and helpful. Wonderful place. Flowers when we arrived, help with the luggage (Yes those are steep stairs). The rooms are small but functional. The hotel is an easy walk from everywhere you'll likely want to go. There is some noise from the street but that's what comes from staying in a lively city with so much going on. It's a terrific place, a fine value and we're sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the nadia”
Reviews.Author: gingerManchester
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is situated about 15 minutes walk form Central Station ,the rooms are very clean with T.V , fridge and coffee making facilities. The staff can not do enough to help you and they are all very courteous which made our stay very pleasant. We have stayed at this hotel for the last 4 years and I would highly recommend any one going to Amsterdam to stay there. Steven Thetford

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Middleagedcouple25
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at Nadia for 5 nights whilst exploring Amsterdam. It was a perfect choice in terms of location, the rooms had everything we needed, the price is amazing considering its central location, it is extremely clean and the staff could not more to make our stay everything we wished for. We stayed in a back room which as reqested was really quiet you wouldn't believe your were in the centre of a city. A good breakfast was provided in the small but adequate breakfast room. The stairs provided some good cardio vascular exercise each day !! A perfect break we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict54
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia was our home away from home for three days in Amsterdam. The hotel delivered beyond our expectations! Our room on the first two nights was small; but well thought out: organized, functional, and every space put into good use. On the third night, we got a room upgrade at no extra cost- a corner room with nice views out to the canal and church- and with a balcony! Service was impeccable: on arrival, the staff carried the bags up into our room and on departure carried it down. We were offered free drinks on arrival and breakfast take-out on our very early departure. Internet connection problem was urgently resolved. The staff was courteous, professional, and very helpful. The hotelâ€™s location was central to Amsterdamâ€™s many attractions and easily accessed by foot. Finally, Hotel Nadiaâ€™s website provided a well of useful information for first timers to Amsterdam like us. Thanks to you Osam and to your staff for making our stay a most pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Room was tiny, economical, clean and shower worked great. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tisidor
Reviews.Content: The Nadia was a small walk-up hotel. The neon sign telling you to enter through a narrow door was of slight concern. The picture on the website is accurate, but entering up a steep set of stairs didn't quite feel like the picture in my head. We were greeted with a warm smile, welcoming us to the hotel. Our room wasn't ready and we were offered a beverage and we opted to wait in the Breakfast Room. The Breakfast Room overlooks a canal and is quite simple and clean. We reached our room by going half way down the main stairs and entering a door. It was the most crooked hallway in the world with doors for rooms on both sides. Our room was very small and efficient. Two (smaller than twin) beds overlooking the canal with a built-in desk and a small TV. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked great! It was just what I needed for a short overnight trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday location.”
Reviews.Author: inchcape121060
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned form a 3 night stay in the Nadia Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel and service was very good, staff could not do enough to help. Hotel mentions the stairs up to the reception as steep and they are correct but dont worry about that as the wee feller on reception manages the bags just fine. The hotel location is spot on and Dam Square, Royal palace, Red light district and Ann Franks house is only minutes away. We really enjoyed Amsterdam and the Nadia Hotel and will certainly be back.
