Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: lucas_style
Reviews.Content: Very personable staff willing to go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. We reserved a room with a balcony and it was outstanding. Location is very good. Close to the high energy of the red light district but far enough away for peace and quiet. Affordable price. One of the best places I stayed in while in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkTheREALCapital
Reviews.Content: This is a typical DUTCH hotel that was absolutely fantastic to stay in for the real Dutch experience. We were a group of 16 adults (mostly couples) staying in Hotel Nadia for the weekend to celebrate a 40th birhday. The staff went over and beyond their duty to make sure we had the best stay possible. The breakfast, as stated, is continental but boy do they make a fine croissant-we fought every moring amongst ourselves for first pickings but the hotel always provided an endless supply. Yes the hotel has steep stairs but show me an authentic Dutch hotel that does not. Do as we did and enjoy the quirkiness of this hotel. You will NOT be disappointed. The location is also fantastic; it's only a 3 minute walk from Dam Square and that's after sampling the local delicacies!!

Reviews.Title: “An extremley enjoyable stay at Hotel Nadia!”
Reviews.Author: Square041279
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the room very small but was clean and had everything we needed. Would highly recommend Hotel Nadia and would definately stay again if visiting Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Tourist Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: kpark714
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The rooms and bathrooms are very small, but it's Amsterdam. The hotel is clean, safe and has excellent location. The staff at this hotel exceeded my expectations. Everyone is friendly and extremely helpful. You should definitely take advantage of the manager, he knows the city really well. He's very helpful and really seems to enjoy giving suggestions (and directions). He mapped out all of our outings and gave us some great restaurant recommendations. This isn't the fanciest hotel, but I'd stay there again. If you're a light sleeper you may want to request a room away from the street, it's pretty noisy by the tram line. Great tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The very frendly Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Davidairo
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel in one of the best parts of Amsterdam close to most places of interest. It is just down the street from the Ann Frank house and two short blocks away from the main tram line. Everyone at the Nadia was very helpful and friendly and the view of the church was great. The stairs are a little steep but that is the way most of the hotels and homes are and there is help with your bags, so the climb is not to bad. I would stay at the Nadia anytime I am in Amsterdam. David L.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great staff”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGlebe
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days in a large room overlooking one of Amsterdam's many wonderful canals. The view was fabuous and the room was spacious and clean. Room service was especially efficient, going as far as hanging some of my shirts. Hotel Nadia is located walking distance from the Dam Square and Central Station. The hotel staff provide very useful directions to various sites. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: vedderfan23
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a backpacking trip through Europe. We spent a few days in Amsterdam, and found Hotel Nadia via the Internet. We would both stay there again without a doubt. Yes, other reviews about the small size of the rooms are true, but we were only using the rooms to shower, sleep, and drink wine on our private balcony. Otherwise we were out exploring the city. The people running the hotel were the nicest I've meet in my trips in Europe. For instance, one night I went to the lobby and asked the gentleman behind the desk where I might find a store to find wine or beer at the hour of 10pm. He asked what I'd prefer - beer or wine. I said wine. He asked red or white. I said red. He asked that I wait a minute as he finished something behind the desk. He then got up and went out of sight, only to return 10 seconds later with a bottle of red wine. I asked how much I owed him, he said it was on the house. From helpful tips about the city, to comfort in the room, and transportation to the airport, our entire experience in Nadia couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “after 5 months of traveling it was like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: Grif_and_Whitestar
Reviews.Content: We decided this year to take the vacation of all vacations and left on a five month, around the world adventure in May, staying in all three, four and five star hotels for the entire period. The Nadia was the last stop on our last leg of a month in Europe. We booked it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, because although it did not have one of the standard upscale brand names that are all over Amsterdam, the reviews were all outstanding. We were not disappointed! From the moment of our arrival everything was beyond our expectations. Although not a standard run-of-the-mill, modern five star hotel, the genuine hospitality, friendliness, attentiveness and service at the Nadia far exceeded anything we had experienced in places we paid four times as much for. Add to that a real classic landmark building two minutes from the center of town looking directly onto the canals with snarling gothic gargoyles leering down from the roof! The Nadia is the real deal! And those stairs! Don't worry, they will run your luggage up and down for you along with anything else you desire, but just experiencing those stairs took us back to the Amsterdam of the 18th century! I wouldn't pass them up for an elevator any day. Osam and his family make you feel like you have come home to Grandma's house. So if you want to experience the real deal while marveling at Amsterdam and be within two minutes walking distance from the Palace, don't take no for an answer and beg Osam for a room with a balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZelG
Reviews.Content: This is the second visit to the Nadia Hotel. The friendly staff gave us a warm welcome, the continental breakfast which is included in the price of the room makes it very good value for money. The location is perfect, a short walk from dam square. The room was clean with a canal view. We will definately be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good break”
Reviews.Author: bway2larj
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was OK for a weekend break - reasonably tacky, but tacky can be fun ! Loads of nice restaurants, and the native Dutch themselves are really friendly (can't say the same about all the nationalities there). Downside was graffiti everywhere, and by our fourth day (we were flying back in the evening) we were pretty bored as we had really done all the local sights and would have had to start travelling further afield. The shopping is pretty dull. So a two or three day trip max is good, unless you are planning on travelling outside of Amsterdam. The Hotel Nadia was nice and adequate for our purposes. Again, the staff were really friendly, and the room, although really small and dark, was comfortable and clean - the bathroom was very clean and well maintained, which was good. Nadia is well located - close to the shops and central Amsterdam, so we walked most places. Took the tram out to the museum quarter, which was a quiet area, so I'm glad we were more central. If we could ask for an improvement, then it would be stronger ligghting in the bedroom (we had a 'delux' room - number 5) and a more varied breakfast. Croissants and bread everyday gets boring fast. Again, adequate, but some fruit, yoghurt and cereals wouldn't go amiss. All in all, Nadia is a comfortable, safe hotel in a good location at a not unreasonable cost. Get past the initial impression that the front door gives you and the small bedroom, and you'll end up feeling that it is OK. We would stay here again without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel is Superb. Great Location, Price, Friendly, Clean, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: 7_Scottish_Ladies
Reviews.Content: I booked the Nadia Hotel for a group of seven using the hotel's website and found that the manager answered any e-mail enquiries very quickly and was extremely helpful. We had one triple deluxe room, a twin deluxe room and a twin room and all were clean, had en- suite WITH HAIRDRYER and well equipped with tea making facilities. We knew that hotel rooms in the centre of Amsterdam are compact, stairs tend to be steep and we had opted for this hotel knowing it did not have a lift/elevator and we just took out time going up and down the stairs. We were a mixed age group ranging from the age of 25 -60 years. Our luggage was carried up and down for us which was a bonus. The hotel was fully booked during our stay, so I advise you to book well in advance. Every member of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and recommended the best places to go to eat and places to visit. The rooms cleaned and fresh towels every day. The breakfast was Continental style self service in a large room overlooking the canal. The choice of food was limited to various rolls, breads, croissants, jams and spreads and cheese but adequate as you could have as much as you wished and numerous refills of fresh orange juice, teas and coffees On our day of departure we stored our luggage in the locked baggage room and we were allowed to use the breakfast room as a meeting point and were offered refreshments. There is so much to do and see that a weekend was not long enough and we all hope to go back and EVERYONE in the group said they would definitely book the Nadia Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: muffinboz
Reviews.Content: Lots of steep stairs are inevitable in the older canalside buildings in Amsterdam, and this is the main drawback of this hotel. Room slightly cramped, but a wonderful canal view - and a LARGE double bed is not always found in Europe (it was more like UK King or US Queen size). Having a refrigerator in the room was also very useful. We had a problem at the end of the stay when the shuttle bus to the airport (booked for us by the hotel) failed to appear - apparently the booking was lost by the shuttle company. Hotel immediately accepted responsibility and ordered us a taxi to the airport (paid for by hotel). Generally an outstanding experience, with easy transport links and a five minute walk to Dam Square. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Nadia Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieWirral
Reviews.Content: Hi. Just returned from weekend break to Amsterdam. Stayed in Nadia and had read reviews in advance - forewarned about small rooms and the stairs but going with logic it's only a bed, didn't worry unduly. Actually thought the stairs were great! Took a photo - just like lots of stairs in canal houses - made us laugh. We were a party of two couples - and were given two rooms - one double and one twin. It was pot luck, and when we went to our room, opened the door - I saw the bed an immediately looked for the other one - assuming we had the twin. There wasn't another one - it was a double bed and with a husband of over 6 ft - it's a good job I'm only small. It was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The bed had to be that small, it wouldn't have taken another one. The shower was also dodgy. Difficult to get water temperature right - poor pressure - but it would suddenly go to scaulding hot which was a little scary. The good points were that it had a fridge -and a safe which was great. Also luggage care (we only had backpacks) was fine. Left them on last day and picked them up later. Very friendly people, breakfast okay - but get there before 8.30 or you won't get in. Good location - just by Anne Frank house - and pretty easy to get anywhere. Our friends room - the twin - was better. I'm sure ours was the smallest in the hotel. The photos on the website are taken at an angle to maximise space!

Reviews.Title: “We liked...”
Reviews.Author: Parabolah
Reviews.Content: ... to stay in Hotel Nadia. Room was quite small, it was just what we expect. Breakfast was good. Location of Hotel Nadia is REALLY good and staff is really nice! We will recommend this hotel all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Nadia Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: psimper
Reviews.Content: 22nd September 2007 We have just spent 4 days in Amsterdam staying at the Nadia Hotel ,the hotel is in a very good position and we found it to be very clean. The staff at the Nadia are very freindly and are always willing to help, the only concern we had was the size of the rooms you can only get into a double bed from one side and the shower room was very tiny also a lack of storage for clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth year in a row back at Nadia”
Reviews.Author: GerryE
Reviews.Content: Coming back five years in a row says it all! Gerry from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler14
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. There is great free breakfast and refreshments included with the room. The location is unbeatable. The rates are so reasonable, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest People”
Reviews.Author: Selface
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is a really gorgeous place to be! The people are very warm, helpful and friendly :D The room was spot less and the bed SO comfortable and the sheets thick and soft :) This is my second time staying at Nadia Hotel and nearly everything was perfect, the only thing I would say that was not perfect is the shower, it had a strange smell and it was far too close to the toilet for my liking but then again when I stayed last year the shower/toiler was fine, maybe this was just unlucky on my part. Over All, hotel nadia is the place to be! :D

Reviews.Title: “.fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: mmj125
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a weekend in amsterdam,what a great place,people are so friendly and especially the staff at the hotel who made sure our stay was as hassle free as possible.the rooms were clean contained everything we needed eg.shower kettle fridge safety deposit box etc.Every time we handed in our key or retrieved it from the main reception we were offered soft refreshments from the fridge and boy were we glad of all the water. breakfast was continental lovely fresh juice also.We had access to the dining room at all times if we felt like havinga tea or coffee. I would highly recommend the Nadia to any one going to amsterdam its only 4 minutes from Dam Square the heart of the city.Lm defo going back nxt year,the manager of the nadia suggested that my hubby mite get a job in van gough museam[he the image apperantly of vincent]. See ye all next year.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: shawie3
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Nadia was very enjoyable. Osam who is the owner could'nt do enough for you as also his family and staff who are always very polite and made you feel very welcome. Our room overlooked the canal giving us a good outlook of a beautiful church the bed was comfortable,the room was very clean as was the bathroom. The room was small but for a city break of four days was very adequate. The breakfast was continental style which we enjoyed the bread and confectionary was always fresh and the coffee was really nice. Upon our arrival we were provided with a complimentary drink and fresh flowers delivered to our room. This made you feel very welcome. I think it was Osams son who carried our luggage to our room and again on departure. On this note previous entries regarding the steps should be borne in mind,as these stairs are unsuitable for infirm or unfit people. We ourselves did'nt find them a problem. If we go to Amsterdam again we would definately go to the Nadia which we would recommend as good value for money, very friendly atmosphere and in an ideal location for sightseeing. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Remarkable!”
Reviews.Author: ziggymbg
Reviews.Content: It is my great pleasure to give my review of The Nadia, a little hotel in the center of Amsterdam which provides to the traveler, if they are willing to be challenged as to what a hotel experience is usually like, an amazing and rewarding stay, a small, warm, humble, pleasant place unlike anyplace Iâ€™ve stayed in. This is because of the intimate nature of the physical structure, the history, and location of the building, and the intimate nature of the hotel owners and staff. Now itâ€™s very important to understand; this hotel is not for everybody because, and I like to think in a symbolic way, the two flights of very narrow and very steep staircases that one must climb up to hotel itself. If youâ€™ve stayed there you know exactly what I meanâ€¦this is an old building with no elevator so in order enter you must climb a big staircase. No joke. It like climbing a small mountain. But if you are up for the task and ready to climb the stairs to see what awaits you at the top then push the buzzer on the street go though the door and up you go! Warm and friendly faces greet you at the top in the very small cozy lobby. A smiling attendant offers to bring your luggage up the steep staircase. You are welcomed with a cold drink. Osam and his staff are ready for your arrival and they addressed me by name before I told them who I was. Osasm sized me up and gave me the loveliest room, #207 by the way, a corner room overlooking the canal and street. He gives rooms based on personal need and his expert knowledge of what room would be best for you. Donâ€™t expect a luxurious room. Mine was small yet warm, with few amenities. (ok Osam, here is a negative, just like you wanted to know): the bathroom amenities could be greatly improved like better towels, soap, show curtain etc. It was clean but not fancy. Small but cozy. Trade in fancy for an historic building with years of history and personal service. Itâ€™s an old building and an historic monument so I take these things in strideâ€¦this is not a fancy place, itâ€™s a genuine place and so some things can slip by. The personal service continued through my stay. Each time I returned to the hotel and by the time I reached the top of the stairs my key was placed for me on the counter. You leave the key each time you go out. The staff experience here is unlike any other. When was the last time you were greeted and attended to by the owner himself who is running the hotel from the big the long counter in the lobby. A place you must spend time in is the kitchen/ breakfast room. There you will find a tasty breakfast in the AM and coffee served all day and late into the night. One morning I ate some croissants and sipped coffee on the small kitchen balcony overlooking the street below. It was bucolic; a memory and feeling I will always cherish. My pleasant interactions with Osam the inn keeper continued my entire stay and during my last night I stayed with him talking for 2 hours and having the nicest exchange. When my cab came at 5:15 am Osam himself carried one of my bags down those steep flights and arranged a cheaper cab to get me to the train. I could go on about the guys who carry your bags up those long stairs and the kitchen staff, the magnificent view of the church across the street across from the Ann Frank House, the location, the locationâ€¦5 minutes walk to Dam Square, near all trams, near the quite Jordan and the â€œ9 streetsâ€� shopping area, an internet cafÃ©s down the street, good restaurants on the street, and a really tasty french fry cart right across the streetâ€¦ and on and onâ€¦. but what makes this place great is what YOU can get from it. I will certainly return to the Nadia again when I visit Amsterdam. Osam has already promised me that if I want the same room, itâ€™s mine although there are so many lovely rooms I might try something new. This is a marvelous hotel experience and should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Ina_cea_rea
Reviews.Content: Nadia is a lovely hotel in a excellent location and amazing building. The hotel staff is very friendly and they managed to make my stay there unforgettable. The room was very small but with a huge balcony, allowing me to enjoy the canal view, the Westekerk view and the street view. Enjoy Amsterdam from this hotel if you need a place to stay right in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: busdriva69
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and a last minute change from another hotel to the Nadia, all we can say is, brilliant. We read all the whinging reviews about steep stairs and small rooms, so we were forwarned. But you show me a building in Amsterdam without steep stairs, and it does your legs good anyway :-) Greeted by the very friendly Osam (cheers for an excellent stay and a great way to kick off our Euro holiday) Great location and value. It was clean and everything worked, plenty of hot water etc etc. Wont bother trying another hotel when we next visit. If your on to a good thing stick to it. We were even offered a room with a better view after our first night, but we were comfy and couldnt be bothered moving, we didnt go for the view from the room, we went to experience the city. And what an experience it is. We couldn't get over the amount of people in one place, its full on and 3 days was probably abit short, so that just means we will have to go back. And the Nadia is where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “A Vsit to Nadia and no Lion or Witch in the Wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: lindadennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended and we weren't disappointed. The staff were friendly and although the room was small we were able to shoe horn ourselves in quite comfortably. We had a lovely canal view room and I would say the only thing we didn't know about was the clock in the church just over the canal that chimes but as there is so much to do and see you will be exchausted and probably won't be kept awake. We will definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lazey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at nadia over bank holiday compact, clean & the staff very freindly stairs something else.Ten minites walk from station & three minites from dam square if you are looking for character & not quality this is for you

Reviews.Title: “Back home at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: SwedTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4th visit to the Nadia Hotel and it just gets better. The Nadia is a very charming hotel with a friendly and personal staff. We enjoy the small, but very clean and charming room with modern facilities. We also enjoy the continental breakfast in the comfortable breakfast room with wonderful views. We look forward to "coming home" to the Nadia again soon! Peter & Malin, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Dinky Room!”
Reviews.Author: Tarnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia from 21 - 23 August. I agree with a previous comment that your heart does sink a little when you arrive outside the hotel and see the entrance sandwiched in a row of shops. My heart sank even more when we were shown to our double room which was really tiny with barely enough room for myself and my partner to move in at the same time. However, after the initial shock wore off we found the room to be more than adequate. The bathroom was small but clean and the shower was surprisingly powerful. Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the main road and canal which was very pleasant as the weather was quite warm. Although I didn't notice the noise from the trams my partner began to find them quite annoying! The staff at the hotel were very friendly and we were given useful maps and a guide book on arrival. The location of this hotel is perfect. We were able to walk from central station and from the hotel to Rembrandtplein, Leidseplein and the museum quarter. We didn't find it necessary to use either taxi's or trams. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on this website, the hotels location and the fact that I wanted to stay somewhere with a bit of character and not a modern chain hotel. I would recommend this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed my stay there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly”
Reviews.Author: KACLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully friendly hotel where staff made every effort to ensure that our stay was pleasant and comfortable. We especially liked the fact that we could leave our luggage at the hotel before we checked in and again after we checked out. Furthermore the breakfast was a lovely surprise, offering a selection of breads, jams, spreads etc. in a lovely ,sunny room decorated with plants. The room was good value and every effort had been made to make visitors welcome, for example with a fan, a fridge and a TV. The hotel is located in a historic part of Amsterdam within walking distance of the station and many museums and attractions. My husband and I will definitely stay here again and next time we will bring our daughter and try a family room. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and family since our return this morning because of its lovely location and kind and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended (with reservations - no pun intended)”
Reviews.Author: Beet7hoven
Reviews.Content: Arriving for the first time at this hotel your heart sinks (well, mine did, despite the positive reviews). From the exterior, it is unprepossessing - the narrow front door entrance is shoe-horned between a sewing machine shop (they still exist!) and a lighting establishment, with a protruding sign reminiscent of the Seventies. You press a buzzer to be let in and you are faced with a veritable Matterhorn of narrow, steep steps up to Reception. But, hey, this is Amsterdam, and that's how they made their houses. So either you will hate it already and wish you had booked a modern, purpose built, characterless concrete rectangle somewhere, or you will love it for its characterful, traditional appeal. I loved it. The Nadia occupies several floors of a sweeping crescent terrace, built circa 1890 and once elegant, but in need of the refurbishment currently underway. In its early days, part of it was used by the royal palace on Dam square, a few minutes walk away, to house its servants. At other times, it provided apartments for well-to-do middle class Amsterdamers, and had an array of useful shops at street level â€“ one of which (no, not the computer outlet) still exists. Once you have scaled the entrance steps, you will more than likely be greeted by the owner himself manning the Reception desk who will offer a welcoming drink from the chill cabinet, proffer maps and guides and useful info, and, if your room isnâ€™t ready, suggest you wait in the bright, airy and welcoming breakfast room along the corridor, overlooking the street below on one side and canal on the other and bedecked with plants and flowers. Judging by the brochure, the rooms are varied and quirky. Iâ€™d booked a twin for single occupancy, which had a (smallish) double bed and (child-sized) single bed. It was at the rear, looking out onto other apartments but suited me fine, especially as it was blissfully quiet, apart from the non-intrusive quarter-hour gentle bonging of a nearby church clock. With full occupancy of a (slim) couple and (well behaved) child it would have been a squeeze, with definitely no leeway for swinging a cat, especially in the toilet/shower-room which was definitely one person standing room only, but for a three-day stay (which, Iâ€™d guess is the average for most people visiting Amsterdam), it would be bearable for a two-and-a-half person family, and, erm, cosy for a couple. Think twice about demanding a room with a view â€“ there could be traffic noise from the street below. Breakfasts at the Nadia are what you would expect from a typical Dutch hotel â€“ croissants, a variety of breads and confitures, cold meats and cheese, coffee and a choice of teas â€“ all help yourself, but with the lady of the establishment on hand in the adjacent kitchen. Anybody wanting eggs and bacon and hashbrowns and suchlike should opt for a concrete rectangle placeâ€¦ Apart from its welcoming atmosphere, cleanliness and quiet, the joy of the Nadia is its perfectly located central position â€“ twixt Central Station and Rembrandt Square, and the Red Light District (should you wish its dubious delights) and the architectural jewels of the Westerkerk Jordaan quarter. Everywhere else is either walkable or easily accessed by tram, bus, or canal bus, or, if you must, wobbly (depending on your ability) bicycle. My reservations? Definitely not suitable for the infirm or anyone with mobility problems (as are many other Amsterdam hotels with walk-up, steep stairs), and, judged entirely on my own room, not suitable for the claustrophobic or any couple not on the best of termsâ€¦ And the lack of air conditioning could be a distinct drawback on hot nights (although my room had a fan strategically placed pointing at the bed. I wondered if the Red Light establishments had such luxury â€“ I didnâ€™t find out). Otherwise â€“ 10 out of 10 â€“ especially at the priceâ€¦ (PS: Bath mat, please, before my return visit!) (PPS: Beware Amsterdam taxi drivers. I was overcharged on arrival and short-changd on departure. They should be ashamed.)

Reviews.Title: “Nadia hotel--excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: gerib100
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other positive TripAdvisor reviews and they were accurate. The price is great for the value, especially considering it also comes with continental breakfast (nicely served in a sunny breakfast room). The hotel is in a very good location--a minute from excellent public transportation connections and also next to a pretty canal, and within comfortable walking distance of many areas. The room was small but pleasant and comfortable, and the staff were all very welcoming and helpful. I recommend it highly--just be aware there is a steep flight of stairs to get to the lobby if you have any mobility issues. (Luggage isn't a problem, they are happy to carry it for you.)

Reviews.Title: “What a welcome!”
Reviews.Author: HDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam, staying in the Nadia Hotel. We have rarely encountered such friendly welcoming staff who really made our visit memorable. Five minutes after we checked in Flowers were delivered to our room with a welcome card - really nice touch.You might not get the same high class amenities that are offered in some of the bigger chains, but if you want to stay somewhere that makes you feel at home from the moment that you walk in the door, then this is the place for you. Personal service and a warm welcoming smile, coupled with unique rooms devoid of any uniformity make this a place to remember - I'd have no hesitation recommending it to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Ozgirly
Reviews.Content: What a great find! The staff was so helpful with our luggage, we actually got in "trouble" for carrying it up the stairs ourselves! They were also helpful when the airport shuttle drove right past us. The Manager called and made them send a special car to come and get us! The room has everything you need (including fresh flowers!). Obviously it's small, you're in Europe afterall, but really who spends time in their room while on vacation! We had a room with a balcony and I recommend splurging on it! At night we bought a bottle of wine and sat on the balcony watching the sunset on the Westerkerk. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Roberto21
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the Nadia Hotel for the beautiful journey. Me and my wife have been wonderfully. A tranquill hotel in a great area. The personnel of hotel are very very kind to help us to bring the lugggages. Very good also breakfast and really we have had a great welcome! The room was very nice and original, a romantic room! Thanks for All. Roberto from Rome

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: davidhfromliverpool
Reviews.Content: just got back from Amsterdam good hotel the only problem was the stirs lots of them.the best thing about the room was the balcony very handy for hot summer nights.the room had every think in that you need bed,shower,WC,safe,kettle and wait for it a fridge perfect for your cold beers they could also do with getting English channels.all in all would stay there again if asked good location that was the key.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: JackieLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a 3 night stay at Hotel Nadia. The staff at this hotel are exceptional, friendly and hospitable with nothing being too much trouble. We were provided with 6 complimentary beers in the fridge upon arrival and were also given complimentary drinks by the manager on our last evening there. The breakfast was lovely, fresh coffee, orange juice, croissants etc. We stayed in room (208) it was extremely small and after 3 nights felt claustrophobic. Although the room was clean the bathroom tiles were grubby with black mould growing on the grout between them. The stairs leading to reception are extremely steep but we were aware of this before we booked. The hotel is central to all amenities, 10 min walk from the train station and 5 mins to Anne Franks house and Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Wadhurstgill
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small don't be fooled by website as all done with wide angled lens. It was clean but not nicely decorated and the breakfast was terrible. However the staff were very helpful and friendly. Won't be rushing back there although we loved Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: MaxMilan
Reviews.Content: Just come back from it. Good value for the money, friendly atmosphere and very convenient location in the heart of the city. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Nadia Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Poppy95
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from Amsterdam, staying two nights at the Nadia Hotel, travellng with a friend. The hotel was recommended to me and in turn I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, a big thanks to Osam and his team for making us feel so welcome and comfortable. The service was exceptional with nothing too much trouble; help was cheerfully given even when the staff were obviously very busy attending to other guests as well. The hotel is in a central location, great for exploring Amsterdam on foot, very close to the Anne Frank House and a short walk to Dam Square. The room was immaculate and also had a lovely view of the canal. Yes, the stairs are steep, but this is typical of Amsterdam and staff are on hand to help with luggage. I think you'd be hard placed to find a more friendly place to stay, thanks again to the team at the Nadia Hotel for making this visit such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday at the Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slg40
Reviews.Content: 31st July 2007 We have just returned from 3 nights at the fab Nadia Hotel. Nothing I can say will do justice to the time we spent there. Apart from the steep stairs up to the hotel (and we knew about them before we left) we could find no fault. The building was "very" much typical of traditional Amsterdam. The welcome you receive was warm and friendly with all luggage taken upstairs for you - so no carrying things up the steep stairs. As we arrived early we enjoyed a complimentary continental breakfast before heading out to explore. By the time we got to our room later in the day our luggage was waiting for us - talk about service. The views from our room were fab and we even had a balcony looking out to the canal. Rooms were comfortable though not overly big but were kept immaculate with ALL linen including duvet cover changed daily. The staff were all so friendly that you were made to feel at home - something you can never achieve fully in a larger commercial hotel. From answering questions to posting our holiday postcards nothing was too much trouble for them. I cannot thank them enough for making this a holiday we will never forget. S & L Gosling

Reviews.Title: “5 night at the Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnny_minimax
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel 5 nights during last June.It was a very pleasant stay.The Hotel is located in a very good location,5 minutes from the Dam Square.Moreover,under it you can find a Tram station,so you can travel in the city without any problem. The hotel's facilities are in great condition,Our room was comfortable,very clean,the bathroom is might small but, it was clean and convenient. The breakfast was edible for Continental one. There are many hotels in Amsterdam,however,I am sure few have such a friendly and fine stuff like in Nadia Hotel. The stuff always willing to assist you and to direct you to Amsterdam's attractions. Finally, you might read about the stairs,I think that people with average health can handle it without any problem. I am sure will return to it. Johnny

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: Habman1
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy clean rooms, friendly staff, and courteous service you'll love the Nadia Hotel. Yes, my room was small(It was a single), and the stairs are steep, but that's part of the adventure. Osam and his staff where friendly and helpful... even offering a bottle of water or a soda at no charge if it looked like you needed it! It's centrally located near the Anne Frank House and right on a Tram line. The breakfast room is a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the traffic and bicyclists. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “central location, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: nixisprite
Reviews.Content: great place to stay in amsterdam. central location, right across from the anne frank house and very near to Prinsengracht which is a beautiful street along one of the canals. the stairs are quite daunting when you first walk in though! great breakfast room. room with a balcony is probably better..

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: danco28
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (in the lovely Jordaan district) and very friendly and obliging staff. The room was v. small but fine for my needs and had been recently refurbished. Breakfast was good, although the breakfast room was quite cramped. As with many Amsterdam Hotels - there is a steep staircase and lots of steps! But I would certainly recommend the Hotel Nadia

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: eindhovenaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night (July 3-4) at Nadia Hotel. We visited Amsterdam on July 3 and then left on July 4 to the Duinreserve (a lovely national park situated between Amsterdam and Alkmaar). Our stay at Nadia Hotel was an enjoyable one. As most other reviewers have noted, the staff were extremely friendly and the price, although well beyond average price for a 2 star hotel in the Netherlands, seems to be a norm in Amsterdam. The hotel is conveniently situated close to all attractions. The rooms are a bit tiny but the big windows openeing to the canal may remedy that (we got a canal-side room). One thing that may make a bad impression at arrival is the very steep staircase (typical Dutch) right at the entrance (leading to the reception) and the very narrow corridor to the rooms but overall, I was satisfied with the hotel and the rooms. The breakfast was ok; there was no milk, cereals or eggs but I guess you could order milk. You should also ask the waitress to toast your bread, if you want some. I was hearing the lady suggesting to another group of guests to buy some eggs and she could keep them in the firdge and cook them for their breakfast. All in all, there is not much luxury in Nadia Hotel but it has a very pleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRMW
Reviews.Content: Booked direct for a three night stay - all responses were fast and precise. Our room was on the fourth floor (a lot of stair climbing, but this IS Amsterdam!) in the front corner, so the window looked onto the canal, balcony looked out over to the church - well worth the climb. Great location - a few minutes stroll to many canalside bars for late afternoon drink, maybe 10 minutes to Dam Square (hard to say as who's counting!!) The hotel was spotless and the rooms cleaned to "just as it was when you arrived" every day The staff were exceptional - friendly, couldn't do enough to help in every respect with luggage, directions, advice. I would certainly recommend the Nadia without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: TinCop
Reviews.Content: My brother, and my husband and I stayed 3 nights at Nadia hotel during our trip to Europe and visiting Amsterdam in the first week of June 2007. Itâ€™s a lovely hotel in central location in Jordaan which is conveniently closed to most attractions. The hotel staffs are very friendly. And Osam, the hotel manager is exceptionally nice and is fun to talk to. We arrived at 9:30am and the rooms were not ready until 2pm. The hotel staffs stored our luggage until we came back in the afternoon and Osam had the luggage delivered to our rooms for us. On the day we leave, our flight out of Amsterdam was at 7am, so we had to leave the hotel very early at 4:30am, and requested a wake up call at 3:30am. Osam was there at the reception at 3:30am personally gave us a wake up call and made sure our luggage (that the staff carried down the stairs for us the night before) are ready at the front door. The stairs are very steep, we felt like climbing a ladder, but it was actually fun to climb and that is unique about this hotel. Osam said that we got free exercise with no extra charge! My husband and I got the Tower room at the corner on the top floor which is lovely with nice view of Wester Kerk church and Keizers canal on one side and a balcony facing Raadhuisstraat on the other side. The bathroom is very small but this is normal for most hotels in Europe. We like the large desk space by the window and a large walk-in closet (we just need to watch our head when we walk into it). If you look for a clean, friendly hotel, with reasonable price and great location, this is a place for you. We definitely will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notintheseshoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nadia 1 night before we went on Safari and then another 2 nights on return. They not only stored some of our luggage, but also had a "Welcome Home" bouquet for us on our return from Africa. The manager and his staff are extremely friendly and helpful and make every attempt to make your stay in Amsterdam memorable. The location is great with a bus and tram stop less than a block away. Many rooms face the canal. We were in Room 413 which was delightful. Breakfast is included and is in a bright, airy flower-filled room; coffee and tea service are provided in your room. Even though this is a budget hotel, it is clean and is a great value, with many amenities. Yes, there are steep steps, but they provide much needed exercise for most of us. (There is always someone there to take your luggage up and down from street level.)

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: PurpleCat33
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely friendly hotel in a great location, with really good rates. Tiny rooms, with really steep stairs, but that's pretty standard for Amsterdam. Recommended if you're looking for a friendly and relaxed place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel; home from home”
Reviews.Author: Anguskip
Reviews.Content: The Nadia Hotel is about the most friendly and comfortable place you can find. Osam the manager and his staff are always cheerful and the hotel, in a beautiful period building, is perfectly placed for access to the city centre.The rooms are small but with a canal view or a balcony its perfect. We have stayed at the Nadia three times and at our last visit, when we arrived we had flowers in our room with a 'welcome home' message.. That says it all! We love the Nadia and you will not find a better deal in central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very small but pefectly formed”
Reviews.Author: marathonSurrey
Reviews.Content: Alhough the Hotel is fairly clean and friendly it is very small after you have climbed many steps to the reception area. The rooms are also tiny and have a strange layout because they have obviously been converted from larger rooms. The breakfast room is again quite small and does not offer much other than bread/cheese/croissants/orange juice/coffeee/tea. I found it weird that there was not any cereal or fruit to eat. If you like your bed to be hard then you are in luck, my back will bear testiment to that. My partner and I found our selves having to breathe in to pass each other in the room and to get in and out of the shower room also. Nice people but frankly I would never return to this hotel to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gqusaf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia for a week (May - June 2007), in a double room with street-side balcony. GOOD POINTS: EMPLOYEES - Very courteous, always willing to help, including ordering food, giving directions, or anything that will make your stay more enjoyable. Absolutely professional and friendly! LOCATION - The hotel is only a 15 minute walk (5 minutes by bike) from the Red Light District, a 5 minute walk from the Anne Frank House. Major tram stop is less than 5 minutes away. SECURITY - Everyone who enters the building must be buzzed in by the front desk, and they have cameras all over the hotel. So no riff-raff hanging around inside, like some of the seedier hostels! BAD POINTS BREAKFAST - Left something to be desired...croissants, juice and coffee is about all you get. Also, breakfast is only served until 1030...if you party late and then sleep in, you'll probably miss it altogether. ROOM SIZE - The pictures on the website are misleading, as they shot them with a wide-angle camera...they are TINY! Not to be graphic, but if you are on the toilet with the bathroom door closed, your knees are hitting the door! I understand that tiny rooms are the norm in Amsterdam, but you will still be shocked when you see it! VISITORS - I'd like to see the "no visitors rule" softened...if you want someone to visit you in your room, they have to be a paying hotel customer to enter!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price”
Reviews.Author: Borbel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in one week (flying into/out of Amsterdam) and found it to be great value. 1st room was quite small and difficult to move around for 2 people but the 2nd room had a lot more space. They were also doing rehab/improving some rooms. Very clean, great staff, friendly and perfectly placed to visit all that Amsterdam offers. If you want somewhere clean, good value and convenient then this is perfect and I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - very small room”
Reviews.Author: marciabob
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY small and bathroom L-shaped with the floor of the toilet and shower a few inches below the floor where the sink was. When you showered, therefore, the floor was also wet around the toilet. Upon arrival, the door was locked, and we later found out that you had to push the buzzer to gain entrance. Only a steep flight of stairs faces you with the reception area at the top. The friendliness and helpfulness of the owner made up for these disappointments. The small dining room was open in the evenings which helped as there was no "lobby" to sit in. It was straight to your room, otherwise, or stay out until you were ready to turn in. To its credit, the hotel was in an excellent location, 5 mins. from Dam Square. It is around the corner from the Ann Frank House and the Westerkerk church, the latter being seen from our small bal- cony.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: UkJacqui
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 4 day trip to Amsterdam and loved every minute of it. Booked the hotel due to previous reviews on trip advisor and wouldn't change my decision for the world. Yes there are steep stairs BUT they are do-able. I'm 12 weeks pregnant and we were on the top floor so had over 70 steps to climb each day,but it keeps you fit. Plus the view makes it worthwhile. You probably only climb them 2-3 times a day, keeps the calories off after trying out the pancakes and other delights Amsterdam has to offer. Must say when the hotel found out I was expecting they did offer me a room on the first floor but we stuck to our original room. They also had a lovely bouquet of flowers waiting in our room for my partners 30th birthday. Yet another lovely touch. The location is excellent. About a 5 minute walk to Dam Square, 2 min walk to Anne Franks House and a 10 min walk to Liedsplein. Everywhere within walking distance. Our room was small but great. Had room to unpack and store our clothes. Also a Balcony, double bed, shower etc. Breakfast was simple but enough to start you off for the day and keep you going til Lunch. The staff are lovely. Able to offer advice on places to see, restaurants to try out etc. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a bargain proce”
Reviews.Author: helen46
Reviews.Content: This is a great tlittle hotel and don't let the stairs put you off - you can stop halfway for a breather and anyway, all little hotels in Amsterdam are like this! The welcome was friendly and we were offered a drink from the chiller cabinet as we booked in. The room was compact but the best thing was the bed - probably even more comfortable than my own bed at home. The location is great, really central but quiet and peaceful. The staff were very friendly and even advised us on local transport. The place was very clean and although the breakfast was basic (cereal and croissants) it was adequate to set you up for a wander around this great city. I'd certainly stay there again - really good quality and good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Compact to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: bexbobs
Reviews.Content: I was really chuffed to have found a hotel so central and in our favourite part of Amsterdam, the Jordaan. On arriving, we were a little disappointed to find that the road outside was quite a main one and that our requested canal view required us to lean a little over the balcony to catch a glimpse. The room was pretty small but it was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable after a day schlepping round the 'Dam. In fact it came to grow on us throughout the weekend and the bathroom door bumping onto the bed became a bit of a running joke! The staff at Nadia were very friendly and made us feel like we were at home abroad. The location couldn't be any more central and only metres away from the peace and tranquility of Herengracht and a stack of wonderful bars and restaurants. My overall advice would be to stay if you want something relatively cheap and cheerful but if you have an issue with steep stairs you may want to reconsider!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation in the heart of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: aristidis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was a great palace to stay in amsterdam.The rooms were great, very clean and cosy,the staff were very friendly and really cooperative.They found out all the information we needed for sights and other things,the breakfast was very good(croissants,cake,toasted bread),the manager had a great sense of humour and treated us with drinks on arrival and departure,We were two young couples and we had a great time there.Finally the hotel was very close to everywhere,imagine that we used the tram only once from van ghaugh museum because of the heavy rain,apart from that we walked to the rest of the amsterdam very easily.Thank you very much for the pleasant stay.we recommend it to you without second thoughts

Reviews.Title: “Steeper than you think!”
Reviews.Author: BaldinoLondon
Reviews.Content: stayed at The Nadia for a couple of nights on business. To be fair I did know about the stairs but they really are a killer, especially after a couple of drinks.. Also, there is no airconditioning and my room got uncomfortably warm. However, its cheap and cheerful and in a great location. The hotels website is very honest about the a/c, stairs etc so you do know what you will be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, noisey room if staying at the front of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire1977
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, who took our bags to the room due to the steep staircase!! Rooms clean and basic, unfortunatley we stayed at the front of the hotel rooms 1 & 3 the traffic noice was so loud, it was as if there was a tram coming through our room it did calm down after about 11pm, but being party animals we did sleep in which was difficult with the noise from the trams. Breakfast was continental and quite satisfactory. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the attractions, 15 min walk to the Red light district & Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: bielbb
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, friendly/helpful staff, good croissants, clean room, quiet and excellent location. Plus, free WiFi available in room. A potential negative for some: Reception is on third floor at top of steep flight of stairs; porter carries bags, you hike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: VTMChris
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Amsterdam is VERY walkable for those that are fairly good walkers! ROOMS: Very small but cute and some rooms have balcony's, we really liked this feature, originally we had a room without a balcony and the staff offered to show us another room (which we didn't ask for, but was nice of them and we preferred the room with the balcony)! Bed was small, and space in the rooms was at a premium, bathroom was also small with one of the tiniest sinks I have ever seen, even in Europe. Rooms and hotel were clean and well maintained. Most channels on TV were in English with Dutch subtitles which was nice. BREAKFAST: The breakfast room was small but quaint. croissants, coffee, tea, orange juice, bread, cheese. It was adequate for our needs. The breakfast room has a little balcony that overlooks an intersection and canal. STAIRS: The hotel is on the upper floors of a building, you have to be buzzed in but the desk is staffed 24hours. The stairs leading up the hotel are intimidatingly steep, but they ask you to leave your bags on the first level and they we bring them to your room. The hotel is within two blocks of the Anne Frank house and three or four blocks of Dam Square. We were happy with the location and the hotel was quiet, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: jtw1953
Reviews.Content: Good things were: Staff all friendly and welcoming. Very good location (eg tram stop nearby and easy walking distance to Anne Frank's house and other "sights"). Complimentary soft drinks. Early check-in. Luggage stored safely on our departure day. Minor concerns were: Our room was tiny and no drawer space, however it had a good view of the canal and the Westerkerk. Breakfast had limited choice, however it was adequate. Overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia”
Reviews.Author: ilovecatsdidcot
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia is lovely - the staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean (as a family, we had the 'quad' which was a bit of a squeeze but the beds were very comfortable and plenty of cupboard space). The steep stairs might put some people off. The dining room is also small and tables were not always available for breakfast. Also the central location meant that traffic noise (and church chimes!) were noticeable. But walking distance of many places and right near Ann Frank Museum. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a special place!”
Reviews.Author: Bosch116
Reviews.Content: For the first time in 10 years we were going away without the children,and the Nadia Hotel,Amsterdam was to be our home for 4 days.Booking online via the hotel website was easy and there was always a prompt and thorough response to any enquiries.We were slightly daunted by the prospect of all THOSE stairs but,hey,they say exercise is good for you!!!On arrival at the hotel our fist impression was"can this ordinary looking front door in amongst a row of shops really be our hotel entrance?"But,on that door being opened and seeing THOSE stairs we knew this was it!Our bags were carried up for us by a very friendly chap,and as we entered the reception we were greeted with a very warm welcome from Osam and his receptionist who immediately offered us a drink on the house.After a short while relaxing in the breakfast room we were directed to our room,which was small and basic,but was clean,comfortable,en-suite and had a lovely view of the canal and church.Having a fridge in the room was good for keeping the Heineken chilled(recommend anyone to do the Heineken Experience,great fun!)Also,satellite tv was provided which included BBC so we even watched Eastenders and match of the day!We also had tea/coffee facilities.Breakfast was a simple selection of continental usuals-croissants,jam,cake,bread,cheese,coffee,tea,juice.All self service so you could fill up before heading out and about.Osam and his staff were all so friendly and helpful we almost immediately felt as though we had known them for years(this feeling was only reinforced when on my birthday,the day after we retuned home,a message was left on our answer phone wishing me a happy birthday from all at the Nadia!)Their advice was a key factor in our ability to see and do so much in the short time we were in Amsterdam.The Hotels central location combined with the wonderful staff made this,in our opinion,the perfect accomodation.Try it for yourself-you'll love it too :-)

Reviews.Title: “A warm family!”
Reviews.Author: TulipMania
Reviews.Content: Nadia hotel made our stay in Amsterdam a wonderful experience! The location of the hotel is great, less than a 5 minute walk to Dam square and right on the Keizersgracht canal across from Westerkerk. There is a shuttle service that connects the hotel to Schiphol and the hotel staff is super available to help arrange transportation for their guests. Breakfast in the mornings is generous and the rooms are clean and cozy! Best of all, the hotel staff was super helpful from the minute we arrived. They are happy to take care of your luggage (don't let the steep flight of stairs scare you!) and they went above and beyond what was expected in their tips of what to do in the city and their hospitality throughout our stay. It really feels like you are staying with a family, and it is hard nowadays to find a hotel with such a warm atmosphere. I definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: GovernorofRome
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was average. First glance was scary - when the door opens and you see 2 flights of STEEP, narrow stairs. But the hotel staff was happy to take our luggage to our room. Rooms were musty and smelled of smoke - despite the non-smoking preference. Also was bothered by the lack of insulation from the ouside street. Make sure you bring eaplugs. Rooms were small, but adequate. Staff was very helpful and assisted with luggage on both arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Our Dutch Family”
Reviews.Author: dondeestafede
Reviews.Content: The Nadia hotel is a place to come back....the buiding is lovelly, the location excellent, everything is pretty close, the rooms are nice as well, there is no elevator, but even with stairs you dont suffer them at all, because staff there look after you all the time, also a good stair excersice is needed in amsterdam, because if its your first time in town, prepare yourself for a couple of extra kilos..jaja, food is awesome everywhere in amsterdam. breakfast is very nice as well, they treat you like family, and that you dont get it in a five star hotel. Dont hesitate, its perfect

Reviews.Title: “VERY friendly and central located Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kokusz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nadia Hotel for 3 nights and loved it. The rooms are quite small, but as you can walk to the Rijsks- and Van Gogh Museum in about 20 Minutes and to the Central Station as well - it is very good located. We never had to take the tram to go anywhere. The rooms are small, but very clean. Breakfast ist simple, but enough, and the hotel is just tipical dutch I guess. Will be coming back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome at the Nadia”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Ryders
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed at the Nadia for 3 nights in March. The hotel is in a great location, close to Dam Square and many major tourist attractions. The staff are very friendly and the complimentary cold drink - once you have hauled your luggage up the stairs was very much appreciated. [They will be more than pleased to help if you need it]. The buffet breakfast was fine - one improvement would be a non-smoking breakfast room. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Nadia to travellers looking for a short break in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home in the Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_DHoboken
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to Amsterdam, many of my fondest memories include the Nadia Hotel. Our decision to book at the Nadia had much to do with the competitive rates, but mostly the glowing reviews. The Nadia Hotel lived up to every wonderful thing we have read. The staff is warm, friendly and accomodating. The owner, Osam is special in his own right. He makes you feel as though you are the only guest and your happiness and comfort is his priority. He adds personal touches similar to what you would experience in a bed and breakfast. My favorite memory of Osam is being invited to the kitchen as he made me a pot of coffee 2 hours before breakfast even began. We had many fantastic conversations with Osam that again, are as memorable as Amsterdam itself. The past reviews have mentioned the stairs, yes there is a bit of a climb which before arrival, we worried about, however, the anticipation far exceeded the reality. We saw guests young, old and even disabled climb the stairs to reception - use your judgement based on your own physical capabilities. There was a specific review mentioning room 316, that it was small, dirty, with an odor. I had the PLEASURE of staying in room 316. It was cozy, bright, clean and perfect as far as Im concerned. Im confused to even read such a review. Why would anyone care if the rooms are small in a city like Amsterdam? The only quality time spent in the hotel, was not the room, it was dining in the lovely breakfast room or at reception having wonderful chats with the staff and Osam. I look forward to returning to my new second home at the Nadia Hotel. If you decide to book a reservation, I can say with certainty that you made a wise decision. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “perfect little haven”
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights at the hotel nadia and have to say i was extremely satisfied with both the accommodation and location. yes the rooms are small (we stayed in a double room with balcony) but you definetley get what you pay for. If you want to go to amsterdam and experience all the charms that this city has to offer then the hotel nadia is the perfect choice. I read the reviews before i went and had mixed signals as to how far away the hotel actually was from the square. it took approximately 5 minutes leisurely stroll to get to the square and a further 5 minutes to central station. the hotel is situated in a very nice quiet area with lots of restaurants close by. the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and offered a nice cold coke when we arrived. Dont be put of when you see the infamous nadia stairs, theyre really not so bad and the staff are always willing to assist with your luggage, plus all the exercise meant i could have an extra cake or two!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Amsterdam April 2007”
Reviews.Author: KANJISTOMPIESOPHIE
Reviews.Content: The hotel Nadia is a hotel at a very good quality price level. Room is comfortable, with a nice view on the canal and Wester Mark Church. Welcome is warm. The hotel is well located in the center of Amsterdam, and not very far of Central Station. For a big family, we recommend you this hotel as it is not always easy to find a big room for a large family. Travellers from France.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jellybaby88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from long weekend in Amsterdam (13-16Apr07). The Nadia Hotel was fantastic. Excellent and hospitable hosts!! Location is only about 5min walk to Anne Franks House, 10min to Dam Square and 20min walk to Centraal Station. Fantastic shower, especially after long days of sightseeing. Breakfast at the hotel is adequate. No complaints at all! Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service ;-)”
Reviews.Author: jon777
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a standard single room and was delighted with the quality of facilities. Indeed the hotel was clean and welcoming and the room was everything I hoped for and more. One great advantage of the Nadia is its location and this with the competitive price makes this hotel a great choice. The staff are invariably helpful without being intrusive and I have no doubt I will be returning soon ;-) All in all an easy hotel to recommend without reservation. Jon Clarke April 2007

Reviews.Title: “Nadia is 5* in our opinion”
Reviews.Author: Hitchin5
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we decided to spend the Easter break in Amsterdam. The Nadia hotel only added to what was a brilliant long weekend. All the Nadia staff are so nice. Osam, the manager, goes out of his way to make sure everything is perfect for you. The kids were treated like royalty and spoilt rotten with Easter eggs, drinks and genuine affection. They loved it. We had a 3rd floor family room, and yes the stairs are steep but considering the staff do all the baggage handling and steep stairs are common place in Amsterdam I don't see why people feel the need to complain! We hope to return and I know we won't be looking for anywhere else to stay. The Nadia ticks all the right boxes with it's location, outlook and above all else friendliness. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: VenusDc
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews regarding this hotel I was worried and emailed the hotel to ask for a room at the front (which are meant to be bigger). On our arrival someone brought our bags up (stairs are steep) and we were given our welcome drink & shown to our rooms. It is not the Ritz but the rooms are clean & nice...TV, Fridge & Safe. The staff are very helpful and chatty! The location is brilliant & we walked everywhere. I would recommend Nadia and would stay there again when in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: mapleleafsWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, is clean, and there's good security with a 24-hour desk. But, it's also rather costly for the what are probably the smallest hotel rooms I've ever seen. The beds are very narrow, but decent enough. Rooms on the front street can be very noisy, especially given that some windows don't close properly. Washrooms in each of the rooms is a plus, but you pretty much need to leave the door open in order to use them in a couple of the rooms. Breakfast is rather under-whelming. None of the sliced meats, selection of cheese that we were used to in other Dutch hotels. Still, the location is worth a lot, and one does feel secure here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: irishBunnybun
Reviews.Content: Am just back from a terrific weekend in Amsterdam where we stayed 2 nights at the Nadia hotel. The hotel is very central & is perfectly placed to allow you to tackle all major sights on foot, which is exactly what you need for a w'end city break. Firstly, I really cannot say enough about the staff. They were so pleasant and so helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Secondly, The rooms are clean & functional and are grand for a short break. But they are TINY!! I cannot stress that fact enough. Fine for a couple, but we had some comical moments nontheless. Breakfast is nothing special - great coffee, bread, cheese jams etc. Not exactly hearty if a full irish is your thing! The next really remarkable thing about the hotel, is the stairs in it. You have to climb a sheer cliff face of stairs just to get to the reception. Seriously, a rope would not have gone astray. You need to have your wits about you going either up or down them and if you are in any way unable for climbing/ abseiling then this is not the hotel for you. Overall though its a good spot and a great base for a weekend in Amsterdam. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetduck
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nadia was great. It was right in the centre of Amsterdam, which made getting arountd the city easy. The hotel was comfortable, but most of all the staff were really friendly and the service was personel and very friendly. I would definately stay there again if I was in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples”
Reviews.Author: amberschaller
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We asked them for suggestions for places to eat, etc and took their advice and each time were not disappointed. The rooms are small but had everything we needed. I suggest to get a room with a balcony, great view of westermarket and canal. Breakfast was nice, croissants, breads, and cakes. Also, tea and coffee. But to stay here you must be able to walk up a lot of steep stairs. It was a great couple of days, loved the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly, and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dellwop
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at the Nadia and once again my stay there was AWESOME!!!!! I can't say enough good things about the Nadia. Very pleasant staff, made me at home. Fresh flowers in my room to greet me. This time my husband was not able to come on this trip but, I felt very safe and secure. When reading some of the reviews that others have written they complain about the steep stairs and small rooms but, that is the way the city is. All of the hotels that do not have elevators have steep stairs, so what, just a little extra exercise. The rooms and bathrooms might be small but, I don't know about you but how much time does one stay in the room when on vacation.? Small bathroom, yeah but, who cares. The friendliness and outstanding service make up for it all in end. I will not stay anywhere else when visiting Amsterdam. And it is in the perfect location easy access to anything you will want to do.

Reviews.Title: “4th time around”
Reviews.Author: amsterdammers
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have made amsterdam a yearly break and we always stay at the Nadia. Its perfect for us! Dam square is a 10 minute walk away ( a lady never rushes! ) and its on an easy to find road - this is a bonus when its your first time in amsterdam and you've got lost and your trying to find your hotel. Its round the corner from the anne Frank house and there is a canal bus stop opposite- bonus! The staff are friendly and there is always someone at the desk. The stairs are really steep to get up to the hotel so i wouldnt suggest going there if you have a disability or have troubles with stairs. The rooms are clean. Small but cosy. They are en suite and the bathroos are also small but again clean, and the shower doesnt trickle. The double beds are huge and really comfy and you have a safety deposit box, a fridge and a TV in your room. You also have tea facilities in your room, and as every self respecting brit knows a good cup of tea at the end of a long day is well appreciated. Breakfast is served in a quaint little room with a view over the canal and the church. You have a choice of juice, tea, coffee, croissants, bread, toast, cheese, cakes and jams. Its not a full english, but its continental and adds to the experience of a european break. I could not fault this hotel and could not ask for more from a hotel- its safe, friendly, clean, cosy, reasonably priced in an excellent location - i would highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: XsezX
Reviews.Content: II have just got back from my 3rd trip to Amsterdam and felt compelled to write in. i have stayed in the Nadia Hotel all 3 times i have visited and i cannot say a bad word about it. The staff are lovely and very helpful, the hotel and rooms are clean and well maintained. the rooms themsleves are quite small but i never expect anything less over there as most places are small with steep staircases anyway! we asked for a balcony and we got one too.it is right the the heart of everything-dam square, red light district, anne franks house, museums and maddame tussauds are all within easy walking distance. the breakfast at the hotel is continentil so we didnt bother with that cuz we just wanted our full english but it looked good nethertheless. oh and it is very cold in feb/march so wrap up warm! cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FrankWirral
Reviews.Content: I found the Nadia staff very friendly and helpful but I must admit I was a bit disappointed with the hotel and my room. The room was very small and I did think it was overpriced. The breakfast was only ok. The hotel is in a good location however be prepared for very steep steps - I don't think I could bring my Mum! The whole place felt a bit 'cramped'.

Reviews.Title: “genuinely friendly”
Reviews.Author: the_two_malones
Reviews.Content: sum up - great little hotel 5 min from damm square, and most other attractions on foot. very friendly staff on arrivial we couldnt believe the flight of stairs although one on the friendly staff was at hand to take our bags. the lady at the desk was very nice and gave my partner and i, and another couple a quick induction to the hotel, the facilities and a map and city guide book to get us going. although it was 11am and check-in wasnt ment to be until 2pm, she invited us to the breakfast room where we were served tea and coffee for 20 min while they cleaned and prepared a room for us which had an early check-out. . .a benefit of going to a small hotel. our room was small (make that very small) but very clean also. the size wasnt an issue due to amsterdam having so much to do and see..anyone who uses there room for anything other than a wash and a sleep is in the wrong city. what really made the difference for me was when leaving at night to go out for the evening was the staff telling us to have a pleasant evning and the staff always being more than happy to help with directions and advice on everything we asked. all in all a great trip and i cant wait to go back. would highly reccomend for value -for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Nadia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxy12
Reviews.Content: Myself and five others have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Hotel Nadia. I found it by surfing around and the Hotel fit the bill. On arrival we were more than impressed by the friendliness of the staff and a welcome drink was waiting for us before we unpacked. The Hotel is on a Bed and Breakfast basis, the breakfast room overlooking one of the lovely canals. The Hotel is nicely situated not far from Dam Square and all attractions were easily accessable from the Hotel. But if you do not like walking, a tram stop is situated just opposite and very handy for anywhere in the City. We enquired several times for the location of different places and each time the staff on duty were extremely helpful and we were directed the best way to get to the destinations and therefore made our holiday stress free. The stairs were steep (as in all of Amsterdam's hotels) and there was no lift - BUT this did not deter us and was not a problem. In any case staff were on call at all times to help, should you need it, to take your luggage or bags up and down the stairs. I would throughly recommend Hotel Nadia to anyone planning a stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A LET DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: 1FPER
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews it has on this sight and I ended up extremley dissapointed!! Yes the location is very good and yes the staff are friendly (which you should expect at a hotel anyway!), but the hotel isn't anything special. I had done my research before we arrived and i was expecting a small room and steep staircases. But the rooms aren't just small they are TINY. We had a room at the back of the hotel and you could actually stretch your arms out and touch the walls on each side. The bathroom was even smaller. I dont consider myself to be fussy but these rooms shouldn't be commissioned by the hotel as they are unbearable. I would have struggled to feel comfortable if i had stayed in the room alone because of the size, but with my boyfriend in there too we were constantly bumping into eachother. We couldnt be moved as the hotel was fully booked. We caught a glimpse of rooms at the front of the hotel when the maid was cleaning and they looked much bigger and much more comfortable so maby we were very unlucky. Advice for future guests AVOID ROOM 316. Also a horrible smell kept wafting from the bathroom, like sewage/ drains. It was like we could smell poo coming from the toilet when it hadn't been used! Not very nice. I wouldn't say that the hotel was particulaly clean either, the bin in our room was still full with the lasts guests rubbish when we arrived and the sheets looked as through they had been used since the 1970's. The hotel smelled a bit musty, it wasn't filthy but I think the standards could be improved. I wouldn't reccommend this hotel, and I wouldn't go again. Amsterdam on the other hand was brilliant and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JasperJack
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights Feb. 7th and 8th. Previously stayed in 2001. The welcoming atmosphere was exceptional, and despite the formidible stairs, staff helped carry luggage to the room. Room was small, but had all the features required for a comfortable stay. Why would anyone want to stay in their room, except to sleep anyway? Breakfast was a delight, with a warm, comfortable atmosphere. Won't hesitate to recommend to anyone, and staff are to be complimented on their friendly and helpful assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler_72
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Nadia Hotel. While it is very small, we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were clean and it was quiet. This was our first trip to Amsterdam and we felt extremely lucky to end up in the neighborhood we did. We found several fabulous places to eat and did a good amount of shopping. We would stay again and would recommend it to friends (as long as they understand that the rooms are small).
