Oh and the staircase -- it is so tall and steep (which they warn you about on their website) that I laughed everytime I saw it. It is wise to take them up on their offer to carry your bag to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lady_of_rohan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Nadia twice and it has been a great experience both times. The location is perfect, close to all places of interest but far enough away from thre rip -off areas. The staff are very helpful and friendly (giving you a can of coke when you arrive is a welcome touch especially if you have walked from the train station at top speed). The rooms vary, some are small, but on our most recent trip in Feb 2007 we were given an upgrade to a room with a canal view which was stunning. I would highly recommend this hotel for value, convenience and romance. Breakfasts were good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: baf72
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic location in dowtown Amsterdam. Clean hotel, good (yes small, but good) rooms, cheap (considering it's downtown amsterdam) and very friendly staff. Certainly would come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: jwBristol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the end of January. On the plus side, the location is excellent and the staff are helpful. The downside is that the room we had was extremely small, dark and dingy - I asked if we could change rooms but the hotel was fully booked. I have also unfortunately managed to catch scabies which is highly unpleasant. I have stayed in many hotels and can say that this is the worst one ever - I would definitely not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Such small rooms!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfandrew
Reviews.Content: Some reviews of this Hotel i just cannot believe. The Hotel rooms were SO tiny. We asked for a move and were given room 413. Anyone booking this Hotel, this is the only room worth having. Comments on the location and friendly staff were spot on, would i stay there again, definately not.

Reviews.Title: “We would always use the Nadia in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: screen1Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 5 friends for 2 nights. Staff were extremely friendly and could not do enough to help. Fantastic location. Would recommend a stay at the Nadia for anyone travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Never Again, Not Even for Free”
Reviews.Author: HJFLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 3 nights and apart from a central location and a cheap price I ended up with scabies for months. Beware as it seems to me it is infested by bugs. Also apart from having a fridge and tv the bathroom was basically a shower with a toilet in it. The manager seemed extremly rude, unfriendly and I would not recomend staying there unless you want to suffer!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: S&Ctraveling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Amsterdam as a romantic getaway and the Nadia Hotel was the first hotel that we stayed at. The service was perfect, though the room was very small, typical of Dutch hotels. The small but cozy room overlooked a canal and a church. We wished that we would have stayed at the Nadia Hotel during our entire visit. Great location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LindaD26
Reviews.Content: Booked solely from the reviews from this site, and the hotel lived up to expectations! Very very friendly staff who couldnt do enough to help. We originally booked a quad room for ourselves and our two children, but soon realised how safe the hotel was - lots of CCTV cameras around, so felt comfortable changing to two rooms - the children are 10 and thought it was a great adventure having their own room! Breakfast great - kids first time in Amsterdam and loved the food! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again, having stayed at a couple of others which were far more expensive and far less personable.

Reviews.Title: “it's better than home”
Reviews.Author: badgirlDorset
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there 4 times and recommend the hotel to everyone. the staff are outstanding, friendly and helpful.as soon as i get home im planning my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: markmort2003
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accommodations Thank you Osam and the staff of Nadia Hotel for another fantastic visit to your hotel. My wife and I stayed at Nadia twice during our two-week trip to Holland over the holidays. Both of our stays were absolutely incredible. Like many other reviews on this site, I must start by saying that one of the real benefits of this hotel is the manager and staff, who are always pleasant, upbeat, and very helpful. We were fortunate to be able to stay in several different rooms during our stay. The two rooms on the 4th floor that have balconies facing Westerkerk and the Canal are really nice. The view of from there is beautiful and we were lucky enough to have room 412 (with a large balcony) for the unbelievable New Yearâ€™s Eve fireworks display. I highly recommend Amsterdam for new yearsâ€¦very fun! It is true that the breakfast is very basic, but itâ€™s free! So itâ€™s hard to complain too much about that. The stairs are very steep; however, in my opinion, that makes Nadia even more charming and the staff went out of their way to help carry bags up and down the stairs for the guests. The location of the hotel is fantastic. It is easy to walk to many major attractions and for those that are farther away, there is a tram stop and taxi stand across the street at Wester market. In this regard, Osam and the staff are also very helpful in providing assistance in getting around town and finding what you are looking to see. I am very happy to have found such a great place to stay. You will be made to feel at home during your stay at Hotel Nadia! Enjoy you stay in AMS! Mark & Jenny (Lawrence, KS, USA)

Reviews.Title: “Nadia Hotel is the Best in the Dam”
Reviews.Author: BaronessBB
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Nadia from Nov 18-20 and loved every minute of it...Osam, Ming and the rest of the staff were wonderful and Osam even called to make sure we were OK since we had arrived late..It was my friend's 54th birthday and they brought flowers to our room and when I called (at 1am) for more coffee, tea etc they brought it right to our room..Who could ask for more....What a experience it was to celebrate a birthday in Amsterdam and be lucky enough to find this great Hotel...We had a lovely room with a canal view and also a view of the church...I loved listening to the church bells.. Yes the stairs are steep and the room was on the small side but Who cares!!! You are in Amsterdam and it awaits you, get out and explore..We ate at Jennifer's across the street and they had the best chocolate waffles and devine pastries... I am still trying to figure out when I can go back there and will definitely stay at the Nadia (room #7) it is my home away from home and maybe they will hire me!!!!! Osam your the best and keep up the good work!!! Beth from OKC, Okla

Reviews.Title: “Lots of STAIRS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ragan_Dragon
Reviews.Content: Its very well located! Be prepared to climb a massive and steep flight of stairs, so DONT bring wheely suitcases... only backpacks. Request a room on the first level. Very small room, very strange bathroom, very plain breakfast but for the value... the BIGGEST bargain. You can WALK everywhere in the city so don't bother with any transport passes. Make sure you have a VERY good map.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tipsymazuk
Reviews.Content: First, take a look at the hotel's website. It is beautifully composed and will give you a good insight into your stay at the Nadia. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome and yes, the room was small, but adequate for two of us. In fact, it was cosy, intimate and in character with the rest of the building, which is historic and should never be modernised. I do have problems with my knees and was apprehensive about the stairs, but there is a hand rail on each wall and I managed them better than I had hoped. Just be careful as the steps are narrow. There is a small landing halfway up the staircase, which is good for an oxygen intake! The breakfast room is one of the prettiest I have ever seen. Sadly, the breakfast itself comprised only of bread, cake, croissants and various jams. I feel some cold meat and eggs would have been a nice addition. The room itself was decorated in dark wood paneling, with lots of shelves and a small, but very functional bathroom. It was very warm however, so we kept the window open at all times. Please be aware that trams run constantly and love to ring their bells and the church opposite chimes every 15 minutes. The beds were very, very narrow and extremely uncomfortable. We spent each night clinging onto the mattress for fear of falling onto the floor. Regarding cleanliness, the hotel was spotless and we were asked each day if we would like housekeeping to tidy our room. Despite the poor beds and lack of a decent breakfast, this is a lovely hotel, with friendly staff, in a fantastic location. Amsterdam is a beautiful, friendly, relaxed and fun place to be and I would challenge anyone to visit the city and not have a good time. For something a little different, visit De Efteling which is an amazing fairytale themed park. It is an hour train ride from Central Station, then approximately 50 minutes by bus. We went to visit the Winter Wonderland that they do for Christmas, and it was absolutely perfect. Fake snow, real bonfires, warme chocolade melk and hot waffles. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Very Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JenJet
Reviews.Content: Nadia Hotel is so wonderful! The staff were very warm and friendly! In very good location too. The stairs are high and steep, but inside it is beautiful. I felt so at home there, and can't wait to stay there again in my next visit to Amsterdam. I got wonderful quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jensun01
Reviews.Content: This is one of the friendliest hotels we've ever come across in what has to be the friendliest city in Europe - and it offers outstanding value for money in an excellent location. The rooms are tiny but spotlessly clean with everything you need, including tea and coffee-making facilities. Although the hotel was full for most of the five nights we stayed there, we never heard a sound from the adjoining rooms or from the Nadia's charming cats. The staff could not have been more helpful with advice on the best tram routes round the city and other useful tips, and their help with luggage up and down the stairs and its safe storage on the last day, plus the provision of coffee while we waited for transport back to the airport, were the icing on the cake. Tip: For transportation to and from Schiphol Airport, we used the Connexion Hotel Shuttle (---) which provides door-to-door service at unbeatable prices. For the return journey we had the minibus to ourselves, so it was like a personal taxi for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “6 minx's from wales think its fab”
Reviews.Author: minxi
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in dec 06 came back yesterday, i think its fab i would defo go back there, the hotel staff are very friendly and they gave us free pop on arrival one night i went to the vending machine and pressed the wrong button so it gave us the wrong food the man opened it up and gave us 3 free chocolate bars!!!! the rooms are quite compact tho and the beds are very small so one of my friends ended sleeping on the floor the whole time as he kept rolling out of bed, also do not book a single room as they are very chlostraphobic the size of a shoe box!!!! we had a balcony on our room as it was a triple so the view was nice, the hotel staff could not do enough for you they were very friendly, the breakfast was not up to much tho, for the price i think this hotel was fab only 2 mins walk to dam square i would defo stay here again- recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nadia's the Best”
Reviews.Author: murfsclover
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel perfectly located where everything is. The staff no matter morning, noon, or midnight was warm and friendly. Amsterdam is beautiful and very friendly. Can't wait to go again! Stayed 2 nights at Nadia great balcony with a great view. Thanks Crew!!!! Patrick & Irina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: smn2006
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Nadia and would definitely stay there again. Pros: * well-situated (close to Dam Square); * friendly, helpful staff; * welcome drink (non-alcoholic); * free wi-fi; * great balcony view of canal (if available). Cons: * steep staircase, four flights to top floor (although the staff will take your bags and itâ€™s really not that bad, just hold the rails); * very small bathroom * limited breakfast (but weâ€™re not overly concerned about meals anyway â€“ get full and get out is our motto) The staff were very accommodating when we wanted to keep our room for an extra nightâ€¦friendly, helpful people, just like everybody else we have met on both of our trips to Amsterdam â€“ an awesome city!

Reviews.Title: “Top Stuff”
Reviews.Author: jonnyhedless
Reviews.Content: To keep this review short and effective the hotel is very nice and very welcoming. All staff were most helpful and nothing was too much. Yes the stairs are very steep, but it all adds to the character. We stayed in a double deluxe room WITH balcony (you have to request this specificly when booking) which was on the top floor and had a cool view of what was going on outside. Deffinatly worth a stay if theres rooms available!! Many Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: iltlifts
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed to hotel Nadia with open arms. All of the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel is located on a beautiful canal and you can hear the bells of the West Church all day. The hotel is close to everything. The room that I stayed in was very clean and I had a wonderful view out of my window. The breakfast room is so charming, I just loved all of the fresh flowers. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying there!”
Reviews.Author: magdam
Reviews.Content: Central location, very friendly people, welcome drink, breakfast included.. very steepy stairs (if you have some walking problems that might be a problem otherwise not a problem at all), very small room (dont choose that hotel if you want to stay in your room all the time othrwise its fine). We (a couple) came there on a Saturaday for 2 nights. Room was booked earlier via internet. We wanted a double room but the hotel was acctually fully booked. The manager offered us a single room with quite a big bed.. It was fine as we did not plan to stay all the time in our room.. And the price was cheaper than for a double room... The room was really very small, but the bed was quite big and we had a balcony- we spent more time there than in our room!! That was very nice of them to give us a room with balcony ;). The stay in Amsterdam was very very nice! We had so much fun! And if we go there next time we will choose the Nadia Hotel one more time cause its really worth it! By the way! if you plan to go by your car to Amsterdam check P+R Parking!!! We left our car at Olimpia Stadion. Veeerrryyy cheap and safe!! We truly recommend Nadia Hotel and P+R Parkings!

Reviews.Title: “Nadia is N-I-C-E”
Reviews.Author: bigbit
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and a group of friends. We had 3 rooms total. two doubles and a single. I am from the USA and they were from UK. We stayed a total of 7 days and some had to leave in 4 days. I had a very nice room, although small as all Amsterdam Hotels are unless you are willing to pay 200 euro per night. I also must add the only time you will go to the room is to sleep and how much room is necessary for that. There is a safe in the room and a hairdryer. It was a bit dark and I asked for a lamp and it was delivered. They advertised wireless internet but at first it wasn't working. I must say that the owner/manager along with some outside help worked around the clock to make it work perfectly. So if wireless is what you need they have it and it was fast. The room was clean and we had a beautiful view of the canal with windows that opened, that made it even better as the church bells were very pleasant to listen to. The room was cleaned every day and the entire staff was very friendly. The beds were comfortable and the pillows just the way I like them. I felt very much at ease and comfortable here. The same 7 days at a few other places were 800+ euros and we went and looked at them. We found that we were winners at 650 euro. The only bad part of the whole experience is the steep steps, but if steps don't bother you as they didn't our 40-50 yr old group, then you won't have a problem. It was sort of an experience and a good laugh when you see the steps. Also if you like hot breakfast go across the street to Jennifers and tell the gentleman running the place you want "Over easy Eggs like Angelo" as he now knows what they are. Please Tell the Nadia owner Angelo, sends his regards. I will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: janoandpastie
Reviews.Content: the hotel room's were very small and the stairs very, very steep but apart from that it was in an ideal area as everything you want to see is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “fresh fowers and friendly faces”
Reviews.Author: yannie
Reviews.Content: Having been warned about the steep staircase on the Nadia website it was still a surprise. However, we were met before we had ascended by a friendly young man who took our luggage. Tess on reception performed the official signing in routine with ease and directed us to the flower festooned breakfast room where we were given a welcome drink. Our room was tiny with 2ft 6inch twin beds and shower room. Functional and adequate except for insufficient lighting. Much appreciated were the small fridge, safe, telephone and tea/coffee facilities. Breakfasts were self service continental style with toast on request and drinks served with the familiar Nadia charm. On departure our luggage was stored until we were ready to be transported to the airport. Again we were directed to the breakfast room where we were plied with offers of refreshment. The staff carried our luggage down to the pavement and wished us a safe and pleasant journey. To sum up the Nadia in one sentence; a clean and friendly hotel suited to the more energetic slim visitor. Jean and Annie.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent welcome by NADIA Manager , great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pspiandorin
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome by NADIA Manager, very good breakfast with cannal view, well located to reach Dam square/red light district and also to Jordaan neighbourghoud.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: antp
Reviews.Content: Just spent a prolonged week-end in Amsterdam. We are a family of 5 - 2 adults and 3 children aged 11, 15 and 17 - and Hotel Nadia was absolutely perfect for this purpose. With a very central location we had most of the sightseeing within walking distance, Anne Franks house across the street, shopping and strolling in "the nine streets" just around the corner and very good restaurants at reasonable prices on the other side of the canal in Jordaan. The location couldn't be better! Very cosy hotel with small rooms and steep stairs - what else would you expect in an old house by the canal in Amsterdam? The breakfastroom has it's own charm and though small the personal manged every morning to seat the 5 of us at the same table. Extremely good and helpful service. We booked our rooms on the website and a with a phonecall in advance we were sure of rooms on the same floor - with a special view for the two "old" ones. We will keep Hotel Nadia in mind next time we come to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: amferrao
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hotel Nadia because it was recommended by Frommers. The hotel itself is nice, but we had several problems. The online reservation website asks you to specify what time you're arriving. This is more for their benefit then yours, which is important information for travellers coming in on overnight flights. We had to wait several hours before a room was ready in their very tiny cafe, where there were no seats available. Also, the very long, steep flight of stairs up to reception can be a bit daunting for weary travelers and very unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nadia, Review from a students point of view.”
Reviews.Author: hivez
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the nadia hotel for 3 nights and just got back yesterday..... We were`nt looking for a total budget hotel so this seemed a good choice as it wasnt too expensive yet wasnt to shabby! Arrived at the hotel and first thing we saw was the stairs, this was funny for us as we are two young students who found them fun to run up but at the same time if your disabled/older then you might want to be prepared for it so its worth mentioning. when we got into the check in counter we were given some maps/drinks by the young pretty lady at the counter and she gave us our room key and wasreally nice all round and I would imagine they would help you out in any scenario you might get yourself into! got into our room and it was a bit small but very nice, tv, balcony, power shower, sink toilet, safe etc... and a general nice room all round, with no problems I can report on and we were both really pleased with it and we have a fairly high expectation on hotels as we are regular travalers. id say out of the whole of amsterdam this is probably the best location to be as there is a large supermarket 2 mins walk away plus your 2 mins walk away from the sqaure and personally id rather be staying 2 mins walk away from the sqaure as it quite loud and there are some dodgy looking peeps about so for the location of this hotel. It says on there website and brochure its about a 10 minute tram ride away from the central station... this is not true, for us it was about a 5 minute walk from the station on foot in the rain! so all in all, location this place is the best! to sum up my whole review, for all of you who are now looking through the endless hotel websites then reading bad reviews on them and getting annoyed with yourself, just stop there... im your avaredge travaler who normally spends around 60-80 pounds a night on a hotel and Id give this place a 3/4 star rating and have no reall negative onit, so do book it! its really nice place to relax and enjoy amsterdam and id also say to ask for the balcony rooms and then you can enjoy some drinks on a night there if you want to get away from the amsterdam constant rush, all in all 10/10 GREAT HOTEL!!! If nadia read this, let me say a big thanks to you and I will without a doubt be rebooking later this year, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: wwwwwwwwwww
Reviews.Content: The very long stairs are impossibly steep. The room was so tiny that one person had to stay on the bed to let the other move about the room. I do not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: BillyBoyBlue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over easter and I wish we had stayed at home. The rooms are very very small. You could shower while sat on the toilet. Compact is an understatement. Cleaniness also seems to be lacking. In fact we changed rooms as in the first room I awoke to be COVERED in flea bites, disgusting, Second room was better. It was at the front of the hotel. Still very small and not practical bathroom. Not for us I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: happy-traceller
Reviews.Content: We visited this lovely little hotel with some friends (sept 06) for my 40th birthday. Yes the stairs are steep, but we had a laugh about them. Luckily our room was on the first floor, directly next to the dining room, so we didnt have any more stairs to climb, unlike our friends whose room was on the top floor! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, bringing our bags up to our rooms for us. The breakfast wasn't anything special. Basically toast. The room was small, but had a fridge, a safe and tea making facilities included in the price. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We also had a balcony and enjoyed sitting on there for an hour before getting ready to go out for dinner, watching the locals cycling by. Amsterdam is a lovely city, with something to see and do for all ages. We are intending to return one day and will definately return to the Nadia if they have rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but limited”
Reviews.Author: brushman333
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Nadia for several nights. First, I'll say that I'm a seasoned business traveler, and have been to Amsterdam 11 times, so this is not my first "small hotel" expereince in the city. I arrived around 10am. No one offered to help me up the very steep stairs to the lobby which is one floor above street level. The staff was always very nice and helpful. I was offered coffee or tea if I wanted, and they checked my bags, advising the room would not be available until 1pm. More very steep stairs up to my room. Facing the steepness of the stairs was a real drag after a long day of walking around the city. If you don't have alot of stamina, skip this place. Yes, these stairs are steeper than any I've encountered in Amsterdam. My room was cramped, even by Amsterdam standards. The bedspread was torn and had burn holes, the sheets were clean, but had a rip in it. I did not receive fresh towels for several days - the staff would simply fold up the used towels and place them back on the rack. This was annoying as I was only given one hand towel and one bath towel, as a single guest. I found myself hitting my head on shelves, and banging my shin on the bed platform more often than I care to admit, as the room was so tight. As mentioned in other reviews, the toilet is in the shower. My toilet seat cover could not be lowered, nor could the seat be lifted, due to it being wedged between the toilet tank (hard to describe). This led to constant risk of items falling into the open toilet from the miniscule glass shelf above, the only place in the bathroom for your personal toiletries. The room was on the back of the hotel facing a courtyard, and was mostly quiet, with the exception of hearing the church bells of the Westerkerk through the night (this was very pleaseant, actually). Some of the nights were warm, so I had the window open. Apparently the reception desk also faced the courtyard some floors below, as on a couple of nights I was kept awake by the constant piercing ring of the reception desk telephone, echoing up the courtyard at all hours. Why the management doesn't either lower the volume, change the type of ringer (a flashing light perhaps?), or simply keep the window shut so as to not disturb the guests, is beyond me. I'd say the Nadia is an okay place to stay if you're not bothered by what I've mentioned. The location is very good for getting around the city (close to 3 tram lines, Canal Bus and Dam Square), there's an ATM across the street, and an internet cafe a block away. I feel the price was high for the room. I won't be staying at the Nadia again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulastew
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed in the Nadia Hotel Sept 06. The Hotel itself is lovely although the rooms are very dated, small and the bathroom really smelt bad, but i think that is a problem in most hotels in Amsterdam. The staff and manager were the nicest people ever and our room was cleaned every day. We really enjoyed our stay at the Nadia and will definitely stay there again. This hotel is in the most perfect local with everything in walking distance. Great hotel with great people!!

Reviews.Title: “'Quaint!'”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Cox
Reviews.Content: For a two star hotel int he city centre you couldn't do much better, but beware. The stairs are the steepest I have ever seen, if you are not that mobile forget it. The staff are very friendly and helpfull with that dutch sense of humour. The breakfast room is quaint with lovely street views, the bedrooms are small and cramped with the toilet (literally) in the shower. Overall an excellent location and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable retreat”
Reviews.Author: nlg7681
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Nadia hotel and had a wonderful experience. All of the staff were extremely helpful and our room was very comfortable. The rooms are quite small as well as the bathrooms--but that seems to be common for amsterdam. I thought the price was on the expensive side--but we did have a private balcony and it is comparable to other hotels. The location was fantastic...right in between Jordaan and Dam square--about 10 min walk to centraal station and 3 mins to Dam Sq. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and overall we had an excellent stay! I highly reccommend this hotel over others--I researched many others and Nadia had the most benefits!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - going back for our 4th stay in December!”
Reviews.Author: Edith_G
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the reviews for the Nadia and am glad to see that most agreed with us. As for the negative reviews some people must be really fussy. The rooms are clean and tidy, all with en suite facilities, TV, phone, safe, fridge.I'm not aware of any street noise and you get used to the Westerkerk bell ringing out every quarter of an hour - it just adds to the ambience of the holiday.Ok the stairs are steep but your luggage is brought up for you and deposited in your room - you only need to get yourself up and down the stairs. Osam and his staff go out of their way to make your holiday enjoyable - you are like part of the family. We have just returned from our 3rd stay at the hotel and are going back to spend Christmas out there. The hotel is centrally located for all the attractions, shops, restaurants etc and the staff are more than willing to advise of places to eat etc. Personally I would not hesitate in recommending the Nadia to friends and family.Rooms may be on the smaller side but it's somewhere to rest after walking miles. Almost like a home from home. We will always return to the Nadia when we visit Amsterdam. I can't help but recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A long awaited return”
Reviews.Author: Gaz23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my third stay at the Nadia, the first 2 being in 2001. I'd tried to book there since, but unfortunately it was always full for the dates I wanted. We were lucky this time and managed to get a room. This is a great hotel and I always enjoy staying there. The staff are friendly, the rooms are clean, and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “small but pretty”
Reviews.Author: greenisthebest
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I stayed for the weekend in this lovely hotel. we really liked the location, every place that you might want to see are in walking distance. the management and stuff were all friendly and helpful. even though our room was kind of small everything was so clean and nice. the steep stairs can be the only problem if you don't like to climb.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try. Really !”
Reviews.Author: antasaurus
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Nadia Hotel. We really did. The management and staff were really friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We had a fair bit of luggage and when they saw how much we had, they showed us several rooms until we found one that would fit us and our bags quite happily ! Now just to address some of the complaints I've read in these reviews, Yes the rooms are tiny and some an odd shape. But how much time do you plan to spend in your room ? Yes the stairs from the front door are really steep, but they employ guys to bring your bags up and bring them down to you when you leave. So there's minimal bag lugging on your part. The hotel is in a good location and it suits the budget traveller. But most of all, we'd stay there again quite happily. So ignore the whingers and give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of character”
Reviews.Author: Simonedelany
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this lovely hotel. The family room was great value and the en suite was modern and very clean. We loved the hotel for its central location, its extremely friendly and helpful staff and its character. The rooms may have been a bit small, but the wood panelling and the view made up for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: BeaconHill
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend after reading about the hotel on Tripadvisor. The rooms are TINY but have everything you need - fridge, safe, TV, phone etc. Plus plenty of shelves and hooks, so we actually had more storage space than in many much bigger rooms in the past. We had a great balcony. Stairs are very steep! Staff were all very friendly and the breakfast was basic but fine. The only negative aspect was an odd smell in our room that was noticeable when entering from outside. We had to ignore it with the help of air fresheners. Our friends were in the next room which was odour free. If you just want somewhere to sleep and shower, the Nadia is just about ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Steep stairs (an understatement!!!)”
Reviews.Author: ABCanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. It ended up being the most expensive hotel we stayed in during 2 weeks spent on short notice in Holland and Belgium. Proximity to the bus and tram stops was a plus. Our room was waaaaaaaaay up on the top floor, so we had 80 steps up and down to the main entrance. Fortunately we travel lightly, so we managed to survive the cramped room. The breakfast was good, standard fare and the staff were helpful. I found the stairs VERY steep and would not recommend this location to anyone with either height or balance problems. We requested a non smoking room and I was quite nervous about the smell of smoke in some areas. I felt it was a fire trap, but consoled myself with having the balcony off our tiny room, as an emergency exit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SA_Travelers2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved this little hotel, and we would definetly go back if we were to visit Amsterdam again. What was most impressive was the friendly hospitality we received, the staff were very helpful, we thought the staircase was a very interesting topic to write home about, we had no problem with it at all. The rooms were all we needed, its also a very close walk to Dam Square and The Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Good location bad stairs”
Reviews.Author: Limao
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nadia is in a great location, it is near to most of the touristc places. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in the rate and was surprisingly good. The rooms were very small, so small that they ask you to leave some of your luggage in their storage area downstairs. My room was not very clean and the towlels were so old, faded and stained. I really wish I had my own towel with me. Elderly people and young children should not stay in this hotel because there is no elevator and the stairs are extremely dangerous, with very narrow steps, it is very scary. It only makes me wonder how many accidents has happened in those stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chickencurry007
Reviews.Content: I totally disagree with legalyblond901. This is by no means the worst hotel in the world. It was great! Great location and great value. We stayed here for one night on the 21st of June. It was very easy to find after we got on the right tram. After taking the train from the airport to Amsterdam Central Station, we got on tram number 17. The drivers were very friendly (all spoke English) and they let us know what stop to get off. If you do take the number 17, at your stop, you'll see signs for the Ann Frank House. Turn around, the hotel is on the opposite corner on the right-hand side of the street. It's a good hotel with a nice buffet breakfast (typical continental stuff) in the morning. You can walk to the main square in 5 minutes and see all the major sights. I highly recommend the Heineken Experience if you like beer. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Barry32
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old son and I stayed in a comfortable small room for three nights. I had requested a first floor (one flight above street level) and back room because of reports of the steep steps (they are steep, but they help with the bags) and street noise. We found the room quite comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendly and quite helpful in terms of directions and suggestions. There is a tram stop a half block away which is quite convenient in getting to and from the cental station (which is also the way back to the airport). It is centrally located. I think it is competitivelypriced with similar quality establishments in central Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Amsterdam. It certainly helped make our stay in Amsterdam enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings but have to remember it is a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hemikiwi
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I arrived in Amsterdam at a time when all my favourite hotels were full due to a conference. I eventually had to go to the Tourist Information to book a room. Even here, rooms were full due to a conference in town. Whilst I was there, a phone call came in from Hotel Nadia due to a cancellation. I was offered a double room for 100euro. I agreed as I needed a bed for the night. The Hotel is situated quite centrally but in a rather grubby road. The staircase to reception needs to be seen to be believed....i have seen many steep staircases in Amsterdam but this was steeeeeeep!!!! However, an employee ( you are buzzed in from reception) came down and carried my bag upstairs. You are then greeted by reception and offered a free cold drink ! My "double " room had a double bed , space for clothing, a tv, and tiny bathroom. I was grateful to find a room due to the conference so i was happy to be there. However, for 100euro plus booking fee it was definately overpriced. As a budget / 2 star hotel it was perfectly fine and as I normally stay in more upmarket hotels i know i need to be careful of my expectations. However, i still think 100 euro plus booking fee was overpriced for the quality of the room. My only complaint would be that there was a lot of noise coming from the restaurant / breakfast room late at night. Staff were very friendly , room overpriced for a 2 star budget hotel but if i had been lucky enough to get a good deal , i would not have any complaints apart from noise from through the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Coziest place ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: michellemb77
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best parts of my trip. My husband and I took a trip to Europe during the 05/06 new year holiday period. On the way there we had pre-booked a room and I was worried because I hadn't faxed over my credit information. Well it wasn't a problem, we were greeted with warm smiles a friendly atmosphere and best of all.....good coffee. They got our room ready for us as we had some really smooth strong coffee and they even got us a few cookies to keep us from starving as they knew we hadn't eaten in hours. They truely made us feel welcome. Yes the rooms are small in fact very small bu,t there is plenty of room to put things away and in fact most of the hotels have very tiny rooms...this is Amsterdam, a small place that needs to accomadate a lot of people. It's clean though and that means a lot to us. We actually came back to the same hotel on our way back to the states after new years. It's very well located, we walked everywhere but if you prefer there is a tram stop right outside the hotel (1 block). Public transportation is amazing and word of advice stay away from taxis..they cost insane amounts of money. You can grab a tram outside of centaal station almost to the hotel door. Pack light and you'll do great. This is a hotel that makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Waste Your Amsterdam Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley I stayed this hotel. It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed. The rooms are very very small, very smelly, uncomfortable, very distubing beds, with very old and stained sheets. Teribble stay.This hotel totally ruined my Amsterdam visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wee Place”
Reviews.Author: Jim Z Douglas
Reviews.Content: GREAT WEE PLACE My wife and I stayed at the Nadia Hotel for three nights and found it very satisfactory. On arriving when the door opened I saw the stairs and wondered how we would get the bag up but they shout down for you to leave it at the bottom and they will send someone down to take it to your room. 39 very steep stairs later we were at reception and the very helpful and pleasant staff allocated us a room on the second floor. The room was very small, but considering it was a 2 star budget hotel we were prepared for this. The room, had en suite facitities, phone, TV and tea and coffee. It was clean and room service changed the towels daily. The continental style breakfast was good and again the staff were very friendly. The hotel has a good central location and is an ideal base for visiting the many attractions of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel Nadia for 2 nights. The location was excellent, you can actually see Anne Frank's house from the breakfast room, although the rooms were small, they were very clean and warm (an essential in February!) and the staff were very helpful. The breakfast was very nice and although the stairs were very steep, this was no hardship for 2 days stay. I would highly recommend the Hotel Nania.

Reviews.Title: “average..... only just !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nadia hotel for 2 nights for a short city break in the lovely city of Amsterdam.Sadly we were very disappointed with the hotel, the location was great and most of the staff were friendly except one memeber of the breakfast staff who was very angry that we had come for breakfast at 10.10 as she abruptly told me that breakfast actually finished at 10.30 and we were late ... 20 mins is ample time for breakfast in my book ! However the main thing that would stop us from staying here ever again was the actual bedroom - it was tiny, so small that the door couldn't open fully and the noise of the traffic was almost unbearable. I know that the hotel room shouldn't really matter during a short city break but it does need to meet a certain standard and being able to sleep without so much noise would've been a plus. My advise would be to stay else where. Amsterdam is a great place to visit and the rail link from the airport to central station is great, makes getting to and from the airport a breeze.Just pick another hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AnneJones
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Nadia, which I'd booked after reading some of the reviews posted on this site. On first arrival the doorway is a bit uninviting with a buzzer, (oh yes the tram stop is Westerkirk, it's really easy to find from the station)but at least you feel a bit secure because they buzz you in each time so people aren't just wandering in. And yes the stairs are really scary looking but you do get used to them, although any one with mobility difficulties would not manage them. The room we first stayed in was a twin room at the back of the hotel, but I'm afraid I couldn't cope with the claustrophobic feeling it gave me and the manager was really understanding and we managed to move rooms. The rooms are small, but very clean and the sheets and beds are comfy, and the room service is excellent. Obviously if you are looking to spend a lot of time in your room you may find it negative re the size of the rooms, but if it is a city break or you are not bothered too much about the room size, then I would recommend it. The location is good and we walked most places and also took the trams. I cannot praise the staff enough and they were extremely friendly and helpful and I would definitely go back again! And one last thing the coffee is really good that they serve for breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: steve-norf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid Feb. when all 40 odd rooms were booked. I Knew the location which is absolutely central and very very close to the Westerkirk, The Anne Frank house, behind Dam square and only 10 mins walk from the Station. The staff are friendly and helpful, all with perfect english. The rooms are average for Amsterdam, small but comfortable. Enjoyed the visit and happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. It's pretty basic but this is more than made up for by the fantastic service and incredibley homely atmosphere the owners and staff provide. When we arrived, we had been up since 3am as we had caught the early morning flight from liverpool. It was freezing cold, sleety and windy when we arrived in amsterdam but the welcome we received at the Nadia really cheered us all up. Once we had navigated the notorious stairs (we left our bags in the ahll and the staff brought them up for us - thank God!)we were warmly welcomed at reception. We were there before our rooms were ready so the owner sat us in the breakfast room with a pile of brochures and booklets and kept our mugs of free coffee full until our rooms were ready. The rooms are tiny but so well laid out that they have everything you need and more. The rooms even have fridges which I know from staying in Amsterdam several times before is very rare, expecially for a 3*. The location is good, right by the Anne Frank museum on Prinsengracht and only a few minutes walk from Dam Square. Also, our favourite coffeeshop (La Tertulia) is just around the corner so this is another bonus! Breakfast is simple continental style - croissants, pastries, fruit, ham, cheese, toast, jam etc. with lots of fruit juice and cosntant refills of freshly made coffee from (I think) the owner's wife, who is really friendly and funny. I've read other reviews on here complaining about the room size and I imagine if you want to sit around all day in a big spacious 5* hotel for your visit, then you will be disappointed with the Nadia. If, like us, however you just want a base to sleep and eat breakfast with great, warm, friendly service, I highly recommend the Nadia. I'm already planning my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “again and again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: nadia hotel was great! the people there were very helpful with the luggage, places to see and eat. when i go back to amsterdam next year, i will definately be at hotel nadia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but a bit cramped!!!”
Reviews.Author: sydwye
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Nadia Hotel!!! I picked it based on reviews I discovered here and the low cost for hotels in Amsterdam. Although the rooms were small, the space was utilized well. We had a balcony over looking the street and Anne Frank's house. At times, I could smell pot in the hallway but I never smelled it in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: Great situation, within easy walking distance of all the major sites.The entrance is just a single doorway and the stairs to the reception area are the steepest I've ever seen! However we did not have to carry our luggage up or down these stairs.We vacated out room on the morning of departure and the luggage was left in our room until it was put into our taxi when we left the hotel.We also got a free welcome drink when we reached reception on the first day!The staff are very friendly and helpful and all speak English.The rooms are very small and hot. We left our window open at all times and the traffic is very noisy throughout the night. The bathroom is also tiny but the shower was very good. As we only spent a short time in our rooms this did not matter too much.We did not bother to unpack our suitcases as the room was too small for a wardrobe. Breakfast was basic - croissants,toast,cheese, jams, coffee -but it was adequate.We found the restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel tended to close about 10.30pm and the first night we did not realise that there were plenty of places off Dam Square that stayed open much later.A great little hotel but I would prefer a bigger room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very simple and yes the staircase is very steep but it's all worth it. The location i brilliant and the view is cute, the staff is just absolutely amazing, I made such great friends and I had a real good time. The room I stayed wasn't exactly luxurious but had everything I needed and was really clean so I have no complaints at all. Overall I would say this was an excellent choice and very good value for money plus I came back with a few extra friends which is always good!!! I recommend Nadia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Canadian2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nadia for 3 nights in September, 2005. Yes - the staircase is very steep, and the rooms are tiny. But its centrally located, the rooms are clean and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful (they even have unbrellas you can borrow should it rain during your stay). I had a room on the front so the traffic noice could have been a problem, but a pair of earplugs solved that, and the little balcony with a view of the Westerkirk more than made up for the noise. Anne Frank House is just around the corner, the Dam is a 3 minute walk, and the tram stop is just up the street. I had a single room on the same floor as reception and the breakfast room - room came complete with cable TV, a safe, coffee and tea makings, and a very tiny, spotlessly clean private bathroom - all for only 55 Euros a night. Breakfast is served from 7:30 to 10:00 - simple continental breakfast of croissants, bread, marble cake, juice and really good coffee, in a comfortable although very small, breakfast room. And regarding those stairs - I asked and was told that no guest has ever fallen down them yet! All in all, its a good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: roscoeroo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon some reasonable reviews. Sadly, it turned out to be a big disppointment. It appears that some of the more recent (poor) reviews are more reflective of the true standard of this hotel. Our room was small but since we spent most of the day sightseeing, this was no real problem. More importantly, the room was incredibly worn and dingy. Also, the shower did not work properly. There was only a trickle of water from the shower which ranged in temperature from freezing cold to scalding hot. In addition, there was little soundproofing meaning that we were woken up by lots of people coming home at night. Overall, the hotel is badly in need of some refurbishment and is very over rated on this site. I've given it a two star rating because it is relatively cheap, the location is not bad and the staff were reasonably friendly. However, I would certainly try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the 2 Stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our trip with stays at the Nadia. The staff was outstanding, friendly and helpful. The owner, Osam, was by far the friendliest hotel owner I have ever had the pleasure of paying for a room. He made us feel like he was really glad we choose his hotel and made us sooo welcomed. Hotel location is great, but than again any hotel in the city center is good. From the time we arrived, I never touched my luggage going up or coming down. The breakfast room was comfortable and cozy with a great view of the WesterKirk. We did opt for the larger room with canal view and a balcony which was awesome. My next trip to Amsterdam will definitely include a stay at the Nadia. Thanks for eveything Osam and staff, especially the surprise room decoration upon on return at the end of our trip. See you in a couple of years.....S&R from Centennial, Colorado.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about this place”
Reviews.Author: mach3833
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly but the rooms are very small. I had an inside room and it was so hot and stuffy I had to ask for a fan which was not much help. I would hate to be there in the summer. I kept telling myself that for the money it was OK but I saw much nicer places in the city for the same price. The stairs are very steep. The breakfast room has a grat view if you can get a seat. The breafast is nothing but bread,juice and coffee and maybe cheese. I think the Nadia has seen better days. Look for a better hotel, you don't go on vacation to climb steep stairs and sleep in a prison cell.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, small rooms with GREAT service....”
Reviews.Author: IUBBFAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed ot the Nadia Hotel sept 9th 2005. Well, what to say.....Okay, the rooms are REALLY small! The staff were absolutely wonderful! So nice and courtious. The previous post had it pegged pretty much, the rooms are small, the breakfast room is a bit small, but we had no problem sitting and eating. We had a balcony room which was nice, but had to pay extra because of a big IBC convention that was in town annualy that weekend. So 140 euros was the damage, definitely not worth that, but if you could get it for around 80-100 euros it would be worth it. Overall I think that I got what was advertised no suprises. Its just not luxury, if you want that you have to pay a bit more, we were to see the city not stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “claustraphobic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 5mins walk from Dam square which is great but I have to say I was very disappointed with the hotel itself.. for a start we were looking for a hotel entrance.. it ended up being a grubby side door. We walked by it several times before we found it. Once inside the door you are faced with an extremely steep set of stairs.. not for the faint hearted or after a couple of drinks!! The staff were friendly enough and they brought the cases up (thank God!) The hotel was on several different floors, us being at the top.. so you felt like you were climbing forever, and the corridors, stairs etc were very narrow. I dont know whether it was because we got there quite late at night (although we were booked in well in advance) but we must have got the tiniest room in the place.. it was like a little attic room with space enough for one bed pushed into the wall (so the person sleeping on the inside had to climb over the person on the outside) I definitely dont think that it was a room suitable for two.. and it was nothing like the rooms advertised on the website that we booked it from. The breakfast was the usual continental style but the breakfast room is obviously not big enough to accommodate a lot of its guests, there were only about eight tables and when we went down for breakfast, we were told to come back in a while! I found the hotel, particularly the room, very claustraphobic. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling alone - please don't stay at this Hotel. The single room I was assigned on the 4th floor was the smallest I have ever stayed in. There was just enough room fot the bed. The bathroom was also tiny. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: neitzjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nadia one night while we were in Amsterdam. The location was central in the city and about a 15 minute walk from the train station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke good English. They gave us complimentary water at check-in and then again when we got back later that night after checking out the Red Light District. The room was comically small but clean and quiet. The breakfast was average ( a typical European breakfast with croissants, bread, cheese, juice, and coffee). However the stairs in the hotel are quite step and there are plenty of them. This was not a problem for us but I would not recommend this hotel for anybody who is elderly or at all physically disabled. We would defintely stay here again as it was nearly half the price as other hotels in Amsterdam and very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at Hotel Nadia this past weekend while in Amsterdam celebrating my 30th birthday. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Dam Square, which makes getting around easy. There are several tram stops near the hotel as well. When you open the front door to the hotel you will be astounded by the stairs that lead up to the reception, the 2 flights of stairs that go straight up! So this is defiantly not a hotel for anyone who has trouble climbing stairs, as they are a bit steep. Once we made it up the stair, we were given a warm welcome and a nice cold welcome drink and assigned our room. Which was on the 4th floor, so up we went 2 more flights of steep stairs. The room we had was the standard room which over looked nothing in particular as it was at the back of the building. At first I thought I wanted to try to get a canal room, but realized that the traffic noise probably would have bothered me. Now the room is very small and basic but it is clean and comfortable. Our bathroom was the same. It is basically a large shower room, so no romantic baths. My only complaint was that the hotel lacks air conditioning, which would have been nice one the really warm nights. My second complaint, which has nothing to do with the hotel, was about the church nearby that rang it's bells all through the night, so it made sleeping with the window open a bit of a pain. Over all we had a great stay. The staff was lovely, recommending a fantastic seafood restaurant to eat at, and always making sure we knew where we were going when heading out. The hotel may be small but it is clean. So if you don't care much for the trappings of a posh hotel, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: ebetch24
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Nadia Hotel were very friendly & gave us a great overview of the city when we arrived. We were very impressed with how helpful they were & the free breakfast service was also a nice bonus (mostly bread & jams). If you're on a budget, this place is fine. However, the room was clean but smelly (old pipes?) and very small. The door hits the bed and there is little room for suitcases. The location was mediocre - close to the Anne Frank museum and the main canals, but not the best area. I'd recommend spending more and staying closer to the Leidesplien. The Nadia Hotel wasn't terrible, but I would not recommend this place to friends because of the smell & location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorna24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it to be great value for money. The room was small but it was clean and had a safe, fridge and tea/coffee making stuff. The stairs were a bit of a climb since we were on the top floor but it was made easier by the staff carrying the bags to and from the room. I found all the staff members to be very helpful, they all speak great English and even gave us complimentary cans of juice upon our arrival. The hotel is situated between 2 tram stops and is only minutes from Dam Square so the location is excellent for the money. I would definitely stay at the Nadia again and would recommend it to anyone trying to find a clean, central hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 4 nights here and was again treated very well from the staff. I have stopped here before and can highly recommend it, the rooms are small, but they have everything u need, the rooms are clean and it's also quiet. The price is very reasonable considering the location and I would definately stop again if there are rooms available. I can recommend it and you wont be disapointed if youve booked a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Besy hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1978
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam several times and have had different degrees of luck with the various hotels I've sampled there. The Nadia is by far and away the nicest hotel I've stayed in in the city. I booked it after reading the reviews on here. It is fantastic value for money, cosy, friendly and centrally located. The rooms are tiny (like cabins) but have everything you need. The staff are the nicest people you could hope to meet and nothing was to much trouble for them. As for the stairs.....they are overwhelming when you first open the front door and see the receptionist peering down from miles away up on the first floor but we were instructed to leave our bags in the hall and staff quickly brougt them up to our rooms. I notice someone on here was complaining about having to wait for their room to be ready - we had a wait too but the staff escort you to the dining room and offer you free hot or cold drinks so it's hardly a hardship! Breakfast is a simple continental spread - lovely raisin toast, croissants, cheese and great coffee! - and the dining rom is really cosy like the rest of the hotel. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: snow-husky-snow
Reviews.Content: The Nadia is a great hotel, with friendly staff in a perfect location. The free breakfast is good & the coffee great. The rooms are a bit small. but clean & pleasant. The stairs are steep, but they will carry your bags up for you so it's not a problem. I reccomend getting a balcony room!

Reviews.Title: “Why all the good reviews??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the good reviews on this site, but I was very disappointed. Our room was not very clean (one example: the tops of the windows were so dirty you couldn't see through them) and we had to wait 45 minutes after check in time to actually check in (after we kept being told it would be "5 more minutes"). The hotel was in a good location and we had a wonderful time in the city. I can only imagine those reviewing it on this site are comparing it to hostels. (And I must say, I once stayed in a hostel that was cleaner and nicer than this hotel). Also: You have to climb a steep flight of steps to get into the hotel. This was fine for us, but older or handicapped people should beware.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nathsal
Reviews.Content: This is a super little budget hotel in a great location for Amsterdam. First impressions is just a doorway between shops, behind which are the steepest stairs i've ever seen! However, the very friendly staff will help you with any luggage and give you a complimentary drink to recover! I have to say that it was also the smallest room i have ever stayed in with approx one foot of space around the double bed which was pushed up against the window! However, it had absolutely everything we could have wished for... tv, fridge, safe, shelves and radiator all clinging precariously to the walls! It had a small but adequate wardrobe and a minute but clean shower/wc. We also requested a canal view room with a balcony and were lucky enough to be given one by the lovely hotel owner. The balcony offered lovely views of the Westerkerk church and canal one way and the rear of the Grand Palace at Dam Square the other. The rooms viewing the road could be a bit noisy with the chimes of the church and a tram stop outside but it never bothered us. As mentioned the nadia hotel is in a great location, minutes from Ann Frank's house, the red light district and Dam Square and is easily walkable from the Centraal train Station. If you want a budget, central hotel then we would highly recommend hotel Nadia and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful & the staff was pretty nice. But not what I expected. Our room consisted mainly of a giant bed, a desk with a chair, tv up high, & bathroom. There was no extra room, and we literally had to cramp ourselves into the room. We didn't just have backpacks, but 2 giant American suitcases as well, which was not easy lugging up the extremely high & narrow staircase. The bathroom was also letting off a strange, sewer-like smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nadia in Oct. 2004 ,the staff was great ,the room was small, but being a single I did'nt expect it to be grand. The room was cleaned every day. I had a choice of a front view or rear view,being my first time in Amsterdam I thought a front view would be nice,but it was quiet noisey as the Nadia is on a major street. The stairs are steep but the staff will carry your bags for you. If you're thinking about staying here,book early, as I'm having a hard time booking a room for my next trip. Tot Ziens

Reviews.Title: “Five star service and location at a two star price! GO!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: True value, unforgettable staff, great location... As a Concierge and traveller to over 30 countries, This is it! You can't go wrong here. Above and beyond in all areas. You won't regret this one. A much needed oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Halford
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Nadia Hotel after reading good reviews on the internet. I was not disappointed, the Hotel is as many others say very friendly and extremely clean. The staff cannot do too much for even down to a welcome drink. It's in a good location about 5 minutes from Dam Square and located on the corner of the canal looking over the Westerkerk Church. The rooms are on the small side but all have an individual feel about them, not like the normal standardised layout you normally get in Hotels. Ours had both a balcony and a view looking over the church. The only downside is the steep stairs and this would be difficult if you have problems with them. The staff however are very quick to help carry luggage around. Would I stay there again - definately. Can I recommend it - Yes (I've stopped at the prestigous Die Port Van Cleve Hotel and its rooms were worst). Is it value for money - Yes. Have at look at their web site for a better feel. It accurately reflects what you will get. ------------
